Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, but service falls short of setting”
Reviews.Author: joegibbon
Reviews.Content: Was in town to meet family and go to LSU game in Baton Rouge. Had stayed in same property 20 years earlier when a Fairmont. Neighborhood had changed little. Valet'd car at entrance and was greeted with a smile. However, bellman stood there hands in pockets when I opened hatch to get luggage out. Had to hand the luggage to him. Absolutely stunning lobby, restored beautifully. Was promptly greeted at reception, but check in took a long time with a lot of tapping on the keyboard. Disappointed we had to upgrade room in order to make room for daughter in the room. Bags were promptly brought to room. Met family at rooftop pool. Flies were a little too much. Service was spotty at pool. Beautiful and well appointed room, except no hair dryer for wife who had to wait 25 minutes to get one from housekeeping and it disappeared when we got back the next day. Relatively convenient to French Quarter, away from the noise. Great concierge who was very helpful with dinner reservations and directions. Questionable whether I'll stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melanie H
Reviews.Content: This was our first hotel in the USA and it was a great place to start our trip in Luxury. The hotel is in a great location just on the edge of the French Quarter and in walking distance to restaurants, bars and shopping. We stayed in a suite which was a good size with seperate bedroom and lounge area. The bed was lovely and the shower was very spacious. We had room service and the buffet breakfast and both were excellent quality food. The staff were friendly especially in the restaurant. Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Southern Hospitality at the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: PlanetGemini
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 days at the Roosevelt during our first visit to NOLA and we were not disappointed. Though our room was smallish, it wasn't any different than a room found in any other major city like New York or London. And despite its lack of size, it was very well-accommodated with lovely furnishings and an extremely comfortable bed. The hotel itself was elegant and stately and after long days of sightseeing and even longer evenings of enjoying the nightlife, it was always a pleasure to return to the hotel with its grand lobby and blessed air-conditioning. The staff was gracious and we were especially appreciative of the concierges in particular who never steered us wrong with their recommendations. We also loved the location which was close enough to walk almost everywhere, but just far enough off the strip so that you weren't directly in the middle of the never-ending action. The only cons were an unusually long wait for what equated to a mediocre breakfast in the dining room (despite it being relatively empty) and a less-than-stellar view from our window which included the backside of some dirty, dingy buildings. However, there's not much that can be done in terms of the view beyond upgrading to a room with a better one. And we did have a fantastic meal at Domenica, the hotel's Italian-style restaurant; which sort of made up for the breakfast. Though this was our first trip to the Big Easy, I hope it won't be our last as we thoroughly enjoyed our time in NOLA and wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Roosevelt again should we return.

Reviews.Title: “Anticipation!!”
Reviews.Author: nik35805
Reviews.Content: Ok, this review will be updated after my actual stay. Too make a long story short, I am an independent contractor for FEMA and am deployed in New Orleans this week. I am currently staying in another property in the city, that is closer to our base. ( A completely different review)... My husband will be staying at the Roosevelt next week for a conference his company is having. So, I had to cheat and during my walk after work, I decided to check out my husband's accommodations for the upcoming week. (We live in Chicago). I was floored when I walked into the lobby! The lobby is breathtaking and the staff, so nice and attentive. I asked them if I could check out the pool and it was fabulous. It has been really hot this week and I would have loved to take a dip in the pool. Next weekend our family will be staying and I will definitely keep you updated....Anticipating a few awesome days off so I can really enjoy all New Orleans has to offer. The city deserves as much as it gives and I am very excited about finally getting to stay at the Roosevelt. Will keep you posted and message me if you have any questions. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Hurricane Escape”
Reviews.Author: wwpnola
Reviews.Content: Since Isaac wiped out our power and roof, we spent 4 nights at the Roosevelt. The hotel has a beautifully restored lobby, and nice sized rooms, We had a suite with traditional furnishings. There 2 well equipped bathrooms. The Sazerac Bar is very good as well as the coffee shop, Teddy's. We ate two dinners at Dominica where we have eaten before. Very interesting Italian food.

Reviews.Title: “good choice”
Reviews.Author: Christy3
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay here again! It was clean, comfortable - perfect when done with a long day of walking around New Orleans. The room was nice, and it seemed as if the hotel staff thought of everything when designing the room. The shower had glass doors, (which always seems cleaner than shower curtains), and the shower itself had 4 different jet sprays. The hotel has a coffee shop, 2 restaurants, gift shop, spa, and roof top pool. I think the hotel was recently renovated which explains why it felt so clean and....perfect! The only things I would put on a con list for this hotel is that breakfast is not included and you have to pay for internet service.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel / Awesome Locale”
Reviews.Author: Jen R
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights over labor day weekend to celebrate our anniversary. The city just went through hurricane isaac and had lost most of it's power. But not this hotel. everything was clean and ready to go. Gorgeous hotel and rooms. Walking distance to French Quarter. Clean, friendly. Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “The Place to Stay when going to New Orleans!!!”
Reviews.Author: bjaune
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt New Orleans/Waldorf Astoria Hotel is an elegant lodging option with great customer service. There is good reason for why this hotel receives such positive reviews and I can only second the comments made by several other reviewers. Once you pass through the entrance doors at either end of the hotel, you enter a world of grandeur, old-world elegance, comfort and luxury. This hotel generates the â€œwowâ€� factor a hundred-fold. Just taking a stroll through the lobby is a magnificent experience given its form and dÃ©cor which is basically that of a grand, ornate hall comprised of mosaic tile floors, decorative columns, gilded trim, hand-painted wall murals, coffered ceilings and chandeliers that runs the length of a city block. On a previous occasion I have walked through the lobby in December when it is bedecked with Christmas decorations and it is a sight to behold! The hotel is centrally located in downtown New Orleans just off Canal Street and within easy walking distance of the French Quarter. The circumjacent area encompasses a typical metropolitan environment though perhaps a little dingier than that which may be experienced in other, contemporary, American cities. To be frank â€“ and some may disagree â€“ New Orleans is a bustling town that retains neighborhoods and districts exemplifying â€œbygone Southern and/or antebellumâ€� charm but, aside from those areas, the city is not all that appealing and it has seen better days. Hence, the rather pronounced difference between the circumjacent area outside the hotel and the swish environment within the hotel which is obvious but a welcoming experience. Bear in mind though that many other hotels in New Orleans will likewise be surrounded by commercial buildings and activities that may be unattractive. Basically, a sensation of calm and opulence envelops you once you are within the confines of the hotel. Customer service, quality and the overall setting help make the place. The staff is courteous and attentive and they seem genuinely concerned about their guestsâ€™ welfare. Not only do they make an effort to be helpful but, they also make you feel welcome. The hotel is comprised of an older wing/building (original Roosevelt Hotel), located on Baronne Street, and a later wing/building, containing the formal lobby entrance on Oâ€™Keefe Street, that are interconnected in such manner that it all seems to be one complex. Given the height of several nearby buildings, you will, however, need to be on the higher floors to enjoy any kind of view â€“ probably the 10th floor or higher though this is pure speculation. (Note: The hotel is comprised of 14 floors.) The rooms are very clean and comfortable. They are stylishly furnished and decorated in such manner so as to evoke that sensation of classical grandeur, elegance and luxury that I mentioned earlier. Moreover, both the bedroom and bathroom are well-appointed with all the accoutrements that denote a high-class establishment such as quality linens, towels, robes, slippers and other amenities. We were in â€œSuperior Kingâ€� room which means you actually have a separate sitting/living room and bedroom. To be frank, for us it was like having a spacious mini-suite. The nightly turn down service with chocolates is a nice touch. In our case, we were in Room 1302 in the old wing that afforded us a nice, unobstructed view eastward over downtown towards the Mississippi River (in distance) as well as the Southeast part of the French Quarter. Though we came to visit the Vieux Carre and partake of the various cultural activities and venues to be enjoyed therein, I can easily see couples opting to â€œhole upâ€� inside their room for a few days and enjoy a romantic interlude. There is no reason to leave the confines of the hotel to have a great time! Another somewhat unexpected but enjoyable feature of this hotel is their outdoor, roof-top pool and sunbathing deck which can be a relaxing respite after spending time wandering around the French Quarter. Both the layout and fixtures in this recreational facility are more synonymous with the arrangement that one may find at a typical seaside resort - particularly when you add in the bar, eatery and towel kiosk coupled with the ambient music heard in the background (through speakers). While lazing in a reclining chair and sipping a tropical cocktail, if one closes their eyes and clears their mind, one can easily forget where they are and, instead, think they are somewhere far away â€“ certainly not in the heart of downtown New Orleans. Only by opening your eyes and seeing the surrounding buildings brings you back to reality â€“ though it is somewhat unusual to be observing these monolithic edifices from a height other than ground level, particularly the two spires of the cathedral next door. Given the climate of New Orleans during the summer season â€“ hot, humid and sunny - the pool is not only very popular but also quite lively. Finding a vacant chaise can be difficult during the afternoons though the towel attendants will endeavor to find you one as they become available. Another neat aspect was that people were friendly and strangers would talk to each other. Lastly, it is worth noting that the prices of cocktails and food from the poolside bar/grill were not bad and, in fact, equal to or modestly cheaper than the prices found at most other hotels of comparable stature as well as that of many resorts. Though the hotel supposedly contains a world-renown spa â€“ Guerlain Spa â€“ we did not utilize this facet of the hotelâ€™s amenities. However, we did dine at the Sazerac Restaurant located within the hotel on the lobby level. The food quality was excellent, the service was decent and the prices were okay (Iâ€˜ve seen worse pricing at many other hotel restaurants). Unfortunately, the interior setting and decor of the restaurant is perhaps a tad unexciting or cool which leads to a lackluster ambience or setting â€“ but, hey, thatâ€™s just my opinion. In contrast, the adjoining Sazerac Bar is rather unique, funky, popular and worth a visit â€“ if for no other reason than its historical context. The hotelâ€™s website (via the Hilton website) is well-designed, informative and contains several photographs. We recommend that prospective customers check it out. One special feature of their online booking process is the opportunity to pre-purchase an option on a room upgrade that is confirmed at check-in if the upgrade category is available for a very reasonable fee. If not available, then you pay nothing and retain the rate and room category originally booked. This is a great way to potentially have a higher caliber room and live the â€œhighâ€� life for a nominal amount. We did it and obtained the upgrade to the â€œSuperior Kingâ€� category for just $29.00. They also proffer upgrade options involving larger fees which will upgrade you to higher categories. I think this is a neat idea and I wish more hotels would do this. After all this positive commentary one may naturally ask â€“ what are the negatives? There are none per se. But, there are a few things you may wish to consider. They are subjective in nature and may be inconsequential for some. Though we did not stay in a room on a floor near street level and experience it firsthand I could see how traffic and related street noise could be troublesome at certain times. Obviously, for light sleepers and people from other time zones, such noise can make sleeping difficult and the room environment less relaxing. But, this is something that can happen at other hotels situated in an urban environment. The cost of utilizing the mini-bar is high and I highly recommend buying your drinks and snacks elsewhere. There are plenty of options nearby. Moreover, in light of the very sophisticated control system for monitoring consumption I strongly suggest that you donâ€™t go near it at all â€“ unless you truly wish to â€“ and keep the kids away from it or you may incur charges even though you didnâ€™t use anything. To avoid using the hotelâ€™s internet services and costs associated therewith I had my own mobile Wi-Fi device (Verizon) with me. However, curiously, my device would not work within my room which was totally mystifying to say the least. I have no idea why it would not work but that was my experience. I even called my cellular provider for assistance but they couldnâ€™t help me nor explain it. So, be forewarned that you may encounter similar problems. Parking is available at the hotel but it is very expensive. Though street parking can be found throughout the surrounding area the parking rules, time limits and payment methods are complicated such that I advise against parking on the street. It is NOT worth the hassle!!! There are parking garages nearby that charge less than the hotel but, not necessarily a lot less. The best solution â€“ particularly if you donâ€™t need your vehicle while staying at the hotel â€“ is utilizing one of the parking lots within the area but slightly further away from the hotel that proffer discounted rates by pre-booking or via coupons and promotional codes. I obtained a discount code online from the website of one of the lot operators with allowed me to pay just $10.00/day (less than 25% of the cost of overnight parking at the hotel). This particular lot was in the southwestern fringes of the French Quarter within 10 mins.-walk of the hotel. Check out the website for Central Parking in New Orleans which has three lots in the French Quarter that currently offer the ten-dollar rate. Finally, in light of my aforementioned observations regarding certain expensive services found at the hotel, I wish to make an overall comment about the cost of using this hotel. This is a high-end hotel and thus it is not a cheap lodging option for staying in New Orleans â€“ particularly with the addition of the lodging tax (13% or so). However, for what you get â€“ an experience of grandeur, elegance, luxury and service â€“ the rates and prices charged by this hotel are relatively fair and apropos their lower room categories rather decent. On numerous occasions I have either observed or experienced many other hotels and hotel chains within the peer group to which this hotel belongs, as well as several lesser-tier hotels, both in New Orleans and elsewhere, charging higher room rates but without the awesome experience. There are certainly many less-expensive lodging options to be had in New Orleans. However, at this point it is important to recall the old adage that you get what you pay for. One of the benefits of higher pricing is that it normally ensures a better level of clientele. Apropos our stay, the hotel did not appear full and we obtained a greater level of comfort, satisfaction and enjoyment that may not have been experienced at lesser-priced and/or lower grade hotels. We highly recommend this hotel because of its classical appearance, elegant feel, clean and well-appointed rooms, quality facilities, good food, and excellent customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: Lady_Nafziger
Reviews.Content: I had business to do in New Orleans so my husband and I decided to make a weekend of it before the work week as we were celebrating our birthdays on top of it all. We planned to use Hilton Honors points for the weekend and then booked a separate reservation not using points. This hotel is spendy -- $200 + but you get what you pay for. We had serious issues getting to the hotel due to airline issues so we ended up not arriving until a day after our reservation. I had called the hotel and Hilton Customer Service (I am a Diamond Member) to let them know we were going to miss our first night and to get a refund on 50,000 points. I must say I was so thankful with the service and while it took a little while on the phone to accomplish due to computer systems it wasn't a problem. My points were refunded and I was still able to use points for the second night stay. When we finally arrived at the hotel the next afternoon around 4pm the valet staff is so friendly. They should be for $40.00 a day to park the car, but they deserve the tips they earn. I tipped extra on this trip. The valet parking is directly across the street and while we didn't need the car during our weekend stay I did need it during the week for three days of work. By the time I called down and took the elevator the car was waiting. Our check in was pleasant as well - the front desk really goes the extra mile. We were told we were upgraded to a King Suite but that they were running behind on getting the rooms ready. They gave us drink vouchers to use in The Sazerac Bar (which is a nice quiet beautiful place in itself)and when the wait extended to two hours we asked for additional and more were given. The bar has many unique drinks worth trying. It helped take the edge off the wait and I must say the room was wroth it. WOW. The room was just amazing, clean, the bed is one of the best out of all of the Hiltons I've stayed in over the years. Robes are provided, slippers, two rooms, three tv's -- flat screen in the living room, one in the bedroom and a smaller one in the bathroom. Do not touch the mini bar fridge if you do not want to get charged. We new ahead of time that if anything was touched you own it. They do go to great lenghts to tell you this -- their is a card in with your room key as well. The mini bar is expensive -- $10.00 for M&M so go to the CVS a block away if you have a chocolate craving. The bathroom is small but clean and very nice. The shower had jets which were fabulous and made up for the smallness of the shower area and the lack of a tub. That would really be my only criticism -- tub would have been nice. The tile work in the shower and floor is elegant as well. Maid service is great too - with bed turn downs and chocolates left. I did dine at Domenica as well -- the food was great and the atmosphere is casual. This hotel is a great location as well -- sits on Canal across the street from Bourbon and is just a minute walk to everything. We also walked to the French Quarter within 10 - 15 minutes with no problems. Close to everything. The best part was it was quiet. We did not hear a lot of hotel noise or street noise which was fabulous. We were at the end of a hallway though which helped on our floor. I've stayed at other hotels in New Orleans before and this one has them all beat by several stars. I'd stay here again without a doubt. It's a beautiful hotel, with excellent service. I really can't say enough positive things. Thank you for an excellent stay!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite place”
Reviews.Author: NinaHow1
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth time back to the Roosevelt and not my last. We were moving my daughter into college for her second year. We were coming from a vacation in paradise Island and needed some boxes shipped so they would be there when we arrived. They informed me the boxes could be shipped directly to the hotel when I asked about the closest FedEx office. Easy pickup and carried right to car. The staff and concierge are extremely professional and friendly. Always a smile on their faces. Bed is so comfortable and rooms are extremely clean. Food is incredible! Pool beautiful and maintained beautifully. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: HappyCampersRWe
Reviews.Content: We had an amazing room and great time in new Orleans. Would definitely stay there again!! The staff were all above and beyond friendly and accommodating. The rooms were amazingly clean and the beds were so comfy

Reviews.Title: “Walk thru History”
Reviews.Author: frzzy58
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with all the grandeur and luxury. From the lobby, with the baby grand paino, to the shoe shine station (original) with one of the original shoe shine staff. (really) This hotel takes you back in history in the Sazarac Bar, The murals were commissioned and painted by a famous artist and has history of a famous politician. The spa is well worth the extra expense and Don, our concierge, was remarkable. Our stay at the Hotel was the best.

Reviews.Title: “(Barry White Voice) Oh, yeah, baby!”
Reviews.Author: GE1972
Reviews.Content: Short and sweet business trip to the Big Easy. As a Hilton Honors member, was looking to keep it "in the family" and find a nice hotel with convenient access to both the Central Business District and the French Quarter. The property was formerly the Fairmont Hotel and has one of the most gorgeous and ornate lobbies - think very gilded, Art Deco style. My host in New Orleans explained to me that during Christmas time the lobby is totally decked out with unbelievable decorations. A few days prior to my arrival, I received an email from the hotel concierge introducing himself and inquiring if I needed any reservations during my stay. Didn't require his help, but it was a very nice touch. Front desk staff were very friendly, efficient, and knowledgable. Thanks to my Hilton Honors status I was upgraded to a luxurious one bedroom suite. Very neatly appointed with a spacious living room containing plush furnishings. It was perfect for a short business meeting with two other colleagues. Would be ideal for corporate recruiting or any other situation requiring a nice private space for a meeting. Down the hall was the bedroom with king bed. Fantastic mattress and comfy linens. I was on the 8th floor in Tower 1. A teensy bit of street noise did come in during the night - but mostly motorcycles revving their engines so it would have been hard to miss unless you were on the 50th floor of some building. And hey, it's New Orleans if you don't like street noise, you aren't going to like this city. Bathroom had both multi-head shower and a separate bathtub. Grabbed cocktails at the Sazerac Bar and enjoyed a couple of the namesake cocktails. The environment was incredible - again a very stylized Art Deco room with a beautiful bar area. Good place that got pretty busy on a Tuesday night. Only knock against Sazerac was that they did not offer any food beyond the bar snacks (cornnuts, pretzels, and really tasty truffled potato chips) Headed for dinner at Domenica - the Italian bistro in the hotel. I'll do a separate review there - but it was excellent. After dinner wandered one block from the hotel down to Bourbon street to take in that scenery. Conveniently located to take in all that the Quarter has to offer and stumble back easily. Overall, I would STRONGLY recommend this hotel for business travelers or upscale vacationers looking for a nice upper tier hotel in an ideal location with near flawless execution.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Angie A
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive you are welcomed by very friendly staff. Everyone was nice and helpful. The hotel itself is beautiful. It has been renovated and the rooms are wonderful. It is located in a perfect area for walking to the sites.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel right near the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Michelle's G
Reviews.Content: This is an incredibly beautiful hotel with an ornate lobby, and wonderful pool deck. THe room service is delicious, and the rooms are lovely, although not very big. It's close walking distance to the French Quarter, but far enough away that it's quiet for sleeping.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Internet service prevents this from being a useful business hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dempsy
Reviews.Content: While this is an excellent restoration of a grand hotel and I could go on for pages as to what they do right, Poor wifi service prevents me from recomending this hotel as first class business hotel. What a shame. What good is complementrary internet if it is going to drop you regurally, even though your connection bars show an excellent connection. With the importance of inernet today recomend to tripadvisor to add a "Internet Connection" rating in the "Could you say a little more about it" section. Oh yes, if management reads this, your cashier/servers in the coffee seem to be serving people that cut in line before those who have waited. After this happened to us twice, we left the hotel and got coffee down the street.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Town!”
Reviews.Author: MBNissan1
Reviews.Content: The renovation of this was a labor of love and definitely worth a visit. The rooms are lovely, the staff is fabulous. The restaurants and bars are great. Perfect location! It has become my favorite and I am going on my third visit.

Reviews.Title: “March 2012”
Reviews.Author: chris c
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel! The staff went out of the way to be kind and very helpful. The bar was very nice,if you don't want to feel out of place at bar be dressed up. The location is great,right on Canal Street, just a four minute or less walk to Bourbon Street. All in all worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!!!!! 5-STARS ALL THE WAY”
Reviews.Author: poloblade
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights during the Month of August. For a little more money, I upgraded to the King Suite and I have to tell you it was one of the nicestand biggest rooms I have ever stayed in for the price. The hotel is super-clean and management is amazing. Nothing was a problem, nothing was an issue..they couldnt do enought for you...its just one of those hotels that brings back customer service to the fullest extent. The Concierge desk was the best I have ever encountered....so nice and so willing to do whatever you needed. The entire hotel from top to bottom was magnificent. I stay in some of the nicest hotel around the country and this is one of the best! If you love the history of New Orleans and you like a super-clean, super friendly 5 star hotel and a great value, then look no further. Location is perfect...right across the street from the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing restoration of a timeless classic”
Reviews.Author: Irish89
Reviews.Content: I had heard that the Roosevelt had undergone a multimillion dollar renovation recently. Well it shows. The hotel was first opened in the late 1800s. The 2009 renovation returned the hotel to a 1920s splendor. The main lobby is a giant open area all the way to the other side of the building. Everything about this place gives the feel of old-school luxury and opulence. I was there for a conference and spent most of my time in the convention center part of the building. It felt bigger on the inside than it looked on the outside. The staff was very attentive. My room was quite small. Don't be discouraged though. I willingly accepted a small room because i was travelling alone and didn't need much space. From the floor map (on the back of the room door), it was obvious that I had the smallest room on the floor. Despite its diminutive size, the room felt very high end and accommodating. A large screen TV, a mini fridge snack bar, my own robe and a very comfy bed. They even turned down the sheets and left a chocolate on the pillow; something I hadn't seen done in years. I didn't have a chance to eat in the restaurant. I did eat the convention center food. It was very good, but it's hard to make an excellent meal for 400 people at the same time. Plus, I also typically went out to eat. What the point of going to New Orleans if you're not going to go out and explore the local fare? The Roosevelt is conveniently located near Canal street and a block from the famous French Quarter. It's nice to be "near" the French Quarter rather than "in" it; if you know what i mean. The Roosevelt is a classic beauty and allows you to temporarily escape the modern world for just a while. You can imagine what it was like when New Orleans was like in its glory days back in the 1920s. I highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Stately hotel that was very comfortable and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: Doreen R
Reviews.Content: This gorgeous hotel is just off Canal Street and close to the French Quarter. Comfortable rooms with nice linens, good TVs (including a flat screen in the bathroom!), and updated amenities. The only thing I missed was a coffeemaker in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Old School Nice ...”
Reviews.Author: pilotsfeelfree1
Reviews.Content: I like historic hotels that are well maintained. And the Roosevelt does not disappoint. The grand hallway is magnificent. so were the rooms. We even had a celebrity sighting. Fantastic property. Make use of the Conceirge desk ... old school professionals.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel Stay In Every Detail”
Reviews.Author: GuitarBuilder
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights and 6 days in New Orleans at the beginning of August in celebration of our wedding anniversary, and booked our stay at the Waldorf Astoria Roosevelt Hotel. What a great choice that turned out to be. The hotel entrances are just half a block from Canal Street, so you can stroll to the French Quarter in a very few minutes but are not surrounded by the clamor of the nightlife when you return. It is a very historic property that has been beautifully preserved and renovated. The lobby, the beautiful Sazerac Bar, and the "Blue Room" ballroom (which opens to the public for Sunday jazz brunches) all convey a sense of the splendor of times gone by, but none of the glory is faded or shabby. Don't miss the unusual antique clock located near the University side of the lobby...it is really beautiful and unique, a true work of art. This is a big hotel with hundreds of rooms, but the excellent personal service will make you feel like you are staying at a small boutique property. We stayed in one of the hotel's expansive "Waldorf Suites." They run in excess of 1300 square feet. Ours featured one and a half baths, a large wet bar with a refrigerator (great for bringing home desserts, keeping bottled water for walking, etc.), a big soaking tub and separate shower with multiple jets, a terrific set of linens on the comfortable king bed, comfy microfiber robes, and soft and thick cotton terry cloth towels. We were on the same floor (4th) as the rooftop pool and bar, which provided a welcome retreat from the August heat during the afternoons. The suite was full of quality furnishings and featured a big formal dining table and lots of chest of drawers. The bedroom was separated from the big living room by a set of attractive French doors. The climate control was very quiet and was completely effective, despite it being the warmest time of the year. The room was dead quiet, with no street noise at all. Housekeeping adjusted seamlessly to our comings and goings...we would go out at different times every day, but the room was always made up when we returned, and we never ran into them...it was almost supernatural. Likewise we came "home" every night to find our bed turned down and our ice bucket filled. The hotel provided copies of the Wall Street Journal each week day, and the Financial Times over the weekend. The suite was decorated with attractive artwork and vintage photos of various significant sites in the city. Three flat screen TV's, and a mini bar tucked away inside a credenza. We even had a "back door" to the hallway (from the wet bar). Famed chef John Besh has located his excellent Italian restaurant, Domenica, in the Roosevelt's lobby. Their happy hour from 3 to 6, 7 days a week, is the best deal in New Orleans. All their fabulous pizzas, well drinks and cocktails, and wines by the glass, are at half price during these hours. It is a smart strategy, because when you taste one of the pizzas, you'll want to come back for the full dinner service, the food is delicious and very authentic, with great cured meats (made in house), and a wonderful selection of high end cheeses, supporting an extensive and varied menu. The Sazerac restaurant is a solid choice for lunch and dinner featuring typical New Orleans favorite dishes, and Teddy's Cafe offers a full espresso bar and pastry selection. The pool side bar has a grill cook on hand and features some unique and well-crafted frozen cocktails. There's a shop in the lobby called the Emporium that has a really nice selection of apparel and merchandise, in addition to the usual packaged snacks and treats, books and magazines, and other merchandise one ordinarily associated with hotel shops. Fitness and a really fine looking full service spa are all on hand as well. The room service menu is extensive, and the hotel is ready for laundry, dry cleaning and shoe service pickups with a quick turn-around. I am sure I am forgetting something, but trust me, the Roosevelt is a full-service property, in keeping with the high standards of the Waldorf Astoria brand. Our personal concierge, Claire Bartells, deserves special mention and the very highest praise. She contacted us by email a few days before our stay and was excellent at promptly clarifying information and and answering questions about our accommodations. We were contacted again at a check-in and a few days into our stay to make sure everything met expectations, and she was constantly ready to provide information and make arrangements in connection with the rich set of experiences that New Orleans offers to its visitors. Ms. Bartells is a stellar member of an already great team, and the Roosevelt is both wise and fortunate to have her looking out for its guests--her amazing devotion to excellence in her responsibilities is exactly the sort of thing that builds strong customer loyalty. After celebrating our 33rd wedding anniversary with a lengthy stay at the Roosevelt, we now want to return several times a year, and Ms. Bartells fine work is a huge part of the reason. I honestly can't think of even a minor complaint. We loved staying in the Roosevelt, and we can't wait to plan our next stay. Luxury, comfort, and perfect personal service that is genuine, unpretentious and seamless, all come together in this magnificent hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BoilerDan93
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the best place to stay in New Orleans. Rooms are great and the service is top notch. The concierge will get it done whatever your needs. Eat at Domenica and you will be rewarded. And if you are ever in NOLA for Christmas, the lobby is a great sight to see.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable!”
Reviews.Author: Sharon V
Reviews.Content: For the most luxurious hospitable stay, the Roosevelt will from now on be my first choice. From Gabriella at the front desk who felt so bad that our room wasnt ready that she provided us with free breakfasts throughout our stay, to August who helped coordinate our tours. The rooms are ultra luxurious and as someone who travels every two weeks this hotel is one of the finest I have stayed in. Even on a weekend that was completely sold out with three weddings, I didn't wait for an elevator, room service was immediate and the restaurant seating was readily available. Location was fantastic, 2 blocks from Bourbon street so far enough not to hear the noise but close enough that it is only a five minute walk to the action. We were celebrating a 10 year anniversary and the hotel was kind enough to send us Champagne and goodies, can't be the class of the hotel and its staff.

Reviews.Title: “Give it a try”
Reviews.Author: Mr-Nuke-to-You
Reviews.Content: I travel to New Orleans for either fun or business several times a year. I've sort of drifted from one hotel to the next for one reason or another. My original favorite was the Monteleone (I don't recommend it unless things have changed drastically since the final straw that separated me from it forever), then I wandered to the Intercontinental (later J.W. Marriott) where one of the bellmen was such a great guy that I specifically chose the place over others. Well, my friend Alfred left when Katrina blew in, so I've settled on the Ritz for most stays lately. It's a wonderful property and if you have the chance to stay there, I'd recommend it. The problem with the Ritz is that it can be quite . . . ritzy on prices, especially if there's something going on in New Orleans that has a lot of folks in town. That was the case when I booked the Roosevelt in the run-up to Mardi Gras. I'd never stayed in the Roosevelt, though I had walked past a time or two. As a guest, I was pleased with service, the room, the size of the room, the location . . . that is, all the things we're asked to rate on this site. I would not put the Roosevelt in the "worth $400 a night" category, but then again I didn't stay in a $400/night room, so I can't really judge. For what I paid, I was quite happy and the value-to-quality ratio on this hotel is very high. You can pay more for rooms at other hotels, but you won't get more for your money. One last point - and this is always a question in the minds of folks heading to New Orleans - what about location? Yes, you can easily walk from the Roosevelt to Bourbon Street and the French Quarter and just as easily stumble back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our anniversary celebration!”
Reviews.Author: GJS001
Reviews.Content: We spent a 4 day weekend in New Orleans, and The Roosevelt was the ideal hotel for the occasion. The room decor was luxurious without being over-the-top, the staff were friendly, helpful, and first rate, the food was good, and other than street noise from the nearby French Quarter, our sleep was blissful. The concierge desk was first rate, quickly recommending restaurants to suit our tastes, and suggesting tours and interesting places to spend our time. Our room was huge - not sure about the size of the basic rooms. Pool area was large, with cabanas, bar, etc. The spa looked excellent, but my spouse thought it was a bit pricey and declined to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: iluvdatiger
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Roosevelt this weekend. Great bed and pillows and the room wasn't too small. Loved the shower bc it had extra shower sprayers that was like massage therapy. Good bath products too. We also had breakfast at the Sazarac that was pretty good. The pool was nice with good frozen drinks and i had shrimp salsa dish off the pool menu that was good. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Other Than The Phantom Mini Bar Charges”
Reviews.Author: Michael B
Reviews.Content: There is no doubt this is like walking into the 1940's. it is a very well appointed hotel with no lack of quality amenities. The room was top class and had all the props you would expect. it was also very nice to come back ta cool space after the incredible heat from the New Orlean's weather. The only slight put off, was the charges we found on our room bill for the mini bar. We did not use the mini bar, but whe we asked about it, we were informed that if the articles are moved around the inside of the bar, it automatically is charged to your credit card. An interesting view on things from a physics standpoint, but very strange indeed to the traveling customer. The charges were removed and we did not let it ruin our experience of a fine hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Uniquely New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Honeebee2
Reviews.Content: It is not just another hotel restaurant - the Sazerac Restaurant is a lovely and classy place to enjoy lunch or dinner. We have been there once for dinner on Christmas Eve night and then the next year for Christmas Eve lunch. Just walking through the glamorously decorated lobby sets the mood for a festive time. The service is superior and the food is fantastic. Worth checking out anytime of the year.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing But the Best in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: JackandMaddie
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel! My husband and I were so happy we chose this hotel. From the minute you step into the amazing lobby, you know youâ€™re in an historical, luxury hotel. The service was very good. We had no problems with our room at all. The room was a bit small, but that was fine since we only really used it to sleep and watch tv. The bed was wonderful, and they had turn down service each evening leaving us with a chocolate on our pillows. The dÃ©cor in the room was really nice and the shower was absolutely amazing! The shower had different water jets that you could turn on or off on the sides and also a handheld showerhead if you needed. The restaurant Domenica is located in the hotel. They had the best happy hour, and the most delicious pizzas ever! Starting at 3pm you could get half off cellar wines and drinks and half off of the pizzas! I had the gorgonzola pizza with peaches and pecans and it was one of the most delicious meals I had on our trip. Also, the hotel had a roof-top pool with a ton of lounge chairs and a bar. Unfortunately we didnâ€™t have enough time to enjoy the pool, but it was a very nice space that we could gladly take advantage of when we return. I loved that this hotel was so historic. We checked out the Blue Room which was very cool to see. The hotel location is great, just a quick walk from the French Quarter. Also, the streetcars stop just outside the hotel to take you to the Garden District and beyond. This hotel makes you feel very special. I think this may be the best hotel in New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and timeless!”
Reviews.Author: JournalKat7
Reviews.Content: The interior of the Roosevelt reminds me of the Waldorf in New York - gilded, elegant (albeit a bit over the top, with chandeliers for days), and luxurious. The rooms are gorgeous and roomy (our king suite had two bathrooms!) and contrary to some reviews, the hotel did not seem in need of refurbishment or tired at ALL. The customer service was excellent - maybe it's just southern charm, but the staff went out of their way to assist in every way possible. The location was fabulous - one block from the French Quarter. Make sure to grab a cocktail in the Sazerac bar in the lobby - you feel as if you've stepped back in time!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: WickSmith
Reviews.Content: Lovely old hotel, wonderfully restored. We were upgraded to a suite for our anniversary. Pool and pool bar on the rooftop were very relaxing. Service throughout was polite, friendly and prompt. A very special experience.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAY WITH EXCELLENT STAFF AND THE BEST FOOD EVER !”
Reviews.Author: gilliganandskip
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week at the Roosevelt in June. We paid for an upgrade to 1 Bedroom suite and glad we did. The rooms were nice, big wardrobe, good king bed and lovely size bathroom. Ray the concierge was fantastic with many great recommendations and he goes the extra mile for anyone needing any assistance. This hotel just had a great 'feel' to it ! The Hotel is one block away from the French Quarter which is great - we had no noise, but close enough to enjoy it. The 'Domenica Restaurant' was the best ever ! We really enjoyed many meals there (Whilst we are not normally Pizza lovers, all of their Pizza were to die for !!) we found it difficult to go elsewhere........ as the food was just so yummy and the service great to. Be aware they have happy hour from 3.00 - 6.00 pm which means that meals are ridiculously cheap - but still of an excellent standard ! We just loved the hotel, the old world charm and New Orleans - we will be back in the future - Thanks to the Roosevelt Team !

Reviews.Title: “Bad view, small rooms but elegant”
Reviews.Author: lt1953
Reviews.Content: The first thing I thought of when I walked into this elegant old hotel was the movie, The Shining. The valet and front desk staff were courteous and efficient. The hotel elevators were authentic antiques and claustrophobic. The rooms were small but very well appointed. The view from our small windows was terrible - a dirty neighboring rooftop and a few buildings. However the hotel is situated in central downtown within walking distance of all the action. Valet is $40 and necessary because there is not much in the way of easy parking. The gift shop was lovely also.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf Astoria? Try Hampton Inn”
Reviews.Author: Steve4233323
Reviews.Content: Great location, very nice public areas, but the attention to detail is really lacking. No shower cap in the bathroom, no hot water in shower or sink. We passed Housekeeping in the hall leaving for breakfast, when we came back 4 hours later the room hadn't been serviced. We paid for an upgrade to a suite which way way down a quiet hallway. The room was nice but kind of crowded with furniture. The property is very conveniently located to the French Quarter, easy walking distance to breakfasts and dinners. Ray at the concierge desk was helpful in pointing out places for dinner within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “The Roosevelt Hotel - great stay!”
Reviews.Author: TValls
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel in New Orleans for a conference. Great Location and beautiful hotel. We stayed in a King Suite and very comfortable space, with wonderful amenities. The hotel is only 1 block away from Bourbon Street right of the famous Canal street. Its a great hotel in the French Quarter easy and accessible to all the great attractions, but far enough away to not be in the noise traffic area. Beds are wonderfully comfortable deep mattress and fluffy soft pillows for a good nights sleep. Go down stairs to the bar and have their famous Sazerac drink, a New Orleans original. The only downside, is there are no coffee makers in the room, but plenty of places to go for breakfast and coffee within a very short walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection close to the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: houstongv
Reviews.Content: We planned a mini getaway for Thanksgiving weekend to New Orleans. After looking a several French Quarter hotels, we decided to look into the Roosevelt and we couldn't have made a better choice. Although the hotel was packed since it was a major college football weekend, we made the best of our couple of days. It was freezing outside and we didn't leave the hotel the entire first day! Our room was amazing, with a great modern bathroom with a tv! The Sazerac bar was exactly what more than two classic cocktail lovers could ask for, and we the hotel restaurant, Domenica, was so delicious that we ate there two nights in a row. All the staff we encountered were helpful and pleasant. I hope to stay at this property again in the future. For the price, it is a wonderful value.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, great rooms and service, great pool.”
Reviews.Author: Zapalniczka
Reviews.Content: From the moment we arrived the staff were really good and we were impressed. The reception was an impressive old Europe style of space and set up the New Orleans mood perfectly. We were asked what kind of room we wanted and when I requested a high room with a view we were given a top floor room on a corned looking out over the city. The room itself was not huge but very well put together and very clean. The bed was about the most comfortable I've ever slept in and the bathroom was perfect with the best shower I've had in a hotel. The roof top pool was great and a nice place to relax after the intensity of Bourbon street. The location was great, just around the corner from all the action but not in the middle of it so noise is not a problem and believe me it get noisy at a weekend! All in all a great hotel but unfortunately have to mark them down to 4/5 because $15 a day for internet these days is a bit of a cheek in a hotel that is otherwise very impressive. Get rid of the charge and you'd be 5/5.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: travelwith2kids_8
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt was a wonderful family friendly hotel! It was perfectly located close to the French Quarter. My husband and I travelled to New Orleans with my 7 year o.d and 4 year old and they were able to walk easily to Cafe du Mond, French Quarter, Business District and all the popular restaurants. Great location! Clean rooms with turn down service nightly. Beautiful pool and lobby area. Great cafe with wonderful desserts and quick healthy breakfasts! The hotel met all our needs and was very comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: April P
Reviews.Content: The service is impeccable! Gorgeous hotel great location! Housekeeping does a great job too!

Reviews.Title: “Gracious Service, but Watch for â€œBells and Wrappersâ€�”
Reviews.Author: WashDCRoad_Warrior
Reviews.Content: I was initially excited about staying at the Roosevelt. It is part of the Waldorf-Astoria brand, so I expected excellent service and top-notch facilities. My expectations were half correct. I was greeted warmly upon arrival and the check-in process was quick and efficient. The Roosevelt is an older hotel, so guests should not expect the most up-to-date features. Many design aspects are lovely and charming. The paintings and ceiling decorations in the lobby are fantastic. The elevators have indicators that say â€œThis Car Upâ€� when the car arrives. The Sazerac bar is warm and inviting. I found my room, which faced Baronne Street, to be on the small side. The closet was large, but the bathroom was small. The door of the bathroom would not stay open, which meant the steam from the shower would always fog up the bathroom mirror. The hotel provides bath products from Ferragamo. The room did not have a coffee maker, but it did have a warning about how using the mini-bar to store personal items would incur a charge. I bent down to the nightstand to plug in my phone charger and found a discarded candy bar wrapper. Thatâ€™s a sign that the housekeeping staff didnâ€™t do a good job. Across the street from the hotel on Baronne Street is the Church of the Immaculate Conception. I was awoken in the morning by the ringing of the church bells. They donâ€™t just ring every hour, or ever half-hour. They ring every 15 minutes, with a different chime each time. I suppose the bells might be charming in the evening, but after traveling across time zones, they were annoying. As noted above, the service was terrific. After checking out I wanted to leave my lugagge for the day. No one was at the bell clerkâ€™s station, so someone else rushed over to assist me. The hotel also provides an evening turndown service, a rarity these days.

Reviews.Title: “Your concierge staff”
Reviews.Author: sancmm
Reviews.Content: We had a great time. Your staff in general is fantastic. Kudos to your concierage staff, especially the fellow who lived in Miami. They were all great and provided spot on recommendations. They really know the city. Thanks also for the turn down service. Nice pool. Close enough to the Quarter and not too close. Again, the stay was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “A step back in time!”
Reviews.Author: ArmyWife2012
Reviews.Content: This is just a wonderful hotel! We are a younger couple so we felt like we got to experience some old world luxury :) The staff is beyond helpful and kind. The place is just beautiful! There is a small rooftop pool but it is worth going there! We went at night and pool lights up different colors. Best part is, you are just a block and half from the start of Bourbon, right off Canal and yet you feel like you are miles away from the crazy if you want to be.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Hotel Restored to Original Grandeur”
Reviews.Author: Shelane N
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely beautiful and the service was outstanding. The rooms are spacious, everything is brand new. There is wi-fi, there is a wonderful Guerlain Spa with an area you can sample all of the goodies.....The location is excellent if you are looking to be close enough to the French Quarter but far enough away. It is walking distance and it is a safe walk. There are multiple restaurants - a more upscale venue, a more casual Italian (including pizza) offering, and a little cafe. They did their best to use / restore all of the original items like wall murals and lighting fixtures when possible. It is true that it is a bit expensive, but it is in line with the pricing of the more upscale properties in New Orleans. If you are looking for something special with a historic feel (but entirely new), then this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property, Outstanding Service”
Reviews.Author: goferris
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a few days recently while visiting NOLA and all I can say is "wow"! First, the property is in a great location being only a few blocks (very walkable distance) from Bourbon Street, but far enough away to not get the noise or filth. The hotel has also been beautifully restored and has to be one of the most well-done restorations that I have seen. Plus, I found it particularly interesting that all of the staff was well-versed in the history and nuances of the hotel. The service was also outstanding. Check-in and check-out were quick and efficient. The check-in agent even overheard my husband and I speaking about a recent celebration. Although our occasion had passed, she gave us complementary coffee and desserts for every night of our stay. It was a nice special touch. All of the other staff from the gift shop employees to the concierge were extremely courteous and efficient and provided wonderful recommendations. They were even able to secure a reservation for us at the most popular restaurant in NOLA that is booked months in advance! The rooms and rooftop pool were also well restored and clean. Housekeeping and general maid service was great and we never saw a speck of dirt anywhere during our visit. Overall, this hotel is a bit pricey but it's worth every dollar and will certainly complete a trip to NOLA!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: susan905Ontario
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel - enjoyed every minute - won't stay anywhere else when I go back to New Orleans. It is truly grand. Comfy bed, lovely linens, quiet. We booked with What a Hotel- they are always outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “It's Not Worth It!!”
Reviews.Author: MsTab
Reviews.Content: If you use the valet service, please LOCK your money in your glove department. One of the valet parking staff members stole money out of our car. After speaking with an Hilton employee, we found out that the valet service is contract service. Rooms: I've stayed at this location when it was the Fairmont; however, after Katrina, the Fairmont decided not to repair the damages and the Roosevelt moved. The Roosevelt clearly resized the rooms! I remember the standard rooms under the Fairmont were HUGE. We were in the king deluxe room and it wasn't anything special. The hotel also had mini bar where it charges you to remove items. Yes, only to remove items. I understand the charge for using an item but removing an item. Please!!!! The bathroom was rather nice and spacious. The shower was one of the best parts. Check in Process: Checking in was pretty simple. As a Gold member, I received two complimentary beverages at the bar. The drinks were pretty good!! Unfortunately I didn't get upgraded due to a special event in the city. I honestly didn't think the hotel was full. Valet: Sucks!!! It was $40/day. Hotel Decor: The hotel's lobby is beautiful with great artwork I love staying in Hilton hotels; however, this is one Hilton I would not stay in ever again or recommend to any friends or family members. It's not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Rich with history”
Reviews.Author: autothief
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel. The artwork at the entrance and in the lobby is so detailed. I stayed in a suite on the 3rd floor overlooking the Orpheum Theater. The room had a living area with a pull out bed sofa and refrigerator. Comfortable bed and spacious room. The shower is very large with shower heads coming from everywhere. I can't really speak for the standard rooms. Nice restaurants and a drink at the Sazarac is a must. Very elegant. The location is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and grand, its classy!”
Reviews.Author: Rakeshrg
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a night on a business trip to New Orleans. Right from the moment you enter the lobby, the grandness of this newly refurbished property welcomes you. The staff and the service is just excellent. The rooms are big and comfortable. I stayed in a standard suite . The main bathroom was small though with no bath tub, but i am not complaining. The toiletries were some designer brand and were excellent. They have an open air swimming pool and jacuzzi on the 4th floor,it was nice! It is located on the canal street and close to the french quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid Opulence”
Reviews.Author: DIANNE S
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is like the grand dame of NOLA. From the minute you walk it, it just exudes an understated elegance. I had the 1 BR suite, and it was fabulous; it even sports a 1/2 bath! The only draw back was it didn't have a bathtub. Wonderful staff, and the Sazerac bar is great. A good place to get a bloody mary in the morning after a wild night. I'm booked there again in December, I've heard its Christmas decor is breataking.

Reviews.Title: “First Visit To Orleans”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravelDiva
Reviews.Content: A short business trip brought us to the elegant Waldorf Astoria. After reading for weeks all of the wonderful reviews about the hotel, my husband and I were thrilled when we finally arrived in New Orleans. Upon entering our superior room, we discovered several problems. After three calls to guest relations and the third staff member unreasonably refusing to connect us to a manager, my husband and I took a short walk to the Walgreens to purchase cleaning supplies to resolve the problem. As longstanding Hilton Honors members, for the first ever, we felt slighted. Aside from our problem, the hotel is exquisite. We visited all the hotel restaurants and had room service. Each was fantastic! We required wireless internet access in our room, and it was satisfactory. The valet parking was super efficient as was the spa. We are planning a return trip during Thanksgiving.

Reviews.Title: “French Quarter Delight”
Reviews.Author: Dennis10_51
Reviews.Content: Located just off if Canal Street at the edge of the French Quarter, the Waldorf is a great hotel. Beginning the moment you are greeted by the valet, you ate treated like royalty. The hotel is beautiful and walking through the grand foyer just makes you feel good. Excellent stay. My new favorite of the hotels in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: txswinner
Reviews.Content: There is nothing better than the elegance of Waldorf Astoria home away from home experience at the Roosevelt. With 5 years of hotel living in NO I spent the last three at my favorite. The Roosevelt in New Orleans is equal to or superior to all the hotels I have stayed from "The Waldorf" in NYC to upscales in Hawaii, Costa Rica, Italy, Key West and places beyond. None offers the friendly staff and elegance of the Roosevelt. It is indeed to total package to finest hotel living anywhere. Thank you to all of the staff and management, it was a great three years and although I am ending my NO journey I will remember the friendliness of each of you.

Reviews.Title: “Warm Welcoming Personal Service”
Reviews.Author: emanon256
Reviews.Content: From check in to departure, the hotel staff went above and beyond to make me feel welcome. Upon arrival my wife and I were greeted and the check-inn agent even congratulated us on being pregnant. It was a very personal touch. We did notice that one of the 2 free bottles of water in our room had been opened, probably by the previous guest and missed by housekeeping. The reason for the 5th star was because when I reported it and asked them to replace it, they went above and beyond, gave us 4 free bottles of water, and gave us two free drink coupons just for the inconvenience. It was not inconvenient, it was an easy mistake for anyone to make. I was so shocked by the service, I would have been perfectly happy with the 1 bottle being replaced. The staff every time we exited offered to give us directions, and every time we returned welcomes us back, often by name which means a lot. Also the concierge asked us what we like and made restaurant recommendations based on our interests, while many hotels seem to steer us towards chains that give them kickbacks. I was really impressed with the art collection in the lobby, and loved that it was local art specific to the hotel. The clock was fascinating and I loved reading about the mayors lock box and the milk jug. The Roosevelt is a very beautiful historic hotel. It was a very personal experience, excellent service, and less than a block from the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “True luxury in the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Resortdude
Reviews.Content: Ti was pleasantly surprised when we arrived. The entire staff was wonderful!! The luxury suite was very spacious and very well appointed. The pool was very nice. And the poo. Bar and staff were very attentive. All of the services were first class and second to one in New Orleans. Will back again?

Reviews.Title: “Classy”
Reviews.Author: Gerry G
Reviews.Content: Shorts would not be appropriate in the lobby. (That's a good thing) An elegant property in all respects. Don't miss the Sazarac Bar or Domenica restaurant where you'll find a charming and inspired chef.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: ChiHub
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is a elegant hotel with a great location. It is near the Quarter without being in the craziness. The roof top pool is nice and service was good. My only complaint was the music they played at the pool which was somewhere between lounge lizard and elevator music.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Margray_53
Reviews.Content: The room was comfortable, everything worked, the bed was comfortable and had nice linen, the concierge knew lots of stuff and was friendly and wonderful, the staff was friendly and knew a lot. There are three restaurants, one a coffee shop with packaged snacks and desserts and so on that is open long hours, one a lunch and dinner room kind of middle ground place, and one a more upscale place. There is a bar at the pool that serves food and drink, a bar right off the lobby, a mildly interesting gift shop, and a drop dead gorgeous lobby. What more could anyone want? The spa is over the top expensive, so I didn't go, but it has a lot of advertised services.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could have stayed longer”
Reviews.Author: mandem
Reviews.Content: Everything was wonderful. The room, the staff, the ambience, the roof-top pool. The location is great...your a few blocks from the Vieux Carre and right on Canal. Domenica is a bit overrated but there's plenty to like about this place. I'd stay there again and again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shelley12345
Reviews.Content: So very pleased with our recent stay at The Roosevelt. We have stayed at various hotels in NOLA but this one by far is tops on our list. Honestly, there is nothing negative to say. Will absolutely return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “a 2nd stay at the Roosevelt confirmed .....”
Reviews.Author: silvertravel
Reviews.Content: A 2nd stay at the Roosevelt confirmed that the excellent service and elegant appointments experienced on my first visit â€“ were the norm for this hotel and not the exception! The Roosevelt is very conveniently located, within walking distance of the Quarter, Canal Street, St. Charles, even the WW II Museum (which I urge you to visit â€“ even if you are not typically interested in American History). In addition to its location, the hotel over-delivers on its ambitious promises found on its website. You will be struck by the beauty and grandeur of the main lobby, from the moment you enter. Look for the unusual clock near the inside entry and take a moment to read about its mechanics. Off the lobby, Teddyâ€™s offers an early morning espresso or late night gelato and pastries, fresh fruit and a sandwich menu all day long. The treats inside of Teddyâ€™s are outstanding â€“ not just â€œhotel coffee shopâ€� quality. After your evening out, enjoy a cocktail in the Sazerac Lounge and read about the famous resident who once lived on the 12th floor of the hotel â€“ and sample the drink that made the lounge famous. Once in your room â€“ you will enjoy peace and quiet behind the large solid-core door â€“ that keeps any noise from the hallwayâ€¦ in the hallway. Our bathroom had a phone, a TV, as well as soaps, shampoos, and towels that matched the quality weâ€™ve experienced in other fine hotels around the world. You will also enjoy the fine quality of the linens and mattress. Make sure to reserve at least a few hours to enjoy the renovated rooftop pool. There is a full bar, which also has a food menu available. We did not visit the spa, although I would expect it to be on par with the other well executed parts of this hotel. TRAVEL TIP: We took advantage of the $15/day self-parking that is available Â½ block away and across the street â€“ because we did not need the valet service @ $40/day. If you are unsure of where to stay on your next trip to New Orleans â€“ consider a stay at the Roosevelt and you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: sniraga
Reviews.Content: Having read one of the prior reviews saying the rooms weren't spacious I'm wondering if we were upgraded-- our room was massive. Very comfortable bed, nice shower (no tub, which was a bit of a bummer but the awesome shower made up for it) sitting area with giant TV. The hotel common areas are spectacular! The bar and coffee shop wonderful and comfortable. So why the 4 stars? Well, for a couple of reasons. First-- the WIFI charge. I mean, COME ON! This really is a basic service these days and the fact that so many places offer it free should send a message to the hotel industry that they need to pony up and quit charging for it. Second--the staff were very nice, but they really needed to take a stand on all the shrieking children in the lobby. It was horrific to sit in what should have been a wonderful area. I know sucking up to clientele is part of the fancy hotel business, but perhaps they should think of the other guests who don't have children, or (heaven forbid) those with well-behaved children who aren't screaming, running, grabbing. I run my own business, dealing with the public all day long, and I wouldn't inflict that situation on my customers. Third-- and this is just a minor pet peeve, but there was no way to say you didn't want new bedding and towels without saying you didn't want any room service at all. I love to come back to a refreshed room, made bed, et cetera, but I'm not so precious that I need brand new bedding every night. I think it's time that luxury and consumption are separated in people's minds. This was a very luxurious hotel, I didn't need fresh linens after only one night to increase my enjoyment. Maybe just a card that you could leave out for the housekeeper to let them know. I realize New Orleans isn't exactly short on water, but why waste resources if you don't have to? Overall, this was the most beautiful hotel I've ever stayed in. I've been to New Orleans probably 15 times over the past 25 years and always try to stay someplace really nice-- this one has them all beat.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: sotkaz
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Rooms are not spacious but very comfortable and clean. Most but not all service was great. Great Location and bad room service. The pizza was gross but if you go to a restaurant connected to The Roosevelt or others you will be happy. They seemed very confused at times and less organized as far as service, restaurant, pool and pool bar, etc. Overall, I would probably visit the Roosevelt again because cleanliness is one of my main concerns.

Reviews.Title: “first class all the way”
Reviews.Author: ebjones
Reviews.Content: Just stayed two nights at the Roosevelt, waldorf astoria in new orleans. This is a first class hotel and 5 star in my opinion. It reminds me so much of the gorgeous waldorf hotel i knew as a child in new york city, gorgeous breathtaking lobby, first class rooms and amenities, and spectacular service. We had two issues with service but nothing that would change my opinion. One, in the blue room at fathers' day jazz brunch i had to go over to the maitre'd to ask for service as we were ignored after seating. once they realized it, however, they were very attentive. The other, I engaged the concierge for some assistance and found him to be almost annoyed that I was bothering him and not helpful at all. However, I stopped for assistance from another concierge, the next day and he was helpful and spot on with his advice. The location is perfect as well far enough from the partying noise..but a quick walk to just about everything. I love new orleans and was thrilled to take my daughter and her friend for a girls weekend and show it off. Thanks Roosevelt Waldorf Astoria for making it a great time. We will never stay anyplace else in this wonderful little city!!!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay at the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: EJG4
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here 4 times and have not been disappointed. Felt compelled to write another review due to a terrific room upgrade. We used Hilton points for the stay and were upgraded to a huge suite, one of the nicest hotel rooms I have been in. I just love the architecture and detail in the lobby and the rooms. This is a very nice hotel. Concierge was great as well (I think his name was Don?). Only two suggestions for management in case they read this: 1. Air conditioning was not working that well. 2. Need more lounge chairs by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: Monk2975
Reviews.Content: My husband and I brought his mother for vacation and to meet my parents, who are locals. Everything about this hotel is top notch. Upon entry the doormen and valet guys were very welcoming. The lobby is beautiful, the front desk and concierge were immensely friendly, polite and helpful. We stayed for 1 week and enjoyed every minute. The cafe is so charming. It is full of espresso, truffles, and gelato. The staff seemed genuinely happy. We hung around the fabulous pool area every day. The water was perfect temperature, the drinks and food were good. There were a group of bachelors and another group of bachelorettes celebrating, but everything was tame. There were also plenty of couples and families having fun. Somehow the atmosphere remained relaxing and elegant with so much going on. We were so content at the pool that it was so hard to leave our lounge chairs to go sightseeing. Minor complaint- no coffee at the pool. This would be so nice in the morning after a night of partying. fYI get there early on the weekend to get a good spot. The rooms are relatively small... But I think that is pretty much standard for hotels in NOLA. The bed was comfortable but the pillows were not. The irony of staying in an upscale hotel is that they do not provide you with a microwave, coffee maker, mini fridge. I have these amenities at the holiday inn I frequent for work. I guess that's their way of nickel and diming you. You can ask them to empty out the mini bar but they charge you $25 a day. Housekeeping was very good. They cleaned everything very well. I did not like the Ferragamo toiletries. Are they associated with Guerlain? Since they have a Guerlain spa, I thought they would have better tolietries. The high end hair dryer was very nice. Since my husband and I eloped a few months earlier, we decided to have a wedding celebration here. We hired a photographer, who took beautiful family pics in the gorgeous lobby. Then we proceeded to Domenica (Italian, John Besh) restaurant in the hotel. Our server was extremely knowledgeable and efficient. My parents are vegetarian and they were very pleased with the food. The meat eaters were equally happy. We finished off that night with cocktails at the Sazerac. The drinks were impeccable and the atmosphere was sophisticated lounge style ---tourists, hotel guests, well dressed businessmen and locals. It was busy that night but some patrons were nice enough to let me, my husband and my brother sit at their table. Good drinks, good service and nice conversation. We had a wonderful stay, my mother in law felt like royalty. It takes a lot for me to give a hotel five stars. If the rooms were a little better, with better in room amenities this would be five stars in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Thanks for the upgrade!”
Reviews.Author: AandCStoecker
Reviews.Content: We came to new Orleans to celebrate our fifth anniversary. I put that info on the reservation when I booked the hotel. When we arrived, we were pleasantly surprised to learn that we had been upgraded to a suite. Everything was gorgeous! Our room, the lobby, everything. It was across the street from the French quarter. This was good and bad. It was bad in that it was a bit of a walk to some of the sights, such as Jackson square and cafe du monde. But, still within a mile. It was a good location also because it was close to bourbon street but not so close that it was loud or crazy. Overall, wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Most beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kelly B
Reviews.Content: This hotel has become the one place my family continually stays when we visit NOLA. The hotel bar, the Sazerac, has so much history and I can't resist grabbing a drink (Pomegranate Palmer!) every time I am there. The rooftop pool is so comfortable and the staff is wonderful. I do love the pool bar as well. The rooms are beautifully decorated, although a little small. It's walking distance to Bourbon St and shopping so it's great for visitors. My favorite thing about the hotel is the lobby. It's gorgeous and ornate and transports me back in time to the 1920s. Just fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Grand, Historic Property”
Reviews.Author: Island_Gypsy1
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is a beautiful, classy property. Very convenient location to the Quarter and with excellent dining/bar venues. We'll be back to the Roosevelt on the next trip to NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “We will be coming back here! Rooftop pool!”
Reviews.Author: SMorovich
Reviews.Content: This was a terrific hotel with little to complain about. I'll break it down below: Location: Perfect! On the other side of Canal St from Boubon St/French Quarter, so it was quiet yet only 2 blocks away from the action. Not sure I would want to be any further or closer Service: Excellent, from the initial check-in, maid service/turn down service, concierge, pool side waitress to check-out; nothing to complain about. Concierge was helpful, and suggested the great Mr. B's Bistro! Rooms: Standard size was adequate; however, it was more than made up with the fantastic bed and linens. Bed+Black out Shades=Sleep in! Extras: Don't overlook the Roof Top Pool & Bar. Great little setting with a nice little lunch menu. Killed the club sandwich w/ avocado, matched with the suggested Sangria. It was perfect. And the service is just as good as the restaurants downstairs. Speaking of the restaurants; don't miss out on Domenica's. We went there twice. Sazerac bar looked nice as well, though we did not visit. History: When we told locals that we were staying at the Roosevelt, we initially were anticipating disdain for staying in an upscale Waldorf Astoria Hotel. However, it was the exact opposite. Several had fond memories as children visiting the hotel, while others expressed appreciation for the hotel chain trying to keep the original spirit of the Roosevelt alive. Example 1: All the rooms have black and white pictures of the the original Roosevelt Hotel, mostly donated by long time citizens. Example 2: One person told us about the Blue Room, which was "the spot" back in the day. He even went to so far to tell us how to find the room; when you enter the lobby, the men's restroom is on the right side. Next to the bathroom are a set of non-descript doors, which lead to the Blue Room. Entering really gives you a sense of a step back in time. Complaints: Nothing of any note. Parking is expensive, but so is the rest of the French Quarter area. Just grab a taxi from the airport ($33) and use your feet to get around town afterwards! If you area going to New Orleans, I highly suggest the Roosevelt. We will be coming back!

Reviews.Title: “A class act”
Reviews.Author: Jeweledgypsy
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of my favorite hotels. Their service and quality makes me hold everyone else to these standards. This was the first time that we stayed in one of their suites. It was very roomy. The fold-out sofa was comfy and the perfect size for my child. The pool was fun. There were lots of people, but it didn't feel overly crowded. The poolside bar had a nice selection. Teddy's Cafe provided us with decadent treats throughout our stay. Thanks to The Roosevelt, we had a wonderful weekend away.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place To Stay!!!!”
Reviews.Author: JaniceKo
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here several times and have never been dissappointed. The rooms are very large and spacious. They are very clean and beds are very comfy!!!! The food is great! The staff is second to none! Great valet service!!!! In a wonderful location!!! We even had a ghostly encounter! We saw what appeared to be a lady outside of our room walking a standard poodle. She seemed to be dressed in 1940ish clothing. At first we thought it was an actress working on a movie. She them smiled at us and walked thru the wall and disappeared.
