It was kind of freaky only we are used to such encounters at New Orleans Hotels. She just added to the joy of our stay!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wonderful people, great food!”
Reviews.Author: Live_in_STT
Reviews.Content: This was not our first trip to New Orleans, but it was our first stay at the Roosevelt ... I hope it will not be our last! The hotel - from the lobby to our large, comfortable rooms - is beautiful. Everyone at the hotel is very friendly and helpful, and the restaurants and bar are fabulous. We had a great time at the pool bar, too. The Roosevelt is in a good location, just a short walk from the French Quarter, just off Canal. We had a great family vacation over Mother's Day weekend. We did not use the spa facilties, but did enjoy the fitness center.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful”
Reviews.Author: odratis
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is a beautiful and charming in many ways; we enjoyed our stay. Valet team is swift and very helpful. The room is nice, clean, and quiet; comfy beds with crisp, clean linens. Clean bathrooms and fantastic toiletries, so I didn't find the need to purchase additional toiletries. The pool and pool area (open 'til 10pm) is clean -- towels are available at the pool entrance. All the staff we encountered were welcoming, attentive, and quite helpful. The fitness center looked clean, although didn't actually get to use any of the equipment. Each morning, in front of the Sazerac, there's a ref/cooler with water and some fruits to welcome back guests from their morning runs. Internet is not free in-room, but there is internet access in the lobby and at the cafe. Little detail such as the chocolate squares + next day forecast was nice to have. We found the location to be perfect -- it's a short walk to boubon street, and convenient to streetcar stops. If I were to nit pick: - shower head water flow was too gentle -- it was literally like a sparse, constant rain flow - double queen deluxe room was a little snug with all the furniture and two beds; bathroom is also small - parking is pricey at $40 valet -- and guest have to load and unload right on baronne street (although we didn't have any problem) - the foreground view from our room wasn't very pretty - there were two small complimentary bottled water in the room, but was not replenished -- not sure if it is supposed to be or not; however, there's a walgreens and cvs nearby Additional: Sazerac - we had breakfast at, and the fresh melon juice and the creole crab cake benedict stood out Teddy's Cafe - my children adored all the sweets in this cafe -- the ones we tried were decadent but not overly sweet. Chicken wrap was also good. Overall, we enjoyed our stay here, and if we are ever in NOLA again, we will definitely look into staying at the Roosevelt again.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jc_scrappy
Reviews.Content: This is one of my favorite spots! I have stayed at this hotel several times for business in NOLA. It is such a classy place. I love the decor, the food, the bar, and the pool. The rooms are wonderful and the beds are very comfortable. The area feels very safe and the concierge is so helpful. He has worked there for a while and offers great recommendations on food and places to see. ANytime I am in NOLA, I try to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: BEACHTRAVELER648
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Roosevelt hotel to celebrate my 51st birthday, it was 5 star form check-in to check-out we booked a king room although on the small size the decor,linen.bed and overall room made up for it. The bed was super comfortable the bathroom was great and had a flat screen tv, the service was great. We tried the bar in the lobby, great martinis we tried the pizza at the restaurant in the lobby excellent. We will always stay at the Roosevelt when we return, we use to be very frequent travelers to New Orleans before moving to the west coast and we have stayed at several 4-5 star hotels in New Orleans, this one by far has been the best. The hotel is located within a very easy walk to Bourbon street and the Casino.GO ENJOY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “World Class!”
Reviews.Author: Seth D
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just returned home to Chicago from what was one of the most wonderful and luxurious weekends of our life. We are experienced travelers (both business and personal travel) and our recent stay at the Roosevelt was worthy of commendation. The beautiful city of New Orleans played a role in making our anniversary trip special, and it was the Roosevelt and its staff that truly put things over the top! From the moment we arrived, we were greeted at the front desk by a charming young woman whose smile and enthusiasm were contagious. She immediately set a positive and joyous tone for our visit; her positivity continued throughout the weekend and was mirrored by each and every staff member who we encountered at the Roosevelt. We checked-in around 11:00 AM on Friday June 1, 2012, and suspected that our early arrival, combined with the very reasonable internet rate we pre-paid for our room, would result in leaving our bags with the Bell Desk for several hours until a more traditional check-in time. Instead, when the receptionist learned that we were celebrating the 5th anniversary of our wedding, she not only accommodated our early check-in request, but graciously upgraded our room category. From the luxurious 4 headed shower in our room, to the gorgeous pool, to the world-class mixologists at the Sazarac bar, to the prompt room service, to the skilled and non-intrusive housekeepers, the Roosevelt was magnificent in every way. It far exceeded my expectations. I cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: Amanda N
Reviews.Content: I did a lot of research before our trip to New Orleans and wanted to stay in THE BEST luxury hotel there. I chose the Roosevelt because of the great reviews and Waldorf name. I was very happy with the hotel. We received a free upgrade upon checkin and our suite was ENORMOUS. We had a living room, powder room, dining room, bedroom and huge bathroom. My ONLY complaint was the location. If you want to walk right out into the Quarter this hotel is a bit off the beaten path. Next time I will choose a hotel where I can walk right out and be at the bars and restaurants. That being said. the Roosevelt was very quiet and far enough away from the hussle and bussle that it made for a relaxing stay if that's what you're after. I just didn't like the long walk into the quarter, it made me feel like once I was out I had to stay out. And I didn't want to walk that far home late at night.

Reviews.Title: “Too bad. A luxury hotel with Motel class managment”
Reviews.Author: skimny
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed the hotel 4 nights for a wedding and mini vacation. Too Bad. The hotel is a luxury and the classic old world charmer as I expected from Waldorf Astoria but management and staff was a Motel class. The staffs was not professional and did not know how to handle emergency. I travel a lot for business and leisure. Compare to world and US 4-5 star hotels I have been, the management and staffs did not meet my expectation, except Concierge service which was good. Staffs were not professional nor graceful. Also lack of how to handle emergency. We were taking nap after we came back from a wedding party. The Fire alarm went on 6pm followed the by the announcement â€œ the fire alarm is activated. please evacuate immediatelyâ€¦ do not use the elevatorsâ€�. It was on for good 2-3min. we were totally panicked and scared, we got dressed and got thing out from the safe. Our room was on the 4th floor where the pool is. Guests from pool were evacuating in their bathing suit with young kids, no shoes, kids were cryingâ€¦ it was total caosâ€¦ About 40 guests evacuated though the staircase, we met few cleaning stuffs on the way down, who were just standing and sliming at us. They did not say anything to us. We got down to the lobby, there was no evacuation. No staff was guiding us. We got to the concierge who was making restaurant reservation for a guest, we did not know what was going on. Some of us ran to front desk the front desk staff said it a false alarm. One of the guest asked to the front desk staff â€œ how could your even did not announce it was a false alarmâ€¦ the stuff said to himâ€� Chill out man, it is just a false alarmâ€�. The way he responded us would never ever happen in any other 5 star hotel in the world. We were so upset how the staffs handled the situation. No staffs seem to know it happened nor no one cared. The next day, We had problem with the safety box. It was not working, we could not get our wallet to go out. First they said it must be the battery, sent a security. It was not the battery. Then they sent electrician then an engineerâ€¦ they were working on it hours. I was waiting on the bed-wasting my vacation time. After a while, I realized it was quite. I looked out they all just left without telling me. The Safe was working. It was to late to go out before dinner so I went out to the pool. When I came back from the pool I had a phone massage that I have a massage on front desk. I went down, the staff said, the electrician or engineer need to get back to your room to work on the safe, when can I schedule itâ€¦. We were so confused. It was already fixed hours ago! Best of all, the fire alarm went on again while I was taking shower the day we check out. Once again they did not announced that it was a false alarm, we had to call front desk to find out. What a vacation! I was so relieved when I checked out. The Lobby was Grande and classic beauty. The room and bathroom was very clean. The big dark furniture and beautiful dark carpet gives Grande scale old world charm. 4 head showers in the bathroom. The pool is small side but clean. Teddyâ€™s cafÃ© is pure luxury-very spacey and beautifully decorated which is great for Breakfast and quick bite. Domenica is a stylish, vibrant atmosphere wore like a New York style Italian casual dining.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: titanman24
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. It's beautiful and has large well furnished rooms. Also spent some time in the spa and it was great.

Reviews.Title: “My new choice in NOLA.”
Reviews.Author: heatherinPhilly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent four nights at the Roosevelt. It is a wonderful hotel. I am a Hilton Diamond, and a few days before arrival was contacted by my personal concierge August. August was extremely helpful during the visit, getting us dinner reservations during a very busy evening as well as recommending and booking us on a riverboat cruise. Also as a Diamond, I had booked a King Superior room on points, and was upgraded to a wonderful, huge, Waldorf Suite. Beds were very comfortable, room was very quiet. The room also had a refrigerator in addition to the minibar. We did have an issue with our in room safe, but it was corrected very quickly. It took quite a while to get hot water in the shower, and every morning the shower leaked into the bathroom floor (we couldn't figure out where it was coming from). Nothing an extra towel on the floor couldn't fix. If there is one thing that is a bit off about this hotel, it is the housekeeping. Very inconsistent. Sometimes we got turn down service, sometimes not. Sometimes they left ice, sometimes not. On our last night we came back to ice, but no glasses in the room at all (when we arrived we had 6 glasses). There was also some debris on the carpet outside of our room when we checked in, and when we checked out 5 days later it was still there. Clearly no one had vacuumed the hall in 5 days. All in all, nothing that would prevent me from returning to the Roosevelt. It is a marvelous, beautiful gem in New Orleans. Just a few minor tweaks and it would be 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Only if you are prepare to pay for the extras..”
Reviews.Author: ThorTheHague-Paris
Reviews.Content: If you are used to 5 stars hotels and above, wou will feel home at the Roosevelt..however, I personally prefer the more moderns ones with lower prices (271$ incl. taxes conference rate..); anything you want such as wifi, breakfast, printer (for your boarding pass) has to be paid extra. The service was friendly and good, quality of the cafes and restaurants was also good. Location is very good, special mention for the pool which is a must. In conclusion, nice stay, but if I am coming back with family I will certainly try one of the numerous hotels in the area such as the Westin, or W, etc.. New orleans is a lovely city, pay attention when you go to the riverwalk mall tax free refund locket (for tourists coming from Europe..), the charming lady there squeezed me 10$ with a smile..I was too stupd to ask for a receipt (French and women..) A taxi cost 33$ from the airport to the city :-)

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Experiences”
Reviews.Author: Victoria B
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is our favorite hotel in New Orleans. In the past couple of years, we have probably stayed here over ten times. The lobby, Sazerac bar, Teddy's cafe are all beautifully decorated and provide a warm atmosphere. The past two years we have spent the Christmas holidays at the Roosevelt, it is certainly a sight to see, stunning. Each and every time, the staff has been very accommodating and has gone out of their way to ensure that our stay is just perfect. We will certainly be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: reiddg
Reviews.Content: I had the good fortune to stay at the Roosevelt Hotel, which was also the host hotel for my conference. Since it was New Orleans, I of course brought my wife along.because we both love the food and ambiance of the city. I had read the articles on the Roosevelt and its restoration so I was hopeful that it would be a decent place to stay. I wasn't disappointed. The hotel has an old world charm that is recognizable as soon as you step out of the cab. The interior is very opulent and tasteful without being gaudy. The service staff was very friendly and check-in was effortless. We made it up to the room and Josh the bellman was not far behind with our bags. He gave us a nice tour of our room, got our ice and told us to have a great stay in NOLA. The room was very well appointed with a king bed. The bathroom was very nice, but there was no tub, which wasn't a problem for me but my wife commented on it although it wasn't an inconvenience for her. The door to the bathroom closed automatically, which was rather annoying so we had to prop it open. Really though, you should be able to tell that this is a pretty nice place since my only negatives were the tub and the bathroom door. There are so many wonderful places to eat in NOLA that we only had one meal in the hotel, which was on the day we arrived. Domenica, a Chef John Besh eatery, is a pizzeria with pasta and other specialties. We each had a pizza and it was very enjoyable. One evening during our stay, we had a nightcap in the famous Sazerac bar. I wanted to try the namesake drink. It was nice to try such a famous concoction, but I'm not really a whiskey person. I didn't use it but my wife tried the pool and loved it as well as the pool bar. The conference facilities were very nice as well and the hotel did a great job of managing it, including the food. There was no convention chicken, thankfully, but everything was very well done. We had a black tie awards dinner on the last evening and the hotel really knocked themselves out. The food and service staff did a phenomenal job. I can't speak to the price of the rooms. We paid a conference rate of $239 and I didn't look up what the rate would be normally. For what I paid, the accommodations, service, ambiance was more than I could expect. The Roosevelt is on the dividing line between NOLA and the French Quarter, Canal St. It was about a two block walk to Bourbon St. About 15 minutes to walk to the river and Jax Brewery so it wasn't far from everything of interest, including many of NOLA's best restaurants. I would highly recommend try the Roosevelt.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel puts itself over guests”
Reviews.Author: brewsterstravels
Reviews.Content: Beautifully decorated but that's where it ends. Elegant hotel in a urine-soaked neighborhood thinks it's better than it's own guests. It says it has 24-hour room service but you can't even get a danish with your coffee before 6am. We have an early departure due to flight. And they charge $15/day for WIFI when at every other hotel we've been to in New Orleans gave us FREE WIFI (no surprise fees!)...I'm getting a great deal of satisfaction using their WIFI to leave them this review right now!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Nicely redone.”
Reviews.Author: elroy74
Reviews.Content: Took a recent trip with my wife to New Orleans. I was also taking part in a condense that was happening at the hotel. Have to say that the location was great,the hotel was very nice, and the staff was very responsive and helpful. The only thing maybe turning me off was the cost. Was a little steep, but you get what you pay for. The location across Canal from the French Quarter was just right. Quick walk to everything, without the stale beer smell. The poolside bar was very nice, and room service was pretty good as well. They do normally charge for Internet access, which still boggles my mind in this day and age.

Reviews.Title: “Hitting its Stride”
Reviews.Author: ATLcruiser
Reviews.Content: I think this wasmy 8th or 9th time staying at the Roosevelt since it opened. I had a run of about four stays right after they opened, and there was lots of room for improvement. They finally seem to have hit their stride in becoming the grand hotel I always hoped they would become. Check in was a little slow, as they seemed to be a bit overwhelmed with a large conference. I arrived just before 5 PM, and it took her a few minutes to find me a room that was ready. The staff was very friendly, if not a little green. She at first welcomed me back and later asked if this was my first time at the hotel. When I got to my floor, there were quite a few housekeepers in the halls still cleaning rooms. I was assigned a room not far from the elevator, which is opposite of my requested room type, but the superior room was so large, I never heard the elevator bells ring. This was the first time I reserved a superior, and it was well worth it. It is really like a mini suite. It has a full marble foyer, a walk-in closet, three large windows, a long main room with pull-out sofa and chair, and a dressing table outside the bath. The bath is the same as most other deluxe rooms. The room overall is quite a change from the rather snug deluxe rooms. The TV was so far from the bed I was a little concerned that I might disturb my neighbors with the volume, but the room was as quiet as ever. I took a picture of the room, but it really does look exactly like on the website. I noticed this time there was a little refrigerator set out in the lobby in the morning with chilled towels and bottled water for joggers. I'm not sure if I noticed that before. The concierge was extremely gracious in printing my boarding pass. I'm not sure about the complaints about the air conditioning. It reached a record high of 92 while I was in New Orleans, and my room stayed at a comfortable 66 the entire time. If you put the fan on high, it does time out after a while, but the rest of the system does continue to work. My only suggestion this time, other than my usual of no coffee maker in the room, is that the walk-in closet could have used a light. It was a little dark with only the foyer light to see by. I can't wait to visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, good location. But $15 for slow wireless service?”
Reviews.Author: vidiverbill
Reviews.Content: Everything was very good. The staff was excellent. But charging $15 for internet access that was slow is just annoying for the price that is charged for the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, Besh restaurant on property, yummm...”
Reviews.Author: Crunchberry327
Reviews.Content: Basically across the street from Bourbon Street yet quiet at night. John Besh (Celebrity Chef - beat Mario Batelli in Iron Chef, almost won against Symon in the Next Iron Chef) has Demonica? there. We at pizza at happy hour - holy cow was it good. Highly recommend. Everything else at this hotel is what you would expect from a Waldorf Astoria brand. Our room was too warm though, they came and changed the settings but we think the thermostat was off since it was still too warm the next night. Otherwise would of rated sleeping higher.

Reviews.Title: “Not enough stars to properly rate”
Reviews.Author: golfnfool
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a King Bedroom suite for a conference in March. Rooms, service, food, location...everything is outstanding! No complaints or anything lacking.

Reviews.Title: “Great time in Nola!!”
Reviews.Author: mer0406
Reviews.Content: My husband and I celebrated our 35th wedding anniversary at the Roosevelt. It was wonderful. The hotel was beautiful and the room was clean and comfortable!! It's convenient to the French quarter and taxis are easily accessible but definitely within walking distance. We had breakfast in the sazerac restaurant and it was very good. The staff was friendly and helpful. Will definitely return. Great experience!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Flyhigh8
Reviews.Content: This hotel is as beautiful as it is comfortable. The location is great - everything you want to see in New Orleans is within walking distance. The employees are kind and attentive, and the valet team was especially on point. We stayed in a suite on the top floor and it was amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but pricey”
Reviews.Author: CheapEnglishman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a classic elegant hotel from the past. Unfortunately with that comes smaller rooms. The staff were very helpful, checkin was efficient and very friendly. The rooms were nicely appointed, but not very large. The bathroom was small but in good condition with only a shower. The shower had two shower heads, as well as two wall side jets, so it was a very good shower. The room had a large flat screen TV, a fully stocked mini bar, a work area and chair. It was a small room and although it was quality furnishings it did feel cramped. You are paying a premium for a hotel in Hiltons Waldorf Collection, however having stayed at four different hotels in New Orleans, this was my least favorite, not because itâ€™s a bad hotel, just that NOLA has lots of very good hotels. It is a high end hotel, but other hotels had nicer rooms. For example if you paid the equivalent price at the Mason Du Pupuy (my personal favorite) you would have a balcony deluxe and actually be in the French Quarter.

Reviews.Title: “Almost 5-star”
Reviews.Author: WOScott
Reviews.Content: Several of us spent a long weekend here for a bachelor party (classy place for such an event, and no doubt we were not the target demographic). We definitely appreciated the historical/classical atmosphere. The hotel is really in a great spot for going out at nightâ€”just a 2-block walk to Bourbon Street, yet those 2 blocks give you a nice buffer from the late-night noise. We were able to check-in by about 3 or 4pm (although I did overhear a guy complaining that he had been waiting for his room for a while), and were also able to get a later checkout. We had limited contact with the bellmen, concierge, etc., but they were all there if needed. The lobby is extremely well-apportioned and well-staffed. The Sazerac Bar was a great place for a drink (but only one drink at the prices they charge). The bartenders really put a lot of effort into the cocktails. We didnâ€™t eat at any of the restaurants, but they looked very nice (with prices to matchâ€”I think there was a fancy Motherâ€™s Day brunch for $80/person, plus gratuity). The pool was delightful. Although a bit small, it was never over-crowded. The service was impeccable there if you wanted anything to eat or drink (we didnâ€™t). Nice outdoor pool bar and hot tub. The one complaint about this area is the settingâ€”the pool is on top of only the fourth floor, and there are quite a few dilapidated buildings that surround the pool. Nothing the hotel can really do about that, but still, not exactly a pleasant sight to look out on (and this goes for most of the views from the rooms, as well). The fairly spacious rooms were very luxurious: comfortable beds, big-screen TV, plus another TV in the bathroom, robes, chocolates on the pillow, high ceilings, etc. Some contributors commented that housekeeping was spotty; this was not our experience, as each afternoon the room was cleaned properly, and when we returned at night, turn-down service had been performed. Street noise was minimal, and noise from other rooms was non-existent. A few relatively minor nits: First, the in-room refrigerator was mini-bar only, and it was electronically monitored such that if you touched anything you got charged. In other words, you couldnâ€™t use the fridge for your personal use. I really find that obnoxious. The drain in the shower always got backed up. Likely a function of old piping, but still, not pleasant. The air conditioning had a lowest setting of 65F. However, despite putting it on the lowest setting, I donâ€™t think it ever got that cold. We were never uncomfortably warm, but if you like it really cool/cold, you might have an issue. One of our rooms was missing an ipod player/alarm clock, and as I said earlier, most of the views are of building walls. We noticed that guestsâ€™ discarded room service remains sat in the hallways for hours or even a couple days. Finally, if you werenâ€™t HiltonHonors Gold or better, you have to pay for wireless access. All in all, we had a fantastic stay and I would recommend it to anyone. I came very close to giving the hotel 5 stars, but there were enough minor complaints, coupled with a pretty high standard room rate (we were able to get a discounted rate), that kept me from doing so.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Spot in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: ase1707
Reviews.Content: This is a very fine hotel that my wife and I enjoyed for five days. Our room was very comfortable and the hotel made us feel right at home. I attended a conference during my stay and everything from the restaurant and bar to the facilities was clearly first rate. At the end of my conference, my wife joined me and we stayed nearby at the Four Seasons which is also very nice but not as good as the Roosevelt. When I return to New Orleans I will only stay at the Roosevelt Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice property”
Reviews.Author: Kegan36604
Reviews.Content: I left here with some mixed feelings. On one level, the place was wonderful in its decor and service level overall. On the other hand, I was expecting a bit more based on its reputation, cost, etc. At one point I had a small service issue with the room. One that should have never occured in the first place, but hey, these things happen. The desk clerk was sort of like "oh well". Brought to the attn of a manager it was corrected quickly (and they seemed a little perturbed at the clerk's attitude).

Reviews.Title: “Historic gem with big city elegance.”
Reviews.Author: cruisinkim
Reviews.Content: We were in town for 4 Nights for a company sponsored event. The hotel is quite lavish when first entering into the lobby. Check in was smooth, bags wisked away by the bellman, and our room was even ready early when we arrived @ 1pm. It was just a block from Bourbon, which was convenient for walking around the French Quarter. It was centrally located, for walks down Canal, and even to the Riverwalk area. There were two trolleys within close walking distance. The Concierge was very helpful for lunch and dinner recommendations, even taking care of our large group reservations. It was by no means a quiet location, loud sirens, construction and thin walls made it impossible to sleep in past 7-8am. The rooms were small, but well appointed. The A/C had problems keeping the room cool overnight. Overall, the hotel had nice amenities including a spa, coffee bar, restaurants and a gift shop, but be prepared to spend some money on the extras. One of my favorite spots was the Domieca restaurant for happy hour. A great spot to spend the afternoon for pizza and wine. The only true issue we had with the property was the service in the restaurant for breakfast. The service was inexcusable considering the cost, but the food was fantatic. We enjoyed the rooftop pool, small but adequate for the days we just wanted to relax in the sun. Overall, we had a wonderful stay at this hotel. If center city accessibility with some old charm is what you are looking for, this is the spot.

Reviews.Title: “Historic, Elegant, 4.6”
Reviews.Author: PhillyFoodieVA
Reviews.Content: One block away from Bourbon, felt like miles from the craziness, but just a few steps away when you are ready to turn the corner and get lost in the madness. Old, authentic, lavish, deep tone colors, stone/marble throughout the lobby that extended the width of a city block that it occupied. The king suite, just a one step up from the standard room, was amazingly quiet, elegantly appointed, 12 ft ceilings, 2 zone climate control, with a bathroom large enough for a small gathering. Two refrigerators, one stocked, and the other for personal use. While the pool size is modest, the contemporary pool area was very well appointed and heightened in the evening by its lighting scheme. We did not dine at the restaurants unfortunately. Cons: The fitness center is FAR too small. The onsite bakery cafe could not produce a decent espresso.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel, great spa!”
Reviews.Author: alex198468
Reviews.Content: Overall, this place is very nice and has a great location. The lobby decor is quite opulent and well maintained. It is so pretty! The staff was polite and helpful. The rooms are nicely decorated and very clean! I would recommend this hotel for anyone wanting a luxurious stay in New Orleans. However, there are two downfalls. First, the room was so noisy! You could hear everything people said and did when people walked down the hallway. Second, the lighting is not so great in the room. The bathroom light was so dim, you can't see in the mirror or in the back area where the tub/shower are. This was not only inconvenient; but also, potentially dangerous for older guests. The spa was wonderful beyond amazing! One of the best! You cannot miss it!

Reviews.Title: “Great pool and excellent location from the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: Abernathy5
Reviews.Content: Nice rooftop pool and the service (front desk, servers, housekeeping) was outstanding. The room I got (1 Queen bed) was a bit smaller than I'm used to but the TV in the bathroom was an interesting amenity. I'm a walker so I walked to the French Quarter in about 7-10 minutes of from the Business District which is where this hotel basically is. Call ahead to see if there's a conference going on when you're also there. Only meaning that the place will be pretty packed and waiting for the elevators will take a while. The views are just okay but I didn't pick the place because I wanted nice views. I usually stay in the French Quarter but this was a nice change of pace.

Reviews.Title: “elegant and sophisticated and quiet!”
Reviews.Author: tizbiz
Reviews.Content: I was very thorned by choosing the Roosevelt versus a hotel in the heart of the French Quarter. I wanted to experience New Orleans at its full! Reading other reviews I have finally choosen this hotel because in the end I wanted to be able to sleep after an intense day and night in the city. Good decision!! It was the best choice I could have done.. I walked to everything and back to the majestic Roosevelt, full of charme (as other beautiful hotel in the heart of the French Quarter) but.. asolutely quiet!! It was the week of Mardi Gras, very busy to say the least.. Breakfast was very good, service very good too. We booked a suite, comfortable, luxurious and full of charme. The view was not a great one to be honest (not their fault but I have to say our room was overlooking the roof of an abandoned and damaged building) but other than that, nothing to complain. Great choice.

Reviews.Title: “We are moving you”
Reviews.Author: Carrie L
Reviews.Content: Booked a 5 night package through Expedia 9 months ago to go to the Jazz Festival (celebrating my big 40th birthday) leaving for New Orleans on 4/27/12. The package was paid in full 9 months ago. 5 hours prior to my flight departure, I was notified via email that the Roosevelt had moved my husband and I to the Hilton. I spent 2 hours talking to Expedia and the Roosevelt. One of the mangers at the Roosevelt, Mark, told me that there was "an electrical issue at the hotel" then proceeded to tell me that they had simply overbooked. Mark assured me that my stay at the Hilton would only be for the weekend (Sat and Sun) and that I would be moved back to the Roosevelt on Mon, 4/30. Those were the facts. Following are my observations: 1) If I can't secure a room 9 months in advance (paid in full, although through a 3rd party) how much further in advance would I have to pay to secure a room at a Waldorf Astoria hotel? 2) Why would a customer who intend on staying at a Waldorf Astoria hotel want to be moved from one hotel to another in the middle of a vacation? 3) The Hilton, although not a motor inn, has an inferior star rating compared to the Roosevelt. 4) Why should ANY customer be subjected to this kind of undue distress on her 40th birthday, and at the beginning of a holiday, no less? The reason for why we were bumped is obvious. Frankly, my list of complaints can go on but you get the picture. After 2 hours of being transferred, Expedia did the right thing. Can't say that about the Roosevelt. Thank you Trip Advisor for allowing me to opportunity to share my experience.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite New Orleans Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Henry B
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a 4 night stay at the Roosevelt and had a great time, I would definitely recommend this hotel (with some reservation if you're planning to stay during the first week of Jazz Fest as I mention below). Most of the previous reviews cover the basics (both the good and the bad), so I'll just list a couple of strengths and weaknesses of the property that I noticed: Strengths 1) The hotel is beautifully decorated; 2) Location - it is just across the street from the French Quarter, close enough to get there quickly but away from the madness; 3) My room was very quiet and the beds were comfortable; and 4) The outdoor pool on the fourth floor is very relaxing and a nice place to spend the middle of the day when the temperature starts to get up there. (The Ritz does not have a pool) Weaknesses 1) I was staying during the first week of Jazz Fest. Apparently, each year Zurich (insurance company) holds its yearly corporate retreat at the Roosevelt. They literally take over the hotel and if you don't have a Zurich tag you're treated a little bit like a second class citizen. Last year I stayed at the Roosevelt for the second week of Jazz Fest and the service was great. 2) As stated in other reviews the air conditioning doesn't work too well. The rooms have very high ceilings and it's an old building so I don't know if there is much management can do about this. 3) The housekeeping service is not great. A couple of times we did not receive new towels and the turndown service didn't do much (not a big deal to me but it may be to others). I'm planning on heading to Jazz Fest next year and staying at the Waldorf. I've had a great time at the hotel and recommend it to my friends. I just hope the Jazz Fest line-up is better during the second week....

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in Hilton chain”
Reviews.Author: Cgrubb
Reviews.Content: We stay in a lot of Hilton properties, and the Roosevelt is our very favorite. This hotel was devastated by Hurricane Katrina but has been restored to the splendor it displayedm50 years ago (to my personal knowledge). Excellent location for both business and leisure traveler, less than a block from thenFrench Quarter and an easy walk to the Mississippi River. The hotel's furnishings are particularly pleasing. Lots of history at the hotel; it was Huey Long's New Orleans home during his career as governor and US senator.

Reviews.Title: “A must in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: W55Louisiana
Reviews.Content: Absolutely amazing experience. Beautiful hotel lobby, superb restaurant, quaint sweets bar, and gorgeous room. Beds and pillows were comfortable. Wish our stay here was longer.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel - proper five star service”
Reviews.Author: duccessoftravel
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel during our recent visit to New Orleans. We had a King Suite and it was beautiful. We arrived about 4 in the afternoon and had no wait at all and got right into our room. The room was well equiped and the high ceilings were beautiful. We called for wine glasses and an opener and it was delivered by a proper waiter on a silver platter. Very nice. We asked for turndown service. They inquired of our evening plans and when we returned to our room the bed was turned down and chocolates were left for us. Room service was prompt but as you can imagine, quite spendy. We dined poolside as well and that was the most disappointing part of our visit. The pool was beautiful and well maintained. Service poolside was spotty - sometimes good and other times very slow. However, the food poolside was not worth the money spent. It took about 45 minutes to get a salad and potatoe wedges and then when they came the salad was small, mostly iceberg lettuce and did not have the dressing I requested (bleu cheese). I was then informed that they didn't have that dressing at the pool so they mixed bleu cheese crumbles with their creamy cucumber dressing. It was not the same and I probably would have gotten something different had they informed me of that sooner. For the money I paid it was rather disappointing. The most delightful surprise was Domenica, the Itailan Bistro in the lobby of the hotel. Their gourmet pizzas are out of this world and the prices are only $13 each. If you catch them at happy hour from 3-6 the pizzas are 1/2 price. This little New Orleans gem also has aged cheeses and meats so if you are looking for a nice evening snack try this place out. Fantastic. We returned twice during our trip and my mouth is still watering. We are diamond Hilton members so we stayed on points. However, I would definitely pay to stay at this hotel again. It is beautiful and the service was spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kathy F
Reviews.Content: We loved the Roosevelt Hotel. The staff was wonderful and the pool area was just beautiful. We can't wait to return

Reviews.Title: “Suspect Management?”
Reviews.Author: REEF_Surfer_8
Reviews.Content: This is a bit lengthy but hopefully useful if you are considering spending $300+/night on this property. My wife and I arrived at 3:30pm on a Saturday afternoon to a lobby which was strewn with luggage and long lines. The problem: according to a hotel employee, the hotel's computer system had been down for 18 hours, and so the staff (who was working very hard) didn't know who had checked out, which rooms were occupied or which rooms had been cleaned. Everything was being done by hand. It took two and a half hours for us to get assigned a room (we were told that it would be 40 minutes by the front desk....). Ironically, the staff took my cell phone number in order to tell us when our room was ready, but because ATT had between zero and 1/2 bars in the lobby, and I didn't have a lot of confidence in the process, I decided to stand in 20-minute-long lines multiple times to check on our status. We eventually got a room, but we are still awaiting a call telling us that our room is ready. We felt really bad for the two wedding parties who had booked this venue for their wedding receptions because they had undoubtedly paid dearly and expected a more dignified setting. Hopefully, their honeymoon was at a place with better management. OK, so why am I railing against management? First, there is no excuse for a computer system being down for 18 hours. Second, another hotel employee stated that this was the third time this network problem had occurred at this property. I don't know if that's true, but if so, some changes in upper management are needed. Why 3 stars? On the positive side: it's a beautiful property drenched in history. The staff we interacted with were empathetic and tried to assuage our discomfort. Our room was well appointed and roomy (for a historic property). Also, they've got a great gift shop. Yes, it's a little pricey, but we found some real treasures. Well, there was also a spurious charge on our docket, but the front desk quickly squashed that. And I wish they had coffee makers in the rooms. In summary, there were so many positives about this Waldorf-Astoria property that it is unconscionable that management would ignore the information system.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: victormar21
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stay there for three nights before traveling to Baton Rouge. Check in was fast bell man help with ideas of what to see and direction to locations. Had one small problem with room not being clean after long day in the French Quarter. Call front desk and within a fews minutes room was clean and ready for us. Restaurant in the hotel are great for quick breakfast or dinner. Serivce was a little slow but good.

Reviews.Title: “Old style elegance and class”
Reviews.Author: baldguyut
Reviews.Content: Beautifully restored hotel, an experience just to walk through it. Coffee shop/snack bar is great and very convenient. Staff helpful and courteous, room large and decorated beautifully. My wife had a great experience at the spa. The outdoor pool is small and the exercise room is OK. Great location half block from Canal St. Attended a conference and meeting rooms were freezing, even after two days of conference staff asking that temperature be raised so take a jacket or sweater of attending a conference. Bathroom small, but elegant.

Reviews.Title: “Style, comfort, and service”
Reviews.Author: mtnview9
Reviews.Content: Location is everything in NOLA, and the Roosevelt has it. Yes, its neighbors are drugstores and a chintzy gift shop, but what counts is that the hotel is only a few minutes walk from the French Quarter, the St Charles streetcar, and the riverfront. You're spared all the smells and late night noise of Bourbon Street. Waldorf Astoria deserves an award for the reconstruction of this historic pile. It manages to feel opulent, vintage-y and fresh all at the same time. Our room was spacious and well-equipped. Staff were unfailingly helpful and personally engaging. The only deficiency was housekeeping, where they need to step up their game. Towels left on the floor were still there the next day. Drippy dirt on the mirrors was there when we arrived and there when we left. Table surfaces never met any cleaning fluids. The room wasn't unpleasantly dirty. It just was pretty far from meticulous. Not even close to four or five star housekeeping. Putting that aside, we were delighted. The hotel was a highlight of a week-long trip in the South.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Historic Hotel, lack a bit in service”
Reviews.Author: KEEPTAHOEBLUE_NICE
Reviews.Content: I love the beauty of this place. My room was huge, with a nice sitting area and large tv. The beds are wonderful. The bathroom is a bit small but with great attention to detail. The lobby is striking. The cafe is pretty tasty. Chef John Besh's Domenica is delicious. The famous Sazerac Bar is nice. My only frustration with the whole place is impersonal service from bell men, front door greeters, and front desk staff. No one seemed glad you were there. Not like the wonderful hospitality of the Ritz NOLA. The Christmas decorations at the Roosevelt are a must see.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: jdms33
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Roosevelt for 4 nights and had a wonderful time. Was not sure what to expect after reading some of the reviews but the property is beautiful and the staff is very friendly and service oriented. From the moment we arrived at 11:30am we were not only lucky enough to be able to get to our room but were also asked if we have a preference for a floor. When we left, I also requested a later checkout and was accomodated without an issue - the service was as good if not better than any Four Seasons property where I have stayed. The room, a delux king, was a little on the small side but it was more than perfect for our stay. It was clean and well appointed. We had a problem with the television the first night and someone was sent up within 30 minutes and had it working. The ONLY complaints we could have is that the bed, while very comfortable, did seem to get a bit warm at night. The pillows where overly soft for me but perfect for my wife. The food in the restaurants was wonderful. The location of the hotel was also perfect for us. Close enough to the FQ but also far enough away :)

Reviews.Title: “Best service, lovely stay”
Reviews.Author: thirachoo
Reviews.Content: We came down for French Quarter Fest. It was a bit of a last minute reservation but we got a reasonable room rate. I was a liitle concerned since reception had trouble getting us a room but they gave my son a doubloon. But, at every turn, I received an acknowledgement and any questions was answered or given to someone who had the answer, from "Where's the ice?" to "What's the best way to the Fest?" If is beautifully decorated with new modern fixtures but preserving the beauty of this old hotel. As an aside, it used to be The Fairmont and previously the Roosevelt. But, what really won my family over was when my son got sick the AM we were set to depart. I had to go to the pharmacy to get him some medicine and I dropped by the front desk to mention that we might be a little late checking out. They said to take our time and feel free to stay until 2:30PM. One we left, they made sure he was feeling better and gave him more doubloons, which he loves. All in all, a great stay and an emphasis on service makes this number one in my book. Don't get me started on their signature restaurant, Domenica. Oh my god, we love that restaurant!!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant hotel, superior service”
Reviews.Author: Iluveskies
Reviews.Content: This is an older hotel that has been refurbished to its former elegant demeanor, The staff is outstanding, the hotel and rooms lovely, the food in the restaurants has been excellent, and it has a fairly good wine list to boot! Worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, wonderful service”
Reviews.Author: JNYCFQF
Reviews.Content: The hotel was absolutely beautiful, the concierge was fantastic (GW Fins was a great recommendation), and the hazelnut nutella blackberry waffles were TO DIE FOR!!! The 24 hour room service was great too. My only minor criticism is that there was a lot of street noise (car engines racing, etc) from my room in Tower 1. If noise is a problem for you, consider asking for a quieter room. Otherwise it was fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Glamorous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cakeshop
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is a beautiful old school style glamorous hotel. The lobby, bar, breakfast area are beautiful and very elegant. Our room was a tad on the small side as was the bathroom, but I really didn't mind especially for the wonderful price we got. I usually travel with the kids, but this stay was just with my husband so we didn't really need a lot of room. The location is a couple of blocks outside of the French Quarter which could be viewed as a positive or a negative. We enjoyed being a little outside of the French Quarter for the quietness factor (we went for food and definately drank but not really on Bourbon Street- it was a little dirty/gross for us). But the whole area surrounding the French Quarter isn't very nice at all. It was very reminscent of Downtown L.A. or Venice Beach (lots of homeless people loitering around, lots of interesting characters). With that being said, we didn't get harassed or asked for money or anything at all- it just surprised us because we were not expecting to be in a downtown sort of setting. We ate every morning in the Teddy Cafe in the hotel for coffee/tea and pastries and it was fairly priced and everything we ate was good. We ate in Domenica's for Happy Hour and had great pizza (the food is good and the happy hour prices are good so definately keep it in mind for a cheap meal). The walk into the quarter was very short, and with my husband we felt safe everytime even walking back around 11:00 at night. The hotel is close to the rail stops that can take you to the Garden District or Zoo area which makes renting a car a waste. I would definately stay at the Roosevelt again if I ever go back to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cablegram
Reviews.Content: This is a top quality hotel in the heart of the city. The entrance is awesome in its decor and the rooms are very comfortable and well equipped. I guess for the quality you would not expect coffee making facilities in the room but I really am used to having that freedom these days! The location is excellent for the night life of a very vibrant city as well as the Superdome not too far away. Some of the corridors were a little grubby which was surprising. I sell vacuum cleaners in the UK and perhaps they could use some. The staff in reception and the restaurant and bars however were all excellent and vey helpful. Thank you to Amanda from Honduras who was particularly helpful on reception

Reviews.Title: “Top Choice”
Reviews.Author: operaghost1333
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I went to New Orleans for the first time over Easter weekend. We stayed at the Roosevelt for 4 nights and overall I would say this hotel is 5 stars and worth the money. Key Good Points: 1) Within walking distance to everything 2)Very Clean and staff is friendly 3) 24 hour room service 4) has been renovated to be clean and up to date 5)the pool is beautiful, however the sun isn't over it after 4:30, but it is heated and is very nice. There is a bar, but it closes at 6. 6) They have a fantastic Concierge Negatives or things to know 1) Internet is $14.99 a day 2) Parking is $48 a DAY and this does include in and out, but you really don't want to drive anywhere 3) no coffee pot, and for a pot of coffee in room service (which it says is for 8-10 cups) it is $35, however we overcame this by my husband going down to Teddy's in the Lobby and buying two large coffees for $4 which were plenty big enough 4) You have very little control over the temperature in the room. We were on a lower floor and the room was still very warm. Overall, even with what I listed above, this was a fantastic hotel for the location and we enjoyed our stay. If we return to New Orleans we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel for all travels AND HHonors points!”
Reviews.Author: foxyfit4
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the property for work and enjoyed myself. Great for all categories of travelers. Hotel decor was regal and consistent with the Waldorf brand. The hotel rooftop pool is heated and resort-like with cabanas and a poolside bar. The only downfall is their limited room service menu but I guess more people dine out or at restaurant. Two thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “NOTHING SPECIAL”
Reviews.Author: dennis248
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week at the Roosevelt and it was ok. The room was small but pleasent. My big complaint was the service. The front desk is the worst. Asking for pillows 3 times (arrived at 11:00 p.m.), keeping us waiting 6 hours for our room (well past the 3:00 check in), and an overall attitude of "sorry I'm busy". I've stayed at the Ritz, if you're getting Ritz prices you should provide Ritz service.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Service”
Reviews.Author: Leftmid9
Reviews.Content: The staff was fantastic from top to bottom. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. We had one glitch with our room door and within minutes we had management and maintenance there to fix it. The turn down service was a great touch and the housekeeping were very accommodating to any request we had. Rooms were a little small but that was the only negative. Great rooftop pool and bar too.

Reviews.Title: “Old style elegance and first class service!”
Reviews.Author: jacqueet
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference in late January-early February, 2012. The property is lovely and elegant, the staff were efficient, friendly and helpful. I was uograded to a suite and was impressed with the space and amenities. Others at the conference said the same of their rooms, regardless of the location. The bar was not very busy but the selection and service excellent. The conference food was quite good for conference food. The bell staff were very helpful and when I had a problem with something in my room, the front desk staff dispatched maintenance immediately. I rated the sleep quality as only good becasue the windows were all painted shut and the AC would not cool the room sufficiently for me to sleep well. Nonetheless, I would definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “the best in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: burgermaster007
Reviews.Content: seriosuly,,,, if you can find a major fault with this top, top class hotel, then maybe you should give up traveling, it is in my opinion the best hotel in New Orleans ,it is perfectly located for everything in New Orlean, just across the road from the centre of the french quaters, within easy walking distance of just about everywere shopping,stadium,cruise terminal, mississippi, and so on , we stayed here for 4 nights and were given the nice suprise of one of the Astoria suite, there are only 6 of these suites in the hotel and our one was around 900 sq ft , the whole suite was immaculate but then you would not expect anything less from a hotel of this standard and class, and as thy are on a dedicated corridor very little foot traffic passing by your door, that said the beds so far away you would not hear anything anyway, massive big king size bed that you just do not want to get out of, the whole suite is excellently furnished with 3 t.vs including one in the bathroom, the room service as with everything was first class, included in the room are dressing gowns and slippers, a fully stocked mini bar and an empty one for your own use, iron and ironing board, wet bar, double size shower with overhead and wall jets, roll top free standing bath and double wash hand basins the bathroom is about 120 sq ft, as for the rest of the hotel and the services, absolutly top class, helpfull staff who look like they enjoy working, stazarac bar is a good meeting and drinking place if not a bit busy sometimes,in house resturant and italina resturant both very good foor and service, i find it really hard to say anything bad about this hotel and ok if anything it would have been nice to have a coffee machine in the room, but with a coffee shop on the ground floor it was not a problem to pop down and get a coffee or two, i dont know if the rooms have coffee machine or not but i guess they expect people using the suites to call for room service, our friend who stayed here for a few night with us had the Rooservelt suite and this is know as the big one, yes it is massive with a grand piano and dinning table and like ours you could not fault it, you will be amazed by the stunning decor of this whole hotel, the swimming pool is heatad with a hot tub at the side of it, pool side bar with food service, plenty of sun bathing chairs and room for you to find a little spot of your own somewere on the terrace,ok its known to rain quite heavy in New Orleans and your room will be supplied with one umberella, if you need another one all you have to do is ask and it will be supplied, if you want to treat some one to a special treat head for the rooservelt hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, Formal”
Reviews.Author: Psy1ocke
Reviews.Content: My co-workers and I stayed here for a few days and enjoyed every moment, from the rooms and bed (so elegant and comfortable!) to the food in the restaurants within the hotel. The fitness facility has a plethora of equipment (bikes, treadmills, ellipticals, small weight sets) and they provide complimentary water and fruit for hotel guests. The customer service is top notch and we felt like royalty when we stayed here!

Reviews.Title: “Everything I Thought Of Saying Was Taken”
Reviews.Author: NextStopIsWhere
Reviews.Content: Looks like all of the reviews below me think as highly as I do about the hotel. They have spoken for me! As for my two cents, we didn't stay at the hotel much, but when we were around, we had a pleasant, an EXCELLENT stay. Staff is awesome. Can walk to the French Quarter, or if you want, have a short cab ride to the French Quarter. Properties like this make me PROUD to work for Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: Luga1983
Reviews.Content: Beyond first class! Beautiful hotel with fabulously furnished rooms.Every aspect of this hotel was spotless. Extremely quiet rooms, the only outside noise heard was a faint cry from someones baby. The linens are top quality and the bed is most comfortable. The staff if gracious and well informed. I have stayed in many of the New Orleans hotels and this is by far the best.

Reviews.Title: “Classic Elegance”
Reviews.Author: Rosemary S
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed 5 nights at the Roosevelt. Absolutely loved this place - so beautiful and luxurious. The lobby is breathtaking with a long line of chandeliers. Our room was wonderful and the bed, oh those beds... I hated to get out of it in the morning. The bedding is unbelievable. Only negative is the small size of the room. Can be a bit tight with 2 people and suitcases but the good far outweighed the bad. The bathroom, which was also very small, had everything we needed and was so clean it sparkled. The pool area is great and we loved the pool bar - frozen drinks on a sunny day at the Roosevelt pool - life is good! Make sure you check out the Sazerac lounge - we stopped in each night for a "nightcap" and tried their Ramos Gin Fizzs along with the popular Sazerac drink too. We were able to have one meal at Domenico's off the lobby - another advantage of staying here was this restaurant - just yummy. All this and I didn't even mention how convenient the hotel is to the major attractions in New Orleans - most things are very easy to walk to. I feel like a very, very fortunate person to be able to have stayed here and hope I can return one day. If you're looking for a place in New Orleans where you can feel like royalty then please stay here.

Reviews.Title: “This Place is Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: WellTraveled282
Reviews.Content: They clearly went above and beyond on this hotel after Katrina. It is in spectacular shape. The rooms are small (indicative of hotels of the age) but are well appointed and not overly cramped. The bathrooms are, ironically, rather spacious. We had drinks in the hotel bar, the Sazerac, and it is a great space with pit groups as well as low tables and a classic bar with extremely attentive and professional bartenders. It's worth stopping by just to view the Ascot Cup Trophy (Cir 1878) that they have on display. It is the last trophy made from all sterling silver (1272 oz.) and it is valued at over $250,000. It is truly a work of art. Lastly, the location is right on Canal St one block over from the beginning of Bourbon St. You are close enough to walk to the French Quarter while being just far enough away to not be engulfed by the noise and traffic. Whether you are in town on business or for fun, this hotel is ideal.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Best”
Reviews.Author: travelmom71717
Reviews.Content: We were in awe of this hotel from the moment we stepped into the lobby. Beautiful and historical - it has a classic feel with little details left over from a bygone era. Even stepping into the elevators, it feels like an episode of Mad Men! I can't say enough about the rooms. Very spacious and well-equipped - The beds were top notch - so comfortable and everything was pristine clean! The bathroom was a great size and again, very clean - we all really loved the tv in the bathroom too! It has a great location to everything in the French Quarter - next time we are in New Orleans we will definitely stay here! One of our favorite hotels we've ever stayed in!! When stepping through the doors, you felt completely removed from what was going on in the streets!

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel”
Reviews.Author: donnyagreen
Reviews.Content: I try to stay here every time I co e to new Orleans. Service- outstanding. You never have to ask twice for some thing. From the door man to the bar. Everyone is top notch. Rooms- very nice. Fresh & well appointed. Food- amazing. It's rivals most in town. Pool area- very nice. Good pool bar. Bar- nice Spa- very nice work out area. Location- good. It's across canal from the French quarter, but that keeps the noise down. Adds 5 min to your walk.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely done”
Reviews.Author: kevinLR
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Hilton as I needed a smoking room. And they booked a smoking room for me............they don't exist!!!!! I quickly found that out at checkin. Big snafu on Hiltons part. Apparently their new reservation center in the Phillipines didn't get the memo. But this hotel bent over backwards to accomodate my request. They booked a room just inside the 4th floor pool entrance, which is where the smoking area is. They were courteous, friendly, even concerned that my booking was incorrect. After telling them that I had a previous booking in a hotel 100 dollars cheaper per night but had to change because they had no smoking rooms theyeven lowered my rate by that amount per night. I have to say what could have been a nightmare turned into the most pleasant hotel experience I have had, ever. Little pricey but worth it. Nicest staff ever. If you are going to New Orleans and want a relaxing sophisticated stay this is your place.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay”
Reviews.Author: MikeN98
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is a classic old hotel that has been beautifully restored, My wife and I stayed two nights in late March 2012. The location was great, a short walk to the French Quarter, Harrah's, and Armstrong Park. The customer service was excellent. One of the concierge (Don) provided restuarant suggestions and ideas of places to go and all were great ideas. We booked two nights with Hilton points (Hilton Gold Member) and were upgraded to a King suite on the 13th floor. It was likely the nicest hotel room I have ever stayed in. The furnture was beautiful, the bed was very comfortable, the linens were high qulaity, and it was clean. I travel extensively for work and do not get the oppotunity to stay in high end accomodations, this was really a treat. The lounge offers several signature drinks; however, the gin fizz was one of a kind and worth the $13. The bathroom had no tub, but the shower had multple jets and was wonderful. We stayed in Tower 1 and were on the 13th floor and you can still hear noise outside, but it was no problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and friendly service”
Reviews.Author: alli565
Reviews.Content: My husband, along with another couple and I stayed here for three nights recently. The hotel was selected and booked by my friend through Travelocity. We did not realize it was affiliated with Hilton Honors so we couldn't take advantage of upgrades (and our flight delayed our arrival by eight hours so I was too tired to remember to ask for one upon arrival). I did call ahead to let them know about special occasions we had, and was extremely pleased with the champagne and strawberries we received for our anniversary and the happy birthday cake my friend received. Great touches at this hotel include those special gifts, wonderful robes and slippers to use, newspaper in the morning and turn down service with chocolates. We were in Tower 1 (wish I has also thought to ask about Tower 2) looking out onto the Ritz Carlton Hotel and Canal St. The streets are noisy early in the morning, but with the late nights, I had no trouble hearing it and then falling right back to sleep. It is conveniently located to Bourbon Street, we walked to Frenchmen Street, the French Market, Cafe du Monde, Jackson Square, the riverwalk, and right around the corner is the stop for the St. Charles Streetcar as well as it is close to the Canal St Streetcar. We had coffee and chai tea in Teddy's, the concierge was very friendly and informative and the front desk staff was efficient. We did have problems printing our boarding pass (that is on floor two, I think), but they printed them out for us at the front desk. The pool looked wonderful (I had plans to bring swimsuit but the website stated it didn't open until April 1st so a bit disappointed there)--wish I hadn't lost a day in the airport, otherwise, I would have just sat poolside with a drink and a book! The room we had was a Queen room and our friends had a King. Their room had a short hallway then the bed was right there. Our door opened right onto the bed. An older hotel so small rooms are to be expected. The bed and pillows were very comfortable for all of us. The bathroom shower jets were fabulous, wish the hair dryer had been more powerful, did use the tv in bathroom when getting ready but the door to bathroom needs adjusting so it doesn't automatically slam shut, the robes were super comfy (I may have to purchase one!), the view not so great but then again the building isn't close to the waterfront but on a busy block, and the bathroom wallpaper is in need of redoing. The one day we did have to ask the maid to come back later (it was four pm and we had about 20 minutes to get refreshed)--she just left things alone for us and did a great job each day. I didn't use the spa but visited the shop. The woman helped someone else check out before helping me (I had asked to see something in a closed case and the woman paying for an item had merely just stepped up to the register)--she was friendly enough but not efficient. If in a pinch, I might buy something from the shop, but there are too many stores everywhere else to pay the higher prices there. I will definitely stay here again when I go back to NOLA!

Reviews.Title: “Well done”
Reviews.Author: aspen5
Reviews.Content: What a great place - from the moment you walk in the door you feel like it was 1940. The decore is fabulous, the lobby has a character you don't see anymore. I was in a 2-queen bed room, with a separate sitting area. very comfortable with a double walk-in shower and three shower heads. Had a great time - good value considering the lesser places i've stayed that were not nearly as interesting. Staff was fantastic - great people, great place.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful New Orleans hotel”
Reviews.Author: emfeAthens_Georgia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights as he attended a meeting held on site. From the welcome in the gracious lobby, to our lovely top floor room, we truly enjoyed our visit. The French Quarter is in easy walking distance and the tram line is also close. We had a king superior room which was spacious with a sitting area in the room and large flat screen tv. The bathroom had a shower with no tub. There was a large closet off the entry which really needed to be lit. The closet was very dark and the safe was difficult to set in the dark. I would suggest adding closet lights. As a convention site, the staff did an excellent job. The meeting rooms were well lit and comfortable. The exhibition space was sufficient and the food served at all the events was very good. The wait staff were attentive to any needs. I enjoyed the roof top pool and also used the work out room, which though small was adequate. It was in in windowless room. I also had a massage which was very nice. The spa facilities were small with no lounge area- only 4 chairs in a waiting room. The spa did not have sauna or steam room. The spa shower stalls should have a hook, shelf or bench in each stall as there was no place to set belongings. There were no locks on the shower doors. The staff in the spa were all polite and welcoming. In fact, the staff attitude throughout the hotel was top notch. If was obvious the staff was lad we had chosen their hotel. Our one complaint- we used the hotel driver one evening instead of a cab, and he became hopelessly lost, causing us to be late. Only after several calls were we able to find the wanted address. We will certainly plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury ala New Orleans style”
Reviews.Author: srk3465
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a meeting for 5 nights. Meeting was in hotel so lodging was pre-arranged. However I booked rooms on line and did better than meeting rate. Hotel is situated on the other side of Canal Street so you are not directly on Bourbon Street or the Quarter but it is a block or 2 away. I have to think this is the best since you have easy access to the action but dont have to hear it or be in it when time to retire. Plus if you want to have a quiet evening, you have that option too. The lobby has a grand appearance, it is well kept and still functional. There are 2 towers with elevators for each. At times, the elevators were slow. Check in was a problem-their computers were down when we arrived. However, demonstrating the level of service I was hoping for, they put us in the hotel lobby bar and covered our drinks. They also put me in the wrong room type but easily corrected this when I called them and moved me quickly to the correct type. Normally all of this hassle with check in would irk me to the point of dropping a rating but their style and attitude and drink comps made up for it. I booked a 2 room king suite, which surprising was not much more than the standard king room. Again, well done in style. Furniture was comfortable, bed was great. I believe the sofa was a pull out. Had TV in each room which was well sized. Bathroom was spacious with fancy shower that had multiple shower heads. Closet was huge and could easily accomodate multiple people. King suite has sink with small fridge-ideal for me since I like to go a buy a small pack of soda from local convience store which even at convience store prices is much cheaper than hotel soda. There are 2 major chain drug stores less than a block away. I had hotel food as part of the meeting, I have say everything I tried was very good. Meeting rooms were also nice, chairs were comfortable. Easy access from meeting rooms to lobby via escalator or elevator. The lobby has a bar, a fancy restaurant and another restaurant/coffee place for breakfast, sandwiches and snacks. Many of us ended up having a coffee in this place while talking, meeting friends etc All in all, I was very happy with this stay and hope to come again. The service was excellent and because of this, i was willing to forget the problems with check in. After all, problems will always come up, it is how they handle the problems that defines them and in this case sets them apart.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Great Service!”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetter_NYC2
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights with my friends. The room was a good size with a walk in closet, large bathroom and two queen size beds. We wanted hot water one night to make tea (the rooms don't have coffee makers) and room service kindly bought up two pots of hot water. The hotel is located right on the edge of the French Quarter. You're close enough but not in the center of it all since it can get a bit crazy. I would definitely stay here again the next time I return to Nola!

Reviews.Title: “A Great Way to Take in the Crescent City!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jakester20
Reviews.Content: I just finished spending three nights with my wife and daughter for my daughterâ€™s spring break at The Roosevelt and frankly, could not of had a better stay. The place shines on many fronts and Iâ€™ll comment on a few below. Rehab I never found out when, but The Roosevelt could have been a very tired hotel built in the 30â€™s and instead has been updated and is a great hotel in the year 2012. The facility has been updated, and it was great to stay in a grand dame hotel that had a terrific face-lift that brought her back to life. Room My wife, daughter and myself stayed in a fabulous end suite so we could all stay together. It could not of been better. Clean, modern, great amenities; i.e. flat screen, wifi, etc. Common Area Like most hotels build in this era common place aplenty. Beautiful main floor, nice coffee bar area and wonderful coffee room. Dominica, a very nice Italian restaurant is part of hotel and we ate there one night and loved it. Fitness Center Was tremendous. Terrific size so could get a machine when wanted and very spacious. Plenty of room to stretch out and enjoy your workout. Location I did not love the location, just off Canal Street on the non-French Quarter side, but it was fine. Canal Street has a full frontal view of New Orleans life, and best to always be aware when walking on it and past it to go to French Quarter. Summary: Iâ€™m not sure of all the hotel offerings in town, but The Roosevelt is a sure fire winner.

Reviews.Title: “Fine,old and charming”
Reviews.Author: MiloMiami
Reviews.Content: Classic fine taste and beautiful old New Orleans decor. THe bar is a great place for an end of the day happy hour. Room/suite was beautiful with nice amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Monumental and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: AssimilatedCajun
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt has been one of the very best hotels in New Orleans for over a hundred years. It's also played a central role in the life of the city: the best society wedding receptions were held there, Huey P. Long kept a suite there, Walker Percy's protagonist in The Moviegoer took his girlfriends dancing there. In 1965 it became the Fairmont Roosevelt and later simply the "Fairmont New Orleans". It was closed after Hurricane Katrina and the ensuing flood in 2005, and it reopened in 2009 as a Waldorf-Astoria hotel. The restored hotel is even grander and more beautiful than it was before. The lobby stretches for a city block, with mosaic floors and chandeliers and lots of marble, and yet somehow manages to be not the least bit gaudy. The guest rooms are also exquisitely appointed. The bar, restaurant, and coffee shop are all quite good -- although the Roosevelt is only a block from the French Quarter, so it's a short walk to the Cafe du Monde for beignets and cafe au lait, to Antoine's and Arnaud's and Galatoire's for dinner, and to any number of bars whose menu and atmosphere are at least as good as those in the hotel's Sazerac Lounge. On the downside, as noted by some other reviewers, many of the rooms are somewhat small, although the bathrooms are large. It's also too bad that the Blue Room -- which was historically the hotel's flagship restaurant/lounge, at one time regarded as one of the best "big band" venues in the world -- now seems to be open only for private functions. Bailey's, once the city's only 24-hour high-end coffee shop, also seems to be gone forever. Hilton Honors members should be aware that while they might be upgraded to a good room or a suite, there is no executive floor or lounge. And then there's the question of staffing: many of the Roosevelt's employees are as courteous and capable as the hotel and its guests deserve, but a few are not. On a recent visit I called the "wake up call" button, the operator, and the reception desk, one after the other, at about 12:45 a.m. Each number rang about twenty times and then gave me a recording proclaiming the virtues of the Roosevelt Hotel. There was no opportunity to leave a voice mail message. I tried again about fifteen minutes later with identical results, so I gave up and set the alarm on my mobile phone in lieu of a wake up call. When I asked about this the next morning I was told that all late-night calls go to the reception desk and that whoever was at the reception desk must have been too busy to answer the call. The employee who told me this, who also worked at the reception desk, did not seem to regard it as an important problem. Despite these few deficiencies, the Roosevelt has done a far better job of preserving its grandeur and its traditions than most other hotels in New Orleans or anywhere else. It's a great place to stay and a great place to be.

Reviews.Title: “will return if we go back to New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: lmdallas
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel. I stayed here in the past when it was the Fairmont, but they have now updated the rooms. We arrived in the morning and were able to check in right away. Room was very clean, well appointed; a little on the small side, but it is a city hotel, so I didn't expect the room to be large. The lobby is beautiful and the gift shop is excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous NOLA hotel”
Reviews.Author: candicemdunn
Reviews.Content: We had a girls trip here last weekend, and it was perfect! The rooms were so spacious, clean, and beautiful!!! PERFECT weekend!! And the location is amazing. I will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great Classic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: volk04
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel. I was in NOLA for the Rock and Roll marathon weekend and decided to stay at the Roosevelt. It was a great choice. The staff is great and very friendly in the hotel. When we got there we had to wait to check in (maybe 15 mins) due to a long line, but they brought additional staff up to try and expedite the check in process. After checking in our room was ready and we were able to get to it quickly. I stayed on the 14th floor in tower one, and never had to wait for an elevator! The rooms at the Roosevelt are large, clean, and nicely decorated. Our room had 2 queen beds. The beds were very comfortable, and had nice clean linens on them. The bathroom was large, and had a tv in it. They use bath products by Salvatore Ferragamo. My only complaint about the hotel was when the bath products ran out they were not refilled. I left a note for house keep to refill them, but it was ignored. The hotel was quiet, but located close to most attractions, and was a short walk to Bourbon street, and many other sites. Overall this a beautiful and classic hotel. If you are looking for a casual luxury hotel in NOLA I highly recommend this location.

Reviews.Title: “3 grown daughters take dad to NOLA”
Reviews.Author: CBugsmom
Reviews.Content: My sisters and I took our 72 year old Dad to Nola in feb. Being a group of well traveled, but difficult sleepers we chose the Roosevelt based on it's location and reputation for comfort. We were not disappointed. We had two suites and two delux rooms. The staff made sure we were all on the same floor. Each room was unique and more beautiful than the next. We enjoyed watching the super bowl in my sister's suite on a giant flat screen with comfy chairs and sofas for us all. We ordered take out from John Besh's Domenica which is located in the hotel. It was a perfect trip.
