Reviews.Title: “Stands out!”
Reviews.Author: Will303
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt hotel is probably one of the best hotels in the country. Everything is so well thought out from service to amenities. A great deal of design and quality has been put into all the rooms. It is elegant and unique, bringing back service and style you expected from a hotel long ago. The staff is proactive in their hospitality and know how to take care of you.

Reviews.Title: “Moved to this hotel from one across the street”
Reviews.Author: TEXKEYSTONE
Reviews.Content: Only a one night stay after 3 bad nights at a hotel across the street. Management was on top of every single detail and I will definitely stay here again. I wish I could have stayed longer.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Coolhandluke13
Reviews.Content: My wife,myself and another couple stayed at the Roosevelt for three nights last week. We chose the Roosevelt due to it's location from the French Quarters. We wanted someplace close to the Quarters but far enough away for some peace of mind. Well, I'm pleased to report that it was exactly what we wanted. Now, as far as the hotel, it was a very pleasurable place to stay. We pulled up to the hotel only to be greeted by friendly staff who politely escorted us to the front desk. The hotel is very elegantly decorated with a sophisticated environment. The deluxe room was small but very nice. However, we asked for an upgrade and redeemed one the following day. Much thanks to the staff for coordinating the transition. Anyone reading this review, here's my tip...don't pass on asking for an upgrade. Anyway, there is a pool and hot tub located on the fourth floor that we enjoyed and afterwards went to the bar to try a Sazerac. I personally enjoyed the drink but my wife thought it was too much. That means too expensive($11-plus tip) and too strong. Well, I guess the Sazerac is a personal preference.

Reviews.Title: “Very pleased, top notch comfort and beauty”
Reviews.Author: gina s
Reviews.Content: Went the weekend after Fat Tuesday. Front desk people nice. Concierge was very helpful getting us into Commander's Palace, helping us with trolly route, which places not to miss in quarter. I never use the concierge but they were nice and helpful. Doormen great and nnot pushy. King suite was spacious and the furniture was beautiful. All was clean. Maid service comes later in day which was fine for us. We found the hotel to be quiet and other guests to be respectful. Loved the difft options for food and items in the attached restaurants, store, cafe. Loved the location -- a few blocks off the quarter on the other side of canal -- close enough to walk places but not RIGHT in the middle of bars. Only negative was a very rude worker at the cafe on our last morning. Tall, bigger guy with curly light brown hair. He was in a sour mood I guess. Just unpleasant, snappish; they had no plastic spoons and not willing to look for any. Sad because that was the last person we encountered before our departure.

Reviews.Title: “You will wish you had your tux on...”
Reviews.Author: PrincessWildhair
Reviews.Content: This is a fabulous hotel that is an architectual wonderland. This is a fantastic, art deco style hotel with incredible tile and fixtures. If you are someone that really appreciates historic hotels this is the place. I would recommend it for a romantic get away as the beds are well...luscious. The staff is extremely helpful without being obtrusive. While there are fantastic restaurants all over New Orleans, the restaurants within the hotel are highly recommended...especially if you dont want to wander your first night in. This is also a first rate conference hotel. I highly recommend it. The facilities are super for groups 600 and under. The staff was on the ball the whole time.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Old Elegance.”
Reviews.Author: MMPera
Reviews.Content: You don't have to stay at the (Theodore) Roosevelt to partake of its wonders. Stroll through the main corridors and check out the impressive chandeliers, marble and tile work, the exquisite female statue w/ pendulum clock in the lobby, The Sazerac Lounge with its politically incorrect happy-slave murals, and the Domenica's 3-6pm happy hour (the best in town), featuring stellar food by renowned chef, John Besh.

Reviews.Title: “I really expected more.”
Reviews.Author: austinteri
Reviews.Content: On one hand, I feel guilty doing this because we did get a free room upgrade without asking, but that is also the reason why I am doing this. Had we not gotten a free upgrade, I would have been very disappointed with the size of the room and bath. For the price, I really want a nice luxury space. We did get that by getting lucky. The entry of this grand hotel is quite beautiful. The location is good and a short walk to the Quarter. Our food experience and spa experience at the hotel was not notable. In all, neither was our entire experience there, which was disappointing based on this being a Waldorf Astoria property.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JenniferChaffin
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Roosevelt and I loved it! We stayed in room 11211 and it was a beautiful suite. It didn't have a great view, but it included a foyer, kitchen/dining area, living room, and a large master bed/ bath. Even on the 12th floor, we could here road noise and hallway noise, but I think it's to be expected in an old hotel. The location is very convenient to the French Quarter, Business District, and the Garden District. Dominica, a restaurant in the hotel was delicious. Usually hotel restaurants are average, but I highly recommend dining here. The only negative to the Roosevelt was Teddy's coffee shop in the lobby. The coffee was average and the pastries and desserts were bad. After our morning run, my husband and I would walk a block away to Merchants. They had great coffee, pastries, and crepes.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: lapizz54
Reviews.Content: This is one of the finest hotels I have ever stayed in!!! Anytime we go to New Orleans we stay here. Everything is first class. Every staff member goes out of their way to make your stay the best it can be. The restaurant and bar on the first floor are wonderful. The pool area is very nice, plenty of space to relax and read or sunbath. The hotel underwent a major upgrade recently which transformed the entire hotel to ultra first class. If traveling to New Orleans around Christmas, please stay here, the lobby decorations are out of this world. Another plus is the Sunday brunch in the world famous Blue Room. Live jazz music by the blues legend Jim Rivers along with some of the finest seafood and southern dishes in the world. Can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: mhempen
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during our wedding night and I couldn't have asked for a nicer place. We had originally reserved a superiour king suite, I believe. I called ahead of time to confirm and let them know that it was for our wedding night and that I wanted to be absolutely sure that we were going to be put in the right place. While we weren't expecting anything other than what we reserved, when we checked in, they ushered us up to our room, and had champagne and strawberries waiting on us. Oh, and not to mention they upgraded us to the Louis Armstrong presidential suite!! This had to be the largest suite I have ever stayed in my entire life. Truly beautiful on all levels... room, views and staff were all above and beyond my greatest expectations!!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: kate2004rock
Reviews.Content: This historic hotel is lovely. The rooms ( I was in a King Suite) has all the luxury touches and the staff was polite and professional. It was a little bit of a trip back in time, but I haven't had such a great hotel stay in quite a while!

Reviews.Title: “Grande Dame Kind of Place”
Reviews.Author: brngckn
Reviews.Content: This is a grande dame kind of hotel - shiny marble, big chandeliers and history. I spent 4 nights in a mini suite. The bedroom was spacious with a very comfortable bed - ironing board, closet, flat screen, dresser, night stands, chaise and bench. The "sitting room" was a little smaller with a couch, ottomans, desk and chair, minibar, flatscreen, wetbar. I found the placement of the desk and chair near the door somewhat annoying as I often had to move the chair to properly open the door to the hallway. Ice was supplied nightly as was chocolate on the pillows and laying out of the bathrobe. The bathroom was a bit cramped, not great lighting and very little counter space. The room was very pretty and seemed well-kept although I have to say housekeeping the first 3 nights was more thorough and timely than the housekeeping on the last night. I never heard noise from the hallways and rarely from the street unless it was loud sirens. There is free wifi for Hilton Gold members. Not sure what it costs otherwise. I did see the price tag for valet was $40/day - ouch! But, I thankfully did not bring a car. The hotel has a lovely large fitness room with full fledged locker rooms. They even put out water and fruit for runners in the AM. It was too cold to use the pool but the pool area was lovely. I did not partake of the hotel restaurants but there are lots of options and they looked nice. You should go into the Sauzerac bar and try the specialty drinks. The service in the bar was efficient but a little apathetic (maybe because I was using complimentary drink coupons?). Go in anyway. The hotel is not in the French Quarter but just across Canal St from it - easy walk to it and the streetcar line.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation!! Couldn't have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: 7Continents4Oceans
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2 queen room over the Mardi Gras celebration. The customer service was amazing, they greeted us at our car once we pulled up, and the valet took our car and unloaded our luggage. The check in process was a little slow, but nothing too frustrating. Once we arrived to our room we noticed every impeccable detail from the bedding through the bathroom. The bathroom was pretty large for a standard room also. Shortly after arriving in the room, there was a know at the door, and the bellhop was there with our luggage. He was EXTREMELY friendly and told us of some good places to go eat and sight see while in town. Overall, the service at this property is prompt and courteous, the rooms are a bit small (standard for New Orleans though), and the decor of the room is impeccable. I will definitely be staying at The Roosevelt in the future!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: lotsofNOLAtrips
Reviews.Content: Fabulous hotel. We stayed for Mardi Gras in a 2 queen room. Everything was fantastic starting with ease & friendliness of checkin to the excellent quality of the property. I love the high ceilings & large rooms. You can really tell this hotel cares about the details with the finishes. Turn down service was a fun touch and unexpected at Mardi Gras due to the crowds and high occupancy. We had a very lovely experience & really liked the tv in the bathrooms and all the marble tiles. I love old details especially when in such a great city. I am so thankful they took the time to do such a stellar renovation. I am a historic preservationist & the details really do matter. The only issue was the water was only warm, not hot. I did not report the issue as it really wasn't a big deal at all since we were just so happy to be there for Mardi Gras. Thanks so much for making this one of my favorite trips. I go to New Orleans a lot & Mardi Gras is truly spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is great”
Reviews.Author: DPH69Mahopac
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week there for mardi gras - it was perfect. rooms were larger than you would expect - they were very quiet - which i was surprised at considering all that was going on - the food was very good much better than the food poisoning i recieved last year at the palm spring hilton. I was in tower 2 which did seem a better choice than tower 1.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, amazing mardi gras experience”
Reviews.Author: MissKitty680
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a week in New Orleans at the Roosevelt, and while I expected it to be amazing, it was even better than I had expected. The hotel was gorgeous, I really can't say enough about the lobby - the pictures probably don't even do it justice. We had a king suite which had a main bedroom, a huge bathroom, walk in closet, powder room and living room with a pull out couch, more space then we could ever need need and very nicely decorated. Also it was honestly the most comfortable bed I've ever slept on. Housekeeping and turndown service always made sure to keep everything neat and tidy and along with chocolates on the pillows there were cute little cards with tomorrow weather and a little quote which was, for me, a really nice touch. I'm a fan of the the little extras, they seem to make the stay a little more special. One extra nice touch was a little package of pralines and a note saying happy mardi gras and thanking us for staying at the Roosevelt, we loved that. The hotel itself is perfectly located, just on the other side of canal street from the french quarter. Far enough from the noise but a super easy walk if you want to get in on the action. Seeing all the parades was no problem because they all went down canal which was literally just steps away. We did take the time to eat at both Teddy's cafe and the Dominica during our stay, both were excellent. Teddy's had quick bites, mostly sandwiches or bagels, we liked to stop for a quick breakfast on busy days and check our email on the free wifi. Also they did make one of the very best lattes I've ever had. The Dominica gets a mixed review. I LOVED it, the fresh ricotta and the Gorgonzola pizza were amazing, my brother thought his clams pizza was just ok. Still, I would for sure go back. And as far as staff go I did not meet a single unfriendly or unhelpful person the whole time I was there. Reception provided assistance, directions, maps and tips on where to spend time. The housekeeping staff were lovely, always trying to make sure they didn't get in our way while still keeping everything up to incredibly high standards. The doormen, security and everyone else, all were wonderful, gracious and welcoming. They really made our stay. If I had to find a con it was the in room wifi, it didn't really work well. It would be lightning fast for a few minutes and then slow to a crawl. Often I couldn't get connected. They did offer a plug in for the internet but alas I had brought my tablet and it wasn't an option. However I did call down about the issue and no internet charges seemed to show up on my bill. Add that to the free wifi in the lobby and cafe and it really wasn't a big deal at all. Oh, and did I mention you get to print your boarding passes for free in the the business centre? I'd recommend this hotel to anyone staying in NOLA anytime of the year. I know that this is where I'll be staying when I return :)

Reviews.Title: “Third Chandelier to the right!”
Reviews.Author: opusfan
Reviews.Content: Selected Hotel Roosevelt for our brief stay in New Orleans prior to embarking on a cruise out of the Port. I knew we chose wisely when greeted by the Hotel staff indicating that we could find Registration at the "third chandelier to the right". I wanted to experience historic New Orleans and this was all of that with so much luxury tossed in that we felt truly pampered. The Sazerac Bar, credited with creating this first American cocktail, was eye candy and the drink lived up to its reputation. We lucked out with a 12th floor room, so luxurious (this is a Waldorf Astoria property after all) with amenities from soft throws on the bed to an umbrella in the closet - which was a lifesaver. Staff from patisserie (more eye candy that can be consumed), to breakfast, to gift shop could not have been more helpful and representative of southern hospitablity. It was a splurge that truly felt like one. Luckily, the pool was not in season as I now have an excuse to return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - service is impecable!”
Reviews.Author: maryloud
Reviews.Content: I agree with all the reviews about the gorgeous lobby and furnishings. the restoration was very well done. The only issue i had was with the bathroom- it's tiny - no surprise there- but why have a tv in a tiny bathroom when a makeup mirror would have been a more obvious choice. you couldn't watch a tv in there! The squeaking bathroom door had to be propped open for ventilation - no fan- to be able to breathe in there.Coffee makers in the room would be a great addition. The furniture and decor are just what you'd expect in a luxury hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Authentic. Easy choice.”
Reviews.Author: jacko_jackson
Reviews.Content: Apparently New Orleans is making a nice comeback because all the hotels were pretty expensive for the weekend (Feb. 11). Roosevelt was worth the few extra it cost over other places. It's in a great location, has great service, and most importantly, it still maintains its unique Waldorf charm. Thinking back on it now, it's an easy choice for a very nice, reliable stay in New Orleans and we are very likely to stay there again. The rooms were pretty updated, big, clean, and fairly quiet. The shower was a bit funky to turn on but clean and good hot water. Also there's a flatscreen in every bathroom I think which is a great move - I wish it was mandatory in all hotels now. I've walked through the place several times but never stayed there. The lobby has one of the better spaces to lounge around before hitting up the rest of the city. I hear the spa is insane and one-of-a-kind but we didn't make time to go there. Until next time. Also, we arrived a bit late around 9 p.m. and had a Best of Waldorf credit that gives you some money towards hotel expenses, but when we checked in we found out that you have to spend each amount per day, or it doesn't carry over to the next day. We were then also told we use it anywhere but Domencia, where we were eating that night. No worries, we ordered a bottle of champagne to the room for like 40 bucks (reasonably priced I thought for most part) and it got there in almost 10 minutes (and chilled). Domenica was great and then hit up Sazarac (sp? that right) bar for some real old school New Orleans drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: 2allens_17
Reviews.Content: This hotel conveys the image of the Waldorf Astoria brand, especially the public areas. I used my HiltonHonors points for this stay, and will do so again. You get a good feeling every time you walk into the lobby. The front desk handled everything properly and everyone was very courteous. The "king" room I had was very adequate, ample pillows and high quality linens. Nice amenities, including a 40-42inch TV, and a small one in the bathroom, too! Housekeeping was good, as were the restaurants. Located 2 blocks from Bourbon Street.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location - but no bathtub in suite”
Reviews.Author: claudia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here during Mardi Gras. We were thrilled with the location - and were able to see one of the early parades. Walkable to Bourbon Street and the French Quarter. Hotel staff is very pleasant. Housekeeping was good - although often came very late in the day. My big disappointment was no bathtub. A good shower - but love a bubble bath as a treat. The suite was furnished nicely. And the room was made up and ice put in the ice bucket every night when we returned from being out. Would stay here again - if we could find a room with a tub!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and luxurious in the public areas, a little less refined in the rooms!”
Reviews.Author: howdeppisyourlove
Reviews.Content: Walk into the lobby and you know you are in a truly magnificent and elegant place. This is a very luxurious looking hotel from the moment you step foot inside her. The grand lobby is a delight to see and as we were here at Christmas we were very impressed by the tasteful and elegant decorations. The public areas are beautiful and do make you feel like you are in a special place. However, the rooms themselves are only of average quality. The decor in our room was a little dark and gloomy and the room was small and decidedly unimpressive. The bathroom was very nice and of a very good size. We have definitely stayed in far superior rooms in less expensive hotels. Compared to the Waldorf Astoria on Park Avenue, New York, this hotel was just lacking the follow through that was promised by its elaborate lobby. We did not eat at the hotel or order room service so we cannot say anything about the food or food service. The most disappointing aspect of our stay here was that I ordered a wakeup phone call at 4.30 am so we could get to the airport- we did not receive this call. Thankfully my son set his cell phone alarm and woke us all up! When I bought this to the front desk employee's attention on check out, he simply said "Sorry", which seemed a little lame considering the wake up call was to get us to the airport and to our flights! Overall, it was a pleasant experience but not as well polished as we anticipated and certainly not of the superior quality most people would expect from such a hotel and brand. We would stay again, with reduced expectations next time.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing, quiet and convenient”
Reviews.Author: WineNDine01
Reviews.Content: We love to travel and when we're in a big city, we love to walk! This was a fabulous hotel in a great location. It was convenient to everything we wanted to do and was a well-lit walk all of the way at night. My husband and I used our Hilton points to stay here and I'm a gold member so we immediately received an upgrade to a well-appointed suite on the 10th floor with views of the city and also of the pool and cabanas below. The room was extremely comfortable and immaculately clean. The fully stocked mini bar was even fairly-well priced, as mini bars go! I fell in love with the shower which included two separate spray heads just for your body- I turned it all on at once and it was like a spa treatment! The experience was wonderful- from the delicious drinks in the Sazerac bar downstairs, to the chocolates and robes at turn down service with a fresh pair of slippers, to the knowledgeable service at the concierge desk. One night, we planned to walk to dinner and a driver by the front door spied me carrying my heels and asked my husband and I if we'd like a limo ride anywhere in the city for just $20! It was a stylish way to arrive at dinner and I think the Roosevelt is a very well-connected hotel. Our experience was top-rate and we'll stay there again next time we're in The Big Easy!

Reviews.Title: “Worth a look but not a stay”
Reviews.Author: rmcguire
Reviews.Content: We broke our rule and did not stay at the Ritz Carlton. This was based on our recent stay at a Waldorf property in Orlando which was tremendous. This is a beautifully restored hotel. It is worth a walk through and the art deco bar is worth a visit. The staff was helpful. The problem is you stay in a hotel for the rooms and the food. The main restaurant, Sazerac, was terrible. The duck had no flavor and the chicken was greasy. Why can't they find a cook in the south who can cook fried chicken? We had a suite with a bathroom so small you could not turn around. It had a shower, no tub. This is still an old building. The safe in the closet, unless locked, would stay open and it blocked the door to the closet from opening. The soap dish had rust. The walls and carpet were stained. The mirror over the desk had a large crack. If you had a large hanging bag with wheels you could not roll it to the closet because the area between the bed and dresser was not wide enough. Poor planning. The towels were kept in the closet on the opposite side of the bathroom. If you forgot a towel and were in the shower you had to get out of the shower, walk through the bedroom to the closet to retrieve the towel. There was not enough room in the bathroom to put the towels. They had an electronic "dishoner" bar and evidently walking by it triggers a charge. We never used anything out of the bar but were charged. They did take that off. We had trouble at another Hilton property before with the elevators and on the morning we left they only had one (of four) elevators running on the tower we were in and it was always loaded. There is no coffee in the room so you have to go to the lobby to get morning coffee. There is no complimentary morning coffee. The coffee bar, Teddy's, was actually decent for small items however we calculated we could have stayed on the club floor at the Ritz Carlton and basically paid the same price as the up charges for the coffee and muffins, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jeweledgypsy
Reviews.Content: This hotel never ceases to amaze me! Everything was just as nice as always. I'm always amazed at how quickly the valet can unload your car and get you in the door. It's as if you blink and like magic your bags just appeared. Check in is also very quick and efficient. The concierge was very helpful. We were in the city for a wedding and weren't exactly sure where we were going. He gave my husband directions and then suggested we take a cab, despite the fact that we were in our own car. This was the best idea! It was during Mardi Gras season and there was a parade and lots of people along the route were to take. If we had driven, I seriously doubt that we would have made it to the wedding on time! And the showers, need I say more. I am not a shower person, but The Roosevelt leaves me wanting to build one just like it in my house! To the staff at the The Roosevelt, thank you. You never cease to outdo yourself. From the valet who hailed us a cab to the gift shop attendant helping me find my size in the beautiful dress I bought, these people make me want to come back time and time again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the bed and hairdryer!”
Reviews.Author: Rinjani_Queen
Reviews.Content: We booked Roosevelt after reading all the reviews, and it didn't disappoint! Impeccable service, from concierge to room service. Convenient location combined with old school charm. Other than the super comfy bed, I'm also pleasantly surprised by the T3 hairdryer ... it's the first I've ever come across! Very thoughtful touch (only women with long hair can truly appreciate this) ... I'm impressed! Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Just ok, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: BuddyMalloy
Reviews.Content: I was a little troubled by first (and probably last) stay at the Roosevelt. It is a beautiful looking hotel, but the room I received was fantastically small. No tub, just a shower, and you'd have to crane your neck to look at the TV (it's positioned at an awkward angle, since it is to the left of the bed and not in front of it). Since I was on business and by myself, I figured I could survive a couple of nights. But the corner room they gave me was next to the stairwell, and I had to listen to the constant banging of the stairwell door late into the night, and early the next morning. When I asked to move, they gave me the EXACT same room in the EXACT same location, two floors up. This happened even though I explained exactly what the situation was with the stairwell. When they moved me after that, I asked for a tub this time but that request was ignored (I would have been OK if they had simply told me one was not available, rather than acknowledging the request but doing nothing about it). The shower controls are impossible are near impossible to figure out, two different knobs that work differently depending on how far you turn them (careful not to scald yourself). Directions should be posted. I was also very disappointed that their website did NOT make it clear the pool was closed (the hotel is only 2 years old, so I was quite surprised it was already under renovation). I ate at both hotel restaurants and was expecting some spectacular food - but both meals were quite bland and in the case of the fine dining restaurant, overpriced. Service at both restaurants took forever, even though both times I was there it was not busy. The rooms, hallways and public areas are pristine though. The business centre, which charges for use (but will print your boarding pass for free) was well staffed. There were no errors on my bill on check out, which I find quite impressive.. Very, very clean. Close to the french quarter. I wouldn't go out of my way to stay there, but I'd probably give another hotel a try next time.

Reviews.Title: “Waldorf-Astoria Gem”
Reviews.Author: Bill R
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week at The Roosevelt Hotel. It is Hilton's Waldorf-Astoria class hotel. The staff displays Southern hospitality at its best. Before we arrived we received an email from our personal concierge. This was a nice touch. She set up a driver to pick us up at the airport - pricey, but worth it since we had never been to New Orleans. When we arrived at the hotel, check-in was a breeze. It was nice to be greeted by our names. The front desk staff was definitely well-trained. We are Hilton Gold Card members and we were immediately given an upgrade to a king suite. Again, a very nice touch. Our rooms were lovely with an exceedingly comfortable bed, two closets, two bathrooms, and a sitting room. I think even a basic room would have been just as lovely, as the staff really makes you feel at home. One especially nice amenity was a shower with multiple jets from the wall, as well as an overhead rain shower. This is a hotel with a grand history. Huey Long, former Louisiana governor, once had a suite on the twelfth floor that was his exclusively. He used it whenever he came down from Baton Rouge. The Sazerac Bar has been remodeled, but they kept the hole in the wall where a bullet missed him during an altercation. Also on display is the Deduct Box replica. They say he deducted a portion of the wages from men for whom he found jobs. Quite a character from the old world of politics, circa 1930s. The food was exceptional. The Sazerac Restaurant, adjacent to the Sazerac Bar, prepared some of the best food we have ever had. My breakfast favorite was the Creole Crab Cake Benedict. In place of the traditional English muffin was a crab cake with Hollandaise sauce and a poached egg. I would have had this every day, except I didn't try I until our last day. Lunch in the Sazerac was also very good. The Prix Fixe menu was the way to go. Three courses for $25 was a steal!! They did not offer the Prix Fixe menu in the evening, although a server said they were bringing it back. It is worth asking about. The absolute best time we experienced was the Sunday Jazz Brunch in The Blue Room. From 11 a.m. to 2 p.m. you dine on exquisite food while listening to the James Rivers Band. James Rivers was in the movie The Bridges Of Madison County. You see him singing to Meryl Streep and Clint Eastwood, look for his signature black beret! To our delight, he also dedicated a song and sang to us. A magical moment. The Sunday Brunch food was a real feast. Starting with appetizers, salad, and gumbo soup displayed tastefully, we sampled some of everything. This was NOT your Vegas type buffet with mounds and mounds of food, just plenty of the appetizers that we had been ordering throughout the week in the main restaurant, plus some added treats. The caviar was one of the extra treats. The main course offered nine entrees, all served at our table. My husband chose the enormous Prime Rib that was an inch thick and filled his plate, and I chose the Herb Marinated Grilled Poussin (chicken) with oyster dressing. I don't think you can go wrong with any selection. Throughout all of this our waiter was freely pouring Mimosas and champagne. We never had to ask, he was just there. The dessert bar included Bananas Foster, creme brulee, cheesecake, an array of pastries and chocolates, and, of course, pralines (my personal downfall). See the pictures, such delightful food. People make or break a hotel. One of the nicest hotel administrators was the Emporium Manager. She was also the hotel weekend manager. We kept running in to her throughout our stay. She saw us in the Sazerac during dinner and happened to have the table next to ours during Sunday brunch. Whenever we saw her in the hotel, she was wave or say, "Hello." Finally, our week came to an end. The Roosevelt had become our home away from home. I will miss it.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms and a classly property”
Reviews.Author: xy223yz
Reviews.Content: Walking into the lobby of the hotel I wasn't sure what to expect. It is clearly an older property. That means one of two things. First, a hotel that tries to slap some lipstick on it but underneath is an old hotel. Or two, a historic property that feels like an old gem. This is clearly the latter. As a Diamond Hilton member I did get an upgrade from the standard king room. That being said, it was a nice large room. It felt like a modern hotel room yet preserved the historic charm of the property. The room was quiet and comfortable. Only complaint was the lack of power outlets. They were there. But you had to hunt for them and spread out your electronics throughout the room. The staff was friendly. The property clean. And located close enough to the New Orleans' action yet far enough away where you can escape the noises and crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you'd expect in a luxury hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Spiritgrl
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week for business and extended it into the weekend for some personal time. My company held an event here and the hotel/catering/event staff catered to our every need. I would highly recommend using the hotel for their meeting capabilities. The hotel rooms are a nice size, clean, and it is relatively quiet. I never sleep that well when alone and away from home for a long period of time, but their beds are AMAZING so I had no trouble at all. The hotel is within easy walking distance to Bourbon St, St Charles Streetcar, Riverwalk, and basically anything in the French Quarter. It was my first time visiting NOLA and I cannot think of any negatives encountered while staying here. Would love to do it again!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding and the service was top notch”
Reviews.Author: LisaLou432
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for the Krewe of Nyx ball and it was a memorable experience. The staff went above and beyond for us. The atmosphere was very welcoming. We stayed with the best and were treated that way.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: andezz99
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is located just on the edge of the French Quarter. Close enough to walk to but far enough from the noise. This is a very noise hotel which has a long history. The staff is very friendly and attentive. I was however surprised not to find the room made up after being out all day, this brought my review from a 4-5, otherwise very pleased with this hotel and would return again when back in NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room in Tower 2, Poor wireless service throughout the hotel”
Reviews.Author: KVP2315
Reviews.Content: Being a Diamond Member, I was treated to a fabulous room in Tower 2, which is the newer tower. My colleagues that were in Tower 1 had extremely small and old rooms with small bathrooms making doing anything more than sleeping difficult. It was hard to work in any of our rooms as the wireless service was non existent in many areas, my hot spot wouldn't work, and cell phone calls were always being dropped. I complained to the front desk and their IT contractor for two days to try to get it fixed. The front desk told me to use my computer in the lobby...not the right answer. I wound up using their Ethernet connection, which they comped. I was at a conference there and found the banquet and conference facilities to be great. The hotel is clean. Housekeeping is fair, they do not go the extra mile, even with a good tip. It's a four block walk from Bourbon Street which is wonderful because it's much quieter. I would stay there again but I would ask for Tower 2 only and make sure I didn't have any pressing business needs that required long private phone calls.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Hotel in New Orleans period!”
Reviews.Author: eduardo d
Reviews.Content: We visit New Orleans on a regular basis leaving on the MS Gulf Coast. The hotel provides one of the best experinces and located walking distance near everything. The restaurant is wonderful along with the exceptional bar, one of a kind............ Eduardo, Natalia and Sofia

Reviews.Title: “Old world elegance and new world comfort in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: SuzyQinHou
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is a NOLA landmark as is the Sazerac lobby bar. BUT it is really a new hotel after just undergoing a $100+ million dollar renovation by the Waldorf Adtoria/ Hilton corp. The rooms are spacious and they have thought of everything to make your stay more comfortable (blow dryer, great bath products, counter space and storage, robes and in-room safe). As mentioned the Sazerac Bar, restored to its original and famous grandeur is the perfect spot for a cocktail. John Besh's Domenica Restaurant is also in the lobby and it is a nice casual dining option. Good food, great pizza, good prices and ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: BeachMiles
Reviews.Content: We are just back from 4 nights in New Orleans. Our room at the Roosevelt was a suite on the 12th ( top floor ) of tower 2 . The suite was great, although we really didn't use the living room for much. No refrig, except for the mini bar. no microwave , so no cooking. That was fine . We came to eat out. Our window looked across Canal Street , facing the front of the Ritz Carlton. Beyond the Ritz was the French Quarter. Turning my head to the Right I could see a sliver of the river through some buildings. The location was Excellent . Right out front we could catch the trolley. Or, walk out the front door , cross Canal St , and you are in the French Quarter. We did not miss having a car. there is enough within walking distance, to keep us busy. The trolley was also easy to use. Hotel staff warm and helpful. The lobby makes a statement , This is no cookie cutter hotel. This place has character and history. The wife felt I had taken her some place special, that's how I evaluate hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and consistent, great location”
Reviews.Author: HonestlyThisIsTrue
Reviews.Content: Love the roosevelt, my favorite place to stay in NO, walking distance to everything, clean rooms, excellent service, tons of history, read the placards in the lobby if u have time, also try domenica (john besh -- one of the foremost chefs in the city owns and runs it) quiet rooms

Reviews.Title: “Old World Hotel with Breathtaking Lobby”
Reviews.Author: GotTicketWillTravel
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival on December 30th, we literally gasped at how beautiful the lobby was. The entire corridor had been arched by white vines with tivoli lights and crystal ornaments hanging down. Truly an elegant winter wonderland effect! We had 4 rooms, all of which were different sizes and very well appointed. We were walking distance to the French Quarter, the Superdome and the Riverwalk. Luxury at it's finest with a great location!

Reviews.Title: “well done renovation, great location”
Reviews.Author: wendygo
Reviews.Content: This stately hotel has charm with modern updates . Rooms and bathrooms not the largest,but, that is to be expected. Within walking distance to the Quarter and easy access to all the NOLA fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location & Great Period Details”
Reviews.Author: Bishti214
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is a beautiful Hotel. Upon entering you are transported back to a different time, the detailed design really made it feel luxurious. The rooms were also quite spacious and nice. I was visiting New Orleans for my Bachelor/Bachelorette Party Weekend. The guys had their own room down the hall and it was equally nice. They had great service and never once seemed annoyed with our many requests for towels, always a request with a group of girls. They were also great for recommendations of places to eat and visit. The gym, was 24 hours and was great for a quick workout. And the hotel bar was amazing for cocktails. Also the small cafe was a great spot for breakfast items, as well as coffee and tea. I also loved the location. It was very close to Bourbon street but not so close that it would have been loud at night. It was also fairly close to Decatur St, where there was a lot of good food and shopping. Also, a Walgreens was around the corner which was very convenient for the inevitable items we didn't pack.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Luxury Suite”
Reviews.Author: staypuffed
Reviews.Content: The luxury suites at the Roosevelt are amazing. The rooms are spacious and the size of a one bedroom condo. Hotel services are also excellent. Stayed two nights with three kids and was a wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but not without flaws”
Reviews.Author: JMW757677
Reviews.Content: The reviews on here are right--this is a fantastic place to stay. The rooms are immaculate and clean, the beds perfect, and the entire place is elegant and solid. A few quibbles that I shouldn't have to make about a property of this calibur: 1--The pool was closed for repair. There is no notice on their website about this--lesser Hilton properties let their guests know that the pool is closed in advance. Why can't the Roosevelt? I was in New Orleans in January and live I in a cold place. I should have been alerted that the pool was closed when booking the room. Unacceptable. 2--There were dirty, smelly dishes in the hall my entire stay. And I saw the cleaning staff many times. Apparently nobody wanted to deal with them. 3--I am a Hilton Diamond member and should get a beverage voucher when I check-in. I didn't get one and didn't realize until I was in my room. But the bottles of water that you are supposed to get were in the room. But I think all guests get those. 4--The restaurant is just OK. With all of the food in New Orleans don't eat at the hotel. The Sazarac bar is worth the trip and cannot be missed. As is the Italian restuarant located in the hotel but not run by it. Overall worth staying. But no notice about the pool on the website and then not telling me when I checked in and making arrangements to use one of the pools at the many nearby Hilton properties is totally not up to luxury hotel standards.

Reviews.Title: “Very, Very Grand”
Reviews.Author: Arlene A
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Roosevelt, was definitely a once in a lifetime experience for me. We were in New Orleans for my Honey's Birthday, and I must say the level of service far exceeded anything I had previously experienced. From the moment we walked in, we were greeted with a genuine warmth that started our trip off right. There are a lot of different options for food and drink available within the hotel. Domenico, a John Besh restaurant was great for light bites and we also enjoyed cocktails at the Sazerac, birthplace of the the drink that bears the same name. The Blue Room offers an Jazz Brunch with seatings every half hour on Sundays. A 10 minute walk to either the Riverfront/Aquarium area or the French Quarter makes this hotel centrally located, which is convenient for us tourists.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful classic”
Reviews.Author: Katie C
Reviews.Content: Went over Christmas with my family and we stayed in one of the suites. Firstly, the hotel was decorated beautifully for Christmas, the lobby filled with trees and lights, making it all the more festive. Secondly, the suite was more than ample in size, and incredibly comfortable. The service was great, from car valet to taking our bags and bringing up to the room quite promptly. Having grown up in close proximity to New Orleans, I've stayed at a lot of the hotels there, but this one is a classic that really cannot be matched.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: cincytravel88
Reviews.Content: The staff was excellent. They were so attentive and helpful. The rooms were very comfortable and spacious- stayed in a superior King room and it had a sitting area with a full sized sofa.. The beds were very comfortable. The bathrooms are quite large.The location is perfect for walking to most attractions. Great lobby. Will definitely stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful for the holidays”
Reviews.Author: Griffith4464
Reviews.Content: This is the most beautiful place during the holidays! Looks like a fantasy land. We make this an annual trip just to see the lights. The location is perfect for getting around in the French Quarter, yet not noisy as some hotels in NOLA are. The rooms are comfortable and spacious with nice bathrooms and a tv in the bathroom. Great for catching up on the news while getting dressed. The staff is professional and the bellhops are great -- fast in retreiving your car and getting your belongings to your room. We will be back next Christmas if not before! (be sure to ask for a large bathroom -- on our recent trip we had a room with a VERY small bathroom -- had never had this before and it was terribly cramped and did not come with a discount on the room rate)

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: ZDivot
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. We stayed in a King Suite, which had a living space with sofa, chair, desk, and TV. Just inside the room was a half bath--perfect for extra space while getting ready in the morning. The bedroom was a separate room with an attached full bath. Large TV in the bedroom with very comfortable king size bed. The hotel was just a block off Canal and easy walking distance to The Quarter (but far enough away to have some peace and quiet). Walgreens/CVS a block away for in-room snacks, etc. Overall, a wonderful place to stay. We will never stay anywhere else when visiting New Orleans. **Tip--be sure to try The Ruby Slipper restaurant for breakfast/brunch/lunch and (of course) Mother's. Both are within easy walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Dneva
Reviews.Content: We spent the week after Christmas in New Orleans and stayed at the Roosevelt. An outstanding facility. Just a bit dissapointed in the fact they did not have a coffee maker in the rooms. Enjoyed the hotel, very helpful and friendly staff. Would highly recommned.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: B S
Reviews.Content: The staff was excellent. They were so attentive and helpful. The rooms were so comfortable and spacious. The bathrooms are awesome. The location is perfect for walking to most attractions. The food was amazing as well. If anything looks like it might go wrong staff was on top of it. It's a beautiful hotel to just visit but if you visit you will want to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: mom2three70
Reviews.Content: Just returned from NOLA. I've been to New Orleans many times, but it was my first time at the Roosevelt. I won't ever stay anywhere else. It is a great location. Convenient to walk to the French Quarter, the river, the Superdome, but one block from the FQ so you don't get woken up by partying. We had a luxury suite, and it lived up to it's billing. I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Over the Top”
Reviews.Author: JonesvilleBag
Reviews.Content: This hotel is just extraordinary. The architecture alone is worth the trip to stay there. The room we had was a luxury suite. It was perfect for entertaining and we did so during the conference we attended. The beds are perfect, our bath had a big clawfoot tub and a modern shower. The Sazerac Bar is straight out of the 30's and 40's. You cannot stay at the Roosevelt and not enjoy a Sazerac Cocktail. The staff is beyond friendly and helpful. Treat yourself to this experience because you will never forget it!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: olescrapiron
Reviews.Content: Many went to a wedding and reception. I stayed at this hotel due to location of the wedding and could have not been more pleased. From the valet to bell captain everyone was helpful. Great room overloking the pool area. living room and bedroom well well appointed and comfortable. Housekeeping did many favors for me and even delievered gift baskets to others in the hotel.There are problems with reception with cell phones in the lobby area, but it so well built and beautiful, it did not matter you could always step outside for a call.. As the bartender said "this is built like a vault"! Recommend it to all.

Reviews.Title: “Visiting this hotel during the holiday season is a must!”
Reviews.Author: kjtraveler2008
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely breathtaking during the holiday season. They have a lighting display through their entire lobby that rivals any I've seen...it's truly magical. You can get a drink at their bar and sit down at some of the numerous couch areas and just take it all in. We are Hilton members and for this trip planned to stay at a friend's house but I made my husband look into getting a room for us here. Just lovely.

Reviews.Title: “Top Flight hotel experience in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Chris S
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here 3 times and been pleased every time. The breakfast and drinks are expensive, but to be expected when staying at a 5 ***** hotel, and the room more than makes up for it. Go ahead and splurge, and get the suite :)

Reviews.Title: “Great New Orleans Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 35805Katie
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt more than lives up to it's great reviews. My family and I stay in New Orleans hotels once a year. This one was one of our favorites. We had a one bedroom suite for our family. The room was clean, comfortable and very nice. The staff, to a person was amazing. Location is good, just across the street from the French Quarter and away from the noise.

Reviews.Title: “They've Finally Gotten it Right”
Reviews.Author: ATLcruiser
Reviews.Content: I think this is the fifth time I stayed here, but I hadn't stayed in a year. This time, everything was perfect. The room was very clean and had all of its amenities, turn down service came the first night, and the bed was just as comfortable as ever. I still wish they had coffee in the room, but I know that is less common in high end hotels. I finally ate in the restaurant for breakfast, and it was the most I've ever paid. They still got the order wrong, but they were very nice about it and fixed it. I can't wait to stay again. I almost feel like it is a home away from home (except I have a Keurig machine in the bedroom at home.)

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Elegance”
Reviews.Author: WHODAT57
Reviews.Content: Exceptional Elegance, nothing else compares. Teddy Bear Tea, Sunday Brunch, Sazerac Bar, The Blue Room, nostalgia extraordinaire.

Reviews.Title: “Words aren't enough...”
Reviews.Author: Numero10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Roosevelt over the Christmas holiday from the 23rd to the 27th and from check-in to check-out our experience was simply outstanding. Our request for a room on a higher floor with a view of Canal Street was honored and we ended up on the 11th floor with a great view of Canal, the city and out to the Mississippi River. The room was small (but hey, the hotel is old so we understood this ahead of time and had no problem with this) but the windows were ah-mazing, taking up nearly 3/4 of the wall (with nice high ceilings). The room was immaculate, the ferragamo toiletries smelled divine, and the bed was incredibly comfortable. The turn down service was always on time and the staff was always at the ready whether we needed a few waters sent up to the room or had a question for the consierge. The gorgeously decorated lobby simply takes your breath away. Everyone who said this is a "must see" if you are in the city at Christmas time was 100% right. Yes, it can get crowded with people passing through but it is quite quiet early in the morning and late at night, a perfect time for a hotel quest to take a stroll through and take all the pictures you want. Beyond the decorations there is so much detail to the property- the moldings, the tile mosaics, the murals- so much to take in. Our Christmas experience at the Roosevelt is truly something we will never forget!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience at the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: ragincajunprof
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at the Roosevelt ( a Saturday) when attending the New Orleans Bowl game. Although we arrived at a very busy time, we never felt rushed by the staff. The hotel appeared crowded with other fans from the bowl game, people artending a wedding reception, and many families with young children attending the Roosevelt's famous Christmas Teddy Bear Tea. The lobby area at Christmas time is breathtakingly beautiful. Check-in went flawlessly and our requested room was ready upon check-in. We had reserved a king suite with a sleeper sofa in Tower 2 - our request was honored. The suite consisted of 2 very large rooms as well as one and one-half baths. We had two teenagers with us and they enjoyed the privacy of a separate room and bathroom. The room was very clean. We did not return to our room until after the game which was about 12:30 A.M. There were no linens for the sleeper so we called and asked for someone to bring linens to the room. A young man promptly appeared and cheerfully prepared the sleeper sofa. We slept soundly as our room was very quiet. The next morning we went down to breakfast at the onsite Sazerac Restaurant as our room package also consisted of 2 complimentary breakfast entrees. Again, although busy, the restaurant staff was friendly and competent. The breakfast buffet was substantial with a wide range of items including omelets and waffles freshly prepared by a chef. The Sunday buffet cost was $25 per person. We checked out after breakfast and needed help with our luggage. Again, service was very prompt, courteous, and friendly. The bellman even offered each member of our party bottled water for our trip home. We had a great time in this beautiful, sumptuous hotel. We can't wait for another opportunity to return. The location is perfect - just off of Canal Street and within easy walking distance of the French Quarter and the Superdome. There is a beautiful Jesuit church right across Baronne Street which holds Saturday vigil and Sunday Masses.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with but a few "buts"”
Reviews.Author: Jeff56
Reviews.Content: Over Thanksgiving weekend 2011, my Wife, daughter and I stayed at the Roosevelt in New Orleans. I had stayed here before on business when it was the Fairmont so I had a bit of experience with it. The hotel Lobby had just been decorated for Christmas, and it was magnificant. Trees draped in white lights throughout the lobby with birds nestled among the lights. Truly beautiful. Upon checking in, the staff was welcoming and friendly. My son (who lives in NOLA) was driving us and the doorman allowed him to back up on the street into the cab stands for about an hour so he didn't have to pay to park which we thought was very nice! We went up to the room on the 3rd floor. There were 2 queen beds, a desk and lounge chair with ottoman so the room was spacious. The main issue we didn't like with the room was the bathroom. While decked out with Kohler plumbing products which is always nice to see, the faucet on the shower was loose (came off in my hand) and a screw was protruding most of the way out of the cover of the handle (the round part against the bath tub. Now when cleaning the tub, I'm quiet sure the handle would have come off in anyone's hand so apparently the cleaning crews must have known about it but didn't (or forgot to) have it repaired. I waiting through the second and third night and it was still not repaired when we left. Another big issue was the bathroom had a pedastal sink and no shelving or anything to put any of your toiletry items on. While I (with my toothbrush and hairbrush didn't mind that much, the two women I was travelling with didn't care for that at all with no place to put makeup bags, and all the stuff women carry with them. Further, the complete lack of storage and only one towel rack in the bath had them storing the bath towels and washcloths outside in the closet in the room, so it was a wet cold walk if you forgot to bring your towels into the bathroom with you before you took your shower. We spent several cocktail hours in the Sazerac bar. Directly inside the bar to the left there is a cozy little seating area where we spent several hours over the weekend. Waitress staff is very attentive and they have these very tasty spicy little corn munchy things that go good with your drink. We also ate breakfast on Thanksgiving morning in the Sazarac. While the food and service were good, we sat down hungrily and were immediately greeted with "I hope you don't mind, but your order is going to take a while because we are back there remodeling the kitchen. Seeing as how we were already sitting and sipping coffee, we decided we were in for the long hall so we ordered our food. She was right, simple omelets probalby took 40 minutes to get to us. ONce there the food was delivered, it was very good and as I said the service was very good as well (except for the wait for the food to arrive). One thing was a bit shocking that I thought might have calmed down since the many times we've been to NOLA. The first night we went out to eat dinner and when walking back, the whole street on the side of the Waldorf had been cordened off by police as there had been a shooting right next to the hotel. We walked up to a crowd that was standing there and they were tourists that were looking forlornly at their car because it was riddled with bullets in this running gun fight that had happened. Two nights later, there was a shooting right on Bourbon St about 11pm. I had always heard that the tourist section was off limits when you were setting arguments with guns, but apparently not that night. NOLA is a lot of fun with a lot to do, but overall, you will be smart to watch what your doing, know where you are (and where you shouldn't be) and keep a wary eye out to your surroundings at all times. Crime is still high in many areas so be careful. It's a great town filled with many nice people, but there is also that element so stay alert.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay for a Special Occasion!”
Reviews.Author: Beachgal817
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt hotel is beautiful! We visited in December and the lobby was stunning -lights everywhere. It was like a winter wonderland! Our actual room was small but all of the furnishings were top notch. There is even a flat screen in the bathroom. The location is good. The distance to the French Quarter was walking distance, but at night when I was wearing heels, I did wish that the hotel was a little closer.

Reviews.Title: “Where to stay in New Orleans to get in the holiday spirit!”
Reviews.Author: kizgat
Reviews.Content: Excellent service ..upgraded room without having to ask...daughter wrapped in a feather boa at check in...everyone with a smile. The lobby decked out for the holidays was stunning and our room was spacious and clean. Went to Teddy Bear tea and it was also fun with lots of picture opportunities. The service at the tea was good and the food was ok. Will definitely stay here again when back in NOLA for the holidays.

Reviews.Title: “Five stars, great location with old world charm”
Reviews.Author: Melissa C
Reviews.Content: I had a opportunity to come to New Orleans in December and stayed at the Roosevelt hotel which is by far the most beautiful holiday celebration in the city! The lobby spans the whole block and from end to end you walk through a winter wonderland. It's very magical and festive full of families taking pictures and couples dressed for a special occaision. It's a must see even if you aren't staying in the hotel. The rooms are large and elegant, with extreamly comfortable beds. I had a seperate sitting area in the room so you didn't feel crowded. The hospitality of the staff was sincere and welcoming. Everything was high end down to the Ferragamo toiletries. The rooms were very quiet and dark allowing you to sleep in if you have too much fun in the French Quarter the night before! The hotel is on the edge of the business district walking distance to the French Quarter but just outside the fray of the Quarter. Its about 3 blocks from the street car so getting to the Garden District is very easy. The Roosevelt is a wonderful hotel, I would stay here again, no question!

Reviews.Title: “In the quarter”
Reviews.Author: Christian O
Reviews.Content: The building is beautiful, from the moment my wife and I walked in, we were greeted with sincere warm hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “First Quiet Stay in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: pucgal
Reviews.Content: We were probably just lucky to get a corner room without an adjoining bedroom - but, it paid off in luxuriously quiet sleep - a first for us in this city. The staff was accommodating from arrival to departure. We were quickly checked in and our luggage taken care of. Our room was cleaned and linens changed after lunch each day. We ran into only one sourpuss bus boy at breakfast one day. Our room did not warm up the first night. We stopped by the front desk to let them know the temperature control did not seem to be working, and that the light was out on the makeup mirror. By the time we returned from breakfast both were fixed. The hotel does an outstanding presentation of holiday decor in the lobby. It was a WOW when we stepped out of the cab. It was enjoyable to see all the families with their kiddies coming to pose for their traditional holiday photos next to the trees. The food service was very good both at Domenica and the main dining room. We ate breakfast in the Sazarac dining room all three mornings. The food was better than average, except for the institutional potatoes which really brought the meal down. Getting a drink is very difficult in both Domenica and the Sazarac Lounge - hugely popular, crowded, no seating, poor service. BYOB. The hotel offers a historic tour on Saturday afternoons. It was guided by one of the concierges who answered our questions, and shared a book of old photos with us. However, he could not explain what happened to the old hotel sign that existed during the filming of Easy Rider. Guess he was too young. The gift shop was outstanding, and the shoe shine service readily available. The concierge desk was always manned and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Service leaves a lot to be Desired”
Reviews.Author: Bigger32
Reviews.Content: You probably will be, and perhaps should be very impressed with the Roosevelt Hotel, initially. Upon arrival, the hotel is a striking, beautiful, stately Grand Dame. Even the nameâ€”the Roosevelt, a Waldorf Astoria Hotel evokes an air of arrival and prestige; and signals that you should prepare for something very special. Unfortunately, the curse of being fairly well-travelled is that one gains a certain expectation for service delivery; and when those expectations are left unmet, one goes on to Trip Advisor, and attempts to maintain a level of decorum while telling it like it is. If you are a seasoned traveler, and have expectations when you check into a â€œpremiumâ€�, luxury hotel, IMHO, the Roosevelt will be a dismal disappointment. This hotel misses the mark on so many levels. We were upgraded to the Huey P. Long Suite for a six day period during the Thanksgiving Day Holiday. You would think this would be a great thingâ€”we certainly did. But, it was not. The suite is a beautiful affair. Iâ€™m guessing the entire space to be around 1,500s/f, with double doors leading to a formal entry foyer, then a huge living room, including original fireplace (non-working), beautiful rough-cut, highly polished hardwood floors, large HDTV, sofa, several overstuffed chairs, live plants, and nearly floor to ceiling windows. The dining area includes a 6-top Oak (Iâ€™m not a wood expert) formal dining table and buffet / server. There is also a separate wet bar with refrigeration and marble counter-tops everywhere. Off of the wet bar is still another roomâ€”a very large butlerâ€™s pantry. With 15 ft ceilings throughout, there are 2 very nice walk-in closets in suite, and a HUGE bathroom that features a ball and claw-foot tub, 4-head shower stall, mounted HDTV, double sinks with granite counters and marble floors and walls. Although, there is no half-bath for guests. Even though the carpeting was dirty, the bedroom was well appointed, and a bit tight. The suite is very well decorated with photos of Gov. Long throughout, and reminisces of New Orleans and of Louisianaâ€”to make sure you never forget you are in the Crescent City. We arrived on a Tuesday afternoon, by cab, right around check-in. The cab stopped in front of the University Pl. entrance. It was actually very slow at the hotel during this timeframe. We know this because there were six or seven porters standing around the bell desk having a pretty good conversation, and totally dis-regarding our arrival. As we settled-up with the cab driver, we began to notice that no one was making a move to help with our luggage, so we got out, and gathered our things and headed up the steps that were covered with old, tattered red carpeting, and filled with debris and dirt. There was another bell person standing at the top of the steps, who at least had enough sense to greet us, but, not enough to hold the door open as we struggled with our luggage. This was the first indication of poor / lacking service. When we arrived at the check-in area, there was a family in front of us already at the counter, and only one person working behind the entire reception desk. There was another, very tall bell person (and perhaps a second person) working with this group, and making over them as though they were the First Family, while nearly knocking us over. At one point, the tall bell person kind of "kicked" my suitcase out of his way. This was the next indication of poor service. We immediately began wondering how these folks were getting so much attention, while it seemed as if we had been erased already. We even discussed among ourselves, who these people might be. Eventually a second reception desk person came from the back office, greeted us, and began our check-in process. He was very nice to us. He welcomed us to the City, and informed us that we were being upgraded to the â€œPresidential Suiteâ€� (not really Presidential). Since I was already a little perturbed, this news was very welcomed, and helped to take the edge off the two or three snubs we had just experienced. The clerk told us the elevators were behind us and that our suite was in the first towerâ€¦again, not offering any assistance with luggage or anything that a guest checking into the â€œPresidential Suiteâ€� might expect; or that we had witnessed the other group receive. We were on our ownâ€”another indication of poor service. When we arrived at our suite, prominently located at the end of the hall, there was a large placard beside the double door, reading: â€œGov. Huey P. Long Suiteâ€�. In that instant, we were very happy, and anticipating what we would find behind the double doorâ€”it had to make up for the heretofore lackluster service. We were not disappointed at first. It was huge. You could not even determine the end of it when you first walked in. It felt like a luxury apartment in the middle of Manhattan. Then my nose took over, and all I could smell was mildew. I never could tell where the smell was coming from. There was also mustiness in the entire suite; but, as long as the 2 separate a/c units remained on, the smell was only slight. Seeing that it was about the cocktail hour, we pretty much dropped off our luggage after â€œooing and awingâ€� for a few minutes, and headed down to the Sazerac Barâ€”which is absolutely beautiful. There are huge murals on the walls which tell the story of Louisiana, and New Orleans (and own up to All the cityâ€™s historyâ€”including slavery and ill treatment of African Americans which occurred in the City). We were really excited about the bar because we had seen it on perhaps HGTV, and it is pretty renownedâ€”and ordered â€œspecial of the Houseâ€� drinks off the menu. I had a Ramos Gin Fiz. It was not good. There was more egg white in it than anything else. I shared my displeasure with the waitress, but, she didnâ€™t care. She didnâ€™t offer to fix another drink, or to take it off the billâ€”still another indication of poor service. We didnâ€™t return to that bar again. We didnâ€™t feel exactly welcomed in there anyway. Perhaps they meant to send the message that we were not really wanted there--I'm not sure. They weren't getting anymore of my money, anyway. But, the contractors were there in the lobby setting up the Christmas decorations at this same time. They were all very pleasant and welcoming to us. We even noted that the people setting up the Christmas trees were nicer to us than the hotel staff! (Decorations are over the topâ€”in a good way! The only bad thing is they are old and dankâ€”they need to get new, fresh decorations). Then we went exploring around the hotelâ€”we went up to the pool area, which was totally empty, and restaurants and other public areasâ€”they were all nice enough. We went to the Besch Restuarant, and the people were warm and inviting there. I understand they are only a tenant in the hotel. Maybe that explains the difference in treatment and ambiance. Finally, we returned to the Suite. This is when we discovered the TV remote controls did not work. We tried different things to make the remotes work, but, they were just not going to cooperate. Finally, I called down to the front desk, and asked them to come and fix the remotes (I really thought something was wrong with the TVs). You could see the wires hanging behind the TV in the living room as if someone had been working on it, but, didn't put the cables back in their "hidden" state. By the time a young maintenance man arrived, I was in the bedroom lying across the bed. The maintenance man could not get the remotes to work, either. I asked him to change the batteries in the remotes, which he initially refused to do (poor customer service). At one point the remote finally made the TV power-on. The maintenance man indicated they were working now. When he handed me the remote I tried to operate the TV, it still did not work. He took it back from me and said: â€œyes, it works; you just have to stand next to the TVâ€�. Eventually, he agreed to go and get new batteries for the remotes. As he warmed up to us, (over the hour or so that he and another maint man were there), he eventually admitted that there was an ongoing issue with the (Lodge Net) remotes functioning properly in the hotel. He also pointed out that we were not getting any of the premium channels we were paying for. So, for 6 days, we had to â€œjust stand next to the TVâ€� in order for the remotes to workâ€”both in the living room and the bedroom; and we didn't see HBO, or all the other premium channels that we paid for. Are you feeling Presidential yet? I just know that if I were the manager at this hotel, there would be a standing directive that I be notified immediately if the tenants in the Presidential Governor Huey P. Long Suite are complaining about ANYTHING. But, we never saw or heard from a manager, until the end. But, wait. This is nothing. When we went to bed in the wee hours, we realized there were three smoke detectors in the unit. We knew this because the detectors blinked, in unison, bright white light, like the strobe lights on an airport runway. WE could not sleep at ALL. I called down about 7AM in the morning to complain about this (we went out and partied, and didnâ€™t return until the wee hours!!!). The clerk at the front desk said: â€œno one has ever complained about this beforeâ€�. As if to imply: â€œ...so, why are you complaining?â€� An hour later maintenance men came with a ladder, and sarcastically asked us what we wanted them to do about it. We asked them to put tape over each of the detectors strobe lights (duh); and that's what they did, but, only after acting like they were being inconvenienced first. Of course, this was during the daylight hours, and they were not the ones trying to sleep with intense strobe lights blasting their eyes out in the middle of the night. They only did a half-witted job of covering the strobe light smoke detectors, and the lights were always annoying, even with the tape. And still no manager!!! I made another call that morning to Room Service. I explained that I had read on the Roosevelt Hotel website that since the hotel didnâ€™t provide coffee makers in each room, they provided complementary coffee upon request. I asked the lady on the other end of the phone if she could deliver our complementary coffee. She told me: â€œYou better go and read the website again. This hotel donâ€™t give away no free coffeeâ€�. Well, upon my return home, I took the young ladyâ€™s advice and did go and read the hotelâ€™s website again. And in fact, under the Q&A section, it clearly states, the hotel will provide coffee at no charge. So, my suggestion would be that the hotelâ€™s employees go back and read the website. I would also like a refund for all the coffee we bought from the hotel bakery shop. At a point, after you are so frustrated, and disappointed, nothing is going to be right. Even if it is right, it will not be right. We reached that point with the remotes, and the number of complaints we had already lodged on just the 2nd day of our vacation, with absolutely no communication from the hotelâ€™s management. Here are some of the other issues: no waste basket in bedroom, radio (which they brag about on the website) did not workâ€”it was not even plugged in when we arrived, so they knew it wasnâ€™t working before we got thereâ€”there was no clock in the unit as a result, live plants had layers of dust on the leaves, and had yellowing and brown leaves, drapes dragged the floor and were difficult to open and close, they brought us dirty champagne glasses and carried them in their hands (as opposed to on a tray, like you would think they would), they were extremely stingy with towels and face cloths, even after requesting more, they never cleaned the bathroom for 6 daysâ€”only replaced towels, if we asked maid service to come back later (after showing up at 8:30AM), they wouldnâ€™t come back at all, we only had turn-down service once in 6 days, they never vacuumed the carpet in the bedroomâ€”there were rocks and mud on the floor for the entire 6 days we were there, we had to beg them to change the sheets on the bed, and even then, they only changed the sheets and didnâ€™t clean up, there was only one robe for two people (and one size does not fit all), you had to pay for internet service (even in the Presidential Suite), desk blocked the walkway in the living room (we figured because the hotel was too cheap to drop an internet line in a location that would have been better suited for a desk than the hallway), old windowsâ€”even on the 11th floor, the suite was extremely noisy (and cold near windows) from outside city noise (if they brag about a multi-million dollar renovation, they should have done it correctly), my pet peeveâ€”they did not have a plastic liner for the ice bucket, and it was a major problem for them to bring one, after we requested it, they wiped out the used / dirty drinking glasses in the room and put them back on the shelf as if to suggest they were clean and ready for re-use (I guess that's how they prepared them for us in the first place), and although the shower stall had 4 shower heads, you had to use one head to prop=up the other head so that you could use itâ€”otherwise, they were limp and just fell over. After we got over the initial "awe factor" of the Suite, we started to realize it was ust not clean, and we were therefore never really comfortable in it. Any interaction we had with staff was categorically not pleasant, with a few exceptions at the Besch Resturant and in the Deli shop. Staff was either condescending or pompus; or both. On the day of check-out, I arose early. A cleaning lady had already entered the Suite by 7AM saying she was sorry--that she thought we had checked out already. I went to the front door and saw the bill had been slipped through. Upon inspection, I realized there was a big problem with the charges. Instead of our bill being X, it was nearly 3X! Needless to say there was a major disagreement at the front desk that morning. After speaking with a young man at the front desk who represented himself as the hotel manager and who has evidently never been to a customer service course in his entire short life, David Simonis eventually came out, and was at least professional, although not friendly. (This is where orchestra plays "grand entrance" flourish) He eventually agreed to fix the problem with the bill after we passed a few words and he realized the fault was that of the hotelâ€™s; and after he destroyed any hope that we might remember our stay at the Roosevelt fondly. Itâ€™s too bad that no one ever told him the customer is always right, especially when you are paying for luxury, "Waldorf Astoria" treatment. His attitude was condescending, and dismissive. All things considered, this hotel added absolutely nothing to the enjoyment of our vacation. Any positive memories we took away were a result of us deciding we would not be deterred from having a good time by the poor experience at this hotel. On the positive side, we felt safe at the Roosevelt. But, if you are seeking a luxury experience, try the Ritz Carlton, across the street. None of these things would have happened over thereâ€”a manager would have been up to that suite after the first complaint to the front desk, making sure all problems were resolved immediately; and I certainly would not have had to argue with an early morning manager about a bill at the Ritz. If I wanted to argue over a bill, I would have never made reservations at what I thought was a luxury brand. We checked in to the Roosevelt because our home away from home is an integral part of our vacation experience. We were made to believe the Roosevelt would deliver on these expectations and thus enhance our vacation experience. We agreed to pay more, because we expected moreâ€”we didnâ€™t get what we paid for.

Reviews.Title: “Five star rooms, two star service”
Reviews.Author: JPax
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt for the second time since the re-branding and renovation. The hotel is beautiful. The rooms are very spacious and comfortable. The service is still disappointing. Upon arrival, we were approached by the bellman who seemed less than thrilled that we were arriving. I asked the bellman to bring in my ice chest. Without even looking to see what type of ice chest, he immediately said that I was not allowed to have an ice chest. He stated that guest with ice chest tend to do a great deal of damage at the hotel. Never mind that it was a very small ice chest big enough to hold insulin and the lunch that we consumed on the drive. We were reasonably well dressed for a six hour drive and we drive a luxury vehicle (we do not look like thugs at 50 years of age). This was the pervasive attitude with most employees.
