The waiter at Teddy's was surly. Room service was unavailable on our day of departure. After calling room service multiple times, they finally answered only to tell me breakfast would take at least an hour. She was not pleasant. We ate at the Sazerac buffet. It was good and the server was nice, but he was very amateurish. On a positive note, the front desk attendant at arrival was extremely friendly. John Besh's restaurant, Domenica, is excellent with good service although not part of the hotel. I never see management. I now think the indifferent service is a refection of management. If you want luxury, you can do much better with the Ritz Carlton, Windsor Court, Loew's, Monteleone, Royal Orleans--to name a few. Only stay here if you get a killer rate.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: MrsClasssyChris
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here. We enjoyed our stay. The location is near bourbon and close to nice stores for shopping and anything else u might want to do. Our room was amazing. Clean and comfy. The bathroom was nice wiith vanity and tv. Will be returning here.

Reviews.Title: “a trip back in time”
Reviews.Author: omni98
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Roosevelt for 5 days . The hotel has been beautifully brought back to it's grandure , staff is proffesional , beds are to die for. The rooms are a bit on the small side & no tub in our bathroom but the shower was new & fancy .I would definitely stay there again !

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: itisandy
Reviews.Content: Best hotel in NOLA. Park across the street and save yourself $20. Very romantic place to spend a weekend. The rooftop pool is great and so is the restaurant. The deluxe king (suite) is very spacious and comfy. Going back for Christmas as they decorate it like no other.

Reviews.Title: “Great Christmas Decorations and Great Service”
Reviews.Author: broadcast9
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt because my wife was interested in the Christmas decorations. One of my clients informed me that he used to go down as a child to the Roosevelt to see them. They did not disappoint. The only downside of the decorations was that there was a constant stream of people going through the lobby. We had a king room which was a bit on the small side. Not much room for our bags or to move around. Despite its small size it worked out well. The bedding was plush and both my wife and I slept great. The shower had multiple levels of shower heads- and once you figured out how it worked, it worked great. I found myself taking longer showers because of it. Service was exemplary. The room was cleaned regularly without the common need for service people knocking on the door asking when they could clean. (I hate that). The turndown service was nice especially given how busy we were. I definately recommend going to both the Sazarac bar and the Domenica restaurant. While I only had takeout from Delmonica (porchetta panini and roast chicken panini) both were excellent. Location is right off Canal a little north of Bourbon. You don't really want to spend much time north of the hotel- but any other direction seemed fine.

Reviews.Title: “A holiday or any day delight”
Reviews.Author: Allen727286
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed the first weekend of Dec. Beautifully decorated. Wonderfully staffed: they are engaging; ready to address any need, problem, challenge. Very impressive. Not just service oriented, but connect with you personally. Suite was outstanding. Although we had always stayed in the quarter, this Location on the edige is great. Great food/drink/service/room. This is a great historic New Orleans hotel. Take some time and ask about it while you are there.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in a great town!”
Reviews.Author: RYB_11
Reviews.Content: I stayed recently at the Roosevelt with a group of friends. The superior rooms we got were excellent and quite spacious. The location is also excellent. Walking distance to the French Quarter and to the Superdome as well. Some of the charges are excessive, like the $50 valet parking fee, and the room service delivery fee, but overall, the hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “Impressive”
Reviews.Author: LikesAShadyBeach
Reviews.Content: We reserved the Roosevelt at a Papa Noel rate for our first anniversary. We live near NOLA and had heard only good things about the hotel. Everyone was right. It is a special hotel. The lobby was decorated for the holidays and lovely, although creating a lot of congestion with the picture takers and perusers. Our room was a deluxe king in tower 2. It was both the most lovely room I've ever stayed in and the tiniest, with seemingly massive furnishings. It all fit, with a path around the room, but no room to spare which was fine for us. The bed was deliciously comfortable. The bathroom had a shower only, which is a minus for me, and next time I'll be specific about room with a bathtub. We had PJ's coffee at Teddy's Cafe and breakfast at the Sazerac restaurant, which was of course nice and pricey. Valet parking is $40. It was perfect for our special occassion and we definitely look forward to another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Staff a cut above”
Reviews.Author: Shreveportspoon
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights over Thanksgiving in a luxurty suite at the hotel. The suite was very nice, but the service from the hotel is what exceeded our expectations. My husband forget a few articles of clothing in a drawer when we checked out. When we called to check if they found it, we were immediately connected w/ secuirty which checked their computer, Yes, it had been found; they sent it to us via UPS the next day. The service our entire stay was always prompt, courteous and better than we expected.

Reviews.Title: “So much fun in the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: captainhook8486
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spend a wonderful week in New Orleans in Oct. What a fantastic time. We stayed at the beautiful Roosevelt Hotel on Baronne street. This property is without a doubt the finest hotel in down town New Orleans. Everything was new and clean and restored to its formal glory. World class food and service with the exception of the help and staff in the coffee shop. These guys had a real attitude and we heard several other guests complaining about them. The good news is there is a Star Bucks just one block toward the river. The Roosevelt right across Canal street from the French Quarter. We walked to the French Market for Breakfast in the morning. We caught the Garden District trolley right outside the front door of the hotel ($3.00 for a full day pass) We listened to the street musicians. (Our favorite was a seven piece band call Skinny Tuba) We ate great food every night. There is so much to do in this lovely town. We just had a blast. The Roosevelt is expensive but given its location and its true class style it is worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: BrodieThomson
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Roosevelt for Thanksgiving for two nights. We had a great room and the service was excellent. Beautiful decoration and decor throughout. We expected it to be really good based on recommendation from a friend and it absolutely met or exceeded our expectations. Verty happy and satisified.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: BoonieWills
Reviews.Content: This is a great place with solid service and beautiful rooms. Every time we went out and mentioned where we were staying people mentioned how nice this hotel is. They were right! We loved our stay here and will be here when we return. Book in advance and it will be the same price as placed much less appealing.

Reviews.Title: “First Trip Back Since Katrina”
Reviews.Author: Chewman
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Roosevelt in it's former life as the Fairmont several times, the last being in December 2004. Going back, and expecting things to be different, I was surprised that some things were different, and many were not. Both these situations were pleasing. The incredible visual treat of the Roosevelt, walking into the lobby, it felt like I stepped back in time. I stayed there in late October and early November this year. I just missed the Christmas decorations, but even without them it is a beautiful place. The restaurants are still great, and the ability to sit comfortably in the lobby and wait for friends or read a book and get something from the very nice "to-go" coffee bar is a nice touch. The staff is incredible. Everyone was very helpful, they went out of their way to do whatever they could whenever I asked. And I mean everyone, housekeeping, to valet, to wait staff, front desk, and on and on. The room was completely redone, and it was beautiful. Everything was very clean and worked well. I understand there are a number of very nice hotels in NOLA, but when I return I will definitiely return to The Roosevelt.

Reviews.Title: “A truly excellent hotel and experience - Nostalgic and Elegant”
Reviews.Author: nytraveler4biz
Reviews.Content: One of the most spectacular historic renovations I've ever seen - the hotel is as nice as any Four Seasons or Ritz Carlton with some truly nice touches. Hotel lobby has a number of historic placards and antiques. Restaurants have a great vibe. Christmas decorations are over the top. If you're interested in an elegant five star hotel with a great historical feel, this is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely bygone era - but expensive”
Reviews.Author: TravlChick
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Roosevelt twice in the past year, January 2011 and November 2011. Both times we were upgraded to a suite due to my Hilton status. The suites themselves are beyond comparison - huge, with large living rooms, extra bathroom, walk in closet, and pure luxury. Really quite nice and way beyond a typical room. The hotel is a classic, elegant hotel that is a throwback to a bygone era. Both of the times that we were there, the Christmas decorations were up and that adds to the enchantment. Surprisingly the staff are not of the stature of the hotel itself, other than the concierge. Other hotels of this time in New York and Europe generally have more mature staff that have been at the hotel for a while. The staff I have encountered are polite but generally young. The gym is of decent quality - 4 elipticals, 2 treadmills and some bikes. They also have a leg press machine, an array of dumbells, and a cable machine. It won't provide a solid weight workout but the cardiovascular machines are top rate. The biggest issue with this hotel is that everything about it is expensive, from the coffee bar to the Sazerac bar to the valet parking. If you are on a budget, park at the lot next door. Valet parking is $40 per night. Food and drink costs are more like a New York City grande hotel than a New Orleans one. The hotel is located in a great place - we don't like to stay in the French Quarter but it is quite close to both the quarter and also the central business district. Stay here if you want an elegant experience, but be prepared to pay for it.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great ambiance”
Reviews.Author: Jeannie C
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been lovingly restored, with period furnishings. It is truly lovely. And the location was great - just on the other side of Canal St. from the French Quarter, so it was significantly quieter than those in the Quarter. Service, without exception, was excellent - friendly, , knowledgeable, helpful and polite. I was lucky enough to attend a conference at the Roosevelt. The conference price for delegates' rooms was a bargain, and they also only charged me the reduced rate for extra days that I stayed !! So I asked if an upgrade was available for my entire stay - for $22 per night, I was switched from a Deluxe room to a Superior room - which was twice the size with a living area and walk-in closet !!! Just beware that some of the bathrooms, although fully fitted out (even with a TV), are tiny.

Reviews.Title: “Step back in time”
Reviews.Author: Mary W
Reviews.Content: Restoration is wonderful. Staff was helpful and welcoming. Vrry friendly. Great location. Resturants and bar are nice. Rooms are on on thr smallar zide. But they are nice. Yo ok have to remember this is a older hotel.

Reviews.Title: “OUTSTANDING HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Artyscott
Reviews.Content: Read several reviews on here of poor service in the past...I think they must have stayed in a different hotel! ALL of the staff were very friendly and courteous from the receptionist at checkin to the turndown maid at bed time! I must say, please go talk to the concierge..Don, I believe was FANTASTIC! This was our first trip to NOLA and he steered us toward some really neat spots in the french quarter...I would definitely check with them before you make any plans. The hotel was beautiful...you can tell that the company did a great job recovering from Katrina. Again, I give this hotel 5 stars!

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed...”
Reviews.Author: Fireflyfarm
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed. When you spend $350/night on a hotel you expect a certain level of service. Unfortunately, it was not to be had at The Roosevelt. Positives: the hotel is beautiful. The Sazerac bar is everything you expect. The location is very convenient. Negatives: cold water. We didn't have hot water in the shower. It was barely like warm. Just barely tolerable for a quick shower. We reported the problem twice in a 3 day stay. I don't think anything was ever done. Not sure anyone even came to the room to look at it. It was basically ignored. On our last day, check out is at noon. At 9:00 am housekeeping knocked on our door to see if we were gone. At 9:30 am, what appeared to be housekeeping management knocked on our door. When I answered she had a clipboard and a bad attitude. She literally asked me what time we would be gone. Horrible! I've never been glad to leave a hotel before.

Reviews.Title: “98% a Waldorf”
Reviews.Author: RappiToma
Reviews.Content: As Hilton Honors Gold members we have stayed in many Waldorfs and other luxury hotels around the world. We love this brand! This is a magnificent hotel - inside very historic and lush. The bed and pillows- always an indicator were very good. The room was clean. The best experiences in the hotel were two; The Concierge DON was great - he took the time and set us up in two great restautrants, (one which I will review) was one of the best dining experiences I have ever had. Now the nickpicks-- for a Waldorf the economy must be making the management pinch pennies. There was no coffee maker in the room---had to troop down to the first floor and buy coffee every morning--a Waldorf?! - really? -- cheap.. In addition, the maids seemed rushed and forgot to the refesh the room twice during the day and they were very stingy with the bottled water. Got two the first day, and then two on the fourth. The Szaerac Bar is very cool,. but again no-one in managment is thinking about profit margins- as the bar was always packed with people - so we skipped it. If the Bar had just put 6 more bar more chairs at the bar (there was plenty of room) they would recoup the cost in one hour. Additionally- get rid of the couches- they just take up space- and four more small tables could fit in. Lastly, on a finishing high note- the Blue Room Sunday Jazz Brunch was great- not crowded- great selection of food. Recommended. Rappi

Reviews.Title: “A Historic Hotel, but the rooms are overrated”
Reviews.Author: hhiguy
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a part of the Waldorf Astoria Hotels, which is the top tier of the Hilton Chain. The lobby area has been redone and is quite pleasant to look at. I have a problem with the rooms. The first room my wife and I were assigned to was extremely small, We could hardly move around. They put us in what they called an executive room next, This room was larger and contained a seating area. the bed was large and comfortable and we slept well. I was part of a large group and was not able to do much in the way of expoloring the immediate area. I do know it is well situated to most of the major attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Class with a New Orleans Twist”
Reviews.Author: trippy0nes
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt has been beautifully renovated, plushly appointed, so rich in history. New Orleans is an experience one cannot describe completely with words. See it, smell it, taste it, hear it. Feel it's power through it's culture of music and style!

Reviews.Title: “Superb accommodation”
Reviews.Author: SAGlobetrotters
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been completely renovated since cyclone Katrina and is beautifully furnished. The best thing about the hotel was probably its location. It provides easy access to the French quarter, Bourbon street and the street cars - the St Charles streetcar is only one block away. There is a Walgreens on the corner. We went to the IHOP across the road on Canal Street for a cheap and filling breakfast. There is a charge for wifi. We stayed in a suite which was very spacious and had a sink and small fridge and dining table in the sitting area. There was a separate bedroom. Had dinner at their restaurant Domenica one night, as the night before dined in Bourbon Street and saw a violent fight right outside the restaurant which didn't feel very safe with our 18 month old. Domenica had not bad food for reasonable prices - had a happy hour until 6 with half price pizzas and drinks. Would recommend the Red Fish Grill not far away on Bourbon Street for dinner, especially their double chocolate bread pudding! Staff were very welcoming and accommodating. One day we brought our 18 month old back for a nap and the maid got another maid to help her so that they would clean up our room as quickly as possible. Concierge always very helpful. Only complaint was that the shower was unpredictable. Sometimes you would have a nice hot shower and other times you couldn't get it beyond luke warm. Took a long time to get the bath water running hot as well.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Property”
Reviews.Author: WLifeMan
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt New Orleans is a Waldorf Astoria Hotel and one gets that feel upon entering the building. It is beautiful. While I found the service to be lacking a bit for a hotel of this kind of reputation, it was nonetheless a wonderful stay. The food was excellent. The rooms nicely appointed, but the highlight was the beautiful architechture inside. Even if you decide on staying (probably due to price, as it is not inexpensive) it is worth a visit just to "peak inside". The clock in foyer is amazing for instance. The location is excellent, just off Canal Street. The staff is friendly even if not efficient.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful, "grande dame" hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: OtherJFK
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Roosevelt New Orleans for only one night. I wish I could have stayed longer, but business trips can be like that. The hotel upgraded me to a king suite (thanks to Hilton Honors) which consisted of a good-sized living room, bar/hallway and big king bedroom. The bathroom had a small wall-mounted TV which was a nice touch. Everything in the room was very clean, nicely appointed, etc. They have a nice turn-down service. The lobby is beautiful. The coffee shop off the lobby is great. The catering staff at the two events I attended during my conference were great. All in all a great stay at a great hotel. My only complaint is not with the hotel, but the city. I'm over New Orleans. Walking out of the hotel within a block I was hit up by panhandlers and berated for not giving them money. The city feels very threatening. I only go when I have to, but if I have to go back I'll stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Just Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: BeckyPlummerLafLA
Reviews.Content: We heard about the $150 million dollar renovation at this historic hotel formerly called "the fairmont"; but originally The Roosevelt; the famous hang-out of Huey P. Long, the colorful former Governer of Louisiana......the hotel is 1/2 block off Canal and 2 blocks from Bourbon Street; walking distance to the Riverwalk, Aquarium, Harrah's, etc. From the moment you arrive, you know you're in "Naw'lins"....the "smallest" room is really small; go up to the 2 queens room at a minimum; it's the size of normal hotel room and is beautifully decorated. we had a wonderful view of canal street with huge windows. robes & slippers are provided for extra comfort. The hotel is just beautifully renovated. There's a really nice coffee & sweet shop in the lobby; in the morning they have danish and other breakfast yummies; at night they have luxurious desserts. We ate at Domenica, John Besh's Italian restaurant.....have the buckwheat pasta with italian sausage; absolutely one of the best italian dishes EVER.....also at the Sazerac inside the hotel....definitely 5-star; the good was beyond anything i've had before. it is quite expensive; but they have a "pre fixe" menu of $30 for 3 courses. it was worth every penny and we ate every morsel. they allowed me to substitute a salad for the appetizer offering; which was not on the "pre fixe" menu. the service was outstanding. Our entire experience at The Roosevelt was beyond anything I would expect. It is quite expensive; however, for a "splurge" definitely would recommend The Roosevelt in NEW ORLEANS. Pets allowed for a fee.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: jenleeparker
Reviews.Content: Well situated, friendly and helpful staff. Has a wonderful roof terrace with a pool and bar. Beautiful rooms, spotlessly clean and the bed was very comfortable. Only complaint was that there was no coffee making facilities in the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Modern convenience wrapped around Southern hospitality”
Reviews.Author: JonnyHei
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is well situated to access the French Quarter as well as downtown New Orleans. From the moment our taxi arrived to the morning we departed, we felt like the hotel staff was looking out for us without being pressured. The rooms are quiet, spacious and ours included a comfy sofa and deep bed. One minor complaint was weak water pressure in the shower. The gym is well ventilated but cramped and a little boring (e.g. no windows). Drinks at the Sazerac Bar were delectable and served cold. John Besh's Domenica restaurant located off the lobby served up refined-rustic-Italian (nee Tuscan) cooking. The food was excellent and flavorful, a nice escape from the de rigueur of heavy southern food. Although we didn't explore the Guerlain Spa, it is humongous and accessible from inside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED The Roosevelt hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: ontheroadalot_Canada
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to stay at The Roosevelt hotel in New Orleans during the week leading up to Mardi Gras, and it was fantastic!! We were with a large convention and thoroughly enjoyed it. It was a business trip and pleasure trip for our family - my husband, me, and our daughter who turned 4 the week before the trip. From the moment we arrived we were in awe. The lobby is simply gorgeous, with some interesting history e.g. the Paris Exhibition Clock, the Blue Room - every time we walked in we were in awe of the beauty. Next, check in, which went quite quickly for our large group. We arrived very late at night and I think there was extra staff on duty because of the size of our group because most hotels would not have so many people working the front desk so late. The staff were all very friendly and efficient, and although some people in our group had mix ups with their rooms e.g. not getting a suite as requested, or getting a somewhat small room for a family of four, we couldn't have been more pleased with our room. It was beautiful and large - we seemed to have been given one of the larger rooms with a large bathroom and large walk in closet. The bathroom had a fabulous tub, great shower, double sinks with a large vanity and a large mirror - perfect for getting ready for our big events. And the toilet was in it's own little space on the side with it's own door for additional privacy. The beds, 2 king sized, were extremely comfortable with piles of super comfy pillows which thrilled me because I am picky about my pillows and like to have at least 2 or 3. We all slept wonderfully in the beds, it was quite possibly the best we've ever slept. In the main room there was a large desk with chair, 2 king sized beds, bedside tables, a large tv stand/dresser and another long end table, plus a bench at the end of each bed and yet there was still tons of room to move around/for our daughter to play. The view from our room was a roof below - not great. But we weren't there to stay in our room looking out the window so we didn't care too much. We really appreciated the heavy curtains on the windows, they were like blackout blinds, because they kept the bright sun out which meant our daughter slept in to a decent time in the mornings and had no trouble falling asleep for her afternoon naps. We also heard no outside noise when in our room. The location was ideal - so close to The French Quarter, right across from the street car station. I was worried about going out and about with my four year old by myself while my husband was working, but it was a breeze to get around using the trolleys as well as just walking e.g. to the French Quarter, the aquarium, shops etc. The one place I was not comfortable was at the McDonalds nearby - that whole area near it was somewhat sketchy and I do not recommend spending too much time in that area; it is only minutes from the hotel but what a difference only a couple of minutes can make!! The IHOP across the street was better, and ideal for our little one when we had a couple of morning meals on our own. The staff were amazingly friendly there but I will save that for another post. The beignets and coffee in the little cafe in the lobby were delicious! I wasn't a big fan of the Sazerac cocktail - a little too strong, not really my thing. We didn't try any of the real restaurants in the hotel, mostly because we found their hours to be inconvenient to our schedule, but the hotel catered the food for our banquets (which was most of our meals, including breakfast, lunch and dinner) and the food was unique and delicious, with great service too. The pool area was great, our daughter loved it. There was lots of room on the large patio and the pool and hot tub were both nice. Not a great view/ambience but again that wasn't important to our stay. We loved the nightly turn down service, complete with chocolates on our pillows, and also loved the morning paper and weather forecast which was always very accurate and thus helpful. The one complaint was that the insulation between the walls was inadequate. On our last two days/ nights we had a businessman staying next to us who was on constant business calls while in his room, and we could hear absolutely everything of his conversations loud and clear in our room. This really ruined our moods the last two days as he was up very early and on the phone most of the day which meant he woke us up, and also made nap time for our daughter tricky. If he had been beside us the whole 8 days it would have ruined our trip. Luckily the rest of the time we either had no one, or someone very quiet, next to us. When it came time to check out we discovered a fairly hefty phone charge on our bill, even though we had followed the calling card directions on the phone which should have made the calls free. Without any fuss, and in fact with an apology, the charges were immediately reversed when we expressed concern at the front desk. Great customer service! Our flight was not until quite late at night, and we were pleased that the hotel held all our bags in a secured back room for the day/evening after we checked out. Further, our daughter had a balloon animal made during one of the events, a large alligator, and the staff at the luggage desk took extra care of him to ensure that he was still in one piece when we came back - instead of putting him in the back room with the rest of the luggage they kept him at the desk with them so they could keep their eyes on him and make sure he didn't get popped. This meant the world to our little one! If I remember correctly the young man's name was Kevin who went above and beyond for us. He was unfortunately off shift by the time we left at night, but the next person was also very good and it took us no time at all to get all of our bags back and get a cab to the airport - it was the fastest turnaround time ever, from requesting our bags to getting into the taxi that he had called - we almost felt like celebrities getting whisked away via top priority service! And this was on a rainy night, yet the cab arrived in no time and the hotel staff loaded our bags into the car so fast I don't think they got a drop of rain on them! Overall this hotel was fabulous and we would highly recommend it. If we ever make it back to New Orleans, which we would love to, we would love to stay at this hotel again. The service was stellar, the decor was beautiful, the location was central, the food was delicious, the room was large and the beds were divinely comfortable. A+!

Reviews.Title: “Great place, no complaints here!!”
Reviews.Author: YO_Boracho
Reviews.Content: Stayed here weekend of the 21st. Got a king Suite, 12 floor, with great views. Upon arrival , which I was early, bell captain kept bags for me while I went in to the quarter for lunch. They called me when my room was ready. After checking in to room, bell captain had bags up in MINUTES!! Suite had 2 HDTV's which actually had HD CHANNELS, great bed, in room safe, and shower that you did not want to get out of. Hotel has First class dining and bar. It's a Waldorf property so bring credit card, checkbook and cash if you get my drift, all in all 5 stars from me!!

Reviews.Title: “Wasteful housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: cyclnbj
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is a very nice hotel with all amenities anyone could ask for. I was disappointed in the non-concern for the environment though. Housekeeping removed towels, a wash cloth and the floor mat after only one use. They probably changed the sheets but I couldn't tell. While I was out for dinner, they performed the bed turn-down service. This is nice and I like having a bite of chocolate before going to bed, BUT the AC temperature in my room was adjusted too low, my TV was turned on, as well as the lights. There is no need for this. AND, after my morning towel was removed I had hung another one near the shower. This towel was unused but removed by housekeeping in the evening when my bed was turned down. UGH!! Disappointing that the Roosevelt Hotel obviously does not consider the environment when performing their housekeeping practices.

Reviews.Title: “Well appointed hotel but needs better cleaning staff”
Reviews.Author: layla6202
Reviews.Content: My spouse and I recently visited New Orleans for the first time in October 2011. When I made the reservation for The Roosevelt I made a note on the online check-in that it was our first time and we were hoping for a memorable experience and booked a superior room. Upon arrival at the hotel, my spouse and I were given an upgrade to a large suite, which was huge, well-appointed, and well beyond our expectations; it had a double door entry way, marble floors, bar, living room, hallways, bath, and separate bedroom - when I say huge, I am talking one bedroom apartment size suite. Everything you could think of was provided: toothbrushes, loofahs, robes, bottled water, shoe shine rags...more stuff than one could ever use. The downside one might ask? The cleaning staff could have done a better job. The bathroom lights had long, possibly female, hairs trailing off them, the very large sunken tub had smaller, black (pubic?) hairs in it. I brought this to the attention of the front desk before we went our exploring the city, with hopes it would be taken care of while we were out, and we were assured it would be. When we returned to our room much, much later that evening, we were surprised to see a nice hand-written note from the front desk clerk apologizing for the inconvenience and two complimentary hotel breakfast coupons inside as an added bonus which was great. What was not great? The bathroom still had the hair - it never did get cleaned. Had we been staying more than one night, I would have been more apt to have complained again, but as it was, we got a few hours sleep and checked-out the next morning. Would I stay again? Possibly. The hotel, it's character, charm, location and amenities were fabulous. But I'd make sure my room was clean before paying over $450 a night again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: RI_Jehanne
Reviews.Content: I had a lovely weekend at this hotel. I loved the peace and quiet offered at this property. I also enjoyed that the location is so close to the hustle and bustle of the busy downtown area and public transportation. The staff was very accommodating. My only regret was that the room only had a shower and didn't have a bathtub. The bed was by far one of the most comfortable ever & the blackout curtains the best! I was traveling with a large group of family and friends and did not hear a single complaint from anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mhoffman821
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay!! Very elegant hotel. Great food, service, and staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but.......”
Reviews.Author: Heatherog1245
Reviews.Content: Hotel was beautiful, clean, and great location. With that being said, kinda strange to say I won't be back!!!! NOLA is known for people to come and have a good time, well maybe the staff should try to relax a little, they were all a little "stuffy" with no personality. We never once felt comfortable in this hotel. I would have much rather stayed in a Motel 6 than to feel like everyone too good to simply carry on a conversation. The valet people were way too eager to help which was nice but got on my nerves you couldn't walk by them without 2-3 of them trying to take something from you, calm down!!! Staff should all go on a retreat to learn to act human, theres no way everyone there is really that stuffy!!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, would go again for a Personal Trip”
Reviews.Author: KatWomanNYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roosevelt Hotel in late September for a work event. I am from NYC and small hotel rooms are the norm, so this cozy room at the Roosevelt was not unfamiliar. The staff were impressive right from the front door where I was assisted with my luggage to the reception area where I checked in to the hotel staff who handled my turn down service with a robe and slippers placed for my use as well as a shoe shine try and laundry details. This was a work conference so most meals were handled by the hotel. I must say, the seafood gumbo served at the awards dinner was amazing!! For a hotel feeding about 400 people that night, I was pleasantly surprised and I went back for seconds (buffet style). The hotel gumbo was much better than the gumbo at a local bistro the night prior. I have already put this hotel on my list to use for a personal trip.

Reviews.Title: “Historic elegance in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: delpha_
Reviews.Content: I spent the weekend in New Orleans with three girlfriends, and we were able to get a double room with an adjoining suite at the Roosevelt as home base for our eating and drinking adventures. The location is fantastic - just far enough away from the madness of Bourbon but still an easy walk to anywhere you want to be in the Quarter. The hotel lobby is beautiful, and service was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Would go again in a heartbeat”
Reviews.Author: la-rick
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in many New Orleans hotels, but none better than the Roosevelt. The room was well appointed, everything was extremely clean and the service was extraordinary. We were in what was probably the least expensive room -- not any larger than you'd find in a Holiday Inn or Marriott. But it was worth the extra money. The only negative was no in-room coffee. This is a Waldorf Astoria property, so be prepared to pay. . . but it't worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Historic property”
Reviews.Author: BarbNY
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is one of the oldest hotels in New Orleans. It's a great location and the rooms are nice. We were lucky to get a suite with a living room and 1 full and 1 half bath. Note that these suites are only available in tower one. My only reservation about this hotel is the service. We moved rooms and were told that morning that our bags would be moved to the new room. Upon returning at 3pm no one knew where are bags were. They were found in our original room which obviously had not been cleaned yet. Finally the bags arrived. Otherwise, it was a great facility.

Reviews.Title: “Old charm right in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: Michael A
Reviews.Content: First off, the rooms are a bit "cozy", but that can be expected with a hotel that dated. But it makes up for it 50x over with the service, the amenities, and the concierge that will get you anywhere you want to see (read, Katrina) if your heart desires. Got us car service to and from the Superdome and somehow missed traffic both ways. Booked thru AMEX Platinum so had the best breakfast you can find in a hotel on their dime, and were a very close distance to Bourbon Street. Only possible drawback is that there are way too many people per lounge chair at the pool. No matter; if you are going to New Orleans, the pool should not be your first priority. Will definitely stay there again on my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great historic property”
Reviews.Author: msgrits
Reviews.Content: This classic property offers a geat location, good staff and fabulous rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: MJB0404
Reviews.Content: I was very impressed with this hotel. We were upgraded to a suite that had 1 and a half baths and a lovely sitting room. The historic building was nice to explore. We enjoyed the Sazerac bar and the John Besh restaurant, Domenica. It's only a short walk to Bourbon Street as well.

Reviews.Title: “verry nice hotel but smaller room and a bit noisy and not a great gym”
Reviews.Author: TiGrasSt-Isidore
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roosevelt for 4 nights for a conference in September 2011. It is a very nice hotel with a nice lobby, nice rooms, comfortable rooms, bed was turned down every night. The food we ate over those 4 days was very good. I found the room a little small, especially the bathroom which was very small. There was no fan in the bathroom and the bathroom door was not staying open unless you kept it open with the closet door or the garbage can. The shower glass door looked cheap. Also the room was not well insulated for the noise. you could hear people talking in the other room and the corridor. The gym had a lot of cardio machine but the was only 2 weight machine and dumbells so not great to do weight. There was no sauna and the the whirlpool was near the pool on the 4th floor instead of near the gym on the lobby floor. The elevators were not quick, we used mainly the stairs since we wereonly on the 4th floor.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel but not 4 or 5 stars”
Reviews.Author: chicagotravelgirl
Reviews.Content: It's all in what you expect. If I had the same experience at a Hampton Inn, I would not have cared because I would not expect turn down service. Also, they give you free breakfast and coffee at a Hampton. However, the Roosevelt is supposed to be BETTER than the Hampton Inn. This was not better. It was maybe as good as except at the Hampton you don't get charged through the nose for everything. This last week I stayed at the Roosevelt for a conference. The first room I had was lovely, seemed very clean, and spacious. At turn down they gave me slippers, chocolates, the weather forecast, and a robe which was very nice. However, I noticed a small ant on the bed when I went to sleep the first night. I got up, got dressed, and went to my conference. Later in the morning I stopped in my room. The left side of the bed had about 30-40 tiny ants crawling all over it. I told the maid who called maintenance right away. When I came back later, the room stank of pesticides. The windows don't open so I asked for another room. They transferred me to another room and gave me a free bottle of wine. Sounds like they handled it ok right? However, the new room was not the same. The new room had a bathroom so tiny that they had to put the clean towels outside in the closet. Do you think to look in the closet (which is not right next to the bathroom) for towels? Me neither. Also, I had to put all my toiletries on the floor. The maid kept stacking them precariously on a tiny shelf that they had glasses on every day when she cleaned. When my husband arrived (they knew I expected him), the situation was worse in the bathroom. This maid tossed chocolates on the bed (almost fell off every day) and never gave us slippers or a robe. To add insult to injury, in the coffee shop, I waited in long lines every day for extremely expensive and very slow service. Finally, one day I waited, evidently behind the wrong people, in the wrong spot, and the guy waited on people that just walked up first - completely ignoring us (the counter is not very long so there is no way he could have not noticed us). I got so mad that I stormed out and found a nearby McDonalds. Which while a bit skanky - I recommend - it's right around the corner on Canal, WILDLY cheaper and WAY faster. Finally as we were leaving the room, another maid (this was not the maid that did my turn down or lack thereof) was getting berated loudly by another maid or supervisor outside our room. Not sure what's going on here but it's clearly not 4 or 5 star service. Just poor management.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & staff!”
Reviews.Author: Joshua H
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel quite a few time in the last few months and have never been short of stunned at the attention and personal touch the staff offers at every encounter. I've been lucky enough to be upgraded a couple of times to a suite, and these are definitely worth looking into if you are in NoLa for more than one night - you can spread out and relax easily in luxury. The beds are also excellent here and the room service is fantastic - make sure you eat at Domenica, John Besh's restaurant on the ground floor of the hotel. Excellent food and atmosphere! The only cons are the same disadvantages every New Orleans (and any other metro city hotels for that matter) have: Expensive parking. However, the Roosevelt has an excellent and very speedy valet staff!

Reviews.Title: “Class Exemplifed”
Reviews.Author: daves_32
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in the Roosvelt for a total of five nights over two business stays. The long opulent and historic hallway leads to a seamless check-in process. They make the guests feel like they are at home. I have stayed in the Deluxe room and Superior Room (both one King bed). The Superior room is huge (maybe 600 square feet or more) and may even be a little too big. No one could sleep on the couch so with a maximum of two people on the King bed, it is almost wasted space. However, it is cool to have a big room. The room and bathroom are impeccably clean. There is a television in the bathroom so I could watch Sportscenter in the morning through the glass shower doors. The soaps are from Ferragamo and smell really nice (like cologne, not some overly fruity orange ginger or some other generic hotel smell). There is turndown service at dinner time, including chocolate on the pillows, a card describing the next day's weather, and a complimentary shoe shine if one so desires. The one downside is the bed is really too soft. If you are used to a firm bed, you might struggle adjusting to the bed. Other than that, the hotel is excellent. Ask for Tower 2, which looks onto another building rather than overlooking the street. This will save you some noise! The hotel is less than three blocks from Bourbon Street and just a few minute walk from my favorite restaurant in New Orleans: Mr. B's Bistro on Royal St.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely visit in the Crescent City at The Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: French S
Reviews.Content: We had a nice weekend visit to the Cresent City in New Orleasns at The Roosevelt. It really takes you back in time with the gorgeous lobby area. Our upgraded suite was fabulous and the food was excellent. Location is good and accessible to the many city's attractions. A must stay when traveling to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: JenJamTX
Reviews.Content: I could have moved in! Our suite was large, comfortable and very well appointed with beautiful furnishings, two flat panel TVs, a comfy bed and 1.5 baths. The charge for upgrading to a suite was a bargain compared to similar hotels and worth every penny. Two couples in our group stayed in "regular" rooms and they were also very nicely appointed. The location is very convenient to everything. The service was excellent. The old, historic elevators were a bit slow, but that is the price you pay for the ambiance. The Sazerac Bar was like walking back in time, with yummy cocktails and comfortable seating. I've stayed in many hotels in N.O. and nothing has compared to the Roosevelt. We are already planning a return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous suite!”
Reviews.Author: pjgator
Reviews.Content: Definitely worth the splurge. We had a suite w/ a large living room, a bedroom and 1.5 baths that was immaculate and beautiful. The pool area is fantastic, and the spa is the best ever!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: GrkKookla
Reviews.Content: Hotel was conveniently located and very CLEAN! Great staff and rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: NancyPhoenix
Reviews.Content: Was here for a conference. Therefore, they offered us an excellent rate! Loved this location - everyone was extremely helpful with restaurant suggestions, etc. Concierge is extremely helpful here! Made most of our dinner reservations for us (for the nights that we didn't make in advance which I highly recommend). They have great dining options here as well. And, they have a great gym....a little small. But, you have to remember the age of the building, etc. Will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Fabulous Service”
Reviews.Author: Ok2BMe
Reviews.Content: Stayed for an extended weekend and was happy with the location, being without a car. The concierge was the best in recommending resturants where locals go, the Jazz Brunch on Sunday was excellent and Dominicos was another highlight!

Reviews.Title: “What do you mean you want US to make up YOUR bed???”
Reviews.Author: RMZR1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I came to the hotel for my birthday weekend. It's a gorgeous facility. The room was small but very nice. The location is great. However, $50 a night for parking is a little steep, don't you think? Hotels.com told me my reservation included breakfast buffet each day. The desk clerk said it did not. Basically, he hid behind the fact that "we don't control what they say". I forgot my HiltonHonors card and he said too bad again. He couldn't locate me in the system. On Saturday, My wife and I were out from 10AM until 5PM. We entered our room and were shocked to find that the room had not been made up. My wife called the front desk and they blew her off by saying that they were still making up our floor. Then, I called Guest Relations and asked for a manager. Instead of getting a manager, they asked me what was wrong and I told them. He said that I was supposed to call to REQUEST that my room be made up at a CERTAIN time. I couldn't believe that he thought this was normal. I finally waited on a "short hold" for about 10 minutes and then was connected to Adrianne (I'm not sure how to spell her name). She also thought that not making up my room was the norm. I just hung up on her. If this is standard procedure for this "upscale" hotel, then they're in big trouble. Am I wrong to expect to have my room made up sometime before 5PM or not? I don't think I am. I won't stay here again, not only because that type of service stinks, but more importantly because management thinks it's OK. Bad attitude, Roosevelt Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Very plush and good location”
Reviews.Author: eng2mksd
Reviews.Content: We stayed 6 nights for a conference that was being held in the hotel. The room was not large, but very plush with a flat screen TV. All the furnishings were of nice quality and the bed was very comfortable. I did learn about the sensor monitored mini bar and snacks. Within 10 seconds of moving an item, your room is billed. They removed the charge, but you cannot put any personal items in the refrigerator. There is turn down service where they bring you chocolates and fill your ice bucket. The bathroom was nice and large and if you are 7 feet tall, once you stepped under the shower door, you would find the shower head nicely placed above your head. I ate breakfast once in the coffee shop which was good and we tried the "signature" drinks, the Sazerac, in the bar. The pool is on the roof and very small so the water was very warm. We shared it with lots of young groups of people that were careless and left their cups all around the pool and in the bottom of the pool. There is a pool bar that took good care of us. The location is good for walking to most everything. Bourbon Street is just a few blocks and we walked to the Riverwalk as well. Besides being really hot and really humid, it was easy to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Historic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ajgtraveler
Reviews.Content: I stayed a the Roosevelt over the summer while in New Orleans for business. I choose to say at Roosevelt (though the Ritz Carlton was at the same rate through my work travel provider) due to the recommendations on trip advisor. I am a Hilton Gold member and was upgraded to a posh 1-bedroom suite and was very happy with the room. Service was great, I experienced no problems whatsoever and the staff was very friendly. Totally worth the money, spent!!

Reviews.Title: “You will NOT be disappointed by The Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: silvertravel
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Roosevelt, while dropping a student off at Tulane. I have no complaints about the experience, the property, the staff, or the value. This is a very old building, that has been renovated with great care and attention paid to detail, historic architecture, and modern conveniences expected by savvy hotel guests. The lobby is elegant, and bustles with activity day and night. The lighting, sound, and textures are all perfect for the period in which the building was originally built. You will find stone everywhere and (on the upper floors) hallways with more width than you ever see in todayâ€™s hotels as well as ceiling heights that make you feel like you are someplace very special. 2 comments â€“ NOT complaints: - Valet parking at the property is available, but very expensive (not by New York or LA standards â€“ but for New Orleans?). We self parked in the garage across the street. It was very close and convenient â€“ but I felt a just little uncomfortable walking the short distance back to the hotel on my own â€“ very late at night. It is not a real problem - and I would do it the same way again, for sure. - Iâ€™ve read other reviews about the room safes on the floor in the closets â€“ also a bit odd. I had no problem sitting on the closet floor to use the safe â€“ but thatâ€™s because I can. Travelers less able-bodied may find that task to be more discomfort than its worth. Iâ€™m sure the front desk would gladly lock up jewelry or other valuables, but maybe there is a better alternative location for the room safe? My guess is â€“ that management has determined that there is not another suitable location for the safes â€“ and maybe they are in better locations in other rooms? These 2 minor comments will NOT keep me from returning to the Roosevelt â€“ we had a very, very good experience there!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Palman13
Reviews.Content: Was going to New Orleans for some personal activities, had a reservation at another hotel but the Trip Advisor review was less than stellar, found The Roosevelt with good reviews at a slightly higher price and made reservation. The negative reviews related to service but found the service excellent and responsive. One weakness is the $48 valet fee but ended up parking next door for less than half the price and got lucky the 2nd night in a free space on the street directly across the street.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Flash1056
Reviews.Content: All aspects of my two night stay were perfect. The hotel lobby is the first clue you have that you are in an outstanding hotel. The rooms are spacious and quiet. Staff is helpful and friendly. The onsite restaurants were excellent. Location is great for French Quarter access as well as close to pickup points for the streetcars that can get you near attractions. Possibly the best hotel I've ever stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: MrsLeggett
Reviews.Content: For starters, this is one of the most, if not THE most beutiful hotel I have ever stayed in. It has recently been restored and is absolutely breaktaking as soon as you walk through the doors. When you stay at this hotel you feel taken care of. There were men with top hats who always opened the doors for us and of course the valet service was great. The red carpet that leads of the stairs into the hotel make you feel like you're royalty. I also loved the fact that this hotel was on Canal St. right across from the French Quater, making it very close to everything! Now, with all that being said, there is a reason I did not rate this Grand hotel an Excellent, a few reasons actually. First, the guestrooms did not come with refrigerators or microwaves. With a city where's there's food everywhere you are defintely going to need both and we were without either. You would think this type of hotel and with the prices a refrigerator and microwave should automatically be in each room. Both appliances were each $50 extra dollars for each night, ridiculous! Second, there is no complimentary breakfact of any kind with the price of your room. I don't understand why at these already expensive hotels, you even have to think about paying extra for this...it should be included as well in my opinion. So, with having two young little boys and having to go find breakfast every morning was a huge inconvenience as well as not having a microwave and refrigerator, which we sometimes used the mini bar to keep our drinks cold. But on a positive note, I did love that the rooms came with complimentary his and her slippers. I wish the wonderful bath robes were free too but of course they were $115 each. Furthermore, the pictures online of the pool looked extraordinary, but in person it's very, very small. With all that room, you would think the pool should have been olympic size, but yet it was barely smaller than a jacuzzi. All in all, I would consider staying at this hotel again, but next time I would ask for a free upgrade to a suite which I do believe, if I'm not mistaken, include those two applicances. Oh and to add, the housekeeping services were amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Grand!”
Reviews.Author: tina1848
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is amazing! My husband and I enjoyed our stay very much at this luxurious hotel. The service and friendliness were phenomenal, as well as the amenities. It's almost a self-contained vacation spot...we didn't want to leave to go do what we had planned to do in the Quarter. I can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Better Than The Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Trockie
Reviews.Content: I had a nice stay at the Roosevelt/Waldorf this week. The staff was gracious, rooms were clean, well decorated and nice-sized, amenities were all very nice, iPod player, flat-screen TV, etc. The only minus was no tub but the shower had body jets, hand-held spray and rain head. The one thing the hotel did not offer, which was a negative, was an Executive Lounge. There was also no accomodation to high-level rewards guests for the lack of a lounge, which is inappropriate for this level of property and therefore a drawback. The breakfast in the restaurant is also overpriced, particularly for what you get. As far as the attractiveness of the property, I even liked it better than the Waldorf Astoria in NYC. It is also conveniently located in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Better than the average conference hotel”
Reviews.Author: sjlm
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a mixed bag. Beautiful public spaces. Convenient location to the French Quarter and the Warehouse District and driving to Garden District and Uptown. Do not arrive when you anticipate the hotel will be very busy--they can't handle it. We arrived on a Sat. at about 4:30pm. Room should have been ready at 3. Many people were complaining about their rooms not being ready. Ours wasn't ready until after 6:30. To make up for the craziness, we were given a complementary drink each in the Sazerac Bar, a complementary lunch, and promise of an upgrade the following day. Our regular room on the 5th floor was quite nice. Beds were comfortable; AC worked; bathroom was large but no separate shower and no ventilation; separate makeup table in addition to desk; stupidest location for a safe I've ever seen: almost on the floor in the back of the closet so you had to sit on the floor with your clothes in your face. I refused the offered upgrades b/c one room might have had more sq ft but it was divided up into a very small bedroom and a smaller dark, dank front rm w/ a TV and a pullout-ugh! The other rm was on the 12th fl but was darker than my 5th fl rm b/c it faced the interior not the street and it was right across from the "dinging" elevator and it had a walk-in shower but the bathroom was much smaller and older looking. Price (even w/ conference discount) should have been better: Club Level at the Ritz across the street was very little more, and the Wyndham around the corner was less than half.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LeBonVoyage58
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel for a conference. My room was fabulous. Conference rooms more than adequate. There is very much a feeling of staying in a bygone era with all of the modern conveniences here. The staff was superb -- the concierge desk exceptional. Only two small things -- the meeting rooms were absolutely frigid and one could not get coffee before 6 a.m. without calling for room service. Several of us early birds were a bit disappointed by this. The coffee shop opened at 6 with an unlimited cup of coffee. But, a small thing.

Reviews.Title: “Spendid hotel and a great location.”
Reviews.Author: marypat1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel when it was the The Fairmont well before Katrina. The renovations are amazing, everything is so beautiful from the lobby to the rooms. The Sazarac Bar is great and the there are nimerous dining opportunities at the hotal and close by. The roof top pool and bar is also a nice addition. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “wish I could give a great review and may try again but bad experience”
Reviews.Author: GeorgeConsol
Reviews.Content: There are so many things to love about this hotel, but unfortunately one unprofessional hotel staffer ruined my night and next day by waking me at 5 am. After being fine with my room (although much smaller than all my friends and colleagues there with the same rate room) and happy with the comfortable bed and beautiful lobby, I was feeling pretty good about the hotel. BUT... I went to bed at around 1 am hoping for a great relaxing night sleep but was awakened by a LOUD scratching noise at 5 am and jumped up from a deep sleep thinking someone was trying to get in my room or that there was a rat in the room. It turns out that a hotel employee was trying to put the bill under the door at 5AM and it got stuck so they kept crumpling it and trying to force it under! First of all- don't put bills under the door as early as 5 AM! I have stayed at fine hotels all over the world and have NEVER had this happen so early. MORE IMPORTANTLY- when it does not work , don't make a bunch of noise forcing it and wake the guest up at 5 am! It takes a lot of noise to wake someone out of a deep sleep. I was unable to fall back asleep until 8 am and then lost half a day of my trip. I called the manager and her offered me a late check out which I gratefully accepted. However, in retrospect he really should NOT have charged me for that evening. I was too exhausted to think clearly enough to ask for him to compliment the night but considering that they ruined my night and day, he should have offered. Most fine hotels would have offered. The Roosevelt is just under what I would consider a fine hotel but does have a lot of things to offer at great rates. I, unfortunately, had a bad experience. I would consider staying there again IF and ONLY IF- they did something to make up for the last trip AND they promised that NO ONE WOULD PUT A BILL UNDER OUR DOOR AT 5 AM and make a bunch of unacceptable noise. HOLD THE BILL DOWNSTAIRS PLEASE! All that said- I feel like I just had bad luck and a strange bad experience. I just wish the manager had done the right thing at the least and not charged me for what was a terrible night caused by his staff. I'm going back next weekend for 3 nights and think I will try the Ritz Carlton this time.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: NatalieMaryland
Reviews.Content: This is our first time to New Orleans and we chose the Roosevelt over JW Marriot because it is a Waldorf Astoria. It just underwent a major $170 million renovation and it shows. The lobby is beautiful and elegant. The King room is beautifully decorated and new looking. The bathroom is very spacious with its own TV. I love the shower because it not only has a hand held but a "rain" shower head and back massaging spouts. The room comes with bathrobes and slippers. They leave you with 2 bottles of complimentary water everyday and even get your ice for you by the time you come back in the evening. Don't open the bar fridge though because I think it will automatically charge. Our view is nothing to write about ... the back of buildings and dirty parking lot. We were on the 8th floor but can still hear the occasional delivery trucks and police sirens. The TV is huge but there's often problem with the satellite signal. The hotel is located right off Canal street. It's 1 block away from the St. Charles streetcar where you can take to the Garden District. It is a nice ride on a hot day for $3 day pass. I'm not particularly impressed by the houses on Garden District. I was expecting mansions but most are somewhat run-down. The Roosevelt is also only 1 block away from Bourbon street (after you cross Canal St), and 2 blocks from Royal St. Riverwalk and Harrah's Casino is about 7 blocks toward the river but if you don't want to walk on a hot day, take the Canal St. streetcar which you can catch in the middle island of Canal St. Because it's located off of Canal, it is a little more quiet than the hotels facing Canal street directly. I'd stay here again. BTW, Mr. B's restaurant on Royal is great, but Dickie Brennan is over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service”
Reviews.Author: DavisandCo
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for several nights on my own and enjoyed it very much. Rooms are clean, nicely decorated. Bed good quality. Large bathrooms, and proper amenities. The hotel is exactly on the border of "good part" of the city and the other one not so good. Hence, you have to be careful not to wander off in the wrong direction. Apart from that very pleasant place, the clock ath the entrance is definitely worth several photos and few minutes of admiration, Would definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Romantic trip”
Reviews.Author: Pmo28
Reviews.Content: This hotel was phenomenal! We had a great long weekend in NO planned and I had read some of the reviews on this hotel and was not disappointed. I am a frequent business traveler and over the years have become a bit of a travel snob. When on leisure travel with my wife we like to stay at upscale hotels, but I judge every room on the basics of cleanliness, a comfy bed and a good shower. This hotel nailed all of these crucial areas. We had a suite which was not well described on their website but was well worth the upgrade. The room was meticulously clean, the bed was big, very comfy and the shower was simply AMAZING. Four heads great pressure, lots of control and lots of HOT water. (ignore the other review i guess) No tub, but I am not a bath-in-a-hotel type anyway. So not a problem for me but may be for you. The only issue we had at all with our room is that they did not restock the mini bar over our stay so the best snacks and drinks were gone by the end and they also didn't restock toilet paper which is not cool. But a call to housekeeping resolved theses small inconveniences. Outside the room the hotel is spectacular. The Grand Lobby is stunning, and there's bars restaurants, coffee shop, spa, concierge all on the premise as well as a John Besh restaurant Domenica. (delicious italian) The property is two blocks north of Bourbon Street on Canal on the edge of the French Quarter. We loved this hotel, it was frankly my favorite part of the City as it was always a clean fresh cool oasis in a dirty, old, hot city.

Reviews.Title: “Classic, Elegant Hotel with a Few Faults”
Reviews.Author: dehenderson
Reviews.Content: The staff is outstanding. The rooms are wonderful. But the Roosevelt has poor valet car service and a less than mediocre coffee shop.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the French Quarter without being in it, hotel with real charm”
Reviews.Author: Soda100
Reviews.Content: Ah, now this is a hotel! First, it has all the old-architecture charm of elegant â€˜Old New Orleans.' This is hotel lobby has been beautifully updated, yet retains the old architectural features that make it special. Thereâ€™s a interesting historical clock in the foyer, too. We were staying in the hotel for a private event and really enjoyed it. Service is very good at this hotel, which you should expect if youâ€™re going to pay this much for a hotel. Easy valet, friendly check-in, quick orientation of services, and they had our allergy-free room ready from the get-go. Parking is $40/night (Itâ€™s $10/night at a public garage a couple of streets round the corner on Camp, I think), but chances are you are ok with paying $$$ for parking if you can swing the cost of the hotel itself anyways. Likewise for the internet access that you purchase in 24-hour blocks and the tasty but pricey breakfast. There are so many wonderful places to eat breakfast or brunch in quick walking distance that it seems hardly worth it to stay in the hotel except that the service is so pleasant. The pool/patio area looks really nice, spacious, and nicely arranged. You can have room service bring you something to eat if the bar isnâ€™t open yet. I didnâ€™t really enjoy i, though others in my party did. I didnâ€™t like it because the air conditioning units mounted on the top of the buildings were really noisy. Never mind, there are plenty of things to do in New Orleans, and the hotelâ€™s location is really great. Itâ€™s extremely convenient to the French Quarter (2 min walk), near to a CVS and Walgreens, and both the Canal Street and the St. Charles street car lines. You can also easily walk to the aquarium and the casino (~5 min walk). The Saturday Farmerâ€™s Market is nice, too, and itâ€™s just a 5 min walk away. The fact that itâ€™s so centrally located, yet on a quiet street means that when you want some quiet, or just a quiet nightâ€™s sleep, youâ€™ll get it. Our room was spacious and very comfortable, including a little flatscreen TV in the bathroom that we never used, but was novel. In-room safe, large closet, plenty of soft towels, nice soaps, fizzy bath tablet, fluffy bathrobe and slippers for your stay, make for a nicely pampered feeling. Very clean, and a very well-kept hotel overall, decorated in a sort of â€˜old southern mansionâ€™ style, with all the modern ameneties. Is it worth the price of the stay? Only you can judge that, but if youâ€™re going to spend that much, you will really enjoy what you get for the money here.

Reviews.Title: “Classy, location, service”
Reviews.Author: TampaInsuranceTravel
Reviews.Content: I have been to new Orleans a few times now. I finally bit the bullet and stayed at the Roosevelt. Best thing I ever did. If you reserve a 2 queen room, the room is a lot larger. They have tours of the hotel- a bit cheesy but worth the time. Coffee shop downstairs is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: “Top Shelf”
Reviews.Author: troyk
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. The workers at this hotel are excellent. They try very hard, and it shows. Check in was flawless. Room was beautiful. Lobby gorgeous. Very clean hotel. Extremely safe. Best part was the roof top pool and bar. Lots of chairs, umbrellas, and good service. I hope this hotel can continue to provide this level of service, as we will surely use it again. This is the best hotel I have stayed in for years. They must have good management. No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great location. Overall great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Nikki1522
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, beautiful rooms and bathroom. Clean, comfy beds. Excellent location. we arrived early so until our room became available bellman took bags so that we are able to leave and come back. Minor issues with tv not working properly but hotel personnel did attempt to fix before our departure. All inall, great stay and have already booked next stay this month!

Reviews.Title: “Great but not perfect”
Reviews.Author: angbin
Reviews.Content: Hotelnis great. Very beautiful. Had a spacious king suite, with 2 bathrooms. Bed very comfortable. I never did figure out the 4 head shower, but enjoyed it. The only reason I say " not perfect" is the service. I ordered a hamburger at 9:50 pm and it took over An hour to get the food - after I called twice. Also, the maid service was very late in the day, as I was getting ready for evening activites. I had no wash rags for 2 days and asked the maid several times to bring them, which they didn't do. Finally, I asked the concierge for a lunch reservation an he told me the restaurant was closed that week. Later that day, I walked by the particular restaurant an it wasn't closed. A concierge at this level of hotel should know better. I would stay again, but be on top of any service requests.

Reviews.Title: “It exceeded our expectations!!!”
Reviews.Author: ConstantTraveler99
Reviews.Content: From the moment you arrive you are welcomed in a warm and friendly manner, the check in process could not be any faster and how about getting an upgraded room just by asking. What a room in deed! One of the great things about old beautiful buildings is that the rooms tend to have very high ceilings and thick walls. The furnishings were exquisite! No expense was spared to help make us comfortable as everything was top of the line! The only thing I missed was having a tub but the great multiple head (four) shower was very nice! They must only hire the best people because the level of friendly, attentive and professionalism is much higher than any I have encountered across the country! The quality of all of the food including room service was very good but the creme de la creme is the Dominica restaurant!!!! If you want to make your spouse feel special bring them to The Roosevelt it will be a treat for gothic you!!!

Reviews.Title: “Impressive elegance, The Roosevelt didn't let me down.”
Reviews.Author: Atlantis104
Reviews.Content: Great place, nothing like the hotels of yesteryear! The Roosevelt has the grandeur and elegance of old matched with modern amenities of luxury and convenience. Plus, the hotel staff was polite, courteous, and helpful. My only complaint was either my neighbors in the adjoining room were extremely loud or the walls were thin. Nonetheless, it was short lived and didn't kill by buzz (i.e., ruin my experience).

Reviews.Title: “Old world charm without pretentiousness”
Reviews.Author: Chaledou
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Roosevelt. This was our anniversary trip and we were upgraded to a king suite as HH members. Beautiful furniture, generous marble, very comfortable bedding with European-size pillows. Some very nice touches such as a superior stereo with iPod docking station and 2 pairs of nice slippers. The gift shop located in the lobby is much more than a traditional gift shop: you can find virtually anything you would have forgotten to pack, with room for local products and unusual brand of toiletries that made it a pleasure to browse through the store. The service was more than satisfactory and very friendly. Drinks were charged in error even though we had used a coupon received at check in, and they were immediately removed from folio once reported. It was a real treat to be in a gorgeous historical setting without the pretentiousness that often accompanies these upscale properties.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel, great location and service”
Reviews.Author: CzechMate2010
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed over Easter and we picked this hotel based on other reviews and of course, value and location. It was perfectly located just a few blocks from Bourbon street. It was elegantly appointed with a gorgeous pool area. Frederick the doorman provided us wth outstanding service and knew a lot about the histoty of the hotel which was unexpected and enhanced our arrival! We wish we could have stayed longer than the long weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and luxurious”
Reviews.Author: sprintf32768
Reviews.Content: I can't find anything wrong with this place. I feel like I am in a glamorous movie from 1943 when I am in the magnificent lobby. Upstairs, the hallways seem fifteen feet wide, with high high ceilings. And then this room! This room is bananas. I suggest getting a big suite. You'll pay what you'd pay for a regular hotel room in Chicago, and your jaw will drop every time you walk in. This place is poised just far enough away from the mayhem. I think it rocks!

Reviews.Title: “A Definite YES! This hotel was Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: TravelerChampion
Reviews.Content: Service was exceptional. Hotel is clean. This hotel stands in a class of its own! Very sophisticated and our stay was pleasant! If you have any questions or concerns, they will be addressed. Also, they have a military discount for all of our service members! We were very pleased with our stay and we would stay at The Roosevelt again!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Milwaukee_Hotel
Reviews.Content: This was probably one of the nicest hotels I've stayed at in New Orleans, and I've stayed at many of them. The staff was very accommodating, and helpful. The room was spectacular and I was upgraded to a suite when we arrived. The location was on the far end of Canal Street (about a block off actually), and easy to get too. One complaint i do have is the mini-bar. Watch it - I never used it and was charged about $40. Complaining didn't do me any good three weeks later when i saw the Visa bill, but I guess these things happen. The hotel is a little more on the pricey side, but if you want to experience a fine hotel with class, then it's well worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorites in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: pennyh09
Reviews.Content: I love how they renovated this hotel. The lobby is gorgeous, especially at Christmas. The rooms are very nice with many amenities. I love Domenicas Restaurant located inside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, upscale hotel near Bourbon Street.”
Reviews.Author: joelandcc97
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt Hotel is a beautiful old hotel across Canal from Bourbon. Marble floors, crystal chandeliers, gold leaf accents. Simply stunning and thats only the lobby! Our room was spacious with it's own entry way with marble floors, A sofa with ottoman, desk, flat screen tv, luxurious linens, and even a make-up table. The bathroom was oddly disproportionate for the room meaning it was a little small. The shower was good size with several different shower heads that you could have running all at once- very relaxing. My only complaint is the bed. It is like sleeping on particle board- very hard and not very comfortable. My husband and I both had to go visit our friendly chiropractor when we returned home. The pool and bar is located roof top off the fourth floor. We had a nice time escaping the NOLA July heat lounging by the pool and enjoying the beautiful architecture of the surrounding buildings. We visited the spa for a couples massage one day during our visit. Beautiful spa and also very luxurious. The massage itself would make my top 5 list of massages. I left feeling like melted butter. Overall, I give this hotel 5 stars. We will be staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious rooms”
Reviews.Author: WestwoodTrekker
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in 2010. The rooms are very spacious. Great location - short walk to French Quarter; a little farther to convention center (maybe 3/4 mile?). Loved the rooftop pool. Will probaby stay here again my next time in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Katrinar787
Reviews.Content: Three of us fit comfortably in a room with the Roosevelt for the weekend. It is located in a central, great spot that made it easy to get around on foot. The rooms are really nice and the bathrooms were very large/made it easy for everyone to get ready in the morning. The staff was very friendly. We also did the Jazz brunch on Sunday morning which was fabulous! Such a variety of food that was to die for! It was a little more formal than we expected, but totally worth the price as it was one of the best parts of our trip! The roof pool was really nice with a great bar set-up to enjoy the night. All around impressed by the property and would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Luxuriously appointed!”
Reviews.Author: Lafayette1
Reviews.Content: Our room was beautiful. This was easily the nicest hotel room I've ever stayed in. There were beautiful light fixtures, mirrors, chairs, etc. The only negative is that there is no coffee pot in the room. You must have their signature Sezarac cocktail in their bar - The Sezarac.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and would stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: kristylwood
Reviews.Content: My husband and I drove down from Memphis for a weekend getaway and we were very impressed with the Roosevelt. We loved the amenities and the rooms and you couldn't ask for a better location. The character of the hotel reminded us a lot of The Peabody in Memphis. It felt like we were in another era but with all the modern day amenities we could want. We had a king bed suite with a half bath in the front hallway and sitting area with a desk, sofa and large LCD television. The sleeping area of the room is separated from the sitting area by a wall and had a king bed with a chair and another large LCD television. There was also a full bath with a small LCD television.
