It really did feel like a small apartment and we actually spent a lot of time in our room at night just relaxing and enjoying the posh surroundings and view of Canal Street and the river. The hotel is right off Canal and provides easy access to the French Quarter with Bourbon Street being right across Canal. It was about one block to get to the St. Charles Trolley which we took to the Garden District. We did not eat at any of the hotel's restaurants, but did have coffee, light breakfast and sorbet at Teddy's Cafe which was very handy. It was only a 5 minute walk each night for dinner in the French Quarter. My only complaints would be the noise on Canal and $40 charge for the valet parking. There is a parking garage right next to the hotel and I hear it is $24 a day. We decided we felt a bit safer to let the valet just take care of our car and it was ready for us very promptly upon check out. Canal was very loud both nights we were there. We were on the 13th floor but my husband and I counted 10 police/ambulance/fire engine sirens in about a two hour period and just random street noise when the television was off. It literally sounded like the town was coming down around us, but I realize that is part of the city and the hotel can do nothing about that. The windows appeared to be older, possibly original so maybe they could invest in more soundproof windows at some point in the future. All in all those are mild complaints and we had a fabulous stay. We would definitely stay at the Roosevelt again in the future!

Reviews.Title: “The Sazerac Bar Inside The Roosevelt Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deny777
Reviews.Content: This was the first stop on our First Annual Trip Advisor Flokin Cocktail Tour. The bar was astoundingly beautiful and elegant. Luckily it wasn't too busy when our group of 12 people walked in. The lone bartender, Russ, never looked the least bit shaken or flustered when we strolled up to the bar and began ordering our many drinks. The one drink several of us wanted to try was the Ramos Gin Fizz. It is quite an art to make one of these drinks, and they can only be made one at a time. Russ entertained us with his bartending skills while making the drinks. My sister and I wanted to split one so he even went through all of the trouble to put the drink in two separate glasses. Talk about being impressed with the beauty of the bar, the kindness of Russ, and the extremely delicious drink. I have no idea what the price of the drink was, but it was worth every cent. If you want a really special drink in a beautiful atsosphere with a great bartender go to The Sazerac Bar and find Russ. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotels Can Make a Comeback”
Reviews.Author: marttch
Reviews.Content: Nothing is more difficult for a Yankee than going to the heat and humidity of New Orleans, especially when for business only. The grand old dame, which until recently was a Fairmont, has reclaimed a lot of its past elegance and charm. The rooms are not perfect (no tub for instance) but they are large, well appointed and overall comfortable. The Sazerac is always worth a visit for a classic cocktail. The new John Blesh eatery on site was stellar. I recommend the stracchi with oxtail ragout and chicken livers, if your cholesterol levels are controlled. The staff was friendly, although the concierge desk seemed overly busy at times. I would have preferred a choice of newspapers and the fitness center might be a little small at high times. Location is acceptable and in off season, especially for business, this was well worth it.... m

Reviews.Title: “My New Favorite Hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: jo00
Reviews.Content: From the moment you step in the lobby you know it's a great hotel. Stayed in a 1 bedroom suite and it was perfect. Even had turndown service nightly. Great pool with hot tub and bar. My wife was happy with the spa, the fitness room was small but adequate. Domenica restaurant was top notch. Sazerac bar was like stepping back in time. The service was fantastic, virtually everyone was extremely friendly and helpful. Location is perfect. Across the street from the quarter, 10 min walk to casino, can catch the St. Charles streetcar 1 block away to go uptown. If I had to give negatives there was one guy in the coffee shop who came off a litte rude (might have been his dry personality) also my confirmation said free wired internet in room, but there wasn't. I called the front desk about it and they gave me a little friction, but eventually provided the internet service without charge.

Reviews.Title: “Grand luxury is back”
Reviews.Author: mjrwjr
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed for a weekend at The Roosevlt. I was extremely impressed. The grand old days of luxury have returned. The service, staff and accommodations were exceptional. Will return as soon as time allows. By far the best hotel in New Orleans. The only other one that comes close is the Windsor Court, but it is not the same since changing hands. The Ritz-Carlton is vastly overrated and doesn't come close to The Roosevelt. When staying at The Roosevelt, treat yourself to a drink in the Sazerac Lounge and imagine yourself sitting at the same table as Hemmingway or Tennessee Williams.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at Roosevelt for Business”
Reviews.Author: nbm5b
Reviews.Content: I was in New Orleans for a conference (meetings were all at other hotels on Canal Street--not the Convention Center). I don't like staying in conference hotels because it's so hectic. This hotel was a safe distance away. I did a lot of "research" in choosing this hotel and was very pleased with the choice. Lobby: This is the crowning jewel of this hotel. The lobby is beautiful. You feel special just walking in. The tile work is impressive. I've been to a lot of 5-star hotels and this one, while not 5-star room-wise, has a beautiful "old school" lobby. Loved it. Accommodations: I thought the room decor was a bit dark and it had no good view (although no room would given where the hotel is) but a friend who shared the room said it was the best hotel she's stayed in. She loved it. Bathroom had a tv in it and the requisite granite. Toiletries were fine but not remarkable. Bed was very comfy and quiet--all things I'd expect from a Waldorf Astoria. Eating: I didn't eat in the restaurant but did eat in the cafe several times which was perfect. I am not a big breakfast eater, so the bagels and fruit and coffee were great. Plus the lines at PJs and Starbucks down the street were just crazy (this was a conf w. about 20,000 people attending). There's an Italian restaurant that I wish I had tried--but with sooo many places to eat at in N'awlins, didn't have the chance. Location: The location is good, even for Bourbon Street. I walked to Bourbon at least 3 times while there...and once at (ahem) 2 AM. I felt safe. Internet: You have to pay for Internet in the room but not in the lobby. Parking: The valet-only parking at the hotel is ridiculously (about $40/day) expensive but you can self-park right next door for about $24/day. Shopping: There's a great little shop attached with all kinds of sundries and souvenirs...and the cashiers were very nice & helpful with ideas and restaurant ideas. Sazerac Lounge: Great lounge for a late night cap or just to relax. Would I stay again: Absolutely! And, I heard that there were some great summer specials when it's really hot in the Big Easy!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: sarahclise
Reviews.Content: The lobby is gorgeous. The rooms are very pretty. We had a superior room with two queens. The Hotel was only about two years old so there was no wear and tear. All non smoking which I liked. We were right across the street from The Ritz. To get to The French quarter you have to walk in a seedy area Bourben St. Etc. But who cares. We felt completely safe. Our room was large and only $239.00 a night. Probably because it's hot as he'll there now. Only one complaint. A small bottlle of water in the hotel cafe area is $5.00!! Get your waters at the nearby grocery or drugstore. Very expensive bar and not really worth it unless money is no object.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: eschule
Reviews.Content: I go to New Orleans about twice a year and I think I found my new place. It is across Canal Street from the French Quarter which means it's 5 seconds from the quarter without actually being in it. The hotel is beautiful. The room was HUGE (probably 400-500 sq. ft) with an entry way and high ceilings. The layout is one room but because of the design feels almost like you have a living room as well due to long configuration. Bed was very comfortable. Bathroom was very nice. Women will enjoy the separate makeup table outside the bathroom. Men will enjoy the TV in the bathroom. :0) It felt more like a small aprtment rather than a single room which is all it was. Pool area was also very nice. Great hotel. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Imatexan56
Reviews.Content: Our room was not ready so we were upgraded to a suite. The bed was divine, all the service was impeccable. Would go there again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful old world style, with modern amenities”
Reviews.Author: MrsAWW
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Roosevelt for five nights, while attending a conference in New Orleans, and hope to be back soon! Though some reviewers have felt otherwise, the service in my time at the Roosevelt was excellent. From the valet attendants outside to the front desk staff, concierge, bell staff, room service, and beyond, everyone I encountered was friendly and helpful. My room was spacious, clean, and had every amenity I wanted. The only challenge I encountered with the room was that my Verizon Mifi card didn't work (probably a result of the old building--lots of steel and cement for the signal to get through), so I did have to pay for hotel wifi. Once I did though, it was fast and well worth the price. The room service menu is complete, though a bit pricy, and you can order food 24/7. I found both the breakfast and dinner selections I made to be very good, certainly above the level of most hotel food. The business center is staffed during working hours, but available 24 hours, which certainly comes in handy. The fitness center is also well stocked, even with infused water and fruit, and open 24 hours. Generally speaking, this hotel is well-set-up for business travelers who may be operating with very full schedules, something I certainly appreciate. I did enjoy my massage at the spa, though I realized after the fact that gratuity was included in the price. I wish someone had mentioned that to me before I tipped an additional $35 on top of that, but my massage therapist was so nice, and my experience had been good, so I didn't call and ask them to make the change after the fact. Nevertheless, that is something they should tell you before you sign the credit card receipt, which is NOT itemized. The neighborhood is not awful, but right on the edge of the zone where things turn a bit sketchy, so if you're a woman traveling alone, I would take cabs most places. You are within walking distance of the French Quarter, but again, late at night, that can be a little dicey. Cabs will take you anywhere, and the valet attendants at the Roosevelt are wonderful about calling them for you. There's even a car service that works with the hotel, so if cabs are scarce, that is another option. Overall, I was a big fan of The Roosevelt during my stay. I will certainly consider it again when returning to the area for business or personal travel.

Reviews.Title: “Old style charm with all the trimmings”
Reviews.Author: montegrappa
Reviews.Content: This is a very comfortable hotel, with all the traditional charms and services you could expect. We were made to feel welcome from the very first contact with the Roosevelt team. Checkin was quick and easy, our room was ready and before we knew it, we had freshened up and looking for Bourbon street. We took the option to upgrade for a token value and were not disappointed. Our King Suite was simply fabulous. A lounge room with a >40" LED TV, comfy lounges, writing desk and lots of space was well used. The dressing room was a real treat and the bedroom was simply huge with another >40" TV and space to lounge. The bathroom was smallish, but well appointed with wonderful designed toiletries. For our first nights dinner, we selected to try the in-house Ialian restaurant, which had a wonderful selection on the menu, a great wine list and very good service. My wife and daughter made good use of the concierge services and Barry was just marvelous. He answered all their queries and booked restaurants for us with a high level of efficiency. We used the in-house town car service and were thrilled by the fantastic service of Anthony. He took a lot of care to make sure we were all comfortable and then gave us a running commentary of the sights as he drive us to our restaurant. He was true tohis word and was available to pick us up when we had finished. The hotel is one block away from Bourbon street, which we found to be very convenient and gave us not only a quick walk to the famous street, but also gave us a feeling of security as we walked to and from. We we also very impressed by the friendliness of the New Orlans people we came into contact with. All in all, we really enjoyed our stay in New Orleans and would certainly stay at the Roosevelt (Waldorf-Astoria) next time we visit this lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay in Nawlins”
Reviews.Author: VeronicaRN90
Reviews.Content: My company chose the Roosevelt to host our annual Sales Meeting. I was apprehensive since this was my first return to New Orleans since Katrina (2005). All of my concerns were clearly misplaced. This hotel was wonderful. My HHonors status qualified me for an upgrade to a suite - which we loved. My husband loved the TV in the bathroom (Sometimes it's the small things) and the room service. I love the fact that there were 1 1/2 baths. Very nice when traveling with Hubby. There were three TVs, if you include the one in the bathroom in our suite. Though we agreed things were overpriced, it's New Orleans. All of the accomodations were top notch and we had an incredible view from our room. The concierge staff gave excellent recommendations for dining and activities. We explored the city and had a wonderful time at New Orleans School of Cooking - based upon their recommendations. The housekeeping staff kept the room in tip top shape and made sure our unique requests were met. Some parts of the hotel are a little "dated" - according to some of my peers. But I feel that it added an authenticity that you lose in brand new hotels. The internet was free for Gold and Diamond HHonors, but others pay approximately $14/day. Bed was super comfy with quality linen. There is a pastry shop in the hotel with neat sandwiches and pastries. Again, a bit pricy, but worth it. Would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “An Extrodinary Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tvilleret
Reviews.Content: I appearantly erased what I had already written, so I will try again. The hotel is the best hotel I have ever visited. The hotel itself is so classy and yet warm and inviting. The staff at the front desk were so friendly and helpful, by the time we were heading up to our suite I felt as if we had all known each other. The Sazerac Bar was great! The bartenders were fun and friendly and the enviroment was cozy. The Sazerc Resturant was fantastic! There was so much food, and delicious food, that I broke my diet big time. The King Suite we stayed in was so comfortable, clean, spacious! The bed felt like I had slept on a cloud. We didn't want to leave our suite, much less the hotel itself. The staff from the door men, the luggage carriers, front desk staff, the housekeeping staff, the resturant employees, the bartenders...I wish I remember all thier names. Kudos to all of them, they are what made our stay along with all the mentioned above a Special stay.Thanks to all of you! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “The Roosevelt: The Best”
Reviews.Author: parkhill24
Reviews.Content: Of all the hotels my wife and I have stayed in over the years in America and abroad, we have never encountered a more friendly, professional and responsive staff than at The Roosevelt. They were great from the start and superb when we had a medical emergency. We cannot imagine any hotel anywhere responding more quickly and efficiently -- or caring more. This is a staff with a heart. Kudos to management, too, for instilling and maintaining a culture of thoughtful service. Our rooms (we were in two) were large and excellent. We were pleasantly surprised also with the food and reasonable prices, especially in the Domenica casual Italian restaurant and in the coffee shop -- so much so that we ate in the hotel as much as elsewhere, an unusual thing for us. Thanks, too, to the on-the-ball security staff and the most-helpful concierges. The Roosevelt's location immediately across Canal Street from the French Quarter was a plus as well. No noise, and easy access. It's obvious that individual experiences and attitudes color every stay and every TripAdvisor review. From our viewpoint we could not have chosen a better New Orleans hotel. We will never again dismiss as irrelevant, as we might have in the past, reviews praising a hotel's "friendly service." It does make a difference.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in an okay location”
Reviews.Author: elmcnam
Reviews.Content: I LOVE New Orleans, and have stayed at several hotels in the city! This is probably the most luxurious hotel we have been to in the city, though it is not necessarily my favorite after our stay. That said, I would recommend the hotel, I just feel there are better choices for us. Highlights would be the room size, decor, flat screen televisions (which seem to be missing in NOLA), and that it is not in the French Quarter (though it is right next to Walgreens on Canal, which is not necessarily a bonus if your trying to get away from the drunks). We had a deluxe room with sitting area, and it was spacious for our family of five. The couch in the sitting room folded out to a bed, which my toddler loved sleeping on. We had a crib for our 3 month old twin boys, but the hotel did not really go out of its way to accommodate youngsters. You might say NO is not a town for kids, but I would argue that Mid City Park and the Audubon zoo make it quite entertaining for them. Plus, the Four Seasons in Las Vegas (another questionable destination for children) gave us toys, toiletries and a diaper pail for our kids. Nothing comparable was done at this grand location. The hotel is very well decorated, probably the best that I've stayed at in the city, though I think the Ritz might beat it (have only dined there, though, so hard to say). It's nice to finally have a flat screen, though it's not necessary for me. The bars and restaurants at the Roosevelt, are also top notch. Besh's restaurant, Domenica is in the lobby as is the historic Sazerac bar. However, the posh feel, sometimes made me feel under-dressed at night. As for the location, it is great that it is not in the Quarter, unlike the Ritz. However, I prefer the Warehouse, Marigny or Garden. It's close enough to the quarter and Canal, that you catch some of the overspill from Bourbon. Plus, while it's nice to have a drugstore nearby, that Walgreens next door doesn't always attract the best customers. One last note, if you are driving, park next door and don't valet if you aren't coming and going more than once during the day. It's $44 to valet, which is steep to me, even coming from Chicago which is also not a cheap city to park in. Overall, I would stay here again, but only if the price was right. I might select the Renaissance Arts Hotel over this one, but they are in different leagues; purely for location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PWL30080
Reviews.Content: Large immaculate room, very helpful staff and the French Quarter starts across the street. We were there for a convention, at special room rates and would probably only stay there again if we could get similar special competitive rates. The Italian restaurant/bar off the lobby is excellent and especially good value during happy hour. Only negatives: valet parking is $40+ per day (but self parking is possible across the street for $20 per 24 hours); no coffee maker in the room (presumably most guests prefer room service!) and very little seating space in the bar for the size of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at a beautiful, classic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hendersongal
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at the Roosevelt Hotel in May 2011 while my husband was in NOLA for a conference. Check in went smoothly and the bellman who accompanied us to our room with our luggage did a great job of showing us the amenities of the room, etc. We stayed in room 1300 on the 13th floor. Yes, the hotel has a 13th floor! I expected the room to be on the small size since it's an older hotel, but it really wasn't that small. Considering I've been on many cruises, this was actually quite luxurious compared to those cabins. The room was extremely well appointed and very nicely decorated. Nice flat screen TV in bedroom, TV and phone in bathroom, clock with iPod dock, robes, slippers, etc. The bed was very comfortable and the shower featured several shower heads. As far as the rest of the hotel, it is lovely. It has such a nice history to it. I have gone to the hotel before when they had the holiday display and itâ€™s beautiful. We checked out the pool area, but were so busy that we didn't get to give it a try. Very nice area on the roof with seating, pool bar, cabanas, etc. Ate at two places - Domenica (see separate review) which was very tasty and their coffee shop - Teddy's CafÃ©, which was fine, nothing special. Expensive bagels and such, but it was convenient. Location is pretty good, but with a little one the walk to the aquarium, cafÃ© du monde, etc. was a bit long. There is a Walgreens right on the corner if you need anything and a couple of fast food places within a block or two â€“ just in case! Experienced a couple of snafus but nothing horrible that would prevent me from going back -- 1) Phone in the bathroom was falling out of wall (see picture). Not that I wanted to use the phone, but for such a nice place there shouldnâ€™t be a phone hanging out the wall. We did report it, but no one came to look at it.2) A mini bar charge on the bill, which was from when the bellman brought us up the first day and showed us what NOT to do. They did remove it, but it was just the aggravation of having to go deal with it. 3) Housekeeping came by for turn down service at about 6 one night when we were still getting ready - I asked them to come back at 8. They never returned. Overall, a very nice stay and I would definitely consider for a future stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Harrietdyer
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful hotel this is - expensive but you don't feel ripped off. Unlike some luxury hotels in USA there are no charges for additional services, and the bathrooms are spacious and well appointed. Our room was large and beautifully decorated and the service was first class. On top of this it's also brilliantly located, being easy to find from the airport, and within a couple of blocks of the French Quarter and Bourbon Street. My girlfriend is the pickiest guest ever (see her review of the Peabody in Memphis), and always finds a fault somewhere but even she couldn't find a fault with this hotel. SUPERB!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Classic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: caltraveler_8
Reviews.Content: This hotel was recently updated and is a classic beauty. The rooms are large and have high ceilings, very comfortable beds, nice linens and amenities. The decor is classic and the furnishings high end. The location is close to everything but far enough away from the more active areas so you will have a nice, quiet stay. The pool area is very nice and is a great place to relax. The concierge was very knowledgeable and helpful. Don't hesitate to stay here! The best part of our stay was due to the wonderful ladies from the Emporium Gift Shop in the hotel. The trip did not get off to a good start. We arrived at the hotel very late at night on the day of my birthday. When I started getting ready in the morning to go out and have a wonderful birthday in New Orleans, I discovered that I was missing a very important carry on bag. I packed everything in the bag that I didn't want to lose in case my suitcase got lost - my bible, medicine, make up and all of my favorite jewelry. I then remembered that I left it in the cab we took from the airport. Everyone I spoke to regarding getting my bag back gave me very little hope that it would be found or returned. I went into the shop to ask the ladies where I could go shopping to replace some of the items I lost. When I told them my story they were so wonderful - giving me hugs, told me they would pray for me and took me over to the hotel spa to get some help with replacing my make up. When I got back to my room, a bag tied up with beautiful ribbon was delivered to my room. It was from the ladies of the Emporium Shop and contained a beautiful cross necklace and a pair of earrings! I was so touched by their act of kindness and I'll never forget it. How did the story end? Due to the diligence of Peter from the transportation department at the airport, my bag was tracked down and everything was returned as I packed them. This was a miracle in itself as we had very little information to give him to help track down cab - no cab number, paid in cash so no paperwork to refer to and wasn't even 100% sure of the name of the cab company! Everything turned out great due to some caring people and we had a terrific time in New Orleans! We will return to The Roosevelt Hotel next time we visit this great city.

Reviews.Title: “Holiday Wonderland, great location!”
Reviews.Author: meredith422
Reviews.Content: Should have written this review back in January when we returned but better late than never! We arrived in town 2 days after Christmas and stayed thru New Year's and the hotel was decorated beautifully, a winter wonderland with thousands of white lights! The only downside to this was the tourist traffic (who were not guests of the hotel) coming in to take pictures day and nite! The rooms were beautiful and clean. The concierge was extremely helpful and even set us up with a local man who lived in the 9th ward during Katrina and now gave private tours of the area! Very easy walk to Bourbon and Royal St. A great experience in every way!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Luxurious Stay”
Reviews.Author: MardiGras7
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, with friendly & helpful staff. The suite was awesome, loved the extra bathroom! The rooftop pool and pool bar were enjoyable as well. Sure, it's a little pricey, but you get what you pay for, for the most part. Wish we could have stayed longer!

Reviews.Title: “A Class Act Hotel in the heart of New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Jgal0
Reviews.Content: This hotel has everything at your fingertips. Upon our arrival, our luggage was taken out of our car quickly by the bell hop. We checked in and our luggage was taken to our room,while we enjoyed smoothies (highly recommended ) at the Cafe. The hotel is granduer, from the chandeliers to the furniture. Our room was a nice size for a deluxe room with 2 queen beds. The bathroom had ample space, but could have used more space for toiletries. Housekeeping could use some improvement. Checking toilet paper supply should be a basic, which was overlooked when we stayed. They did turn down the beds at night, which was a nice touch. Everything was in walking distance, if you like walking. If not street cars are a couple blocks away. Within the hotel we enjoyed the gym,the Scazerac Bar and Domenico's - All get an A +.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for Canal Street area”
Reviews.Author: MIAnonymous
Reviews.Content: Nicely renovated hotel with better service and accommodations than many of the usual conference hotels in the Canal Street area. Very clean and comfortable guest rooms, and the John Besh restaurant on site (Domenica) was terrific. Just a quick walk gets you to the French Quarter and streetcars, so this is a good home base for sightseeing as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Kath610
Reviews.Content: We loved the Roosevelt! Great vibe, beautiful property, big rooms, great pool and truly wonderful staff. Great for business or leisure.

Reviews.Title: “Splendid hotel.”
Reviews.Author: the_savman
Reviews.Content: We spent 2nts here in Feb 2011, it was our first stay in a Waldorf Astoria and it did not disappoint (well, not too much). Check-In was easy, staff were very friendly and efficient and the lobby itself is pretty spectacular. The room was truly sublime, excellent in every way. We had large HD TV's in both rooms and another in the shower(!). The bed was just the most comfortable we've come across in a long time. On site dining is expensive as you might expect, but we had a great meal here so no complaints and the service was top drawer. The only drawback was the housekeeping which was erratic and unpredictable, on one of the days we had to make a couple of calls to get something taken care of, but to the hotel's credit once we raised the issue they got it sorted swiftly. So housekeeping 5/10 but everything else 10/10!! Location, could not be beaten, everything is within walking distance including Streetcars running in multiple directions. You really are right in the centre of town. Whatever you make of N'awlins, it's a city obviously trying to find it's feet again after a horrid time, but The Roosevelt absolutely made our stay here (we thought the infamous Bourbon St was just overly seedy). We loved The Roosevelt and would love to return some day!

Reviews.Title: “could be so much more”
Reviews.Author: T_Dang
Reviews.Content: This hotel could be so much more. The grandeur of public areas and rooms are not matched by the staff. Check-in took way too long with only one person behind the reception desk. It was rare to get a smile or hello from any of the staff. The housekeeping staff is probably the worst though, the room was missing towels, notepads, and toiletries when I first arrived. Even though the hotel only recently reopened the curtains, shower fixture, and iron was broken. I feel it is up to housekeeping to find and report these issues to maintenance. I received a complementary upgrade because of my HH, and the room was huge and very comfortable. The location is a convenient walk to the quarter, but far enough to avoid the noise and heavy traffic. Despite the short comings, I would stay here again, at least until the place really starts to fall apart.

Reviews.Title: “Really fabulous and reminescent of buildings built with detail”
Reviews.Author: sb512
Reviews.Content: We stayed here three nights and really had a good time. The rooms were a good size along with the bathroom. They had turn-down service at night. All of the hotel staff was very nice. The hotel itself is a beautiful old hotel that has been maintained and updated but still able to keep its lustrous feel. It has a rooftop pool which is very relaxing. The in-room snack bar is pricey and motion sensitive, but luckily there is drug store right next to the hotel where you can stock up on snacks and beverages. The hotel is pricey, but worth the penny.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious and beautifully restored to reflect another era!”
Reviews.Author: roseinto
Reviews.Content: It was like stepping back in time to the 20s or 30s! A beautifully restored main floor, from its intricate mosaic tiled floor to the lovely crystal chandeliers. Our room had a very comfortable king size bed with crisp white sheets and billowy comforter, it was turned down each evening - a nice touch to come back to after an evening out. Rooms were a good size, very clean and staff quick to provide a missing bathrobe. We were there for a conference and the staff was gracious, food was delicious and service impeccable. The French Quarter was a couple of blocks away and hotel security provided bracelets for the guests to come and go during Mardi Gras. Would definitely stay there again, it's in my top 5!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, fabulous rooms, great location!”
Reviews.Author: amyd20
Reviews.Content: My friend and I went to New Orleans for one night and stayed at the Hotel Roosevelt. We had a great corner room which was beautifully decorated and extremely clean, but it was small. Nice staff and very quick to respond to our bell hop and valet request. We had breakfast at the hotel and it was standard fare. The hotel location is just at the edge of the French Quarter so it's convenient if you want to go there. I would definitely stay again, but it isn't inexpensive.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay at this beautiful property”
Reviews.Author: ravenna
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to New Orleans. Liked the location of the hotel. At first glimpse I thought Canal Street was a bit sketchy, but really no issue at all. Hotel was beautiful, with incredibly comfortable beds and nice appointments. Easy walking to the Quarter, Aquarium, Riverwalk and Lafayette Square. Very pleasant and accommodating staff. On arrival, I asked for a view room on an upper floor and was obliged. The tenth floor room overlooked Canal and there was noticeable street noise. But like I said, it was my request. Next time I'll take tranquility over view. Cool rooftop pool with great views of Downtown at night. Housekeeping seemed stretched thin, but got the job done. And I still don't understand why Holiday Inn Express has free Wifi but you can't get it here when shelling out over $300 per night. Loved the food at Domenica, a John Besh restaurant in the hotel. Just across the street from the hotel is the beautiful, historic Immaculate Conception Church. All in all a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Service Not Up to Luxury Hotel Standards--Try the Ritz Instead”
Reviews.Author: veggiegirl1968
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed for a weekend at the Roosevelt recently. The lobby is elegant and the bar has nice wood decor. Aside from that, I cannot recommend the Roosevelt and would not stay there again. My husband asked the concierge to arrange ground transportation from the airport for me (I was coming in on a later flight), and the concierge made it clear that he resented the request and agreed only reluctantly to make the call. When I got to the room, we were appalled to discover a dirty sock left over from a previous occupant. The front desk took 20 minutes, keeping me standing there the whole time, to sort out a discrepancy with Expedia over the room rate. Nightly turn-down service was absent or incomplete both nights of our stay, and it took up to 45 minutes to have that problem corrected. And the door to the mini-bar would not open, so we had to pay room service $20 for two small bottles of water. When we checked out, we presented a number of these complaints to Sarah at reception, who did not seem surprised and said simply that she would "talk to the concierge." When my husband told her we would be inclined stay at the Ritz on our next visit because the service at the Roosevelt had been sub-standard, she said she agreed and understood. No offer to speak with a manager was made, and we have received no follow-up communication from the hotel concerning the complaints or attempting to remedy them. If service is important to you in picking a luxury hotel, stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay...Very Small Bathroom”
Reviews.Author: garythetraveler
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt Hotel has recently been renovated and the lobby and the rooms are very nice. Service is good but not great....room was not cleaned until after 6:30pm one day. Staff was all very friendly. We had a King Suite.....with a very small bathroom. This is the kind of bathroom that the door cannot be closed unless you stand to the side of the toilet. Two people could not be in the bathroom at the same time (unless one person is in the shower). The recently renovated room could have very easily been renovated in a different way with a much larger bathroom. Still overall a very nice place to stay. We did not have a view at all. I do not know if other rooms had views.

Reviews.Title: “Meh- go to the Ritz”
Reviews.Author: Floridays21
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Ritz in Oct. 2010 but had really wanted to stay at The Roosevelt so that is where we booked our rooms this time around. In short, next time I'll be booking with The Ritz Carlton again. The Roosevelt has a beautiful lobby but thats about as far as it goes. The room my boyfriend and I stayed in looked like a cowboy let loose with steel toed boots on. The bathroom door had a 1" by 1" piece of wood peeling off of the bottom of it, the walls were covered with giant scrapes and scuff marks, there were old drink spills on the walls and even a red mark behind the nightstand that resembled blood. Paying $200 plus a night for a hotel that was remolded not even two years ago should get you a room that hasn't been beaten to he*l. No matter what temperature you set the A/C on, the room still heats back up to a stuffy 75-78 degrees. It would get so hot at night that we would wake up. I don't like it when hotels regulate the room temperatures to save $. Housekeeping was intermittent at best. We had regular housekeeping the second day of our stay. The subsequent days we had to request service three times and one of those times housekeeping still didn't show up. The last day of our stay housekeeping did not come until sometime between 3 and 5 o'clock. The pool area is itty bitty and the pool and hot tub are even smaller. The vinyl sides of the pool are dirty. It clearly doesn't get regular cleaning. And, there is no pool bar. If you want food or drink you have to call down to the Sazarac and wait 25-30 mins and then pay nearly $40 for a Bellini and a rum and coke. If you spend any time at the pool and want something to drink, go to Walgreens and buy your own. My boyfriend and I would wind down our day relaxing by the pool before going out at night. The location is decent. The Ritz has a much better location. I am 22 and my boyfriend is 25 so we spent our days walking around the French Quarter and our nights eating dinner in the Quarter and enjoying Bourbon. It was a pain having to cross Canal Street every time you left the hotel or were coming home. The Ritz is on the Quarter side of Bourbon, which is much better. We found some great restaurants to eat at in the Quarter- The Courtyard of The Two Sisters and Arnaud's were two of the best. We also had a lot of fun listening to jazz music at The Funky Pirate. It is a low key crowd and very fun. Not crazy Bourbon Street stuff. Overall, my boyfriend and I spent $1600 staying at The Roosevelt and I think the hotel was only worth $600. We were not impressed and will spend our money elsewhere next time. ***The only plus, which most nice hotels will do this, is The Roosevelt accommodated a romantic request made by my boyfriend. He had the hotel deliver a bottle of champaign and chocolate covered strawberries to the room while we were on our date at Arnaud's.

Reviews.Title: “Mardi Gras 2011”
Reviews.Author: Robengar
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in a King Suite over Mardi Gras. The hotel has been beautifully renovated. The staff was very pleasant and accomodating. Domenica is an excellent restaurant. Even given the high occupancy percentage, there were almost no long delays for bellman, room service, valet, etc. During Mardi Gras the location is also great as the hotel is north of the parade routes so you do not get stuck if you want to head uptown, to the airport, etc. The only complaint we had was the size of the bathroom. You almost have to get in the shower or stand on the toilet to open or close the bathroom door. I am confused because there is a walk-in closet next to the bathroom that is totally unnecessary. I wish they could have used some of that room for the bathroom. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but expensive”
Reviews.Author: staredat
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a superior king room. There is really no view in any of the rooms here, including the outdoor pool area, so don't expect it. The hotel is surrounded by other buildings. They do a nice job of decorating the rooms, so you don't have to open the windows anyhow. The room is pretty and clean. The bathroom was great with 3 shower heads and big comfy towels and robes in the room. My girlfriend is very picky about the comfort of beds, and she absolutely loved the bed in this room. They are basically all the same to me but it was very nice. The outdoor pool area has big comfy couches which is a nice area to relax. A few things that did bother me: The hotel kinda smelled. Not anything to keep me away, but it is a very old hotel that was just renovated. We didn't get maid service for two days for some reason. I usually don't need much, but I figured for $300 a night I would get some decent service. You have to pay for everything here and you will pay through the nose. A bottle of water was $4. A $30 bottle of Johnnie Walker was $120. Internet is not free...and for $300 a night, you would figure that they would throw that in. It was $12 a day. I got some grits form the lobby restaurant one morning for $11. They sounded good on the menu. I got to the room and it was half a cup of crappy grits. Not worth my money. I would recommend staying her and enjoying the room, the shower, the bed...but don't even think about buying anything else in the hotel...unless you have that kind of money. PS...don't even touch the minibar. They have some sort of automated system that charges you when you remove things, even if you put it back. I avoided this, but I heard quite a few folks at the reception desk upset about their charges that were incorrect.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Ajdana21
Reviews.Content: Classy and clean with great service Location is spot on and walking distance to French quarter but far enough away so it isn't loud Rooms are small and water pressure in shower needs improvement but have to consider how old the building is. Best value considering luxury, service, and location. We would stay here again. Didn't wait long for valet or bell staff to assist with luggage.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous hotel - great value and service”
Reviews.Author: frida11
Reviews.Content: We were in NOLA for a conference and pleasure and stayed at the Roosevelt, which is a block away from the conference hotel (the Ritz) and a couple of blocks from the French Quarter. The Roosevelt is quiet (a rarity in New Orleans), clean, and the staff was great. The rooms are on the small side, but this is an older hotel, and that is to be expected. The beds are comfortable, and the bathrooms and toiletries are quite good, though a little below other Waldorf/Conrads that we've stayed at. The fitness center is great, and we really appreciated the complimentary water and fruit. The only downside to the hotel is the breakfast buffet in the restaurant. Unless you're getting this comped as a H-Honors Gold member, than I would stay away - it is not worth the $25 price. The food is mediocre at best, though the service was wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and GREAT Price”
Reviews.Author: pinxstripes
Reviews.Content: We stayed here around Christmas. First let me say the decorations in the lobby were GORGEOUS! We took many, many pictures! The hotel room itself was nice and polished. The beds were by far the most comfortable in any hotel we've stayed at. The reason I knocked a star off is because the hotel furniture was a little dusty, indicating it had not been cleaned recently. Also, the hotel parking price is high, so I suggest parking in the parking garage next door which charges half the price. Besides that, my family and I had a wonderful stay at the hotel. The price is fairly cheap for a 5 star hotel. I definitely recommend staying here next time you're in New Orleans!

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: alynnem
Reviews.Content: The hotel has been beautifully restored, the location was perfect - easy to walk anywhere. It was very quiet which was surprising considering we were in the midst of Mardi Gras. The staff was very friendly (with the exception of the bartenders at Sazerac - not bad, but certainly not like most bartenders). Cody was the best concierge I have ever met - very patient, very helpful. If the hotel is smart, they will do whatever they need to do to keep him! All in all, great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Opulent doesn't begin to cover it”
Reviews.Author: UmbralEchoes
Reviews.Content: This hotel was simply amazing. The decor was classy New Orleans all the way. The staff was very professional, even though I was there with lots of people for a convention. The only downside is that they rake you over the coal for parking -- they wanted to charge us $40 per night, so we just went half a block away to a parking garage. I booked a suite, and it was everything I wanted. A flatscreen TV in the master bedroom and in the foyer, a separate guest bathroom and closet, and the king size bed was amazingly plush. On the downside, my girlfriend demanded that we find out what sort of sheets they wanted so that we could get some for our home. The shower was a slate tile deal with large glass doors and several nozzles that the water comes from. That part was a bit tricky to figure out, and the bathroom itself wasn't huge as you can see in the photo (though the guest bathroom was). There were some nice pieces of photography on the walls. Our view was pretty good too. The pool area looked pretty amazing, and got good reviews from friends, but unfortunately we were too busy partying to use it. There were some very swanky looking restaurants in the hotel. We only went into one, which was set up for a convention party with some nice hors d'oeuvres and a nice little dance floor area. Location-wise, it's close enough to walk to Bourbon Street, though it is a few block hike to get to the strip. I didn't mind, but if you plan on wearing high heels it could be a problem. Then again, I highly recommend against wearing high heels on Bourbon Street regardless. Overall we had a great experience here. Would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and a great location”
Reviews.Author: navy_wife7606
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at The Roosevelt in New Orleans during Mardi Gras. The hotel was absolutely stunning with historic charm. Our room was beautifully decorated and luxurious. The bathroom had a walk-in shower with 4 shower heads and a flat screen that you could watch from the shower or toilet. There was also a huge flat screen in the room to view from the comfy king size bed. The bed was so comfortable. We were on the 14th floor with amazing city views. The hotel had great soundproofing as were heard nothing all night. The concierge was very helpful in giving us a map and directions to where we wanted to go. My ONLY complaint about the hotel would be the wrist bands. During Mardi Gras you have to wear a wrist band to get in and out of the hotel. They were very strict about seeing your wrist band and I found it to be a little silly. I think showing your room key to get in should suffice. We were walking distance to the Mardi Gras parade location, French Quarter, Cafe Du Monde, riverfront, etc. It was a perfect location. Wi-fi is 13 bucks a day and valet parking 40 bucks a day. We parked on the same block in a garage for $20 a day, much cheaper! This hotel is pricey, but worth the splurge for luxury and location in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service”
Reviews.Author: wick1979
Reviews.Content: We booked 3 nights at the hotel and was given an upgrade to a 2 bathroom suite the hotel was beautiful, Hilton should be given a metal for restoring this to its former beauty, but should reconsider how they treat customers. After the first night in the room we were rudely awaken by banging on the door. Please know that the do not disturb sign was on the door. The house keeper handed me the sign and asked if she could clean the room. After slamming the door in her face and contacting the front desk and advising what had happened. They advised they were extremely sorry and would correct the problem, which they did for about 4 hours. Then someone came up and told us that the hotel tower was closed and we were not allowed to be there, after contacting the front desk they advised that was there mistake and would move us to the other tower. So for our inconvience they down graded our room, and when the front desk manager came out, she was extremely rude. Being a Diamond memeber with Hilton and having received some of the best service at hotels in there company I was shocked that they would hire someone this poor at customer service to run there flag ship hotels. The hotel is beautiful and a must see, but I would pass on giving them my money again. The restaurant inside the hotel are ok, the room service was exceptional. Truffle oil french fries were out of this world.

Reviews.Title: “Glad to come back to the Roosevelt.”
Reviews.Author: IRGPT
Reviews.Content: Overall, I love the Roosevelt. I had stayed here twice back when it was the Fairmont. Grand old hotel. A few points: Hotel/location - Gorgeous lobby. The hotel offers a great little deli style place downstairs as well as two more formal dining options and the Sazerac bar. Great gift shop as well. Neat rooftop pool. Also has a spa and nice workout area. The location is good. You are across Canal from the French Quarter so it is nice if you want to be close but not necessarily in the Quarter. It is also a great option if you need to access the CBD. About a 20 minute walk to the Superdome. It is about 20 minute walk down to the convention center so if you need to get down there for meetings The Roosevelt isn't a terrible option but you may want to look for something closer if you need to go back and forth a lot. Rooms - My room was a tad small but not atypical for an older hotel. The bathroom was actually pretty large and offered a TV next to the mirror which was cool. Room was comfortable overall; great bed. Service - The front desk staff was average. I would have expected more from a Waldorf Astoria property. The valet service was short staffed. Waited over 20 minutes for my car because there was only one guy who was working his butt off retrieving cars and hailing cabs for folks. (You can park across the street but I had some issues with the garage so I just went ahead and used the hotel valet.) Hotel does have turndown service. There was a lady working in the gift shop who was an absolute jewel. She was extremely helpful and just as charming as she could be. Value - Rates were comparable to most other hotels in the area including the larger chain hotels and the smaller boutique hotels so I can't really complain. I would return to the Roosevelt given the opportunity but my confidence has been shaken somewhat.

Reviews.Title: “Rocky start, but the staff more than made up for it.”
Reviews.Author: houselightsdown
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed to find out that our booked room wasn't there upon arrival (King One Bedroom Suite). We were told that if we were willing to downgrade for one night we could move the next night. We really didn't have an option and were very disappointed, as we were going to celebrate our engagement and my fiancee's birthday. We accepted a reduced rate for the rest of our stay (4 nights total) and free breakfast for the length of our stay as compensation. The hotel also paid for us to attend the Sunday morning jazz brunch. We felt more than fairly compensated for our troubles. When it comes to staff, we were concerned that we were going to deal with attitude perceived by some other reviewers here. For the most part, everyone from the desk staff to the concierges to the bellmen were friendly, helpful, and interested in insuring us a great stay. We also utilized the spa and really enjoyed a couples massage. I think that the rooms were quite nice and definitely clean, but were neither luxurious nor overly unique. That being said, we slept well. The views were nothing to write home about, either, but the hotels location right off of the French Quarter was perfect. Finally, I think that the rate of nearly $300 per night was a little aggressive for two weeks before Mardi Gras and I didn't appreciate being nickel and dimed for the Internet. Even so, the staff and location more than made up the difference and we would definitely recommend staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “I'LL BE BACK!!”
Reviews.Author: irishmike52
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 nights over New Years 2011 at this hotel. The hotel was built years ago but went through an extensive remodel job. Well done. Still decorated in a 20's motif. Rooms are "cozy". The people that work at this hotel could not have been any nicer or helpful. The coffee shop was extremely handy for morning coffee, muffins, croissants, and the like. The restaurant was great for breakfast (a buffet). The activity in the bar was a blast. The location was ideal, 3 min from Bourbon St and the St Charles streetcar, 1 min from the Canal St streetcar, and less than a 10 min walk to the Waterfront and the Casino. It's close enough to the action without being in the middle of it. As a side note, if you go during the Christmas holidays, the decorations are the best of all the hotels in the area. We checked them all out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: lnd85266
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, great service. Would recommend the Astoria Suite.

Reviews.Title: “So overrated, conceited”
Reviews.Author: uptowntouchdown
Reviews.Content: The constant clanging of the pipes in the roof resulted in zero sleep. When we complained, they sent up a guy to replace the air conditioning filters. Thanks. Don't waste your time or money, this place is a joke.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is unworthy of the Waldorf brand and I strongly discourage staying here.”
Reviews.Author: cjett
Reviews.Content: I choose the Roosevelt to host 150 of our friends and family for our destination wedding in New Orleans. We had a room block for 9 months prior to the wedding and our guests all made their reservations about 6 months in advance. We had a huge brunch planned on Sunday in the Blue Room and had given this hotel plenty of business. When my guests began to arrive on Thursday afternoon, the hotel did not have rooms ready for most of my guests and asked them to wait in the lobby until rooms became available. Several of them had traveled from other countries with small children, including infants. Six hours later, the hotel started telling people that they ran out of rooms that night and would be bumping people to the Hilton Riverwalk, which is a MUCH lower quality hotel. At this point, I felt it necessary to intervene and asked to speak to a manager and was told there was none on duty. When I asked the "person in charge" why our guests were being bumped when we had a room block and reservations for months, he had no answer. When I asked why they couldn't be moved to a hotel that was at least as nice as the Roosevelt, I was told that there were no rooms in the city at the nicer hotels. I then requested that he call again IN FRONT OF ME a nice hotel - the Windsor Court and ask for availability. Of course, there WERE rooms available and he had LIED. Unfortunately, about 50 of my guests missed the first night's festivities because of the extremely poor treatment that the Roosevelt bestowed upon us and they managed to REALLY UPSET a pretty laid back bride and groom on the eve of their wedding weekend. I would caution anyone in a similar situation to trust the Roosevelt with such an important event. Also, it should be noted that I have never written a bad review.

Reviews.Title: “Old World Beauty”
Reviews.Author: ninchken
Reviews.Content: I was there for a medical convention. The hotel is newly renovated. The bed quality was typical Hilton, wonderful. I am an HGVC member and was upgraded to a suite. The high ceilings, huge living and sleeping quarters are luxury. The bath[s] were immaculate. This hotel has so much history. The lobby clock is fascinating, whole history there too.. The bar is famous and comfortable, as is the drink, The Salazar. Pardon the spelling if it is wrong. The woodwork at the bar is art. The staff was friendly and helpful. What can I say, loved it. I travel quite a bit and this is one to go back to.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Atmosphere, Terrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: LandL2006
Reviews.Content: My husband and I plus our 3 small children traveled to NOLA and stayed at this hotel for a family wedding. My son and I were members of the wedding party. I requested early check-in to get started on Matron of Honor duties and could not be accomodated but was assured my room would be ready at 3:00 check-in. My room was not ready until 5:45pm which was 1 hour before the wedding. My husband and I couldn't get dressed, children couldn't rest/nap, and all were exhausted. We invaded the bridal suite! This was very disappointing and ultimately paid $$$ for being inconvenienced. No response or follow up from Front Office Manager or General Manager.

Reviews.Title: “I don't care how much money they spent to renovate- it comes off very cheap and tacky.”
Reviews.Author: alex378
Reviews.Content: I was deeply dissapointed with my experience at this hotel. It was billed as a renovated, historic four-five star property to be a flagship of Hilton's new Waldorf brand. While I expected a stupendous, elegant, refined hotel with impeccable service akin to the St. Regis experience (as with Hilton rebranding their superluxe hotels as Waldorfs in homage to the Waldorf=Astoria in New York, St. Regis was Starwood's effort to rebrand their superluxe Sheratons into St. Regises in homage to the St. Regis in New York), what I found was a tacky hotel with mediocre customer service and a design that seemed to be done on the cheap. Let's start with the decor. The room amenities and furniture seemed to have been picked up at the local Target. While drapes from a distance appeared to be sumptuous valour, a closer look revealed them to be cheap vinyl drapes with graphics on them meant to look like they were valour. The furniture in the room was tacky. The lighting consisted of awful compact fluorescent bulbs that seemed to suck light out of the room- not what you would see at a St. Regis, Ritz, or Four Seasons property. The customer service was dreadful. I had the misfortune of checking in late in the afternoon. I was traveling solo and requested a king bed. They had none. They offered to "upgrade" me to a regular room with a king bed for $15. I felt that that was unnecessary nickle and diming that left me with a really bad taste in my mouth. The mention of any monetary amount less than $20 should never occur at a luxury hotel check-in! I declined to pay for the upgrade out of principle. Shockingly, when I expressed my surprised to the front desk manager about this I got nowhere. The lobby had the usual gilt and gold one would expect from a historic hotel. The location was dismal. It was down the block from a somewhat dilapidated main drag (Canal Street) that was filled with cheap pharmacies and seedy looking people. You had to cross it to enter the French Quarter. I do wonder why Hilton is rebranding based on the Waldorf in New York. Anybody who knows that hotel knows that it is dowdy, very old hotel in New York that caters primarily to businessmen- it is hardly the image of trendy luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite, wonderful post-Katrina restoration.”
Reviews.Author: Michelle21620
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt meets all the expectations of a luxury hotel: truly lovely and perfectly detailed to a prior era, well-appointed rooms and baths, and polite, helpful staff members. The neighborhood is a little dicey, especially a night. We were told there were 2 muggings nearby at 4:30-5:00 in the afternoon. The contrast between the atmosphere surrounding The Roosevelt and the homeless hanging around the area is sad; one can only imagine what it was like before the rebuilding that has occurred. What really surprised me at The Roosevelt was (a) local telephone calls are charged at a per minute rate; only 911 is free. (b) use of their wireless internet connection costs $12.00 per day. (c) there is no coffee maker in the room; going downstairs to the cafÃ© for coffee in the morning is acceptable, but $6.00 for a latte exceeds expectations. Why is it that the priciest hotels don't provide coffee makers, charge exorbitantly for internet access, and seem to try to squeeze the last dollar out of the "guest?"

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but not impressed with service”
Reviews.Author: lbagci
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a business trip. While the furnishings were very nice, the room had absolutely no view ( the back end of a heating and air exhaust). On my 3rd day there I noticed a robe card in the closet but no robe. I called down to the desk and they had one brought up- it was well worth the phone call- very comfortable but a little late. The bed was super comfortable and had very plush pillows- one of the most comfortable beds I've slept in. The other issue I encountered was that a bottled water in the mini bar had previously been opened-I brought this to the attention of the front desk, but again- a little late. I did not feel safe walking alone outside the hotel but if you are traveling with someone, it should be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Wow. Could not have been better!”
Reviews.Author: Denisetx
Reviews.Content: We stayed her for my birthday at the end of October 2010. My husband surprised me with a suite for 4 nights. The suite was huge. The bathroom was the size of a small hotel room. This hotel is fabulous. Very classic but with all the new upgrades. Service was fantastic too. I could not have had a better trip. It was so nice being out and about and all day and then being able to come home to this at night. You won't be disappointed here! When you walk in you know you are in a Grand hotel with lots of history.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Romantic and Spectacular”
Reviews.Author: frzzy58
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel, that brings you back in time. The granduer and elegance is simply breathtaking. I surprized my husband with a long weekend birthday getaway and chose this hotel because of the history and beauty. The Roosevelt receives an "A+" for hospitality and customer service. The conceirge went over and above making our first visit to New Orleans special and over the top. From the limo ride from the Airport, to the couples massage at the Guerlain Spa, to the turn down service at night and making tour arrangements, this hotel is top notch. The Sazarac Bar is an awesome place to meet and have night caps. If you don't stay at this hotel while in New Orleans make sure you visit just to walk through the lobby and inhale the beauty and history, it will be worth it.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel in the Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: Waylawfirm
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel right off Canal Street in New Orleans. One block from the French Quarter and 3 blocks from Harrah's Casino. The lobby is inspired and the hotel bar is one of the nicest in the city. The room we booked was exceptionally clean. Service was great. No complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and Luxurious”
Reviews.Author: beauitifulspaces
Reviews.Content: After pouring over hotel reviews, I chose The Rooselvelt because of the recent refurbishment of the rooms. I was certainly not disappointed. My husband and I stayed in a luxury suite. There was a beautiful, large sitting room with all of the expected amenities and more. The bedroom was gorgeous and comfy. The bathroom was HUGE and absolutely LUX with a soaking tub, large shower with multiple shower heads, and floor to ceiling mirror for dressing. No view from our room (I am normally all about the view) but we didn't miss it. As far as location goes, this hotel wins as well. A short walk to everything but far enough away for quiet night in bed. The only small complaint that I have is with coffee shop. Wonderful cappuccino but not service with a smile. Overall, a beautiful hotel that I would choose again.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Escape”
Reviews.Author: Dawkito20
Reviews.Content: While this hotel is off the beaten path (aka not on Bourbon Street), be prepared for rowdy parties, which can keep you up at night if your main objective is to get rest and relaxation. My husband and I were rudely awakened in the early morning to noise from the presidential suite ... Our room was right below it and we soon discovered the rooms aren't sound proofed. Luckily, the hotel staff was able to move us to a different room. Half asleep, we changed rooms during the middle of the night and pleasantly discovered that we had been upgraded to an even larger suite --- complete with a larger sitting room and beautiful bathroom with a claw foot tub (our first suite was also very well appointed; however, smaller compared to our "new" room). It also had a better view, overlooking the pool. Hotel is very beautiful --- Hilton did a great job with the renovations. Property features a great bar --- the Sazerac --- and restaurant --- Domenica (a John Besh restaurant). It's walking distance to pretty much everything, including the Superdome (in case you're down there for a Saints game). Rooms were very well appointed and clean and featured nice amenities. The hotel also features a lovely gift shop --- the perfect spot for picking up a present for a friend or family member. Parking at the hotel can be pretty steep. If in town with a rental car, you may want to consider parking at the garage just before the hotel. It was half the price ($20 versus $40) and they would allow you to come and go as you pleased if you paid ahead.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Rebirth At The Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: Thomas B
Reviews.Content: This hotel had been renovated and is wonderful. It retained its opulence from times past and is beautiful. Check in and out were a breeze. The employees all are friendly and helpful. We had signed up for a potential upgrade to a suite and got a Waldorf Suite for $99 extra per night. It was a very large suite with a table and chairs and chandelier over it. There was a large sofa and chairs set there and even a bathroom. The bedroom was large and had a tub plus shower (although the shower is closet-sized). There was a makeup table, also. The typical high ceilings added to the ambiance. Being located across Canal Street from the French Quarter allows one to just cross the street and be a block off Bourbon Street. The only thing that is really not good is the $40 valet parking tab. Since I was staying as part of a conference group, I was advised to park at 848 Carondelet Street for $10 per day and walk back to the hotel. I did this and it is not a bad walk (about 8/10 mile). We took a cab to the garage and got dropped off right at our car as this garage is a former Chevy dealership. You pay at a machine as you enter and put the receipt on your dash. I was able to sidestep the $13 daily internet fee by being a member of a conference block. If you are NOT in a block, take your device to the lobby level where access is free. It was a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful rooms and lobby otherwise a nightmare!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: bigktx
Reviews.Content: where do i start well me and my girlfriend wanted to get away for new years eve so we made the drive from dallas to new orleans and i had reserved a king suite at the roosevelt and requested a early check in we arrived around 1:30 and we were told our room will be ready in about a hour well 4:00pm comes around still no room after many attempts at the front desk with rude employees finally had a nice young lady that upgraded us to a luxury suite for the night but we had to check out the next morning and go back to the room that we reserved which we agreed to. well there we go again 2 and a half hours later still our room was not ready so almost 3 hours later we finally got it it wasnt the room we requested with a tub and a view so we decided to take it anyway the only compensation we got was 2 drinks and free brunch and to top that off the valet is $44 a night so you would think they would be more proffesional but no i went back to my car 5 min after we parked to get my phone and it was on the side of the road still with the engine running and window down with nobody watching it and note this is a brand new BMW and then there was a small crack on the front bumper once i got it back but i wasnt even gonna waste my time on trying to get anything out of them so in other words it could have been a way better stay!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “I see why the Kingfish lived here.”
Reviews.Author: RabUlk
Reviews.Content: We had been to The Roosevelt for cocktails previously, and decided we would stay there on our next trip if we could find a reasonably priced room. We were able to get a full suite for $130 a night during the slow period right after Christmas... reasonably priced is the understatement of the year. It was a steal. It's a great location. The staff is friendly and engaging. Domenica was delicious The Roosevelt is our new favorite hotel in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “This is the best hotel I've stayed at in New Orleans....”
Reviews.Author: cleolily
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I visited New Orleans for 3 nights over New Years Eve for a wedding. I have been to New Orleans several times and this is the nicest hotel I have visited to date. The hotel is completely renovated and is absolutely beautiful. We booked the king suite that was an upgraded room and it was completely worth the extra money. The lobby was beautiful, the room was great, and the staff at the restaurants and concierge were very helpful. This will be the only hotel I will stay at in New Orleans when I return!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great location”
Reviews.Author: kickdiver
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed this hotel. We upgraded to a King Suite and service was superb, as were the spacious two rooms. Impressive lobby & pool area. Close vicinity to Vieux Carre. Cannot go wrong with this choice, stayed in New Orleans more than two dozen times over the years, this is my preferred choice.

Reviews.Title: “Classic New Orleans Grandeur”
Reviews.Author: tankdagger
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I have stayed at the Roosevelt New Orleans and have found both stays to be great. The hotel is beautifully decorated (especially at Christmas time) and the service is very good. I ordered room service for breakfast and found the service to be very timely and the food to be wonderful. The location is perfect if you want to visit the French Quarter or other CBD attractions. The Roosevelt will definitely be my hotel of choice for all future stays in the Crescent City.

Reviews.Title: “Great 'Ole New Orleans Hotel”
Reviews.Author: familytripper1
Reviews.Content: Elegant, old New Orleans hotel that was beautifully decorated for Christmas. As a tradition, many families were here Sunday morning taking their Christmas pictures. The rooms are small, but very well appointed, quiet, and clean. The bed and pillows were plush. Located close to French Quarter, but still need a cab to most places for safety reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: WTalbotAustin
Reviews.Content: I forgot to review this a year ago so I don't have much to say except it was a great stay. Everything was great. Well except trying to get my car when we were leaving after check out. Took quite some time.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: YRHips
Reviews.Content: The hotel has very nice rooms. We had to rooms in tower 2, a deluxe and a regular. Both were very nice, large, clean, fresh smelling and with nice bathrooms. I travel ,a lot, for business and pleasure. These are nice rooms even given the price. The hotel has character yet is modern. There's even a T.V. in the bathroom. The lobby was beautifully decorated for Christmas. I just wish there had been some decorations on the floors as well. As soon as you left the lobby there was no sign of Christmas. A wreath or bow on each floor at the elevator or something like that would have been nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service Worse PR”
Reviews.Author: Lolainola
Reviews.Content: After visiting the most beautifully decorated lobby in New Orleans with family trying to decide on a place to stay for the holidays I TRIED to order something from the gift shop to be shipped. Gift shop mgr Sarah Buchman was cordial on the phone but after 4 e-mails and 3 phone calls I discovered the order had NEVER gone out! her explanation. " I LET THE WEEKEND GET AWAY FROM ME". At this point it was a week later and my guest were no longer at home to receive the gift. After 2 phone messages to the hotel mgr. went unreturned I dont have a very high opinion of this hotel. I worked in the service industry for over 30 years this was unbelievable.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: news222
Reviews.Content: We selected this hotel using Hilton Honors awards and enjoyed three nights stay recently. We visit NOLA about every other year and have stayed at the W, the Omni, and Le Richilieu in past visits. Entire Hotel is grand and elegant and takes you back in time! It was beautifully decorated for Christmas in the lobby with white lights throughout. We were in Tower 1 and enjoyed our room which was really large for New Orleans hotels. Bathroom was huge with amazing shower, plush towels, and the bed was one of the most comfortable we've been on (Sealy Posturpedic CSS Pillowtop!). If you need a shoe shine be sure to check out the nice fellow in the lobby there - does a fantastic job! Location was great. Just a 2 block walk to Bourbon, but far enough away that it was quiet - no issues with noise for sleeping. Plenty of excellent restaurant choices nearby so we did not bother with hotel food. We did not rent a car - we cab to/from airport and walk the rest of the time, which is so easy to do around the Qtr. Being December we didn't use the pool, but we did check it out and it is a beautiful 5th floor rooftop pool, deck and bar area, if you're looking for a nice warm weather hangout. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel but pricey for items like food and internet”
Reviews.Author: travelergo
Reviews.Content: We arrived for 2 nights for business meetings. Hotel is gorgeous all decorated for Christmas in the lobby with white lights. Check in was quick and I was in Tower 1 and co-workers were in Tower 2 (their rooms was smaller than mine and had pedestal sinks instead of large marble sink I had). We did not eat at hotel due to prices being high and my food allergies. Menu was limited for the restaurants. Internet service is pricey here and we did not use it. It was free at McDonald's around the corner. No bathtub in room, only shower with many jets. Bed was too soft for me and pillows had no support so woke up with neck pains. Best towels I have ever used. Soft plush velvet like large towels. Huge flat screen TV in room. Chocolate mints and turndown service was a nice touch. Had issues with business center with high handling charges (pricey). Walls are paper thin and heard people on the street and people next door throughout the 2 nights. I have attached photos of the room.

Reviews.Title: “quintessential New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: danakate
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt gives you a real feeling of New Orleans; the location is great, the newly renovated everything is luxurious and comfortable. We were last here 20 years ago when it was the Fairmont and were delighted at the transformation/restoration. We got a good deal on the room and an inexpensive upgrade to a small suite, delightful. All the staff were welcoming and accommodating, no wait to check in. Very quiet in the room even though the hotel was packed with Bayou Classic fans that weekend. The bed is one of the best I've ever had in a hotel. Just a few quibbles. The pool area is completely unimpressive for a hotel of this caliber, a little landscaping and cleanliness would go a long way. The prices in the restaurants are very high, especially for breakfast. They charge for internet, rather crazy at these rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great New Orleans experience!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: yessamme
Reviews.Content: My mom called to tell me we would be having thanksgiving in FL, so my wife and I started investigating flying vs driving, we thought about staying in other small cities along the way and finally decided to spend two night in New Orleans. I checked my points and was able to book a room at the Waldorf for 50000 points per night we paid $30/night to upgrade to a suite. The night we got there they we turning on the city Christmas lights and the hotel was decked too the nines. The hotel was renovated in 2009 and they did it right. The staff was very friendly and helpful. We felt right at home. The breakfast was not cheap but it was good (and hey its not The Hampton Inn). This is not the place you can afford to stay on every trip but he guys if you want big points with your honey stay here at least once in you life time. The Kingfish (Huey Long) ran his political machine here. Also if you are a history buff this is the bet hotel in New Orleans. And you are right across the street from the French Quarter. I never did like New Orleans but after this trip I have a new found admiration for the place. I plan to go back to New Orleans and hope I will get back to The Roosevelt.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, refurbished rooms, inconsistent service”
Reviews.Author: jsp3
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Roosevelt for four nights during Thanksgiving week. I grew up in New Orleans and had been to the Blue Room before, but I wanted to show the hotel to my wife and kids. The hotel was already decorated for Christmas, and the lights in the lobby are beautiful. Many tourists come just to have their pictures taken among the white trees and lights. We had a luxury suite, which was quite nice for our family as our girls could share the pull out bed in the couch in the living room. Since the hotel is just across Canal St. from the French Quarter, it wasn't too loud, but it's by no means soundproof from partying and other street noise. (We were there during the Bayou Classic game and events.) The gym, inside the spa, is not well equipped for weights, but it does have many aerobic machines. And each morning, the hotel had towels, water and fresh fruit for those of us returning from a run. Nice touch. It was still warm enough during the first part of the week to enjoy the rooftop pool. We enjoyed the well made espresso drinks in the coffee cafe on the lobby level and had two free drinks in the Sazerac bar, compliments of my HH Diamond status. My only real complaint is inconsistent cleaning service. We got no cleaning service after our first night, although they did try to do a turn-down service on our uncleaned room. When we called and asked for service as we went out for dinner, they didn't even bring fresh towels. Glass wear, if used, was not consistently returned to the room.
