We sometimes didn't receive wash cloths. And debris, presumably from another room's room service tray, stayed on the carpet in the hall outside our room the entire four days we were there. Fortunately, the rate was good and our kids didn't notice these issues, but it wasn't up the level of a Waldorf Astoria collection hotel. Tip: the self park garages near the hotel are about half the $40 per night valet fee.

Reviews.Title: “Space and Quiet Comfort”
Reviews.Author: Florimbi
Reviews.Content: Hotel has just been renovated in the last 1 1/2 yrs - so everything is in like new condition. Beds were wonderfully comfortable. We got upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite - with 2 bathrooms, 3 flat screen TV's - so much space! The lobby is beautifully decorated for the holidays. We took lots of pictures! Guerlain spa on premises and a great gift store. Food from the restuarant was wonderful, too and room service was prompt. Even better was how quiet the rooms were - never heard a sound from traffic or other guests in the hallways. Definitely would stay again and recommend!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, lovely rooms, historic New Orleans gem”
Reviews.Author: TheFlyingMommy
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Roosevelt New Orleans. The hotel is simply lovely. Historic. The service was excellent, the rooms luxuriously appointed. The hallways are exceptionally wide, and the elevators old-fashioned small. One item I will point out that I appreciated - I left behind three articles of clothing, but did not realize it until the next day. The housekeeping staff had turned in the items, and security found it right away. They connected me to the UPS office in the hotel who took my credit card and shipped the items back to me. I really appreciated the process the hotel must have set up for this to have worked so well. In the lobby is a cafe with simply beautiful desserts in the case - made by a local pastry chef. The barristia was a hard-core coffee expert and insisted on brewing a fresh pot for me. The bar is very pretty - original, I'm sure.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: FXTIP
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in September, 2010. The experience was great from check-in to check-out. The employees here are great. The hotel itself is over the top. I had been in the Sazerac bar before and knew that I would have to stay the night here on a future visit to Nola. The Sazerac bar will give you an idea of the type of experience to expect as a guest here (a trip back in time.) I ate at Domenica and had great gourmet pizza at happy hour. The bed and furnishing are high quality . The bathroom posh too with four shower heads arranged vertically. If you have the chance to stay here, Do it. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous in every way”
Reviews.Author: nolazona
Reviews.Content: I have nothing bad to say about this hotel. I'd stayed at it when it was the Fairmont, but was happy to see it restored to its former glory as the Roosevelt. It's a beautiful art deco hotel, with a lot of attention to detail. Rooms were very nice and beds incredibly comfortable (I should know - thanks to food poisoning - I spent about 36 hrs straight in the room - I also know bathroom was spotless which was really nice when I collapsed on its floor). I saw some of the other reviews noted bad service but that was not my experience. The workout room is also head and tails above most of what you will see in NOLA hotels, because lets face it, you don't go there to exercise. Yeah, its expensive but worth it, especially if you are there for a special occassion, you get what you pay for (see my review on the hell hole Ambassador Hotel for evidence of that).

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the Money!”
Reviews.Author: Brandon39
Reviews.Content: Immediately, you will notice the 145 million dollar renovation. Beautiful! However, there's no world class service there to back it up. Check-in was terrible; We had to wait until 6 oclock to get our room. I'm a Diamond Member. The restaurants are very good but expensive. We paid over $50 dollars for breakfast. The bell staff were okay. I've had better at less expensive hotels. We would have been better off at the Hilton or Hampton Inn. Save yourself some money

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Experience at All Levels”
Reviews.Author: GeraldandMarie
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit for business and took my wife on a 5 day trip to New Orleans recently. I am generally a Marriott or Starwoods guy but read the reviews on the Roosevelt and decided to try it. I have been to New Orleans 4 times in the past 5 years...hands down, this is the nicest hotel in New Orleans!! From the time we were greeted, to how housekeeping responded, to the use of the concierge and the fitness center, service was exemplary! For example, when I asked an employee where the fitness center was, he actually walked me all the way there, and conversed nicely with me as we walked. The rooms were immaculate which is important to us. And the location was perfect. I can not say enough....this is an outstanding hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!”
Reviews.Author: Ggauntann
Reviews.Content: We arrived at The Roosevelt, Confirmation in hand, at 6 PM only to find that there was not a room ready for us. We were asked to wait, along with our luggage, in the lobby for "fifteen minutes or so". We noticed at that time that the lobby somewhat resembled an airport that had been shut down due to inclement weather. People were all over the lobby with their luggage awaiting a room. After 20 minutes we returned to the counter to check and were told that it would be "about another 20 minutes or so" before our room was ready. When we asked what would have happened had we arrived at the 3:00 check-in time and we were told that we "most likely would have had a room". So what does this mean? Even though we gave them a credit card to "confirm", thus the term "confirm" our room they seemed to have given it to someone else. We finally settled for a Queen Room even though we had reserved a King. On the second day of our stay, Maid service arrived promptly at 4 PM! (The hotel did compensate us by slipping a letter of apology under the door of our room?) As it turned out, several people attending the same Reception we were, had the same problems with rooms not being ready. Then the evening after the Reception one couple went, Confirmation in hand, to check in and were told they did not have a room and no rooms were available. They were from out of town and had to drive the 70 miles back to their home that night. The only reason for all of these problems can be overbooking. We were looking forward to our stay at a Historic New Orleans hotel with a great reputation but were very let down. We will not be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most comfortable beds I've slept in (home included)”
Reviews.Author: zehver
Reviews.Content: Roosevelt has great ambiance. You feel 1940's Orleans as it were fresh and new. My King Suite room was on a low floor with no view even though I requested a high floor with a view. I went down to complain and see if I could be switched, but the front desk seemed overwhelmed so I figured I'd just deal with it. Needless to say, I began my stay a bit on the negative side. The sheer comfort of the room, bed, and shower won me over. By the first day I was comfortably at home in my low floor room. I was disappointed that there was no coffee maker in my room...but all in all that is minor. I would highly recommend this hotel and stay here again. Note: great hotel bar and coffee shop! Very close to Bourbon Street, but far enough away so that you don't feel on top of the 3am action and noise.

Reviews.Title: “Ants In Our Pants!!!”
Reviews.Author: walkformilers
Reviews.Content: Where do I start??!!! On first impressions you cannot fail to be impressed with what welcomes you to the Roosevelt. The lobby is everything you would expect from the Waldorf chain... but that is where it ends. We were in New Orleans for my partners 40th birthday so definitley wanted a relaxing luxury break. Second day, after the first shower buzzer in the room went.... apparantly underneath our room had flooded. We wern't asked if it was inconvienient for us not to be getting dressed and ready to go out we had to sit there in limbo chasing the workmen to find out when they were coming back so we could get dressed. The champagne we had bought for that night remained unopened. 90 minutes later the workmen finished, leaving us pondering how to salvage our plans. Day three... we awoke to a few ants in the bathroom... a bit worrying but we put it down to the work that had been completed the previously day.......UNTIL we opened one of the draws in the room to find it crawling with ants, (along with the second bed in the room). My partner decended on reception to complain... we were moved to a second room. As I started to pack up our stuff I heard the yell from the new room where my partner had dicovered a MASSIVE cockroach in the bathroom. Once again back to reception to aske to be moved room... which they did but to an inferior room! An offer to pick up our bar tab was turned down by us as we thought we at least should talk about this with the manager...who was suddenly unavailable, (more of which later!). They eventually sent someone up to deal with the cockroach, (again after us chasing them), by which time we had wasted another morning faffing about in the hotel. We have stayed in some of the best hotels in the world, (and some of the worst!!) and this is not what we expected from the Waldorf chain for what we were paying per night. Later that afternoon by the pool, (NB which was also filthy, complete with dirty mark all around it, cigarettes butts floating and a jacuzzi that didn't need bubble bath as all the scum frothed up lovely!), we happened upon the manager who knew nothing about our complaint, (not what the man in reception said who had told them.....). She promised to call us later that day to talk about making things right. This didn't happen although our bar tab and a pay-per-view movie, (about $50) had been taken care of. By this time we were completly fed up. Even though we were kept up the next two nights by next door, we had no faith in the fact that it would have been dealt with - not a good feeling when you have chosen a hotel based on a reputation. Positives?? There were two exits and it was right next to all the resturants and bars which meant you didn't have to spend too long in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Staff needs lessons on manners”
Reviews.Author: Bullie2
Reviews.Content: There is no dobut that this hotel is one of the most luxurious and beautiful in New Orleans. However, The staff was rude and unfriendly. Check in was at 3pm and we were not able to get in to our room till after 5pm. When I enquired about why the room was not ready the lady at the front desk was rude and offered no sort of apology to make up for their mistake. If I am going to pay the money to stay at The Roosevelt then I expect to be treated with respect.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel. I loved it.”
Reviews.Author: safety86
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roosevelt during Halloween weekend. The check in experience was fast and the staff was great. My room was on the second floor with a terrible view but the room itself was terrific. I had a king room. I was decently sized for a New Orleans king room. I heard no exterior noise and no noise from adjoining rooms, despite the hotel being booked up. The bed was very comfortable and I slept well. There was a large flat screen TV in the room and a smaller flat screen in the bathroom, which was nice. The bathroom was very nice. The shower was a walk-in type shower, marble walls with a main shower head, an adjustable wand shower, and two wall-mounted adjustable nozzles for the back, etc. I found the entire hotel to be very clean with a classy feel to it. I didn't eat at the hotel or utilize any of the services such as the spa, so I can't comment on that part. The location is great, too. It is about a block from Bourbon Street on the opposite side of Canal Street. I did not utilize the hotel's internet. I think it was $12.95 a day, which is probably the biggest turn off that I encountered with the Roosevelt. In keeping with my previous reviews, I refuse to give an excellent 5 rating to a hotel that charges for internet access. The checkout experience was good with no billing problems.

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable!”
Reviews.Author: TorontoJeannette
Reviews.Content: This hotel is unbelievable. It is beautiful, gracious and historic. I had stayed here years ago when it was the Fairmont Hotel and could not believe it could be any more luxurious now than it was then but it is! The lobby is breathtaking with lots of marble and carpets. The rooms are bigger than I remembered and are elegant and comfortable at the same time. The staff is right there when you need them. We had polite service during our entire stay. And the beds are marvelous. I would reccomend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful hotel -- we had a terrific stay!”
Reviews.Author: LBuchanan56
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had one night in New Orleans after he had been in town for a conference at another hotel. After some research, I chose the Roosevelt because of its old world feel and the great AAA rate -- we booked a deluxe king room. I cannot adequately express how fantastic this hotel is. The lobby, as many have mentioned, is stunning -- it looks just as it does in the hotel photo gallery. The staff was incredibly nice -- we had requested early check-in but knew it was a longshot on a Sunday. We were unable to check in at 2 pm, but walked for a bite to eat (the French Quarter is 1 1/2 blocks away on the other side of Canal -- the streetcar stops are there, too -- close to the Quarter but not so close that you get all the noise) and the front desk called us at 3 pm (the actual check in time) to say our room was ready. My husband joked about being glad to know our penthouse suite was ready -- we returned to the hotel and were given our keys... to an amazing king suite -- to which they had upgraded us. (Ask for Room 11111.)(That is not a typo.) I have stayed in nice hotels, including Four Seasons and Ritz Carlton properties, which were all lovely, but never in a room or suite this nice -- it was breathtaking -- an entry hall, a beautiful, large living room with a desk, large sofa, large occasional chairs, there was a separate dining table (for 2) area and a bar, then a beautiful, large bedroom with a wonderful king bed, large chaise lounge, huge dresser, wonderful bath w/2 sinks and a separate shower/tub/commode room. Fabulous robes (nicest I have ever had in a hotel) also provided.Two large flat screen tvs and another small one in the bathroom (where the sinks were). All the furnishings were beautiful period reproductions. I was so stunned, I took pictures of the entire suite. I actually called down to the desk to find out what rate we were being charged as I was afraid my husband had signed something for a zillion dollars without reading it, but it was our original AAA rate. The staff was very nice and accommodating. Our luggage was delayed in being delivered from the bell desk, and when we called (it had been about an hour after we checked in, and we could have called sooner, but were enjoying relaxing in the suite), it was delivered immediately with very sincere apologies for the delay. The only other blip was that the shower (very nice with multiple shower heads) had a leak from the glass enclosure to the floor, which we had to soak up with all our available (huge, wonderful) towels -- so we asked for replacements when we came in from dinner and they were delivered in 10 minutes. The Sazerac Bar is a very cool place with all sorts of interesting specialty drinks and, again, a lovely staff. I would stay here again in a heartbeat. It is really a beautiful, beautiful hotel. My only regret was that we could only stay one night. With regard to what we did in NOLA, we had a wonderful dinner at Mr. B's Bistro -- very busy, popular place and the owners are part of the Brennan family, as is true of many of NOLA's finest restaurants -- and heard some interesting jazz at Snug Harbor on Frenchmen's Street (for the over-30 set, our cab driver told us, and we certainly qualified), the obligatory beignets at Cafe Du Monde (tasty and affordable) on Jackson Square, and a breakfast at the Coffee Pot, which we would not recommend -- surly service and the food was fine, but that's it. The WWII Museum is terrific and the film, "Beyond all Borders," is tremendous. We had lunch at the American Sector (part of the museum), which was hip and cool to look at and sit in, but the food was a little pricey and fine, but nothing to write home about.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Sparty2007
Reviews.Content: This hotel didn't live up to the usual standards of Waldorf Hotels. I requested an early check in, but wasn't able to check into my room until 3:30, 30 minutes after the standard check in time listed on our reservation and the hotels website. We had to rush to get ready for a wedding. As we waited in the lobby for our room to be cleaned we noticed many other couples with the same issue. It's a nice hotel, the rooms are clean, comfortable, and nicely decorated, but the hotel is not located in the heart of the french quarter, nor is the stated check-in time standard . I won't be returning.

Reviews.Title: “don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: x2friends
Reviews.Content: DO NOT STAY HERE. There are many choices for luxury hotels in New Orleans, and the Roosevelt just does not measure up. I booked my stay about a year ago, before the hotel had even opened. I called to confirm our late arrival to the hotel earlier in the week leading up to my stay. Yet, upon getting to the hotel at midnight, we were told there was no room for us, and we would have to go to another hotel. We got a room the next day. During our stay, housekeeping failed to clean up the complimentary fruit tray the hotel management sent (it was moldy). Stay at the Ritz or the Windsor Court, where the service is exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible!”
Reviews.Author: hcsd123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I never got a honeymoon so after a year of marriage we both finally took some time off from work. We booked two nights at the Roosevelt. I used my HiltonHonors points for the stay and booked via phone. I requested a upgrade and the reservation person said there were several suites open for my stay (booked it one day before we travelled). After arriving at 9pm, we decided to take a shower and head out on the town. Once we returned, figuring the room was hot from our showers, we went to sleep. I got up at least three times sweating so bad I had to flip the pillow over. The AC only goes to 65 but I will say it must have been regulated to stay at 78. I tried to use the fan but it was too noisy. After a miserable night, my wife and I decided to leave and head back home (7 hours away). Not to mention losing all my points for the second night we didnt stay. Front staff was apologetic and I knew it wasnt their fault so I didnt complain too much. Dont valet park for $38 because there is a parking garage 1/2 block away for $22. Rooms are small but updated and nice flatscreen TV. For the price I would have stayed across the street at the Mariott or an other major hotel---at least I know they dont monitor their AC controls....Very uncomfortable stay and will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful gem near the French Quarter”
Reviews.Author: kpatters
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a King Deluxe room for a conference held in this fine hotel. While the room was not huge there was ample space. The bathroom was a nice size as well. The hotel is beautiful from the moment you step into the entrance. I was impressed with the attention to detail. The pool area is gorgeous - there was even a bartender on duty the day I was there. Other guests in a queen room complained it was small so be sure to book a King room or a deluxe room. I just had two walk two blocks and I was on Bourbon Street. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “This is my new favorite Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MVTUIG
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I recently stayed at the Roosevelt New Orleans. He was there for a conference I was just a tag along. I fully expected our hotel to be a typical conference type slightly tattered corporate hotel. What a pleasant surprise! This hotel is absolutely lovely. Every little detail of the 150 million dollar restoration is exquisite and appropriate. The staff is like nothing I have encountered in the last 40 years. Everyone was absolutely attentive, charming, informative, warm, gracious, knowledgeable could go on. Our room was outstanding, clean fresh spacious with 12 foot ceilings. It was perfectly situated just the right amount away from the french Quarter (3 min walk) to no be in the throngs of people. The Sazarac Bar is a jewel-box. We had a bell man show us the historic Blue Room where many famous jazz era people played. I cannot say enough. Just standing in the lobby is a pleasure. I never even made it to the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Broken promises wouldn't stop me from staying again....”
Reviews.Author: ejk1624
Reviews.Content: I was so excited when I found out my family would be staying at this hotel for a long weekend. We along with a huge group of friends all decided to stay here for a wedding that weekend. The wedding rates were decent and considering how expensive it normally is, we all jumped at the chance to stay here. We knew it would be an experience to remember. Hotel lobby is absolutely gorgeous and pretty much anyone that works there greets you as they pass by. Hotel is far enough you don't feel overwhelmed by all the tourists/French Quarter, but if you don't like to walk or have health issues you may have to take cabs to most destinations. Our room was beautiful and beds were out of this world comfortable. Bathroom was also very elegant. Floor had gorgeous tile pattern and there was even a TV in there. I usually cannot stand the lighting of hotel rooms, but this was excellent. I could get ready and not feel like I was cooped up in a hotel room. Lot's of mirrors and decent closet space. Room also didn't have that "hotel room" smell some have, which to me is a great thing. I had brought my own hairdryer not expecting to find the room was equipped with the best hotel hair dryer, best hairdryer in general I have ever used. I know itâ€™s not usually the highlight of someoneâ€™s stay, but I know the brand and was so pleased to find that in our room to use! TV was nice but remote was a pain in the neck to use and seemed to never work. After talking to others staying there they had the same issue. Internet in the room wasn't free, I thought that was standard these days. My main complaint was the housekeeping. I mean, what housekeeping? If we didn't call to have our room cleaned, it wouldn't get done. We got there Thursday and had to call for clean towels Friday evening and then Saturday had to call just to get someone to make our bed. We had heard someone we were with had turn down service at night, we called to request this and that never happened either. Every time we opened our door from being out we were only disappointed to see beds hadn't been made, towels weren't re-stocked, and bathrooms hadn't been wiped down. Even when we called for service they didn't come. When they finally did arrive it was at a time we actually wanted to be in the room. I get that it's a big hotel and there is a schedule, but honestly if we hadn't called at all, which didn't even work every time, no one would have touched our room. That is pretty much inexcusable for a hotel like this. It was almost funny that no matter how many times we called they kept saying they would send someone....and no one would arrive. And in the end never did get any turn down service. They did try coming at 5:45 one evening for turn down service, which to me was a bit ridiculous. Considering they had just made our beds that day around 3 it was almost laughable that they would come back 2 hours later to turn down our beds. We had requested for them to come back after we left since we would be out all night. She even wrote down what timeâ€¦.and nothing. It was like they just wanted to get it done to say they did it, rather then do it at a reasonable time as they should and as we requested. It was more principle then anything that angers me most about that situation because I don't mind using a towel twice or getting into an unmade bed... I certainly don't get turn down service at my house, but the fact we called so many times and were promised every time to be taken care of and then not was absurd. Then at the end of our stay they had charged us a dollar every time we had called down to ask for service! Everything else couldnâ€™t have been better, which is just a shame that what we experienced is what we remember the most about their service. The pool area was amazing. Pool was very clean and relaxing. The bar at the pool had football on for those who wanted to watch and the bartender and pool staff was very friendly and welcoming. Guest shop is totally overpriced. If you need a soda or toiletries you forgot, go to the Walgreens around the corner from the hotel. John Beshâ€™s restaurant Domenica in the hotel is awesome. Very young, hip, wait staff with a menu to match. I had actually met the head manager out at a bar before dining there and when my family and I went she remembered me by name and came over to see how our meal and overall experience in New Orleans was. The Sazerac Bar is also a nice place to go for a drink, if anything it was cool to go just for the history of the bar alone. Despite what happened, overall it was a great stay. With all the other wonderful things there we didnâ€™t let it ruin our time. I just know how we all had been waiting so long for this weekend and to all stay there, that it was just such disappointment and almost shock. How could a place so nice have a total polar opposite approach to service? Anything that didnâ€™t have to do with making sure we were satisfied was amazing. I knew going into this that it would probably be my only time ever getting a chance to stay in a hotel of this grandeur. I just never imagined that the service would have been the worst part of the stay, not for how this hotel is advertised and what they charge.

Reviews.Title: “6 nights at the Roosevelt”
Reviews.Author: redwing3
Reviews.Content: The hotel is elegant and spotless and the staff downstairs attentive. The concierge in particular was very helpful. We had a large bathroom with tub and one showerhead. Smallish room but well appointed and it felt more spacious because of the high ceilings. The bed was very comfortable and the room quiet. Housekeeping missed our room one day but did come back to clean up at 5 pm. Our one disappointment was the Internet did not work in our room for our 6 night stay and nothing was done to fix it. The wi-fi signal was too low to be usable and I suspect none of the interior rooms have a signal because of the shape of the building, but it worked just fine in the lobby. This was a business trip so Internet was important. A coffee pot in the room would be a nice addition.

Reviews.Title: “My new favorite hotel in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: chickstein
Reviews.Content: I stayed here this week and WOW! What a beautiful hotel. The staff could not have been more friendly. The hotel is throwback to the days of glamour. The rooms are beautifully decorated and quiet. And the SHOWER-OMG! Multiple shower heads coming at you at all angles and heights. Absolutely loved my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Glamorous, Historical, Warm, and Elegant”
Reviews.Author: spartanwhiskey
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent our 20th Anniversary at The Roosevelt. I could have chosen at any Hilton hotel in the world for this event. But when my wife said she wanted to go to New Orleans because she had never been there before, I booked The Roosevelt. A better decision we could not have made. The hotel is very elegant and beautifully appointed. It is polished and sparkling after a recent renovation, and the staff is super friendly and attentive. We had a king suite on the top floor and it was gorgeous, with two giant flat screen TV's (one in the bedroom and one in the sitting room). It even had a small flat screen TV in the bathroom. In fact, there were TWO bathrooms, which added to the sense of privacy and elegance, where the tile floors were adorned with original mosaic artwork. There are original paintings on the walls and the draperies add a rich sense of texture. The restaurant Domenica was fantastic...among the best we experienced in the city. One night we ordered takeout from Domenica and ate it in our room with a bottle of cabernet, which was very romantic. The Roosevelt far surpassed our expectations. Set in a convenient location in the center of everything, this hotel helped make our anniversary a truly memorable experience. The concierge "Barry" suggested excellent restaurants and made our reservations for us. He provided us with a personal itinerary. The rooftop pool is clean, quiet, and a tranquil respite from the busy streets. If you want an elegant, comfortable, and attentive hotel in New Orleans, there is none better than The Roosevelt.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: saints_tigerfan
Reviews.Content: This place is fabulous and dreamy! I loved the shower with four shower heads and the bed was a dream. I slept so good. I will definately go back there!!! Beautiful renovation!

Reviews.Title: “Grand hotel, fabulous staff...no complaints here”
Reviews.Author: antoinemb
Reviews.Content: The lobby of this historic hotel is spectacular. The rooms are very residential in style and have been renovated to perfection. The concierge team is fantastic and extremely knowledgeable. The entire staff is as warm as can be and very accomodating. Domenica restaurant in by Chef John Besh in the lobby is home of the best Northern Italian food. The Guerlain SPA and fitness center is modern and very well appointed. Close to everything and walking distance to the French quarter, the Roosevelt is in an ideal location. I personally would not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property, but issues”
Reviews.Author: PartyOfFiveVA
Reviews.Content: Gloriously beautiful hotel. But they nickel dime you for everything, including paying for Internet access. No hot water in the morning. Front desk totally nonchalant when informed - "I'll get maintainence up" but no apology and i was checking out so what difference did it make. Also, no coffeepot in room and their coffeeshop - which you have pay for - doesn't open till 6am so if you want coffee at 5:30am you have to order a pot for room service. Come on guys, put some coffee in the lobby at 5am, the W around the corner does. Still a beautiful building but they need to work harder on creating a beautiful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Motel 6 would have been better”
Reviews.Author: RicBlasko
Reviews.Content: I checked in, only to find out, their system cut the last day of my trip off, as well as the rate for the block of rooms the 1500 group I was with had settled on. For three days I checked to at the front desk to see if they corrected the rate, ($40 a day should have been removed) Each day I told them I was checking out on Sunday, not Saturday. I was told it was taken care of. On Saturday, I was told at noon, I had 20 minutes to get out of my room, it was booked the night before, and I had to leave. So 799.88 miles from home, with no where else to go at the last minute, I was kicked out of my room. I lucked out, and found space on someone's floor to sleep for a night, while I tried to find somewhere else to go. While there, I found out that 5 other rooms had the same issue, where as a groups we showed up on Wen, some on Thursday, and were all leaving Sunday and Monday, that the hotel started to cut people short, and kick them out of their room, to make room for people showing up for a football game. Locals were given our rooms, while people who traveled from Flordia, Kentucky, Ohio, New York and Washington were sent packing at the last minute with no where to go.

Reviews.Title: “Stately elegance”
Reviews.Author: loPDXer
Reviews.Content: This storied hotel is alive and well post-Katrina. The Roosevelt is centrally located with access to the French Quarter without the claustrophobic clutter of a Bourbon Street alley. The rooms at the Roosevelt are elegantly supplied with excellent bathrooms, comfortable beds and okay TV-internet. The restaurants are quite good and competent espresso in the coffee shop. Staff is friendly, helpful and competent. I found no signs of support for any of the more vitriolic comments at the bottom of this list and must attribute these experiences to the authors themselves and not the hotel. The fitness center is well appointed and maintained. The entire hotel is spotless.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Service and Incredible Rooms”
Reviews.Author: jbowmantn
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this hotel. I have stayed at numerous hotels in New Orleans and the Roosevelt is one of my favorites. The staff is frienldy and went out of their way to make the stay great. Stayed in a King suite with one and a half baths. Room was well appointed and very comfortable and spacious. The hotel pool is very nice with great service. Only complaint would be noise from Canal street, but in the French Quarter, it is hard to get away from late night noise no matter where you stay.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel experiences we have had.”
Reviews.Author: jerryMurfreesboro_TN
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel with friendly staff--not always what you get from a large hotel. We booked a superior room and it was just about all one could ask for; beautifully decorated, big and spacious with nice couch and chairs, a bed that was so comfortable it was hard to climb out of, lots of windows, very quiet, very clean and big TV (and even one in the bathroom). The only downside was that the bathroom, while beautifully appointed, was quite small. But the room itself was so sumptuous I couldn't quibble about the bathroom. Small annoyances: 1) no wastepaper basket in room, only in bathroom. 2) we were missing a bath towel and phoned for one to be delivered, but it never came.

Reviews.Title: “Great Couples Retreat”
Reviews.Author: karenjsmith1
Reviews.Content: My finance and I recently spent four wonderfully relaxing days at the Roosevelt New Orleans. I booked the trip as a surprise get-away for the 2 of us. After searching the internet for a 5 Star hotel with a great roof top pool, I stumbled upon the Roosevelt. Internet prices were around $180.00/ per night. I called the hotel directly and they honored the internet prices. Additionally I spoke with Claire and Jillian who proved to be extremely helpful in helping me to select the exact style of room that I wanted for our weekend. With their helpful knowledge I choose to upgrade to the Waldorf Suite on the 9th floor at a rate of $259.00/night. Ask about the 4th night free, and the rate will actually go down! The suite was extravagant, with a large double door entry way, marble flooring, and beautiful furniture. The sitting room was narrow, but the 20 foot ceilings and large bay window quickly helped you overlook the actual square footage of the room. The suite included a large walk in closet, and a nicely sized bedroom with yet again another large window, and room for a small settee. The bathroom was AMAZING! The shower had 1/2 in glass doors, 54 jets, 1 rain head, and a hand held shower. Additionally the tub was so large that when I set in it the water came up to my chin before I even leaned back. I think it should have been called a personal pool. The roof top pool has been redesigned, and feels like you are a million miles away from the rest of the world. It was nice enough that you could believe you wee at a resort, not just a downtown hotel. Beware of the parking charges, they are ridiculous, and self parking is literally across the street. Ask about deals and offers like the fourth night free. Overall this was a beautiful hotel, and the service was impeccable. Will will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT A BEAUTIFUL HOTEL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sollibaba
Reviews.Content: I live an hour away from New Orleans and visit the city several times a month for travel and leisure. I will say that of all the hotels I have stayed at in New Orleans, this is the best by far! My partner and I booked this hotel at the last minute for a long Labor Day weekend getaway. I was surprised at how affordable the rate was -- $129/night. The hotel was running a special for Louisiana residents, and we were able to get this rate on their website only. I checked Expedia and other sites, and the rate on those websites were $159. Check in went smoothly. There were alot of people checking in with about 7 people at the front desk. There was a little bit of a wait, but it was not bad. I was asked for assistance with my luggage, but I kindly declined because I did not need the help of a bellman. The rooms were absolutely stunning and beautifully decorated. I am usually very picky with the rooms at any hotel that I stay at, and the room at this hotel passed my standards without any problems. Everything was new and extremely clean. I could definitely tell the quality difference of the furniture in the rooms compared to other hotels. The shower in the bathroom was AMAZING!!! There are 4 different shower heads located at different height levels, and it creates the most relaxing shower experience ever. Very nice Agraria amenities too. There is also a TV in the bathroom, which was a great addition (see picture). The tiling on the bathroom floor and in the shower were beautiful as well. The rooms also had 2 complimentary robes that my partner and I enjoyed. Turndown service was efficient. I will say that I cannot comment on services such as valet, luggage assistance, room service, the concierge, etc, because I did not utilize these services. I am just the kind of person that would rather do the job myself. But from what little I did encounter with the employees, they were very nice. Overall, this hotel is outstanding, and will be the hotel of choice anytime I am visiting New Orleans! *TIP* DO NOT PAY FOR PARKING! Parking at this hotel is ridiculous, charging $38/night + tax. There are numerous parking spots on the street for free. We parked on the corner of Poydras and Baronne without any problems. It was about a 5 block walk, but I would rather walk than pay that much to park. Just look for a spot that does not have a meter, and no yellow paint on the curbside. Parking on the Poydras Street area of town is easier and cheaper to come by than Canal St - French Quarter areas. Also, there is a Walgreens right next door if you ever need to get anything.

Reviews.Title: “I would have expected better.”
Reviews.Author: MiamiTed59
Reviews.Content: Room wasn't ready when we checked in middle of the afternoon. They said they would call my cell phone when it was, They never did. After checking with them several times, they finally had the room ready almost an hour after we checked in. Then it took them almost four hours to bring my suitcase up to my room. And the first time they brought someone else's suitcase. You would think that at the rates they charge, they would include free wifi, but the don't. It is free at less expensive hotels. The restaurant is very expensive. over $20.00 for just an omelet and coffee for breakfast. Cell phone reception is terrible at best. That is something that is easy to fix with inexpensive repeaters. They have wifi access points everywhere, they could do the same for cell phone coverage.

Reviews.Title: “Beware: Parking $42.56 a night,”
Reviews.Author: stjoesun
Reviews.Content: I have such mixed feelings about this hotel. The good: The staff was wonderfully friendly in an easygoing, southern way. The lobby was exquisite. Brunch Sunday in the Blue room was very good. On the other hand- I had stayed at this property when it was owned by another group. The desk clerk kept telling me that I "wasn't goiing to believe" the size of the rooms. Well, I didn't. The room was smallish and the bathroom was fairly small, even though I had an upgraded deluxe room. (The opposite of my room years ago). Service was slender, to say the least. I have a severe detergent allergy and the hotel was unable to re-wash my towels and blanket in hot water, something even 3 star hotels have been happy to do for me. (I have to take my own sheets anyway). As to housekeeping, we never had our soap replaced and, like the previous poster, a housekeeper took all out towels and left us with one hand towel. Also, some paper from their doilies stuck to the bathroom sink from being wet. In 4 days, they never cleaned or removed it. The housekeper carefully placed my cosmetics over it so it could not be seen.Told on the phone that we would have discount coupons to the Sunday Brunch, I asked twice and, though promised, we never received them until I sent my husband to the front desk. Parking is $25-$27 dollars a night at every other fine hotel in New Orleans that I have checked. I was shocked (but did not challenge) their excessive parking fees. I consider this abusive and,alone, is enough for me to discourage friends from staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay & ambiance”
Reviews.Author: Mpls_MNWanderlust
Reviews.Content: Had great stay, except someone on our floor tripped the fire alarm at 3 AM & we had to evacuate!!! Luckily it was NOT a fire, but it was a shock. I recommend the restaurant Domenica, it is just like dining in Italy. Also the Sazerac bar has great cocktails. There was no free wireless, a daily fee to use the Internet is applied to your bill. That's a bit chintzy in my opinion, considering the room rate. The pool was crowded and hot, but a nice space. I liked the fitness center, it had new equipment and not crowded. You have to go through the Guerlain spa to get to it, so the hours are not 24/7. All in all, I'd go back. It is newly renovated & a lot cleaner than other NOLA luxury hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Pure posh, great location”
Reviews.Author: lindagaf
Reviews.Content: Really recommend this hotel, it is utterly gorgeous. Staff were impeccable, rooms beautifully decorated, if a bit small. However, this is an old hotel, and when last remodelled they did a great job by creating a separate sitting area. Makes the room like a mini suite, which is good with the kids. Bar and restaurant always busy, guests were quiet. Bear in mind that although you aren't in the French Quarter, you are so close to it that it is irrelevant. Canal Street can be noisy all night, I would ask for a room not facing it. I hate to think how noisy a hotel right in the quarter must be. Luxurious beds, towels, dressing gowns, etc... Stay and you won't be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mellu2msg
Reviews.Content: I think some of the other reviewers must confusing the Roosevelt with some other hotel in New Orleans. We drove up to the door and were nearly carried to the reception desk. EVERYONE welcomed us and wished us a Happy Anniversary. The suite was beautiful, immaculate, and huge. WE have stayed in hotels all over the world and all over New Orleans and this visit was wonderful. Our car was ready for us to leave with a 5 minute notice and the Jazz Brunch in the Blue Room was delicious. No loud tourist noise and the Lobby is fabulous and the staff friendly and courteous. The place is pricey, but you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Property - Classy!”
Reviews.Author: IrishFan
Reviews.Content: I like modern places generally, but once in a while it's nice to stay in a "grande dame" kind of place like The Roosevelt. I just needed a place for one night at the end of a stay in New Orleans and had to get out at 4:00 a.m. to catch an early flight, but in just a 12-hour stay this place won me over. I used a reward cert, so the price (free) was right. Despite being there as a "freebie", my HHonors status got me upgraded to a King suite. Very nice, two rooms, large bathroom...furnishings like I would expect my Grandmother to have maybe, but new and clean! Had a drink in the Sezarac Bar, very professional "old school" bartenders and a great art deco atmosphere. Became dressier as 5:00 approached, but the staff didn't seem to mind. Made a brief visit to the pool area, it might be nice in the early part of the day but late in the afternoon in July it was pretty hot and mostly a sun-baked cement patio so I didn't linger. Very friendly and accomodating staff. From check-in to the gift shop clerk, the bell staff, the conceriege...even an off-duty cook from the kitchen, all had a greeting for guests when I walked by. Did not get to try the restaurant but will have to do so in the future, it looked nice. The only weird "miss" about the place was the lack of Kleenex in the room, there was a dispenser but it was empty. And me with a head cold, oh well. But the overall experience was still so great I'm sticking with a "5" for the place.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed bag.... beware of being trapped in old elevators”
Reviews.Author: Chris1888
Reviews.Content: The good: I wanted to love this place. It has a long history and was nicely renovated. Beautiful hotel in many ways-- esp the lobby areas. Also liked the Sazarac bar and the cafe which was a nice place for late snacks or early coffee/ light breakfast. Good location near canal and French Quarter. That is where the positive comments end. The bad: Arrival experience is horrible. You pull up to busy side street and are ignored by staff. Then you get to shlep your bags up tall exterior stairs through narrow door. Only after you get inside do the bell hop staff show up to take your tip--- err luggage. Absurd. Hotel rooms can be noisy at night with sirens all over town. Our kids ordered room service one night for simple hamburgers and drinks (for 2) and the bill rang up to nearly $100. Hotel "management" was young and clueless. One guy stood at elevators and seemed stoned all the time. The ugly: Apparently the hotel has no concern about the ancient elevators. We got stuck in the very small elevator when heading out to town for dinner. It was horrible. We were packed in there with heavy clothing (it was February) and I thought I was going to pass out. Only input from hotel staff was "they called the elevator guy"-- who knows what that means. I got the feeling these elevators get stuck often--- and if you think that is a minor inconvenience try spending 15 minutes crammed is a elevator with heavy coats, little air and no room to move... and no confidence the hotel is doing anything to deal with your situation.... and we could have been stuck there for hours. I took the stairs every other time after this event. I would not return to this hotel. The senior management at this hotel is obviously out of touch with their guests--- amazing they keep their jobs in this economy.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful renovation, but small rooms and missing amenities were disappointing”
Reviews.Author: poogleypie
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to stay in the renovated Roosevelt (reverting to its old name after years of being the Fairmont). The downstairs lobby/reception areas were gorgeous and all decorated for the holidays (we were there over New Year's Eve). We had a drink at the Sazerac bar which was filled with people having a great time, although the upscale Sazerac restaurant attached was fairly quiet - we didn't eat there. We did eat at Domenica, the low-key John Besh restaurant in the lobby, and it was reasonably good but missing something - the atmostphere felt like something you'd find in a large chain hotel, and had none of the charm and inspiration of his other restaurants. Terddy's Cafe was pretty much just a basic regular coffee shop - I would have welcomed a bit more luxury here, a place that would invite you to sit and relax after a day of shopping/sightseeing etc. The furnishings in the rooms were generally very nice, however our room was the smallest New Orleans hotel room I've ever stayed in. I think it was the standard king size room, and it was a corner room, but we felt really cramped - only about 2 feet of space between the end of the bed and the television, and then only a few feet on either side of the bed. Our bathroom mirrors and furniture were covered in dust, and basic things like hotel slippers were missing (not to be picky, but this is standard at most hotels in this class). Also, we had a package delivered to the hotel, and it was sent to the business center, which seemed to be closed the entire time we were there. After 3 trips to collect the package, we finally gave up. After a couple of days, the concierge was able to bring the package to us. The service at the hotel was generally good, but overall we were disappointed that this historic hotel turned out to be missing the magic. The rates were in the same range as the Ritz across the street, where we've stayed before, and we just didn't feel like the Roosevelt offered comparable value. We ended up going across to the Ritz for drinks one day and afternoon tea another day. And we've booked the Ritz for our next trip to New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great room, great pool!”
Reviews.Author: TheAlbins
Reviews.Content: I travel to New Orleans frequently and have stayed in plenty of hotels in the same area. This hotel is beautiful! We stayed in the luxury suite which was just perfect. Huge bathtub, huge shower, king bed, sitting area. We had one issue with housekeeping leaving cleaner in our room and not leaving clean towels. We contacted the hotel manager about this and they took care of this right away AND compensated us for the inconvenience. The rooftop pool is amazing! Please visit this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Elegance and beauty in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: LynnTed1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Roosevelt New Orleans in April for a little romantic getaway weekend. It was recommended by a friend, and I had seen advertisements on facebook. It was perfect! The hotel was opulent. Every detail was well appointed and beautiful. We loved our room and the location. I would recommend this hotel, and we plan to stay there again this year.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: tomdenverDenverCO
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt Hotel is a nice and very updated hotel in the heart of New Orleans. The lobby and public areas are beautiful and true to the historic character of this grand hotel. The Roosevelt is in a great location within easy walking distance of the French Quarter and right of the historic street car line on Canal St. The hotel has been totally updated and has a wonderful solid feel. I was a bit taken aback by the poor decorating choices in the rooms. The furniture, while high end is very out of character for the rest of the hotel. The rooms are furnished with the finest in McMansion furniture and drapes. We had a suite and the furniture in the sitting area was laid out in a ridiculous fashion (just like something you would see in a suburb where they want to pretend they have taste, but dont). Bigger is not always better and even though some of the furniture was Thomasville brand it all looked very out of place and too our of character for this wonderful hotel. The saving grace is that all the furniture can eventually be replaced and one day they will give the rooms the tasteful histoirc character they deserve.

Reviews.Title: “Classic architecture, elegant, and a great location in the heart of the French Quarter.”
Reviews.Author: RockyTheDog
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt has great location relative to the French Quarter and a quick trip to either Louis Armstrong or Lakefront airports. The hotel itself is truly beautiful; an elegantly ornamented lobby, grand Blue room for galas, and finely decorated yet cozy rooms. Business travelers and conferences are easily accommodated here, as are weddings and other formal events. Service is superb, from the moment you arrive: from the bellhops, to the front desk, concierge and all other staff encountered. This is a luxury hotel, and the clientele and rates reflect that. For budget travelers, there are no included amenities; expect a premium for any additional service from Wifi to use of the business center.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: LindaFL1234
Reviews.Content: I agree with all of these wonderful reviews! It is a beautiful hotel in a great location. It is just a few minute walk to Bourbon Street, Jackson Square, French Market, and the Casino. I much prefer staying in this location than closer to Bourbon Street because it is far enough removed to not be bothered by the noise at night. I was fortunate enough to attend a corporate event at the hotel, and the catering was AMAZING! I don't remember eating so well! Each event was doen perfectly to the last detail! The staff is very professional and helpful, and the hotel is wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, Old World Style Hotel in The Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: lopo
Reviews.Content: Seven-night stay in this very nice hotel. The decor-both in the public spaces & in my room-is exceptional. The lobby is elegant: marble floors, sculptures, classic decor, chandeliers, luxurious wood, leather chairs, inviting sofas - loved it! Staff is friendly, readily available. Concierge services were outstanding. My room was quite large (almost could be called a suite) with a walk-in closet, well-stocked bathroom (including a TV) and a very comfortable bed with lots of pillows. The location is nice, too, since it is far enough from Bourbon Street & The French Quarter that I was not disturbed by the nightly rowdiness, but it is within walking distance of the hot spots. I was surprised that the room did not have any sort of coffeemaker/service (It's been so many years since I've stayed anywhere that did not have this in my room that I take it for granted that it will be there.) Also, there were no mini-fridges available. :- ( Also, I was not pleased that they did not offer free Internet service in my room. I would expect a hotel of this caliber to provide it to guests. Otherwise, the hotel was a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it - superb service and accommodations!”
Reviews.Author: bschiavoni
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints - excellent service, delicious food, luxurious accommodations. Not to mention the location - just a block from the French Quarter. I was there for a business meeting, and all meals were buffet-style. I'm usually not the biggest fan of buffets, but the food served was always hot, always fresh, and always delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Elegance in The Big Easy”
Reviews.Author: SOBE1
Reviews.Content: Having visited New Orleans quite a few time and having done the Bourbon street crawl My wife and I wanted a elegant New Orleans style visit. The Roosevelt hit the mark..Impressive public spaces in old world gold and brass everywhere. Since this was a historic restoration after Katrina the hotel has retained it's original design mode. We originally had a 4th fl room overlooking the ugly ac ducts .After complaining we were happily moved up to quieter accomodations on the 11th floor with a nice view of Canal St and the river in the distance. Rooms average size but luxurious. Big flat screen and very nice bedding.Bathroom had amazing multi head shower and tv by the sink. The huge hotel complex had a Spa, fitness center and 2 or 3 restaurants bars. We also used to rooftop pool for a sunrise dip which was nice. Very few urban hotel pools are left in America so it was neat.All in all nice restful stay and good service. We found street parking to be relatively easy and avoided the high priced daily valet. We used Hilton points so for us the value was excellent. We would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent business district hotel in NOLA”
Reviews.Author: Louisvillian
Reviews.Content: I stayed four nights at the Roosevelt during my company's annual sales meeting. The hotel has been refurbished within the pas few years and it looks great. My room was average sized but well-furnished. The bathrooms are excellent--endless hot water, nifty multi-head shower, etc. I had lunch once and breakfast once at Sazerac and the food was very good-just what you'd expect in New Orleans. All staff members I encountered were most friendly and competent

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel - staff need little more training”
Reviews.Author: NHamptonTraveller
Reviews.Content: I arrived late after a long transatlantic flight and layover in New Orleans and was really looking forward to my stay at the Roosevelt. I was a little disappointed as there was noone to help me with my luggage. I checked in and the receptionist made some comment about how i looked like i would always want the best. This took me a little by surprise and off guard and not exactly polite or the most welcoming of introductions. I was not offered help to my room and arrived to my room which was pitch black and looked like it hadnt been stayed in for some time (there was a slightly musty smell to the room too) My room was huge - a suite complete with pantry, separate area for dining, and a separate bedroom walk in closet and two bathrooms. The bed was probably the most welcome part of the stay - it was fantastic comfy and just right level of softness. The bathroom had everything you needed - nice big spa bath, shower with multi heads and basins but it was basically arranged almost in a long narrow corridor and wasnt very well thought out. The shower didnt have enough pressure for me to use all the heads at the same time and would also take forever to warm up The paintwork in the room needed attention it looked like there had been a painting or something on the wall which had been removed and had left a mark. Considering the hotel has only been open for a short time i thought this was disappointing. The housekeeping was fantastic and there was regular turndown service and the room was spotless (the musty smell disappeared after my first day there too) I visited the restaurant for breakfast one morning. The restaurant and bar are stunning and well worth a trip. I was sat close to the edge of the restaurant and unfortunately as a result of that had canned music from both the restaurant and the lobby which became annoying after a while. I can recommend their melon juice which was yummy and their eggs benedict. On my last day I visited the coffee shop and had a coffee, a pan au chocolat and a fruit cup. The coffee was high quality and the pastry was the freshest i had ever tasted. I also visited the Italian restaurant which is on the hotel premises. This is not quite as pricey as the main restaurant and a little less formal. I can highly recommend it, the food was fabulous and the whole experience was really enjoyable. I had no problems with finding cabs from the hotel (even at 5am for an early flight). The architecture of the lobby area is amazingly beautiful and despite its age the hotel had all the modcons. This is not a cheap hotel and i felt that the eye had not been on the ball. The management needs to pay a bit more attention to the small details and this would truly be a great hotel in a great location. Unfortunately on my visit it was mainly let down by its staff

Reviews.Title: “Most Pimped out Bathroom I've ever had...we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: slee0624
Reviews.Content: PROS: -Location! It's close enough to the busy French Quarters, but not in it so you can get some peace & sleep. Also right off Canal Street, and trolleys coming through all day. -The bathrooms were not necessarily big, but was pimpin'. It had a flat screen TV with a remote control; there were 4 shower heads(big one on top, handheld, and 2 body showers). -Loved the flashy extravagant decor of the hotel and the rooms. It was very "New Orleans". -Beds were very comfy. -Room service food was good. We ordered a BLT, and we also ate several times at Teddy's Cafe located in the lobby. It was very convenient to have that there when we wanted a little snack. -There was a wedding every day while we were there. One of them had a KICK BUTT band...they left the hall doors open so we can hear them. They were great! -Very nice pool on the 4th floor - outdoor with a nice pool bar. We never went though because it was a big overcrowded... CONS: -Rooms were clean, but there was some pencil sketch/graffiti on the bathroom wall. Also, there was a broken hairdryer socket in the outlet that gave me an electric shock. They should have seen & fixed that.. -Taxis are hard to get...so even though we may be eating at a restaurant 5 minutes away by car, we'd have to get down there much more in advance because they were so hard to come across. We found that the Ritz which is right by the Roosevelt, always had taxis on standby so we'd just run over to them when we needed one. -The main entrance street(Barrone) seems a bit seedy...on the dark side, and feels a bit unsafe when you first enter it. -Overcrowded pool with lots of beer cans on the side of the pool. It was a nice pool, but looked like a big hot tub & hook up scene.

Reviews.Title: “excelent hotel ideal place to stay just across from the french quarter”
Reviews.Author: shamtipp
Reviews.Content: this hotel is a bit of luxury has all the right things for a plesant stay in new orleans rooms big cleanliness excellent the conceirge are so helpfull and will tell you all the places and tours you should take and avoid it is across the street from bourbon street about 6 mins walk so you can have all the night life and have a quite night inn should you so wish new orleans is not a place for a car best to walk and take tour buses unless you wish to go further out than city also be carefull of the pavements can jut up a bit also check the areas you visit in the city

Reviews.Title: “2nd Visit-Did not disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: Jeweledgypsy
Reviews.Content: Previously stayed here September 2009. Just as beautiful and accommodating as we remembered. This time we traveled with our one-year-old. Everyone went out of their way to interact with her, from the concierge to the valet and everyone in between. The beds were just as comfortable as we remembered. Took the concierge's recommendations for dinner both nights and were pleased both times. I think even my little one was more than pleased, considering this was her first time away from home. Would definitely recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: Gonzo416
Reviews.Content: I just returned from an amazing stay at the Roosevelt. The location was fantastic, the staff was amazing and our guestroom was beautiful. I found the employees friendly and helpful. They genuinely seem to enjoy working there and really add to the experience. The guestroom was richly decorated, and we loved the bathroom. The room was also very clean, I was really impressed. I stayed at the Waldorf Astoria in NY for business in March and I didn't think that anyone could top that stay. Of course, it took another Waldorf to do that! There is no doubt in my mind that I will return to New Orleans and I will only stay at the Roosevelt.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous experience.”
Reviews.Author: dzemma
Reviews.Content: Stayed Memorial Day weekend. We arrived Thursday morning at 9:30am. Not only was our room ready but we had enrolled in Hiltons upgrade program. For an extra $29 per night we stayed in a one bedroom suite with a king size bed. It was as nice a room as we ever stayed in. Staff is warm and friendly. Many restaurants and bars to choose from. The pool is on the 4th floor and although it's not very big it's more than adequate. After all you're not in NOLA to swim. Across the street is the Bourbon Street area. Far enough that there is no noise from it but close enough to walk everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel- service from hotel staff lacking.”
Reviews.Author: drummer1973
Reviews.Content: This is a nice historical hotel. Very beautiful decor throughout. We purchased the romance package which included breakfast and wine (or champagne)-(x 2 nights- so double each). With the breakfast, we received a card to redeem in the restaurant or in room dining (2- one for each day). We ordered in room. However, after the food was delivered, we received a call that what we ordered was not available with the package and asked to use our 2nd breakfast card. Looking at the menu, the price difference was only $3.00, but we had to relinquish both breakfast cards for that one breakfast. It would have been nice to have been told what was available with the package. Also, we were not told how to receive the wine. The first night I assumed (like other 5 star hotels) that the wine would be waiting in the room at check in. We went out to eat and still no wine upon return. I let this go the first night. The second night I went to the front desk to ask about our package and the girl at the front was not sure and had to request the help of another employee. The other employee stated "Oh, just call room service and let them know you have the package". This, too, would have been nice to have known at check-in. The hotel is nice, but the check in/host staff and procedures were very lacking. We checked in on Friday- there were only 2 employees at the check in counter. On Saturday, only 1 employee, as well as only 1 employee on Sunday. Check in and Check out (unless you check out through the TV) are slow due to inadequete staffing) There was 1 employee from room service (Reba), that was very very nice! The spa was very nice. We has a couple massage. Nice facility and great staff. We stayed at Iberville Suites the last time we visited. It is 1 block from the Roosevelt. It had better service. The Ritz is directly across the street. I will most likely try the Ritz next time we come for a nice get-away. Overall, this is a beautiful hotel. I would recommend for the beauty and nostalgia, but don't expect much from the host staff.

Reviews.Title: “What a very nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Moonriser
Reviews.Content: Lovely and elegant. Great renovation - room beautiful, lobby classic, banquet/meeting rooms pleasant. Bed incredibly comfortable. Service not impeccable, but very good and the staff generally tries very hard to do the right thing. Good location at edge of CBD with a few easy blocks to French Quarter. Only weak links were check-in, which was understaffed and minimally helpful, and cheezy charge for in room internet.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and great stay. Minor (very minor!) complaints.”
Reviews.Author: Thinker_to_go
Reviews.Content: The hotel is gorgeous and opulent. Haven't seen an entrance like that in a long time. The room (we had a king suite) was also beautiful, generally clean and comfortable. The sleep quality was absolutely superb. Loved the shower. My complaints are honestly minor. For example, we went to the business center to check emails and surf the net for some restaurant choices and it was closed (it was 3:30 pm Saturday). Why close a business center? It's not like there's a full time attendant there, so not sure why that amenity can't be available 24/7. The valet/parking fee of $38/day seems excessive. See? Minor issues. Our stay was overall fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking the finesse for luxury but veritable value”
Reviews.Author: ECAH
Reviews.Content: Having read reports of gruff service and cockroaches we almost cancelled. We did request a high floor a request that was ignored by the guy that took our call but actually the poor service pretty much ended there. Staff were polite and Coddy (concierge) was outstanding his service was friendly cheerful and faultless - more of this please. Our room the 'deluxe' ie basic, was tiny but functional. Decor all new but already a few scuff marks here and there. Comfy bed shame about the noise on one night from the next door room - oh and room service hammering on doors. One chocolate at turn-down was shared between the two of us but sadly the one bath robe couldn't be. The tiny toiletries were not refreshed throughout our stay - in the end we phoned housekeeping and they promptly brought us more (so good they did, but not really acceptable from a 4 star hotel not to automatically refresh). Great coffee-shop for early morning cappuccino's (no in room facilities). Minute swimming pool, utilitarian Garden terrace but amazing cocktails. Location - brilliant. Just off Canal Street v close to Bourbon but just far enough away to escape the nightly noise of revellers and party-goers. We paid 3 star prices so great value on this occasion.

Reviews.Title: “Over the top hotel, substandard front desk and concierge assistance”
Reviews.Author: fishfry45
Reviews.Content: The hotel interior is beautiful. But that's where it ends. a I was told check in was at 3pm and I was kept waiting until 4pm. The front desk was almost unpleasant about it and didn't offer any alternatives. Later into my stay, I tried calling the concierge repeatedly, from my room, without any luck. I even left a message, but didn't receive a return phone call. If you're female and travelling by yourself, I would not recommend this hotel for its location. It's a weird spot between the hotel and the French Quarter, even though it's only a block or so away. I've spent a lot of time in New Orleans, but I wouldn't recommend this hotel. Very disappointing for the price!

Reviews.Title: “After some hiccups at check-in, Crystal...”
Reviews.Author: dirigible
Reviews.Content: After some hiccups at check-in, Crystal came to the rescue. We were traveling with our 85 yo family member and Crystal impressed us with the ability to accomodate our special needs. Courtesy all-around from doormen & bellman to the great concierge. Great deep tissue massage by Cliff. Spa staff went above and beyond for me. Gym is well appointed . Chester at the Mother's Day brunch (great food!), kept our coffee filled and then some. He was super! Only nitpick is that housekeeping & turndown a little spotty. A great stay overall we hope to return!

Reviews.Title: “One of the most beautiful rooms I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravel5
Reviews.Content: I travel often for business and pleasure. I usually only rate a hotel when I have problems with it, but thought I would share that we had a beautiful suite at this hotel for this years Super Bowl (Who Dat?), and Mardi Gras. The staff was very professional during a very crazy week. Room service was amazingly quick considering the hotel was filled to capacity and also very good.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely stay here again!!”
Reviews.Author: Debbielu63
Reviews.Content: We were in town for the Jazz Festival and this was my first stay at The Roosevelt. Great location - easy walk to Bourbon St. Amazed with the hotels elegance. Our room wasn't ready when we arrived early afternoon and still wasn't ready when we returned at 6:30pm. Staff was very nice and upgraded us to a suite that was ready. Rooms were "very" everything! Clean, spacious, comfortable. We had two queen beds, sitting area with sofa, two charis, tables and a large flat screen tv. Marble floors, big closet, nice mini-bar. My only complaint is the bathroom was small but it did have a tv and premium toiletries which was nice. Sazerac bar was nice but the sacerac drink was awful - do not try it! We vistied Teddy's Cafe each morning for coffee and danishes. The Roosevelt has obviously improved since all of the negative reviews were posted to this site. If I had to find something to complain about it would be the steep price of valet parking ($38/day) and the fact that our room was cleaned and left with two towels instead of 4. But as soon as a call was placed to the front desk - this was corrected in 5 minutes. Concierge was also very helpful. I have found a new place to stay whenever I visti New Orleans. I was very satisfied. Ate at Theo's Neighborhood Pizza (Canal Street but not close enough to walk) and it was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel feels fresh and clean (a random observation, but true!)”
Reviews.Author: Rob0ny
Reviews.Content: Great location -- easy walk across Canal St. into the Quarter while still being relatively quick to get to/from airport. Rennovation of the hotel came out nicely as others have noted. The rooms are great -- decent sized with nice bathrooms and comfy bed. The roof pool needs a little more atmosphere/style, but otherwise has everything you want. All the staff we interacted in were friendly and helpful, although service in the main bar was slow. In addition to the standard restaurant/bar, they also have a nice cafÃ© for coffee and pastry. Spa also apparently gets the job done. Definitely a great base â€“ ideal for a trip with your significant other.

Reviews.Title: “Honestly the most luxurious hotel we have ever stayed”
Reviews.Author: tvilleret
Reviews.Content: We spent our 15th wedding anniversary at the Roosevelt Hotel. The suite was absolutely luxurious and spacious. The property was located perfectly. We were in walking distance of great resturants, besides the wonderful resturants they have on the property. We walked to the French Quarter, Burbon Street, Harrah's Casino, the Riverwalk, the list goes on. It was extrememly romantic and full of energy. The staff was FANTASTIC. Every single person we encountered were sincerely friendly and helpful. I wish I could remember everyone's names. Overall we had an AWESOME experience. I can not wait to go back, and I plan to go back to the Roosevelt Hotel in New Orleans.

Reviews.Title: “Nice accommodation, small room, air temp too warm: wouldn't stay again for price.”
Reviews.Author: Parrotheads
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for French Quarter Fest weekend, 4 nights Thursday night-Monday. We booked the AAA rate for $189 plus taxes which put this room over $200 a night. The online prepay was cheaper (~$10 night) but doesn't allow you to cancel your reservation. This was the most expensive hotel we have ever stayed at. Certainly the most expensive of our many stays in New Orleans. Because we waited for an air sale which didn't happen until March, we had a hard time finding a quality room for less than $150 because of the festival (which was outstanding). So we splurged and booked the Roosevelt. We had been to the famous Sazerac Bar August 2009 (expensive cocktails, so-so service, but nice to say you've been there), which was shortly after they had reopened the hotel. The girl at the front desk was the same at check-in and check-out and she was very pleasant both times and we did feel that we were "special" because she seemed happy we were there. Desk service at other hotels we've stayed at here was definitely questionable. Our room was surprisingly small for the price. But it was very, very quite. Our room was near the service elevator and before a change in floor elevation so we don't think anyone's room "touched" ours. We never heard the elevators. The furnishings were new and very nice. The bed was comfy enough but the pillows were not very soft. There was scratched off paint near the door but that was the only thing needing touched up. The shower was cool looking, but all the different nozzles are probably not environmentally wise if you want to save water, fortunately you don't have to use them. The shower doors are noisy glass. There is a tv in the bathroom. There is no counter space in the bathroom! When you flush the toilet you have to do it very slowly because it will splash out anything in the stool onto the floor and shower door. We didn't locate the hair dryer until the last day as it was hidden in the dresser drawer we never used. Didn't use the bathrobes but they looked soft. The air: it never got cold enough and 65 was the lowest setting you could choose, but it was definitely NOT 65 degrees, maybe 70. But the windows don't open for a breeze and there is no ceiling fan. So we also had the "fan" running on high for background noise and to circulate the air. We would wake up sweating. It was cooler outside than in our room. The hotel is beautiful inside and the lobby is very glamorous. We were on the 10th floor and the elevators are small but very fast and always available when we needed them. We requested "privacy" and were never bothered. We did not use room service for just the 4 nights we were there. The location is just a half block off Canal, across from the Quarter. The only store between the Roosevelt and Canal is the Walgreens (very handy). The problem with the location for this trip was that we were mostly down around the US Mint for the Festival so once we got down there it wasn't convenient to walk back to the hotel for a shower or nap or to drop off bags. But it would be perfect for Mardi Gras parades. Try your hand at priceline or similar to bid a great deal. If you have a lot of money to blow or a high maintenance traveler who is very picky then you will probably love the hotel. The rich and elite probably salivate over this hotel. For us, we don't need it. For that kind of money, I'd rather stay at the Hotel Monteleone for location. The best thing we liked was that it was quiet, but we've had quiet rooms in other New Orleans hotels. We would rather stay in a smaller, older, more historic hotel where you feel you are a part of old New Orleans and not so disconnected. If you're going to be in the Quarter doing a lot of walking you will appreciate a hotel more centrally located in the Quarter for easy access than the Roosevelt has to offer. If you are there for business you should be fine. Cost of the cab ride for 2 from MSY to the Roosevelt was $33 and took about 18 minutes each way. Cabs were readily available outside the hotel for our return trip, even at 5:45 a.m. Would we stay here again? If the room was equally as quiet and the air conditioning worked to cool the room, we would if we could pay maybe $110-$140 (we have seen these rates for other dates in the past). Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Original Splendor has been restored!”
Reviews.Author: marsky8
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to New Orleans and I am happy I chose to stay at the the Roosevelt. It is a magnificent Hotel; a true Southern Gem. The architecture and interior design are well appointed and welcoming. Every time I walked into the lobby I was happy to be there. From the ceiling and it's chandeliers to the walls to the floor to the floral arrangements, it is simply lovely and delightful. The staff were lovely as well. From the moment I stepped out of the taxi I was greeted by a warm smile from the bellman and then by Crystal at the desk. Both were genuine in their greeting and professional in their manner. My room and bath were equally as well appointed as the lobby. The bed was comfortable and the robes are so cozy. I was able to see the Mississippi river from my window. That was a treat. The Concierge; Don recommended two of the most wonderful restaurants I have ever eaten. He was helpful with all other kinds of recommendations as well. He has such a pleasant way about him. He made me feel at ease and he welcomed me to The Roosevelt like he would welcome someone into his own home. He gets it...True Southern Hospitality; there is nothing like it and I was the lucky recipient! My only negative and it really isn't such a negative is that the windows do not open.
