I understand it is a safety issue but there are hotels where the windows open 6 inches and have a security mechanism that will not allow you to open them any more. i look forward to returning to such a wonderful city and to The Roosevelt! Thank you again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DrumMajor500
Reviews.Content: We recently spent four fantastic nights at the Roosevelt. The hotel is approximately one half block on the other side of Canal Street from the French Quarter making for a very comfortable walk to the action but is far enough away for peace and quiet. We received a great rate so we opted for the Superior King room which was huge. We had a large flat screen TV and a large bureau. A sofa and side chair were arranged in front of the TV with end tables on either side of and two small cocktail tables in front of the sofa. The room also had a nice size desk and a marble entry alcove with a huge closet. The money spent on refurbishing was well spent. The lobby is spectacular and the room furnishings and details are gorgeous. We were also very impressed with the staff. Everyone was extremely friendly and very very helpful. We have stayed at other top rated hotels in New Orleans but will only stay at the Roosevelt from now on.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, elegant and stylish hotel with soul. Beats other bland offerings hands down!”
Reviews.Author: PeaboB
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this Waldorf Hotel on vacation and loved it from the first minute we arrived. The hotel has been completely refurbished and our room was amazing, very clean, and comfortable. The hotel is 2 blocks from the French Quarter and this classic hotel was a haven to return to after a day of sight-seeing. Having a cocktail in the Sazerac Bar was the perfect way to unwind. Service was as you would expect from a hotel of this quality. Would recommend strongly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful renovation but issues, still might stay again”
Reviews.Author: mysons27705
Reviews.Content: The hotel is drop dead gorgeous. The Sazerac bar is fantastic. Service in the bar was very good, though not overly friendly. Our room was small but beautiful and very clean. We loved the 4-nozzle shower, but two vanities would be nice. There are problems. The doorman made some effort to be helpful, but forget about the two bellmen. We are not even sure that they were bellmen, because they just stood with hands in pockets every time we saw them over the 4 days. I carried my own bag, I hailed my own cab. No one welcomed me to the hotel - I get a greeting even at the DoubleTree usually. What is up with having employees who don't contribute? We really didn't appreciate the concierge service. He sent us to La Foret, which is a complete scam. He got us a table at Brennans, but not a good table. When we asked for a better table we got it immediately - does Brennans save their bad tables for guests of the Roosevelt? He could not get us a table at Stella, so we called and got our own. If they want to know what a Concierge can do for their business, they should look to Kevin at the Charleston Holiday Inn. He's made a Holiday Inn the hot hotel for goodness sake. This is a beautiful hotel, and they could be a great hotel. We'd stay again if the price was right, in hopes that management might improve.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably good hotel but extremely confused service!”
Reviews.Author: BlueWarrior1
Reviews.Content: So I decided to use my HHonors points for a weekend getaway in New Orleans. While the Hilton Riverside and Doubletree were both available for 40,000 points per night, I decided to "upgrade" our hotel, and chose the Roosevelt for 50,000 per night. Check in was smooth - we arrived very early (around 10.30 am) and were allowed to check in immediately, and were even upgraded to a King Suite room. We were also given 2 drink vouchers for the Sazerac bar, courtesy HHonors. Nice spacious living room and bedroom but the bathroom was rather small (no space for a bathtub) 2 large flat screen TV's in the living area and bedroom, and a small TV for the bathroom as well, which was a nice touch. Liked the premium quality toiletries in the bathroom. Walking distance to the French Quarter ( just across the road), and a lot of restaurants in the area all within walking distance. Now the not-so-nice parts: We were taking a nap in the afternoon, when someone starts banging our door, and tries to open with a housekeeping key card. Luckily, the deadbolt was in place, and turns out, engineering is at the door because we complained that we can't open a door!!!!! Told him he's got the wrong room, and tried to place a DND outside the room, but couldn't find one in our room! The second annoying experience: Got the folio on the morning of our check out, with a charge for 2 nights!! This was supposed to be a stay using HHonors points, but looks like they goofed up. Well, no big deal - called front desk and asked for a new folio, only to be told "We're sorry about that. I recommend you call up Hhonors at 1-800-HHonors and fix this" !!!!! Told the Front desk rep that I don't think so, and things like this are resolved by the front desk usually, especially since I'm still checked in and calling from the room. Front desk rep probably checked with his supervisor, or someone who knew better, and I got the incorrect charges taken off. Overall, this is a nice hotel in a pretty good location, and reasonably comfortable rooms. However, as stated by other reviewers, this hotel doesn't seem to get their act together on the service front. Next time I'm in New Orleans, I'm probably going to try the Hilton or the Doubletree instead!

Reviews.Title: “An incredible gem!”
Reviews.Author: GCT47
Reviews.Content: The top to bottom renovation of this classic hotel now makes it both New Orleans finest but also its best value! Based on our experience we would never think of staying anywhere else. Even the Windsor Court and other wonderful hotels in NOLA can't compare. The Sazerac Bar and Domenica Restaurant are worth the visit alone, but it's really the decor that's so spectacular. The staff couldn't have been nicer and more accommodating. The rates, at least in March, were a fantastic value. Go!

Reviews.Title: “Item Stolen From Room”
Reviews.Author: Wales2010
Reviews.Content: I would not recommend this hotel. I had an item stolen from my room. No member of the staff was apologetic regarding the occurrence. I was given three different directions for what exactly to do by three different people. Despite being told I would be contacted, I still have not been received a call from the director of security. Even though the item was not of great expense, I didnâ€™t feel safe leaving my room unattended after it occurred. I will never stay at this establishment again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Zero Service, Watch your credit card after you return home.”
Reviews.Author: CG-Traveler-01
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Waldorf for one night on business. I checked in and was given a beautiful room, excellent bed, and a very nice bathroom. I have express check out so I got my bill the next morning and departed. Two weeks later I noticed extra charges on my credit card statement. I called the hotel and ask for the front desk supervisor. I was transferred into a answering system and never received a call back. Two days later I called again and explained my situation and asked to speak to book keeping. Again, answering system. Each time I left messages. Three days I caled and asked to speak to the GM. I had to explain to the girl exactly what I wanted and she sent me into an answering system. I called Hilton Customer Service and explaned what happened and what was done. The rep took my e mail and sent an e mail to the GM with my concerns. Two weeks later I recieved an e mail from the Hilton rep telling me that according to the hotel my situation had been taken care of... To this day nothing has been corrected and NO ONE from this hotel has returned my call. I highly recommend you stay at the Comfort Inn 1 block down the street.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay for their 1st Mardi Gras”
Reviews.Author: meandros
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel last minute for Mardi Gras their first Mardi Gras since reopening this fall. I got an excellent rate of less than $200 so my sense of value is based on this price. The only real hiccup was check in our room was not ready until 6:30. This was on the Sunday prior to Mardi Gras and evidently a lot of the cleaning staff had not bothered to show up. We were not comfortable leaving our luggage with the bell hop. The luggage on this busy day was left on carts in the lobby. As the lobby is a public space and there were even local school children playing around the luggage as they tried to hoc candy bars to the guests, l would not leave our l work aptops and other electronics unattended. Likewise I didn't want to take my laptop to the parade going on outside or to the French quarter so I stayed in the hotel with our luggage waiting for the room. We were given drink tickets to amuse ourselves while waiting which greatly improved my mood. We are Hilton Honers Diamond members, the check in desk for diamond members was not open also there were no Hilton choice perks no breakfast, free internet etc. All in all it was a good stay the rooms are well furnished, they are small as in most historic hotels and we did not have a tub but the multihead showers made up for it. The location was great for getting to the parades and bourbon st. Except for check in there was no problem with staff. There were a lot of silly rules that they had for Mardi Gras. You had to wear a wrist band for each day all day to access the hotel which turned out not to be a big deal. Also the rule was no coolers in the room and they said they would be charging people $2 per beer and $10 for bottle of wine brought in from the outside. Fortunately we never saw these enforced. You do have access to your own ice machine which is nice some of the higher end properties make you call down for ice. Also there is no fridge. Internet was free in the lobby so we just checked it down there rather than pay for access in our room some people told us room access was spotty. The valet parking is $38 before tax (and tip) . I parked in a garage only two short blocks away $30 with tax per 24 hours event parking for mardi gras on a normal day $20 for 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, poor service”
Reviews.Author: SpaceyNC2009
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent four nights for our 10th anniversary at The Roosevelt. When we first walked into the lobby, we were in awe at the beautiful decor. We arrived early in hopes we could have an early check in, unfortunately our room was not ready. We checked our luggage and decided to hit the town. Within 30 minutes we were called by the hotel informing us our room was ready and waiting. Upon check-in we were also informed that our room was upgraded to a suite, so we were totally stoked. The bell man that took our luggage to our room gave us a thorough tour of the room and amenities. The room was absolutely beautiful, it was the perfect beginning of our anniversary trip. However, that's where the good service ended. Day One: On check in we were not offered ANY of the Diamond member benefits. Day Two: The room was not serviced completely, trash was left in the room and all towels were not replaced. Someone tried to key into the room w/o announcing themselves. We did have the door bolt in place but the person who tried to enter did so with so much force that the door closer was malfunctioning and would prevent the door from opening all the way. Some one from maintenance staff was able to get that fixed. I wanted to speak with the manager on duty and security. I was able to catch security doing an audit on the lock and later was told it was housekeeping trying to do a turn down. I was told by the front desk people that if we required privacy, hang a sign on the door. I normally do that, but it seems that this hotel lacks those. I pointed that out to the front desk person who promised one for us right away. We never got it. Day Three:Still not privacy sign, still no contact with management, room not serviced completely. Used glasses, towels and toiletries not replaced. Day Four: Still not privacy sign, still no contact with management, room not serviced completely. Used glasses, towels and toiletries not replaced. Day Five: I ordered an in room movie on 3/7, this was not taken off the bill as one of my Diamond benefits. I had to call front desk and ask for this to be done. No one asked how the stay was on check out, and still no one from management contacted me. During the entire stay the concierge was pretty much non-existent, kept seeing a sign referring us to the front desk? On Saturday the 6th we did speak with the concierge briefly for a map of the quarter. He seemed to be put out by the request. The water temperature could be described as luke warm at best. We paid Taj Mahal prices and got Super 8 Motel service. We will not be coming back. I should have followed the reviews from this site, but, thought that it would be different for me. Oh well...

Reviews.Title: “Great place to have a bachelor party - Suites are the best”
Reviews.Author: tommyvVirginia
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended if you plan on having entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Nearly perfect”
Reviews.Author: lawchick2009
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Wed-Sat for business, in a two queen Superior Room. I would stay again if I could find a rate at $200 or less. For background, I have previously stayed at the Royal Sonesta, Westin, Hilton and Sheraton in New Orleans. The Westin is probably my favorite hotel simply because of the amazing river views. Cons: 1. I wasn't shocked because I did my research, but the $42/night (w/tax) parking really is outrageous, especially since some guests were having problems with it (we saw one guy being charged hourly and being made to pay when he took the car out; they couldn't immediately find someone else's keys). The highest I have paid elsewhere in NOLA is $38, and that was Royal Sonesta. The cheapest I've seen parking is $25/night. 2. Maid service is iffy. Our room was generally extremely clean, but there was some trash between the vanity and wall in the bathroom. One day they took our bath mat and didn't replace it, and also didn't replace the bath salts. 3. Walls are very thin. Thankfully, this isn't the kind of hotel that attracts loud college kids, so it isn't much of an issue. Pros: 1. The hotel is absolutely beautiful both in the common areas and the rooms. The Superior Room was HUGE for a NOLA room (or really anywhere). The bathroom was also huge, with a nice shower/tub combo, and a separate toilet area. All marble in the bathroom. The bed was comfortable - firm with a pillowtop. Truly effective blackout shades. Great tvs in the room and bathroom. Upscale toiletries and a tourmaline hairdryer (!). 2. Great location. Right across Canal from the French Quarter, but quieter and more accessible than the Royal Sonesta. I was attending a conference at the Sheraton and it was an easy 5-10 minute walk. 3. The front desk and concierge service was excellent. We had no problems with billing or anything like that. 4. The most insanely awesome and comfortable robes. It was overall a very good experience and I have no regrets. I would be happy to answer any questions about our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Probably won't stay at the Roosevelt again”
Reviews.Author: JoyRidesTexas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt during the Super Bowl. It was nice enough. The rooms are on the small side. This hotel does not compare at all to the Royal Sonesta, which is spacious, beautiful, clean and very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!! Will stay again.”
Reviews.Author: sxeensweet
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband went for the Superbowl weekend to enjoy the game in the Saints hometown. We are Louisiana natives so we love to visit New Orleans when we can. We decided to try out the newly renovated property as it is hard to find a quality hotel in a prime location. Most are worn down(room wise) etc. We stayed in the Luxury Suite. Overall we would not change a thing except for a few minor issues but the hotel is still working out some kinks. The location is perfect. You are close to everything but yet its away from the hustle and bustle...its only a block or so from the french quarter. Only a 3 min walk. The bellmen and staff were all very friendly. We ordered room service and the food was really good and they were prompt to bring it to us. The girl who brought it also was very courteous. Absolutely loved the layout of the room. Its like being in a luxury apt rather than a hotel so you feel more at home. The bed was very comfortable. The bathroom had a seperate bathtub and shower and a seperate little room for the toilet area. Also the TV in the bathroom was a nice addition while getting ready or taking a bath. Like i said there was only a few minor things i would change....there was dust in several areas in the room that was not wiped, on the duvet cover on the bed there was something on there that to the naked eye while not in bed you would not notice but while lying in bed i saw it(again very small) so i can see how housekeeping would not notice it, and the last bath i took the tub latch to open the drain was stuck and i could not drain the water out(would have called about it but we were leaving so i didnt call to complain), the curtains were a little hard to close, and our view out the window was not the best in this rooms location. Please do not listen to all the negative reviews on here and give this hotel a try esp. the suites! All my issues were minor and im sure in time will get better as this hotel has not even been open a year yet. We already are booked to stay again for our week long trip in November for our 3rd wedding anniversary and are looking forward to returning and trying out all the hotel has to offer. Our stay was too short to really do much this past stay.

Reviews.Title: “Might Not Be What You Are Hoping For...”
Reviews.Author: elladay
Reviews.Content: This place is interesting to look at and the rooms are stylish. I was just a little put off by the $38/night parking fee and the lack of housekeeping. One day we returned to our room at 6:30 p.m. and the room had not yet been serviced ( and it was not so clean to begin with- we found a pair of underwear on the floor when we arrived). We settled for some clean towels but felt sad for the housekeepers as they seemed overworked and exhausted. For the price we paid to stay there, it seems they could hire an extra person to help. I enjoyed waking up to the newspaper each morning and going down to the little coffee bar. If you want a soda however, plan on trekking to the nearby drug store. Although this is a nice hotel, after a long day of walking/sightseeing in New Orleans you kind of want to come back to a tidy room. Maybe it was just an off day?!

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased”
Reviews.Author: LaurieS38
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel located close to the convention center. The room and bathroom were a bit small, but very comfortable. The bed was a pillow top and made for a great night's sleep. The resaurants are great.

Reviews.Title: “Save youself the trouble”
Reviews.Author: Travel1Kenobi
Reviews.Content: I am in the Roosevelt now and feel compelled to write about my experience. I pulled up to the valet and popped the trunk, the valet pulls my suitcase out of the trunk and pulls up the handle for me to roll it myself as he hands me a ticket. Gee, thanks. So now that I'm carrying my luggage, the only way in is up the stairs to the lobby. I am given a room key and I'm told that valet parking is $40/day. What a scam, why not just charge $50 or $75?. It would be good to know that I was going to be overcharged for parking before I booked the room. Or at least mask it by charging more for the room where the rate is known and then charge something reasonable for parking. In my room there is a 10oz bottle of water in the mini bar for $5. Fine, I drink it, but I need more water. I go looking for vending and there is none. I call room service and they bring me 4 warm bottles and I wonder â€œwill it be $10 per bottle?â€�. I ask them for ice and they tell me there is an ice machine down the hall. The decor is nice but they forgot about the basic need and expectation of the guests. Donâ€™t scam them on parking, carry luggage up stairs...preferably to room, provide bottle water, and if asked for ice just go get it. So far, a terrible experience. I come to NOLA 4-5 times a year for the food. But I wont be returning to the Roosevelt. Save yourself the trouble and go to The Windsor Court or the W in the Quarter. You'll be glad you did.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! You never have to leave the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: tigerlily129
Reviews.Content: This was my first time to go to the Roosevelt. I was with a group of girls going to New Orleans for a "girls weekend." We decided to book four "junior suites" and plan a whole day at the hotel. We arrived in the afternoon and were able to check in to our suites- they were AMAZING! You walk into an area with a pull-out couch, chairs and a large flat screen tv. Then in a seperate area, there were two queen beds with very comfortable bedding and a flat screen tv. The bathroom also had a flat screen tv and was a nice sized bathroom with a large closet. The room felt very updated and luxiourious without being "modern." We booked services at the Guerlain Spa in the hotel- I had a pedicure and it was fabulous. Everyone was pleased with their massages, pedicures and manicures. We had dinner that night in the restaurant in the hotel- Domenica. It is a John Besh restaurant. It is trendy but also casual. Great small plates of food. We also went to the Sauzerac bar which was very nice. The lobby of the hotel has a lot of ambiance! My only complaint was that the water in the shower never got "hot" just very warm. I thought the service was great- the bellman was always very fast and courteous whenever we needed one and various times, they brought us things we forgot to pack. They were also very nice when we checked in. I have already booked another stay at this hotel because I enjoyed it so much!

Reviews.Title: “Room and bathroom are extremely small...”
Reviews.Author: APMD
Reviews.Content: Room and bathroom are extremely small. View would be nice if window were not dirty and covered in some sticky substance (don't want to know). No coffee maker or trash can in the room. Fan in bathroom is always on and can't be turned off.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like a prisoner in my own hotel...”
Reviews.Author: sweetieali143
Reviews.Content: How do I even describe the purgatory that is "The Roosevelt Waldorf Astoria." Where should I begin. Before arriving to the hotel, I called to inform them that I would be checking in late but that my guest would arrive a few hours before me and I wanted to inquire to see if she would be able to check in without me. I was greeted rudely on the phone and told that yes, she could check in but that she would need to have a form of payment once she arrives for the $200 deposit that needed to be paid that I was informed of upon booking. I was NEVER informed of a $200 deposit despite the fact that I had called several times before my trip to get all of the details. The $200 deposit was not the problem, it was the rudeness of the receptionist. When I questioned her she stated "That is a requirement at every hotel that you should be aware of." I stated, I have stayed in numerous hotels and have never had a $200 deposit requirement, and to that she stated "Well that is a requirement for the Waldorf Astoria." Well if it is such a big requirement that is obviously common knowledge for the free world, maybe I should have been informed one of the numerous times I called double checking my reservation. She spoke to me as if I was an idiot and I soon realized that this was the attitude of almost all of the hotel staff. Upon arriving to the hotel, everyone was given a wristband and a set of instructions detailing the procedures for the Mardi Gras holiday which included guards at every elevator, and a wristband method for hotel residents and their guests. They monitored the wristbands upon going up and exiting the elevator. Each hotel resident with a wristband was allowed a maximum of 2 guests. This also would not have been such a problem if the guards didn't treat you like you were trying to escape from Alcatraz when exiting the elevators, or like you were trying to enter into the White House when trying to get on the elevators. It was definitely an annoyance in this so called high class hotel. It was also interesting to see that the older, obviously well-to do people were not questioned about their wristbands, but the seemingly less affluent and younger college aged looking guests were hassled every time like terrorists. Everyone in my group was around age 24 and we do look very young but in no way are we wild college students. One guard even asked my friend who was talking while getting on the elevator to "be quiet." Excuse me?? I'd understand if she was being loud and boisterous, but she was not. I am pretty sure that regardless of your class or age, that we were all required to pay upwards of $300 per night for the rooms right? Hmm just checking. When we arrived in our room we were greeted by a big pile of dirty linens on the floor which were apparently forgotten. A mirror in the bathroom that was falling off the hinges and a hole in the ceiling. Even after contacting the front desk and letting them know that the mirror was falling off and that there were leftover dirty linens on the floor, they assured us that they would take care of it, but did not. They fixed the mirror and left the linens. We had to put them in the hallway ourselves. The maid staff was interesting. If they caught you in the halls they stared you down like they were part of the secret service downstairs as well. One maid was staring at us as we were leaving for the night and when we came back to the hotel we came back to one bed being made and the other left undone. I have never experienced maids coming to make your bed twice a day, let alone coming and only making up one bed and not the other. It seemed like she came in just to case the place. Very odd. If it wasn't the rude staff and elevator nazis, it was the nice refreshing luke warm and cold showers everyday. I realize that it is an old building, and that the hotel was full to capacity, but if I am paying over $300 a night for a hotel, I expect to have a warm shower. I even made sure that I was the first to shower each day, and it was still cold! All in all this was the worst hotel experience of my life. I was really looking forward to staying in a Waldorf-Astoria hotel for the first time, but after this experience I would not stay ever again. I would have rather been at motel 6 than this place, at least I would've had a hot shower. And I was not the only one who felt this way. After checking out and waiting outside for my ride, it was hilarious to hear almost every group leaving making comments such as "This is the worst hotel ever!" Please think twice about staying here, I wish I had. Could have saved myself lots of money and stress.

Reviews.Title: “A Terrific Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Ruggles240
Reviews.Content: I became wary of our choice of the Roosevelt after reading some of the reviews posted here. After my stay, I can't believe they were talking about the same hotel. From the bellmen to the check-in person to the concierge, everyone was friendly and helpful. We were warmly greeted by everyone on the staff including the cleaning staff and office staff we encountered on the elevator. The room was not large but being on an upper floor, it was quiet with a fabulous view of the city. There was a HUGE (42") flat screen TV in the room, frankly I thought a bit too large for the room. There was a second (smaller) TV in the bathroom. The king size bed was comfortable with at least 8 pillows and a thick duvet. Another reviewer complained about there being no bathtub, but they neglected to mention the wonderful shower! In addition to a large shower head, there was a hand-held shower attachment as well as 2 adjustable jet sprays. There was also a lighted magnifying mirror in the bathroom. The closet included a safe as well as 15 hangers including 2 padded ones and 2 terry robes. Even though it was January, the heated outdoor pool and jacuzzi were available on the 4th floor deck. I had booked a "Winter Escape" package which included breakfast for 2 at the Sazarac restaurant. It also included a $50 hotel credit for every 2 night's stay. The free breakfasts included a choice of anything on the menu including, eggs sardou, banana pancakes, cappucinos and the best biscuits and gravy ever. They have done a wonderful job with the recent renovation. The lobby is gorgeous and all the details which suggest it's historic past have been retained. I'll certainly return on my next trip to NO.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable upscale lodging w/ excellent service”
Reviews.Author: augieray
Reviews.Content: Just completed a very impressive visit to the Roosevelt. The room was very, very clean and very comfortable. I was particularly impressed with the service--front desk and bell staff were friendly, warm, and very focused on guests. The location is great--just two blocks from Bourbon Street. I would not hesitate to stay here again on my next trip to NOLA.

Reviews.Title: “Halloween at the Roosevelt New Orleans”
Reviews.Author: Rach727
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Roosevelt Waldorf Astoria for a girl's getaway to new Orleans for Halloween this year. Since this was the first trip to new Orleans for the four of us, it was important for me to find a historic hotel that carried the charm of New Orleans, hence why I chose against the W French Quarter. I was excited about the reopening of the Roosevelt under the Waldorf Astoria label and the fact that there would also be a Guerlain spa onsite, and since our trip was soon after the "Grand Reopening" we were able to get a great deal on a suite with 2 queen beds. My impression of the Roosevelt is that it could be great, but it is still a work in progress. The Great: The hotel itself has been beautifully restored, and the lobby is stunning. The staff at the concierge desk was incredibly helpful with finding us a replacement rental car after the Enterprise we had booked with was closed for no apparent reason. The concierge also helped map our our walking paths to specific stores, restaurants, and attractions. The cafe in the lobby had a wonderful fresh assortment of light sandwiches, fruit, and pastries every morning for breakfast. The Roosevelt blend coffee was so delicious that I bought some to bring home. The location was also convenient to walk to the French Quarter, and I must have gone ot the Walgreens next to the hotel 5 times during the trip for various reasons. The Good: The room was nicely appointed, though very small for a suite. The bathroom only had one sink and the room's only closet was in the bathroom. We went up to the pool area once, and it looks like it has the potential to be great with an outdoor grill and areas to lounge, but again it wasn't staffed and seemed unfinished. The signature Sazerac bar was empty when we first came in a Thursday night and the bartender seemed annoyed to be serving drinks at 1am, but was very lively the rest of our stay. We also had a nice lunch at the hotel's Italian restaurant.. The Okay/Not So Good: While I loved the cafe, I wish the hotel had late night dining options other than room service. The spa wasn't fully finished, and lacked sauna/steam room facilities, or even separate showers (guests have to walk over and use the gym's showers). My biggest disappointment though was the Blue Room Jazz Brunch. For $75/per person I was expecting a more expansive selection of food and better ambience (though idid enjoy the cooked to order bananas foster). All in all, I think the Roosevelt has a lot of potential and I would recommend it once all the kinks are worked out.

Reviews.Title: “New Years Eve @ The Roosevelt was great!!!”
Reviews.Author: joneah
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Roosevelt on Dec 31 for New Years Eve. The lobby was beautifully decorated. The staff was very courteous. Although I do agree with other poster that entrance/valet is not marked clearly. Valet and check in were very courteous and efficient. It was new years and very busy. The elevators were dated, but not unbearable. We had a king suite which was very nice and spacious. The bed and linens were perfect. Both bathrooms were great.The furnishings very nice. We had plenty of hot water. All and all the suite was very spacious and we entertained guest with plenty of room to spare. We did order room service and the food was great. It was a little pricey, but not unreasonable. We would have liked to order mixed drinks with our meal only to discover you could only by the bottle, which were very expensive. We defiantly enjoyed our stay. The location and rooms were top notch. Service was good, but could use a little fine tuning. We will return. Great property, great renovation.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotel experiences .... period.”
Reviews.Author: travellots100
Reviews.Content: As a Hilton Diamond Member I travel all over the Country on business and stay in excess of 60 hotel room nights each year. My experience at the Roosevelt Hotel New Orleans was the absolute worst hotel experience .... ever. This hotel is the length of one city block and has two large entrances. Only one entrance is the official "entrance area" with valet parking yet there is no sign anywhere at the other entrance stating arriving guests should go to the other entrance. Upon arriving, I parked at the wrong entrance and a hotel employee YELLED out the door, "OTHER SIDE!" (This is a Waldorf Astoria Collection 5 Star Luxury Hotel???) At the valet / parking entrance the welcome was "less than stellar" as four valet attendants were too busy standing in a circle telling jokes and laughing to take notice of my arrival. Only after I began pulling luggage out of my car did anyone offer assistance (This is a Waldorf Astoria Collection 5 Star Luxury Hotel???). The lobby of the Roosevelt Hotel is, indeed, beautiful and grand. Check-in was very efficient but not overly welcoming. And, the Suite to which I was assigned (a luxury suite) was, indeed, beautifully decorated and of good size. Then the "fun" began . . . When pulling down the sheet of the bed I discovered one sheet was stained with ink and one "sheet" was the wrong sheet (it was a duvet cover). I called Guest Services to request new sheets and spoke to someone named "Arrianna" who appeared to be less than interested in the fact that it was almost 10PM and no hotel ... let alone a Waldorf Astoria Five Star Luxury Hotel ... should place stained and incorrect sheets on the bed. Almost two hours later (after two additional calls to a very disinterested "Arrianna" in Guest Services) a young man appeared at the door with a duvet cover (which was not needed) and informed me there were no available clean sheets anywhere in the hotel. NO CLEAN SHEETS ANYWHERE IN THE WALDORF ASTORIA LUXURY FIVE STAR HOTEL!!!!!! I then discovered the hotel had not honored my prior request to place foam pillows on the bed rather than feather pillows. I again called Guest Services to be told there were only two foam pillows in the entire hotel (This is a Waldorf Astoria Collection 5 Star Luxury Hotel???). Finally, at 2AM, after remaking the bed to not sleep on stained sheets I was able to go to sleep. The next day, when returning to the room, I discovered housekeeping removed the dirty towels from the bathroom but failed to leave clean towels. It was necessary for me to place yet another call to Guest Services and after a long wait I was finally provided clean towels ... one of the most basic items in a hotel (This is a Waldorf Astoria Collection 5 Star Luxury Hotel???). The next day, when returning to the room, I discovered housekeeping did a great job of leaving clean towels .... but forgot to leave soap and shampoo ... yet another one of the most basic items in a hotel (This is a Waldorf Astoria Collection 5 Star Luxury Hotel???). I planned to dine in the hotel's "Domenica" Restaurant. However, after hearing another guest ranting and raving in the lobby about how awful the food was and given my already spectacularly bad experiences with the hotel my dining plans were changed to an offsite restaurant. Four aspects of this hotel truly perplexed me. First, this is a brand new property yet 75% of all guestroom doors appear to be scarred and scuffed with black marks near the floor. Second, the "hot" water in the shower was truly not "hot." Though this did not bother me I am sure other guests would prefer water that is not "lukewarm." Third, not one time during my stay was the mini-bar refreshment center restocked. Fourth, generally the front desk and housekeeping staff appear to be phenomenally disinterested in providing a welcoming and customer-centered experience. In fact, the general attitude from front desk employees was, "We're doing you a favor letting you stay here." Finally, if you actually stay at this hotel ... take your Reservation Confirmation Sheet showing rates and charges and after you depart the property file it away until you receive your credit card bill. Further, if the hotel employees promise you something critical to rates and charges get it in writing. Several weeks after checkout the hotel charged my credit card several hundred dollars of additional unauthorized charges. It was a nightmare to get this matter resolved and the attitude from most of the front desk employees was one of not believing a word I was saying and even a Manager, Dennis, failed to follow through with promises he made to me. Fortunately, given my poor experiences at the hotel, I retained enough accounting paperwork after checkout the hotel did, eventually, issue a refund to my credit card.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay - would go back.”
Reviews.Author: redskinfan78
Reviews.Content: I flew down for the Saints playoff game with a friend and stayed here. This is a solid 4 star hotel and I would stay here again. I am a spa addict, so I was disappointed in the spa not having a sauna steam room or a jacuzzi. That being said, I had a mani/pedi and a massage and the services were wonderful. We ordered room service, and the food was excellent. We also had breakfast every morning and that was good as well. The staff is fairly attentive, but doesn't necessarily bend over backwards. I'm not high maintenence, so that's not a problem for me. However, if you want 5 star treatment, this may not be the place for you. The location is outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “All dressed up, but still has a long way to go.”
Reviews.Author: Haltz
Reviews.Content: A magnificent entry suggests the grandeur of a century ago. Room small, but incredibly comfortable bed. Simply the biggest HD TV you've ever seen in a single room. Concierge was incredible. Everyone was friendly. Nice pool, deck and hot tub. I was at a company meeting, and the hotel caterers provided the best food I've ever had at a hotel, bar none! Negatives: Hair left on floor of bathroom (need I say more!). hot water not HOT! my cup was left out of my room for housecleaning, and it sat outside the room (as did a tray from room service in the room across from me. And, as I type this, I can hear distinctly the people in the room next to me.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: elm75
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel many times when it was the Fairmont and thought it would be nice to revisit it again with it's makeover and introduce my husband to it. The entrance was cold and unoccupied. I had to wander alone down a long corridor to try and find a soul to check me in. There was only one person working the counter and she was helping another customer. So we waited with our bellman for almost 10 minutes before she finally acknowledged us. When she was finally ready to assist us Instead of walking over to the Diamond check-in counter where we were she just stood and waited for us to join her. We felt less than welcome by Catherine and every request we made which we are accostumed to having fulfilled at every Hilton property we've ever stayed was denied or would require an extra fee. I was expecting a refrigerator in our room and I was told that would be $50 a night. It's often not what you say but how you say it that makes the difference in good customer service. After a few hours in our room which was suppose to be an upgrade we decided that our trip was tainted by the poor service and decided to check out the next morning. So I called the manager (Dennis) explained our disappointment and instead of trying to make this right he said he would need to speak to Catherine to confirm our story and then call me back. So his attitude didn't make me happy either but he did explain that a refrigerator would be $50 for the stay not per night which is much more reasonable. So when he called me back to offer us an upgrade to a suite at no additional charge for our entire stay (with a frig) we declined. When we checked out we paid in full for the one night stay that we used instead of the four that we had originally reserved. Dennis confirmed that there would be no penalty for the early check out. By the way, we moved to the Harrah's Hotel where they gave us free rooms that were very similar to our room at The Roosevelt. Two days later we noticed two additional charges from The Roosevelt on our credit card one for $1000+ and another for $1200+ for the rooms we didn't stay in. When we called we got the run around from the hotel. One person could only find one charge, another person found both and said one was for the entire stay and the other was for a no-show! A third and final person told us there was only one charge the other was a authorization that would dop off in a couple days and that she was going to have the one charge removed and call us back. Well, wouldn't you know we never heard back from her or anyone from The Roosevelt Hotel. I have not checked yet to see if the charges have been reversed. So while the rooms were nice they were not over the top and the customer service or lack there of was painful. I do not recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “At least the Gym and Domenicas were fabulous.”
Reviews.Author: Tania_Chris
Reviews.Content: We had a disastrous trip to New Orleans all around and it was my husband's birthday. We arrived at the hotel. No Bell service. There were 6 valet parkers standing at the desk ignoring us. Okay. We had to carry cases up stairs, lucky we are both fit! When we go to the top of the stairs the Bellman was waiting there and casually waved us onwards towards the reception without speaking. Strange! A man (who I later realized was the manager because his photo was in the book in my room) asked if he could help as we were forced to wheel luggage through a caroling concert in the foyer. I snapped "why start now?" The room was a lovely size. The gym was new and so all of the machinery worked and had television entertainment on command. We ate at Domenicas and that was superb! However the overall experience was just too marred: We waited on hold with the concierge for over an hour (we got ready and had it on speaker phone). He asked us if he could recommend that we go to Antoine's restaurant and to have a particular waiter - the restaurant was empty and enormous and the waiter ignored us and the food was tepid. We booked a segway tour in the French Quarter and were told upon arrival that they had phoned our hotel to bring the time forward half an hour and had therefore resold our tickets. (Incidentally, they had only phoned half an hour prior!!!!!!) And it was my husband's birthday. Mortified. The valet parking blocked in our taxi as we were trying to leave. The people who were trying to get their cars looked like they were in Dante's seventh circle of hell. It is obviously big business for the hotel. The service was simply completely lacking in all regards. Perhaps if I had had a better experience with New Orleans itself, the hotel would have seemed better because the room was certainly the nicest part of our time there.

Reviews.Title: “A grand old hotel with a great makeover”
Reviews.Author: pghgiirl
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt is a grand hotel with a beautiful lobby. The rooms have been renovated and are very nicely finished. The bedding, products and shower are very luxurious. We loved the shower head options. The TV in the bedroom and bath are really nice. The concierge services and doorman services are terrific. So helpful and friendly. And we loved the Sazerac bar! Such a great vibe in there. The coffee shop was convenient although it would have been nice to have a free in-room option. Check in was easy although they put "Mom and Dad" in the room by the elevator and our son and girlfriend in the room down the hall with the nice view and quieter location. I would think they would know who is paying the bill:-)! Free drink coupons for my husbands birthday were very nice. The hotel location is nice on the trolley line. I wish that I had time to try out the spa. A couple of things that we didn't like.. The King Deluxe room was really small . It made some NYC rooms look big. Our first day there we got out to see the sites early (8:30 am) and when we returned to the room at 3pm it still hadn't been cleaned. Then the housekeeper came when we were getting ready for dinner. We asked for a late check out on the last day and they said no problem. However when we went to the room to quickly check out and head to the airport, our card keys didn't work. When we went to the desk, they said matter of factly that the key cards stop working at 1 pm. So either we were supposed to stop by the desk before heading up to the room or the first person didn't make the change in the key system. An apology should have been made then. All in all, we like the Roosevelt and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Close to Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Lady_World_Traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Roosevelt for a few days after the Christmas holiday and please put any fears to rest from previous bad reviews. We had a wonderful experience, rating this this hotel is pretty much perfect. We arrived in the wee hours of December 27, and the night clerk couldn't be more efficient or pleasant, and very attentive so late at night. We usually schlep our own bags, but we were exhausted from a series of flight delays due to the botched bomb attempt on Dec. 25 and were thankful for the prompt bell service. The lobby was stunningly decorated for Christmas and so much so we almost couldn't find the front desk! I had read in previous postings that the standard rooms were small, and so went for the 1 bedroom King suite -- a steal at $208.00 a night. The suite was more than gorgeous and extremely spacious, filled with reproduction antiques and a very comfy bed with high-end linens and plush pillows. Comparatively, we had a similar suite at an upscale hotel in Manhattan, and the same type of room with this type of decor would be close to $1000.00 a night. The sumptuous marble bathroom had a walk-in shower with triple shower heads (no tub), plus was extremely clean; bathroom amenities were lemon-verbena Agraria San Francisco products. Even though the lobby was busy with guests/ tourists, I found our floor very quiet. The windows are sealed well; our room was a corner room and street noise was very minimal My only complaints about the suite are the two small ottomans which are used for a coffee table -- makes it awkward for eating take-out or room service. Also, some spots on the marble floor are extremely slippery, and we ended up asking for an extra bath mat. Robes were mid-weight, made of silky material, and terry-lined. However, one of ours had some weird crustings on it -- I think it hadn't been washed properly and a new one was prompty sent up with apologies when we notified them. No slippers are provided. Slippers would be nice, taking into account the slippery bathroom floor. The room service menu is very small -- we were exhausted and decided to order some food. The food arrived hot and within 20 minutes. I had a very good omelette and can recommend that, but the chicken strips turned out to be a very thin, dry, chicken breast breaded and fried whole and cut into thin strips. Domenica on the ground floor of the hotel does take out while it's open and I would recommend phoning down and picking it up if you don't want to leave the hotel. We found the food at Domenica excellent, on par with major foodie destination restaurants in NYC or San Francisco. The hotel staff are amazing. Any requests we made of our housekeeper were done promptly and accurately. The concierges were great; friendly, professional, knowledgeable, and very accommodating. Anytime I was in the lobby, even in the wee hours of the morning, staff walking by always had a smile and a pleasant greeting. There is free wifi in the lobby and in Teddy's Cafe. However, I found the signal was extremely spotty. I was also at the concierge desk and overheard another guest complain about the weak wifi signal in his room, which he had paid for, and was none too happy. Another thing you have to watch for is if you are taking a tour, specify and reconfirm with your tour company which entrance they will pick you up from to save yourself a lot of hassle. Most tour groups will pick up from the Baronne St. entrance. We had a mix-up with our company and I noticed others had the same problem. There is a small, heated swimming pool on the roof with pleasant lounging areas which we did not use as the weather was unseasonably cool. There are also tennis courts, but we did not see them. We would definitely stay at this hotel again; the complaints I have are fairly minor. Yes, there may have been opening glitches, but even over the busy Christmas holiday, it seemed to me things ran very smoothly. In general, it's hard to find good service personnel in New Orleans, but the Roosevelt has snagged them. Don't hesitate to book if you want a beautiful hotel with a great restaurant and fantastic staff.

Reviews.Title: “Clean,quiet,convenient with caring,personable staff at all levels--just do it and stay there.”
Reviews.Author: TomFOhio
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in many hotels and were a bit concerned by the reviews on this website,but felt we would give the hotel the chance to shine.The hotel had undergone renovation after Katrina and has only been reopened about 6 months, so one would expect some kinks that would need to be ironed out. We were treated wonderfully by everyone,from the doorman, valet, business center,coffee shop,front desk,concierges,restaurant,housekeeping to the baggage handlers.The concierges have to be the best we have encountered in 30 years of traveling -- gracious, spontaneous and right on the money with good advice.We were there for 5 days and these folks could not have been more gracious. Think about it: 5 days , over a weekend, a BIG holiday weekend ,and with a big special event in the hotel and in town gave the hotel ample opportunity to reveal it's rough spots,but none were visible. The hotel was magnificently decorated,clean and NOT overrun with tourists at all ( But aren't tourists the people who stay in these hotels!). We even had a national TV celebrity who was staying in the hotel strike up a conversation with us after the Sugar Bowl. We couldn't hear a thing ifrom the hallway and our standard king room was right next to the elevator. The room pricing is competitive to other comparable facilities in New Orleans. Previous stays in New Orleans had convinced us that hotel service and attitude was routinely substandard, and in expensive hotels to boot. Do yourself a favor and give YOU the gift of staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't deserve the stars!”
Reviews.Author: TravelwellUSA
Reviews.Content: This is a dressed up mess! This place doesn't understand the importance of the basics; a comfortable bed, bathtub and a nice staff. They fail on all levels. If you really want to remodel this place start with the management, front desk, housekeeping and keep going. Do yourself a favor and stay someplace else.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but Housekeeping is an issue!”
Reviews.Author: lisalmusso
Reviews.Content: I booked a luxury suite in Dec 2009. The room was not ready when I checked in because it was not clean. This should have been my first tip-off. The room itself was large with a living room and separate bedroom. The decor was beautiful. However, my first room was NOT clean. The mini-fridge had NOT been cleaned out and the marble floors in ALL areas of the room had NOT been mopped. I ended up changing rooms over this issue. I did not want housekeeping in the room after I had checked in. The bathroom floor also had not been mopped. There were large spots of dirt and God only knows what all over the floor. I have read other comments like mine but I had hoped that I would have a better experience. Also, there was spotty internet service. If you are going to charge 12.99 for internet, make sure it works.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OliverRex
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at this hotel. The rooms were nice including the television in the restroom. The Christmas decorations were great. The hotel staff was good.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Stay”
Reviews.Author: hendrixallen
Reviews.Content: I arrived at this hotel around 8pm with my friend who is a Diamond Member of the HHonors Program. While Checking in, the front desk clerk was short and bordering on being rude. She would not give us an upgrade, not even to a superior room! The hotel room we had with 2 double beds was small and cramped, the view overlooked nothing. The lobby is constantly filled with tourists, most not even staying there. After only 2 nights, we left this hotel to find better. The WORST service we have ever experienced. Oh and to top things off, they charged me a $10 dollar fee to simply accept a package, they didn't even bother to notify me it was there or bring it up.

Reviews.Title: “Stiil Hoping They Can Get This Right”
Reviews.Author: ATLcruiser
Reviews.Content: This was my fourth stay, and I have now spent 12 nights at the Roosevelt. I really want this hotel to succeed. I enjoy that it is very quiet in the rooms, the location is excellent, and the beds are incredible - hard to get out of at 6 AM each day. My check-in this time was, oddly, similar to the last two times. Even though my Honors profile says high floor away from the elevator, I was assigned a room directly across from the elevator on the second floor. When I pointed this out, I was abruptly told the hotel was sold out and no changes could be made; however, the young lady looked again and magically found a room away from the elevator on the 11th floor. (Why couldn't she start with "Let me see what I can do?") If they are going to pre-assign rooms, why do they not pay attention to what is in your profile? I had previously noted that I wondered if the hotel could keep up its new appearance, and my concern is justified. This time no sliver ice bucket and tray - just the brown vinyl Hilton ice bucket you are used to seeing. They must be getting stolen. I stayed on the 11th floor this time, and right by one of the elevators was a huge coffee splash on the wall. It was there the whole weekend. My biggest concern remains housekeeping. I think it all gets down to training. After the first cleaning, I was left with no clean glasses - just the dirty ones left by the bedside. The mosaic tile bathroom floors are obviously hard to clean, and they are attracting build-up in the nooks and crannies. The shelf where the towels are put under the sick was covered in dust bunnies. I received turn down service one night, and I have previously commented on its inconsistency. This time, I got the bathroom trash can emptied - nothing else. I spoke with a turn down attendant in the hall, and she said she had 50 rooms to turn down since the hotel was sold out. Obviously, she does not have time to do barely anything. How can Hilton call this a Waldorf and not staff it properly? I am still a fan. I love the beds, the quiet, and the new hotel smell. I just wish management would try to get this right. After my second stay, I wrote the general manager and made some helpful suggestions as well as paid some well-deserved complements. I received no reply.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel - Poor Service -”
Reviews.Author: mgtopagent
Reviews.Content: I thought this was one of the most gorgeous hotels I have ever stayed at. The renovations are a show-stopper - the lobby and all the public areas are meticulous. To the people who said it is no more than a dressed up hilton or holiday inn - i strongly disagree. The appointments and accessories are all very luxe and plush - what holiday inn have you ever stayed at that provided suck thick and luxurious towels, had gorgeous brushed stainless and chrome ice bucket, pens, leather appointments, magnificent decor, etc. etc. We had a deluxe room and did find it odd that that there is no tub - but one must realize that the property is historic and this is a retrofit - we did not miss the tube - great shower - very deluxe plumbing with all sorts of sprays and shower heads and marlbe - (just like holiday inn - not). The issue here is not really that service is poor - just that there is NOT any service. When we checked in - there were a lot of people arriving at the same time - The bell service was completely lacking - no one approaced us - no one helped us with our bags - we had to lift them up stairs. - same thing on checkout - we called for bellman - they said they would be right up - no one ever came. On at least three occasions no one made up our room at all and two nights there was zero or limited turn-down service. I did complain about it - i got a bland and stupid answer from the pretty talking head at the front desk - she had no idea what to do about a guest issue such as this. I did contact the manager on duty and she was lovely, professional and concerned. Clearly, service is a big issue here.

Reviews.Title: “Could have been perfect...but still pretty darn good.”
Reviews.Author: lunarmodule
Reviews.Content: Iâ€™ve just returned from a three-night/four-day stay at the Roosevelt. And while there were some significant areas for improvement, I feel that some of the previous negative reviews are complete hyperbole. The Roosevelt is a beautiful hotel. The public spaces are no less than stunning. The rooms were beautifully and comfortably furnished. The restaurants and bars we frequented lived up to their classic reputationsâ€¦the Sazerac bar is truly a legendary experience. Beshâ€™s Domenica Restaurant served excellent modern Italian cuisine and the contemporary dÃ©cor was refreshing yet fitting. This is no Holiday Inn or Hilton Garden Inn. This is a fine hotel. We reserved a King suite and enjoyed a living area, small dressing room with a wet bar, bedroom and bath. I was disappointed at first because I was expecting the large â€œgreat room-styleâ€� suite shown on their Web site, but it was actually nice having the separate areas. I know some have complained about the lack of bath, but Wow! What a shower! Multiple showerheads (rain-style, side-spray, handheld) were an indulgent surprise. The bed was extremely comfortable. I did not find it too soft, it simply had the feather beds and fluffy duvets that you find in most nice hotels. I know I am in the minority, but I found the two 42-inch TVs and the smaller TV in the bathroom to be overkill, but again we donâ€™t watch much TV, especially on vacation. We had no problems with noise from other rooms, but we were located at the end of a hall. The staff was professional, but I think the surroundings require a bit more polish and even friendliness. Perhaps because the hotel is newly opened, a â€œpersonalityâ€� hasnâ€™t been established. This would go a long way towards elevating the hotel to the five-star rating Iâ€™m sure it would like to secure. The bellmen were the friendliest and warmest, speaking to you as you passed in the lobby. The bartenders in the Sazerac were great mixologists but not particularly friendly. The front desk folks were competent but their hospitality skills were lacking. When I mentioned that we were celebrating our anniversary and if they had a particular suite to recommend (with a view, etc.), the reaction was that sheâ€™d already assigned us our suite. OK, it was a nice suite but it was on a lower floor and there was no view whatsoever. In retrospect, I should have pushed but I hated to get worked up for potentially no reason. My biggest issue was with housekeeping and, more importantly, the lack of promised follow-through from management to make amends. We checked in around noon on a Wednesday and in the evening showered and headed out for the night. Upon returning, I noticed the turn-down service was basically tossing a few chocolates on the bed (which wasnâ€™t turned down). The chocolates werenâ€™t even placed with the logo facing up. Odd, but no biggie. The next morning, I realized they had not provided clean towels the night before so I called down to request them. After an hour, I had to call again. They finally brought towels and we showered and we headed out to a fabulous lunch at Commanderâ€™s Palace. Upon returning mid-afternoon, I found our room had not been cleaned and called the front desk. By five oâ€™clock still no housekeeping. At this point, we needed to get ready for dinner so I asked over the phone and in person at the desk for housekeeping to clean the room after six. Hours later, we returned to find the bed made, but no room cleaning. No fresh towels. No fresh glasses (they had not even removed the dirty glasses from the side tables). No cleaned bathrooms. No emptied trashcans. I was very unhappy and called to express my dissatisfaction. I was told that it was unacceptable and that a manager would contact me in the morning to make amends. Three days later (and back home from New Orleans), I had yet to hear from anyone. We finally received maid service on Friday afternoon, after checking in Wednesday noon. This is a hotel that has much to recommend itâ€¦itâ€™s a shame to have it marred by less than impeccable service, much less the service shortfalls that I encountered. I so wanted to love the Rooseveltâ€¦I poured over numerous hotel sites before selecting it for our special occasion. We had a wonderful trip and enjoyed many aspects of the hotel. I hope that if we return someday, it will live up to its reputation and the expectations it promises. Iâ€™m rating a â€œ4â€� because I still think this is an amazing place to stay. And because I still have hope that a luxury hotel like this will address its flaws and make a truly great destination for one of the worldâ€™s great cities. And just maybe, Iâ€™ll get a call offering a complimentary pot of coffee or drink in the bar. Thatâ€™s all it would have taken to make things OK.

Reviews.Title: “Went the extra mile”
Reviews.Author: vegasslacker
Reviews.Content: We had such a fantastic time at the Roosevelt. They really spent the time to pay attention to the details at this property. We stayed at one of the suites during our stay, which included a sitting area outside of our bedroom and a half bath. We stayed on the 14th floor, so there was no concern about any street noise. The decor and furniture were appropriate to the time period and atmosphere they were trying to recreate with the restoration. We ended up having dinner at the Sazerac restaurant. All I can say is, "wow"! We are already foodies spoiled by the great meals you can enjoy in Las Vegas. The menu was sophisticated and focused on showcasing the great ingredients in each of our dishes. Each of us got a great appetizer and main entree, but the dessert was the ultimate experience...specifically the bread pudding. In fact I would venture to say that was the best bread pudding I've had; I've tried bread pudding prepared many different ways. They took a traditional bread pudding recipe and dressed it up a bit, while still staying true to the flavor profile you are used to with bread pudding. Finally, the service we received while we were there was phenomenal. Everyone there went the extra mile for us. Whatever we asked of the staff, they were very responsive and helpful. Alex at the registration desk was extra helpful to us for all of our questions and concerns we had.

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended”
Reviews.Author: mintimer
Reviews.Content: This hotel despite its grande name, is really just a dressed up Holiday Inn. Pretty much everything about it is sub-par. I spent 6 nights at this hotel (only due to conference going on) and will never go back. Here are some of my notes: ELEVATORS: hotel gone thru renovation, but they didn't update their elevators, as result guests end up with old, squeaky, circa 1950's elevators that choose which floor to go rather than follow guests' direction. ROOMS: I must admit that rooms are overall nicely renovated. The 42' plasma TV and HD television is the most attractive touch, but the rooms (for a 5 star hotel) have the following drawbacks: - Lack of tea/coffee pot with complimentary tea/coffee bags. - Lack of complimentary bottled water in room - Mattress sucks â€“ too soft and saggy. My back started hurting after sleeping on this mattress. I prefer the harder ones offered by Shangri La (made by Simmons) SERVICE: Major improvement is needed here. Staff looks like theyâ€™ve got other things to do rather than service guests. When we arrived, we had to unload our suitcases and take them inside ourselves, while the bellman was chatting up with a buddy of his 10 feet away. Front desk staff needs training on how to speak politely with customers. OTHER: This hotel charges $10 of â€œhandling feeâ€� for any packages that get delivered to your name. Iâ€™ve been traveling around the world and staying at 5 star hotels and this is the fisrt time I encountered such thing as $10 handling fee. Same thing goes if you want to order a cup of tea or coffee â€“ it will come with additional $10 handling fee. Not sure why they are doing it, but this is a major, major drawback for a 5 star hotel. In other words, I wasnâ€™t too impressive by the hotel and my experience. I would recommend thinking twice before committing to stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Money poorly spent to redo the hotel!”
Reviews.Author: antlion
Reviews.Content: I'm 48 years old, and have been going to New Orleans, off and on, since I was a child. The lobby is beautiful, but other than that . . . the valet had no idea what was what, all young kids, lost as snow geese in a cotton field. Our room had absolutely no soap of any kind, and it took 45 minutes to get any. All the staff acted like they had better things to do. The decor mixes a Hilton Garden Inn with a Holiday Inn, from the hallways to the rooms, no romance at all. It's all hullabaloo and holler, I'll never go back! When we checked out, on a Sunday morning, we were three deep waiting to talk to someone, finally leaving after 30 minutes. The management of this place needs to send a spy to Le Pavillion to see how it's done properlike!

Reviews.Title: “No Bathtub for Deluxe Room Category !”
Reviews.Author: Ozeki
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on 10/02/2009, we prepaid(Waldorf Astoria official site) ahead of time for " a deluxe Queen Room". There was a shower only in this room. Welcoming phone call from the hotel personnel asked us what we thought about the room. We complained the room with a shower only should not be categorized as a deluxe room. She said she would give us one free in room movie to make us happy !!! We watched some war movie and the next day, we were charged for the movie !!! We prepaid well in advance, but Waldorf official site reduced the rate 3 weeks before we arrived, AND ONCE MORE again 1 week prior to our check in. Hotel told us they would not give us any difference nor they can see what Waldorf Official site was offering !!!! ADVISE---Book this hotel through Orbitz, or 800 Hotels.com as they guarantee the lowest rate even if the price go down. This hotel just opened less than 3 months ago, and our in-room SAFE did not work but two very nice technicians came and fixed it after one hour. The best thing about this Hotel--A BIG SLEEK LOOKING PLASMA TV ! That was all. I could have stayed home for that !

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but thin walls”
Reviews.Author: skogmus
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nice and clean. Cleaning is good and the TV is greeat. The only two things that was bad was that I can here literally everything that was said and happened in the next room. The alamclock rang in there one morning and I tried to turn off my own. The other thing was that the leftovers from roomservice were placed outside in the hallways (?) and staid there for a long time before anyone collected them. Not so good smell after a few hours.

Reviews.Title: “Old Fashioned Glamour with Modern Rooms”
Reviews.Author: VisuallyOriented
Reviews.Content: Me: Former airline Captain who has spent thousands of nights in hundreds of hotels. I stayed two nights in early October on a business trip planned by a client. I was originally disappointed when I learned that the client had switched our reservations from the W French Quarter to the Rosevelt but after staying there I really liked the Rosevelt. The lobby is spectacular and the rooms are very nice. My only complaint is that my standard room only had a shower...... it did have 5 different nozzles so I made do. The bar and cafe are nice, my coworker said the restaurant was good. It's just off Canal St. 3 blocks from Bourbon Street. Considering that our negotiated rate was less than $200 a night the Rosevelt was also a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Quite Nice”
Reviews.Author: Relaxin656
Reviews.Content: We had not visited New Orleans since Hurricane Katrina. We learned about the opening of The Roosevelt and its renovation/restoration. It gave us a perfect reason to visit NOLA again ! We were very impressed with the accommodations, service and the convenient location! We stayed in a two bedroom suite (1 king BR and a 2 queens BR). The living room area and the bedrooms were much better than we had expected. The rooms were attractively furnished with great decor. The bed linen was exceptionally nice and comfortable! We loved the bathrooms and towels (the televisions in the bathroom was a perfect addition). The service was great from the valet, reception/check in and assistance with getting settled into our suite! Everyone was very helpful and courteous/friendly. The Concierge Desk was utilized for everything (shopping, direction, places to dine).! The service at the desk was consistently great for the days we were there! great! We loved the convenience of the cafe in the lobby. Focus on housekeeping consistency is our one recommendation. We were there for several nights and it seemed apparent that the housekeepers don't have a check list on how to the leave the room after cleaning. An issue we experienced was a long delay in getting extra towels (several hours) and when they arrived they were given to us at the door rather than placed in the bathroom. While not a big issue, it warrants mentioning given the reputation of the Astoria collection of hotels. Overall, this was a great place to stay and I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoy the lobby, but stay elsewhere. For now.”
Reviews.Author: BDfromDC
Reviews.Content: I was one of the first guests at this recently restored grand hotel, which has been closed since Hurricane Katrina (when it operated as part of the Fairmont chain). The public areas are beautiful, and great food and drink outlets, but "the boiler" broke during my stay and we had no hot water to shower or bathe with until about noon. A 500+ room should have a back-up system! There was also a "r bug" curled up under my sink that the housekeeper didn't notice for two days, which worries me. Staff is really nice and accommodating. Location is also grim, derelict closed restaurants and theatres outside both entrances. Maybe in a few years the neighborhood will bounce back, and the hotel will be running smoothly but for now I would give it a pass.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your bill and bring your reservation codes/receipts. Front desk is a mess”
Reviews.Author: pescuban
Reviews.Content: First the positives. The rooms were fabulous. The rates are currently great. The lobby exquisite. Firstly the bell staff was amazing. Their services were exceptional. The guest services manager, Ryan went out of his way and went above and beyond expectations. The waitstaff also exceptional. Positive, polite and enthusiastic. The location is great and I do see great things in the future for the hotel if it is staff properly. I had a wedding reception there which turned out really beautiful. The food, the waitstaff the ambiance was perfect. I have nothing ill to say about that experience. The party was fantastic and I do thank the staff for making it wonderful for me and my now husband. The front desk however is a complete mess. I had a wedding reception there and many of my guests were staying there. They could not find people's reservations. Although I had pre-paid my room several months before arriving to the hotel they charged me for rooms while I was there. Also charged my roommate for another room. We explained our issues to the front desk during our stay several times and they said they would fix the problem. They never did after several discussions and the hotel promising to reimburse. We both ended up disputing it on our credit cards a week after we had checked out of the hotel. They made one of my guests who had pre-paid a room re-book and pay again giving some stupid reason that they didn't check in on-time. They had me and my room listed under another guest's name the whole week I was there. I would get keys for this other person's room rather than keys to my own room and phone calls etc. I went down to the desk everyday to tell them to change this to my name and that I was NOT the person that they had me listed under and they never changed it the whole week. Even the day of check out I was handed the bill I think for the other guest b/c it wasn't mine. Even the manager happened to be at the front desk and knew about the mistake the whole week. Nothing... The manger of the front desk, Treniese, is not management material which may be why her staff at the desk is less than competent. Rather than trying her best to fix our issues, and ensure a positive experience and good customer service, she spent more time projecting blame on her staff at the front desk who were "new" and didn't know how to manage the check-ins. As the manager she should be accepting responsibility and taking care of the issue that had been presented to her many many times. If the front desk staff is new and having problems managing the desk then the manager should be AT THE FRONT DESK, with her staff; training and troubleshooting any issues that may arise. Instead it was all about excuses and no action on her part and she remained behind the scenes except for some phone calls to us that never led to any resolution. After she had told us several times that we would be reimbursed, it never happened. Also they room was very hot and dry and I couldn't figure out what the problem was. After no sleep at 4am the night before my wedding; I contacted the front desk to explain that there was something wrong with our AC. I apoligized for calling so early in the morning too! The lady at the front desk was terribly rude. She abruptly hung up after stating that she would send someone but that I probably didn't know how to use the thermostat (it's not rocket science). After sending engineering up to the WRONG room he finally came to my room and said that in fact the heating system was on, not the a/c and he had to go into the ceiling of the room with a ladder to change the system. Again, not a big deal had the front desk treated me better. I realize things happen and the hotel is new but if you can't be nice to your customers then you will have none. I told them they needed to get their act together because a hotel as beautiful as the Roosevelt and who is carrying the Waldorf name should have customer service at the top of their priority list. I also explained to them that the front desk is one of the first services a guest encounters with when arriving to a hotel (aside from the bellman who were great). It is also a center for all other services during a guest's stay. If the front desk leaves a bad impression on your guests then it will leave a bad impression on the entire hotel for that guest. It's one thing to say you may have had a bad waiter one night and the reflection is essentially on that waiter. It's another to say the front desk had no sense of customer service through out a stay. Overcharging a person the way that they did can really be a problem for someone who is on a budget and can't afford to have those kind of mistakes. Also if you can't call the front desk and receive a pleasant voice then who can you call... I'm going to give it a thumbs down today b/c it was so costly for me and my guests due to mistakes but hope to give it a thumbs up in the future. I think it can correct itself with proper staffing and some customer service training.... Really I am embarrassed as well as the guests at my wedding spent the entire weekend complaining about the front desk and at least 3 others were calling their credit card companies to dispute charges. And I am the one who chose the place with good intentions thinking it would be fun for my wedding guests, instead it was hard for them :-(

Reviews.Title: “The Roosevelt will be the place to stay in N.O.”
Reviews.Author: LBR09
Reviews.Content: Absolutely beautiful! They obviously spared no expense with the renovation - this hotel is a gem. The managers and front desk staff tried their hardest to make our stay nice however, the support staff is still developing a good work ethic. We had to ask three times to have our toilet cleaned. The last time, a very nice housekeeper showed up with her cleaning supplies and shook her head. She apologized and said that she had been told that the toilet had been cleaned but could tell that it obviously hadn't and proceeded to clean it to our satisfaction. The whirlpool wasn't working when we were there but the pool was fantastic - on the roof with a nice bar, lounge area close by. I'm sure that the housekeeping issues will be worked out by the time we visit next and I can't wait - love this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Classic Restored”
Reviews.Author: chmb1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is back in a grand manor! When we stayed, the King Suite was large and opulent but only had a shower. Be sure to ask for a room with a tub if you want one. Parking is pricy at $38/night. The elevators were a bit small and slow. The spa was not yet open. Overall a charming experience if you can get a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely restoration with a few details to address”
Reviews.Author: MTNestersFromNTx
Reviews.Content: The Roosevelt Hotel in New Orleans has been restored to opulent splendor, reopening this summer after Hurricane Katrina ravaged the city. The location near Canal Street and Bourbon Street is great for visiting the French Quarter. It is a mile or so from the Morial Convention Center, and a $10 cab ride, including tip. The lobby is stunning, with shining marble, ornate floors, rich woods, and sparkling crystal, large ferns lining the hall like sentries, and the smell of fresh lilies scenting the air. The staff is attentive, formal yet friendly. Check in was quick and efficient. The room was small but well appointed, with a comfortable bed, large flat screen TV, and minibar. The shower was equipped with wall mounted body sprays; however, one of the sprays did not work. Another issue with the bath was the water temperature. It rarely got more than lukewarm, and on Wednesday morning, was downright cool. A colleague staying in the Roosevelt confirmed that their shower was also chilly that morning. A minor issue was the room door lock mechanism. It was a bit sticky. The Sazerac Bar and Dominica have fine dining, with excellent service, both worth a visit. The cafÃ© is modern, the clerks friendly, the coffee excellent. The bath and door issues could easily be addressed, making the Roosevelt Hotel very close to the perfect traditional first class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: manyooexpat
Reviews.Content: What a great short vacation, New Orleans is a great place to visit. The people are friendly, the food is just great, Coconut rum mojitos at the Red Fish Grill are to die for. The Roosevelt is newly rebuilt and is sumptuous in every department. The King Superior room has a hugely comfortable bed, a nice little living area with sofa and large screen TV, (there is even a TV in the bathroom !!!!) People watch in the Sazerac Bar then indulge yourself with dinner in the Sazerac Restaurant - try the bread pudding, it is to die for.

Reviews.Title: “grrrrrrreat”
Reviews.Author: JOHNJR72
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great. My wife and I when to New Orleans to just get away and have fun. This was the perfect place for us to come too. The hotel was very classy. The staff was very helpful and nice. the room was clean and maintain. The best thing about for me was the T.V in the bathroom. ( It is football season you know.) The showers was my wife fav. It had four showers heads. It also had a nice size t.v in the main. If you are going to New Orleans, you should stay here. P.S. Parking at the hotel is 38 dollars a night.
